review: Best bacon  egg and cheese I ve had in my 10 years living in Austin. Friendly and fast service too

Ate too many beans here but  2 a taco is what s up.  Literally cannot understand any part of this awful city and its pricing.  Boycott absurd taco joints.  I think it s 6 bucks for a lengua at Papalote  Lmao.  La Flor slaps.  Watched a guy who  I think  owns the corner store drive up  blaring electronica  get out in his loud af gear  walk up like Pitbull to a homeless camp next door and rouse one of the fellows to come get a Rockstar.  Badass.

Damn. Good. Tacos.   Too delicious  couldn t pull the taco away from my mouth long enough to take a photo.  Get in my belly   Best tacos I have found in Austin.  They were out of everything but the carnitas and pastor but was still incredibly yummy.  Much better and cheaper than Torchy s.  Will be back again and again.
Delicious and priced right. The tortillas are just the best. And even the simple cheese quesadilla is perfection. I love having this spot in the neighborhood.
Very good food. The flour tortilla is not home made which makes them sweaty and soggy from heat of food which is normal but good flavor. Breakfast tacos are well made lots of flavor.

Hark  It was glorious. Did you eat what I ate  Come all ye faithful taco eaters - joyful and triumphant.  Wow. This really put meaning into those Christmas Carols that I ve been listening to. Glorious. Joyful. Triumphant. These tacos put meaning behind those words.  I have several lists of food in the Austin area and La Flor is on four of those. Wow  some other folks must love it. Now  I do too.  It is a very unassuming manger  I mean food truck  in an obscure part of the city. But the food is truly magical  sublime  festive. I had the carnitas taco and the polo chicken. I wish I had taken pictures. They truly are the best I ve had in Austin. There s a reason that these make so many food lists. They are flavorful. They come on fresh  hand made tortillas  unique flavor  and dirt cheap. These are what put taco trucks onto the map and it stays that way.  Joy to the world  The tacos have come.
the best fajita tacos and the best handmade tortillas. I recommend you stop by and try you will not regret

Cheap   2 a taco  and delicious. The tortillas are thick and pretty large. I like to go for the breakfast tacos because they are pretty customizable but their steak  carnitas and chicken are all great too. Get bacon in your breakfast tacos - it comes thick crunchy bits  you won t be disappointed.  They also serve quesadillas and gorditas if you want something other than tacos.

I ve been coming here since I was a little lad with my old man right before we went to work and I can say these are some damn good breakfast tacos.Not only do they make their own homemade tortillas but also have great tasting food.Its not all just tacos you can grab yourself a gordita with whatever filling you want but you can also pair it with a nice atole.Mi paisas si quieren un buen Lonche la Flor es el lugar.

Best breakfast tacos in Austin  which means they just might be the best breakfast tacos in all of existence. The tacos are two dollars each  and they let you mix ingredients and get whatever you want on a flour or corn tortilla. The corn tortillas are incredible and the flour tortillas are good as well. Everything is perfectly cooked and the red and green salsa are both flavorful and just the right amount of spicy. I can t recommend the corn tortillas enough  they compare favorably to many of the higher end Mexican restaurants in Austin.
Christian and his mom make the best breakfast tacos in Austin. There s not even a close 2nd. Their homemade corn tortillas are the perfect thickness and are never dry.  The service is always great.
Best breakfast tacos in Austin  hands down. The tortillas are amazing- thick  chewy  and hot. The food is authentic  and the service is great. I truly feel like I found a hidden gem with La Flor

These are the tacos my grandma used to make me on Sunday mornings.   Homemade carnitas  hand-cut papas and those hand-rolled flour tortillas  If for nothing else  go for the tortillas. Unlike anything you can find in Austin.  Check out the menu I posted for the different types of tacos. They re out of some of the meats later in the day  so keep an open mind. They re also super accommodating  like making me a quesadilla and huevos a la mexicana when they re not even on the menu.   Best part   2 tacos  no matter what you order.
Their food here is authentic Mexican  U won t regret trying this place  My favorite is the quesadilla and all their tortillas are homemade

Another reviewer said this was a great place even for vegetarian tacos. No  it is not  BE AWARE  they cook EVERYTHING IN LARD  Nothing on the menu can be made vegetarian because it is all made with lard. No bueno.   As a vegetarian  I am used to having to avoid certain menu items like beans or rice which are more often than not made with lard  bacon  chicken stock  or other animal products. This is usually no big deal because I can order an egg  potato  nopale taco or whatever other veggie options a place offers. But you can t do that at La Flor since everything is cooked in lard and they don t offer a vegetarian-friendly alternative. Bummer. But there are plenty of other yummy taco places in Austin to choose from.

The corn tortillas were tasty but a little thick for me. They don t scramble the eggs fluffy and the sausage was dry and too salty. But my bean egg and cheese taco was pretty good. The tortillas are so large they should fill em a little bit more. But all in all a decent taco if you re passing by and hungry.

I ve been coming here ever since i was a kid  im 26 now. I basically grew up on this taco truck. Its amazing food. Home made corn tortillas. The food is fresh. You can call in orders. You can sit at the picnic tables on beautiful days. You definitely have to gove it a shot when your in the neighborhood

My god     this place makes the best fijita tacos or what     We eat here almost every day. My favorite is the fajita taco. Make sure you ask for the grilled peppers  They can be extremely hot . If you are looking some great tacos in town this place is the best     BTW  this place is called  La Flor  not La flour

Delicious breakfast tacos for a good price. The flour tortillas were handmade  soft  and slightly chewy. We got one taco with bacon  sausage and eggs  savory  and the other with potato  eggs  sausage and beans  filling . If you want a hearty meal  get two tacos   Don t forget the sauce

La Flor is in the top tier of the Austin taco totem pole. If you re nearby when they re open  breakfast and lunch only   you better get your taco on.  Handmade corn and flour tortillas  I usually stalk my tacos on corn tortillas  but here  I get both because they actually do wheat flour justice . The tortillas are huge  so the tacos are a great value as well.

Great tacos from a little convenience store trailer.   2 each for any taco on the menu  breakfast or lunch.  The green salsa is spicier than the red salsa but not too spicy.  Definitely going back tomorrow.

Loved it   Blogged about it   Definitely adding this to my list of go-to taco spots    a href   redir url https 3A 2F 2Ftacososcuros.wordpress.com 2F2017 2F07 2F19 2Fcompletely-flord 2F amp s 1b88e3045bf1d407d885a79872cefa6daa0d20b47bdfa9bfeb013992fd8acc8d  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  tacososcuros.wordpress.c   a

Five barks for real  You gotta order the Egg  Nopal  and cheese. I can t do bacon anymore because I don t eat mammals - peace to my girl Okja.  Can t go wrong but they use some strong cleaner on the counter you can smell 20 feet away. Worth the fumes... Petey out.

I used to stop by here somewhat rarely on the off-chance that I was early to work. Since then  I ve started working from home. Among other things  this means I can go days without wearing pants  assuming I don t want to go out and get things like food.  Some days  La Flor is the only reason I wear pants.
I ll take the pepsi challenge with any taco truck against La Flor tacos. You can taste the love in every taco.

Carnitas Taco good  but a bit dry. Corn tortillas excellent with Guisada  meat very tender. Piccadilla with potatoes on flour tortillas was my favorite  For  2 a taco you can t go wrong here. Salsa is bit on the mild side for me  but tasty. Limited seating  but big lot  more seating would be great  food truck could also use some sprucing up  public bus stop next to truck  but other than that well worth the stop

So I had my reservations eating at this place...located outside of a corner store that s sole purpose is to sell cigarettes  lotto tickets and booze  and having a handwritten menu in a stand that looks hand built  it just looked seedy to me.  However this place has probably the best breakfast taco in Austin  certainly the best that I ve had  2  is a great deal  these tacos will fill you until dinner. Tortillas taste handmade  perfectly scrambled eggs with a little pico  skillet potatoes  salty mexican bacon and ooey gooey cheese...mmm. I live within walking distance  I can see myself coming here on a weekly basis. Don t waste your money at some taco cabana or some poorly made donut shop tacos.

It s easy to miss La Flor  as it s a food truck tucked away in the corner of a parking lot next to a Hula Hu convenience store on South First. But if you want to have the best breakfast taco in Austin  make sure you don t miss it. I ve lived in Austin since 1986  and I ve eaten a lot  really -- a LOT  of breakfast tacos. They re ubiquitous around here. And La Flor has the best breakfast tacos. Bar none. Really  there isn t even any competition. They make them on a grill  which you can see while you re ordering. I almost always get the bacon  egg  and cheese. They brown a good size  really delicious tortilla  fry what looks like a whole egg  put it in there with some chunky bits of bacon and the tastiest cheese you could want  and serve it to you REALLY hot. I top it off with some of their  somewhat spicy  green sauce and -- well -- it s breakfast heaven. They have a  somewhat spicy  red sauce you can put on there as well  if you prefer  and if you re really lucky  they ll serve you a taco with a double tortilla. In fact  that seems to happen whenever I order two or more tacos -- one s got a double tortilla  and because of that magic grill  it tastes doubly delicious. And they don t just serve tacos -- they ll make you burritos  Gorditas  whatever you want. And the best part   2 each. You can t get this kind of value  for the quality or the price  anywhere else in Austin. They re open Monday through Saturday  no Sundays  until 2 00 pm  serving breakfast and lunch. If you haven t been  go. You will NOT be disappointed.

My favorite and I know a lot of the taco stands in town   The staff are super - they seem genuinely happy and the tacos are great  cheap  and delicious.... the hot sauce  which is a big part of my judging mechanism is excellent    the tacos are homemade  and they spice them with just the right amount of extra love and cilantro

If you find yourself driving south on congress it before you get to staaney there is La flour. This is one of those taco shacks. It is permantly located in a small trailer next to the Stop and Shop. Dont let the apperance fool you they have some great food.  The breakfast tacos are warm and filling and at  1.50 you cant beat it. I say the bacon egg and cheese is my favorite.  As for Lunch you can get many different items from tacos to tortas all ranging from  1.50 -  3.00. My favorite is the Carnitas Torta. It has tender pork on a bolio roll with letttuce  tomatoes  jalepenoes  refreind beans  onionds and sour cream.  If you get there after 2pm they will be out of the carnitas so stop by early. If you find yourself driving south on congress it

Fairly solid cheap taco trailer. Their basic breakfast taco  which for my purposes is bacon egg cheese  is good and cheap  as it should be  and comes on a decent tortilla. Good salsa  though it s not quite spicy enough for me.  Their tortas are also worth investigating. They somewhat atypically come with refried beans in addition to your normal fillings  lettuce  sour cream  jalape os . Carnitas is a good bet if you re torn between meats. A breakfast taco and a torta is a grand total of  6.  They re in the Stop and Shop parking lot about midway between Stassney and St Elmo on S 1st  which is a somewhat odd location but at least is fairly convenient for me. They re open for breakfast and lunch only  but they serve breakfast stuff at lunch too  the way that God intended.

If you re looking for fast  affordable  and delicious  this is the place. There are a couple picnic tables  but you re probably better off getting it to go  tables are in the Texas sun . Tacos are cheap at only  2 a piece  cash only I think . Two should be good for most people  three if you re famished or just eat a lot. The handmade tortillas have a reputation for a reason. Both flour and corn were delicious and while I normally favor flour  I enjoyed their corn more. The Desebrada was my favorite of what I tried  and I will certainly be back here to explore more of the menu
DELICIOUS  cheap tacos that do not disappoint. I find myself craving comparing La Flor s tacos when I m at a sit-down Mexican restaurant and I think that says a lot. Cash only.

Simply put  amazing breakfast tacos.  And cheap too   2 each  whatever you put on them.  The nopales and eggs are especially good. Usually pretty busy on the weekend  but worth the wait.  You can save a little time if you phone in your order.

I stopped here for a quick bite to eat while traveling. I looked them up after they were featured in the southern living magazine in the fall. They are a hole in the wall place  but after you eat there you won t forget it. Homemade corn tortillas are delicious. I purchased nopal with cheese and fajita tacos for my family. After leaving I regretted not buying more my boys are picky and the wanted more. Thank you for providing great service  at great prices and awesome service. I will be back.
It s amazing. The tacos are super cheap and taste awesome  the best flour tortillas.

I ve lived in this neighborhood for 7 years. We are loyal customers to La Flor. I have their number on my phone.  ring ring   Bueno    Hey it s Graham from down the street   OH HEY   - How many tacos today  ... and after that it s just a matter of establishing how many Al Pastor or egg  bacon  amp  cheese are necessary. Best Al Pastor in town. Hands down
Best breakfast tacos in town  I live way north but try to make it down at least once a month. Have driven from 4 points just for the homemade corn tortillas also

I live right around the corner  but I would definitely make a special trip if I didn t. Bistec Taco. With capital letters. What do they do to them that makes them so good  Little strips of marinated beef cooked on a flat top until some bits are crispy while others are tender  topped with chopped onion and cilantro on a well grilled tortilla. This simple-sounding taco is a complex flavor explosion that I am unable to explain. Good god  they re even good cold.

Highly underrated  Delicious  fresh  filling tacos are the bomb  Seriously  their tortillas are to die for. Everything is made fresh  but it never takes them long to create the deliciousness. There can be a language barrier  at times  but it gives me a chance to practice my Spanish  Love this place
Quick and friendly service  and the food is good but not great. A solid choice for when San Juanita s at Congress and Stassney is on vacation.
I second the carnitas torta  Yummy  I love taco trailers...

I agree with Lazy S that these are about the best tacos you can get  even for the vegan vegetarian. I m convinced it s the best salsa in town  both red and green  the red is my personal favorite though  and the home made from the ground up taste is just great. And absolutely a great way to go on the cheap. I always get potato bean and tomato. Everyone I have taken there whether veg or not has given it great praise and I m glad to live so close to my favorite south Austin food.  0

Amazing taco. Super authentic and the flavorful. I was only able to get the chicken taco  pollo asada  but it tasted so good and so fresh and the salsa that came with it was perfectly spiced. I will be back to try their other tacos. Only issue I have is when I go back sometimes they re closed and it s not clear what the hours are.  Also it is cash only FYI

I came across this food truck on my way back to north Texas and glad I stopped to eat. The tacos Al pastor with hand made tortillas were soooo delicious. The meat had the right flavor and the hand made tortillas were fluffy with that Mexican flavor. I highly recommend this food truck
The father son duo is absolutely killer at this truck. Went 3 days in row and will keep coming  After my 27 years of living here  I can gladly say this is as close to a Valley taco as you can get
Best tacos in the North Central Austin area. Homemade tortillas are a big plus  they always have fresh meat and service is fast. This is a hidden gem and more people should know about it.

Such a random spot  but I work right next door and all my coworkers go to this place so I had to try it. Glad I did  Amazing tacos for a crazy cheap price  I eat a full meal for  5. The carnitas and pastor tacos are the best I ve had

This place is still open and OH BOY IS IT GOOD.  My friends and I have come to the consensus that this is the best late night taco fix  or any time really .  The prices are great and I love that grilled onions and peppers come free with your meal.  I highly recommend the carne asada quesadilla.  F-ing delicious.  My new and top spot for tacos and quesadillas

I LOVE this place  it s one of my favorites on N. Lamar. They have such a wide range of menu items instead of just tacos. I ve had everything from the tacos  to breakfast tacos  elotes  nachos and soup. It s my go-to lunch spot. The owner is extremely friendly and treats his customers like family. They have a drive-thru on one side and a covered area to with tables to sit and eat on the other. Plus the prices are great  Oh and the salsas - they are delicious  They have a super spicy dark one that s amazing but be careful if you don t like spice.

This is one of the top tier taco trucks in town. I ve only been here once  but I already know.   Friendly folks. Supple corn tortillas  made by hand. Distinctive beef fajita. But the carnitas  with its crispy browned bits  won over. Three salsas  including a molcajete. Pickled onions  carrots and sporty peppers. Cilantro y cebolla all the way.  I need more of these tacos in my life.

Wow came because of the yelp reviews and can say this place lives up to the hype. I had the Pastor and Carnitas Tacos and they were amazing    I can t wait to come here again. Best of All the tortillas were so fresh and there were also delicious grilled onions that you can use for topping
I loved my carne asada burrito and the spicy jalape o salsa  I will definitely be back  For  5 per burrito  how could I resist

Taqueria Gardenia a popular food trailer located in North Central Austin at the T intersection of St. John s Avenue and Roland Johnson--practically off I-35.  They are really popular.  I always see people eating here.  Once I drove by at 6 am in the dark pre-dawn morning and there were four people sitting at the table under the blue awning.    During the lunch hour  there s a lot of customer traffic  too.  Many people get large takeout orders.  I see people eating at the table during lunch  too.  There are big containers of salsa and pico de gallo on the table  among other condiments.  I ate there once but it was windy and keeping the napkin from blowing away was a pain.  The menu is listed on a nicely-printed poster next to the order window.  The prices aren t listed but from what I ve experienced  tacos are  1.50  tax included  each.  That s cheaper than most taco trucks in Austin.  Breakfast tacos or time are only  1 each.  They don t have m any  vegan choices.  Bean tacos maybe   The menu accommodates the 80  of Austin who eat meat.  The food is delicious.  I like the red salsa more than the yellowish greenish one because it s a lot spicier.    Taqueria Gardenia is next to the Valero in a little strip mall.  It s pretty easy to find parking.  One of the Hispanic proprietors actually knows some Chinese.  I was ordering in Spanish and he responded in correct Chinese  as a joke or whatever   but it was impressive nevertheless.
Es Bueno taco stand. Barbacoa is legit. Salsa is muy Bueno. Tortillas in house.nice and non desripct.

ALWAYS the move after a night out drinking. These are personally some of the best tacos I have ever had. Their tortillas are exceptionally good  and their salsa verde too. This place is also super inexpensive and open extremely late. Bless this place lol

I laugh whenever anyone mentions Torchy s or a similar place  don t get me wrong  they re pretty good  but this place is the real deal.  I don t know why some people have said it s expensive  every taco I ve got has been  2 each  although I think some are  2.50  which can t be beat for what you get.   Severed with onions and cilantro.  Both red and green sauces are amazing and pack some heat.  Oh  and homemade tortillas that are perfect.  If you re into some of the more authentic exotic Mexican tacos  i.e. tripas  barbacoa  chicharron  then this is your place.  I usually get an al pastor and bistec which is also amazing.  Best part is that they re usually open late  which is awesome because it s right near my house and makes it perfect for those late night alcohol munchies.    Oh  and I think out of all the years I ve been to this place I ve seen a fellow white person maybe once  so you know it s good
Very friendly staff and solid tacos. Open really late  and within walking distance from a lot of neighborhoods.

The homemade corn tortillas got me    Plus the chicharron. These tacos were sooooo good  but for 4 tacos off a taco truck   10  I mean it s not a problem  I paid it. But I think she got over on me cause I didn t speak Spanish. Whatever.

My favorite local taco truck. The gorditas are amazing  my favorite thing on the menu and pretty cheap. The people who own the truck are super friendly and have had us coming back for over 5 years now

Wow   This little taco trailer  it s not a truck  is super nondescript and we probably would have missed it if not for the yelp entry.  No menu or anything but the tacos   all the usual suspects though  al pastor  asada  Pollo a la plancha etc .  Wonderful street tacos.  Go get em.

The most amazing Mexican food I ve ever had  We got the al pastor burrito  chicken taco  and carnitas taco and they were all amazing--and even better  everything together was only  9. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone living in traveling through Austin.

Best Mexican tacos I ve had in Austin  Period. I m from Brownsville  Texas. I ve grown up on Mexican food all of my life. I ve been to many Mexican restaurants and food trucks here in Austin and none can compare to real Mexican food. With that said  this food truck comes pretty damn close. The tacos are only  2 each and are stuffed with meat and veggies. I love that I can choose between corn and flour tortillas. Soda glass bottles are also only  2 each. I can t give this place 5 stars because it is still not the same as actual Mexican food  but like I said  it comes pretty damn close.  For everyone saying the location is sketchy and thought you d get mugged  y all are racists. I ve gone there many times and have taken many friends there of different cultures  and we ve had nothing but great times. The people are very nice. I love this place and will continue to go there as often as I can.
I got super sick after eating here. No prices are listed  menu is slapped together and I felt like I might get mugged.  One star  cause I have to  and because the tacos tasted good going down.  blort
Great taco truck  Ordered a chorizo and egg  Fast service  too. If in North Austin you MUST STOP HERE FOR BREAKFAST  Service was very cordial.

The tacos are pretty damn good. Hand made corn tortillas made to order filled with very flavorful animal protein   topped off with cilantro and onions   and some very delicious green and red salsa. The tacos are  2 to  2.50 per taco. It may seem pricey but it s worth it. This has become my to go lunch dive when I work in this area of Austin.
No menu  no prices  but not really necessary- They have the basic menu  tacos  burritos  quesadillas  with the typical meats  asada  pollo  al pastor  carnitas .  My burrito was 5 -

If you crave legit tacos then look no farther then this place. They are incredible. And nothing beats a handmade tortilla  They re always fresh and cooked right on the spot.  2 for a regular taco and  1.50 for breakfast tacos  Try it out. You won t be disappointed
Probably some of the best tacos I ve had in Austin  Super delicious and very inexpensive  I ll be back.

This place is delicious. Pretty standard taco  amp  burrito menu but they re really doing it right. I love the steak burrito. 5 bucks for a burrito the size of Chipotle made by a sweet Mexican grandma. The guy who is always there is awesome. He s always smiling and is a great chef as well. I prefer this place to any Mexican food in Austin. Since I visited Mexico  I ve always been disappointed with Mexican food in the states  but these guys bring me right back.

Amazing tacos. Friendly service. Muy sabroso    I come here for lunch during work  and it s such a treat. They have great salsas  cooked to order  the meats are seasoned and cooked just right. Highly recommend barbacoa and al pastor. Great prices too
Great little taco truck  Only a couple bucks for a sizable taco. The carnitas was very good  but the al pastor was the best. Definitely worth a try

Gardenia of Eden.  2 tacos nestled in thick soft handmade corn tortillas-- out of this world. So thick they seem closer to crepes or pancakes than tortillas  they are a sumptuous delight I ve never experienced. I lived in LA before Texas and I thought I d tasted good home made tortillas  but these are simply a new culinary experience. Tables and chairs outside could not be more simple  and it s group seating. Not a place for a date or close chat with a friend  but if you ve got a group of people or it s late night and you re hungry this is a food truck dream.

Still good tacos  though the steak was chewy this time. Also  the location is a little sketchy... a lot of people hanging around looking at you like chum if you re out of place. As long as the quality was a blip  it s still hard to beat 2 tasty tacos for  3.

This place is so good  I had the barbacoa  carnitas and al pastor. Reminds me of a little taco spot in Baja California. They fry up their tortillas a little bit and its makes them even more delicious. Definitely would go back if I was in the area

This taco truck is awesome.  The tortillas are freshly made and everything we had was delicious.  We had pastor and bistek tacos and a bistek burrito. The man working there was very friendly and there was a little Hispanic lady cooking the food.  CASH ONLY.

The lady working was nice  and the breakfast tacos were tasty. The cilantro was a nice touch  too. I think she charged me more for breakfast tacos  though  since it was 6pm.  Menu says they serve breakfast until 11  I think.  Whatevs. I got breakfast tacos. I m happy.

Solid taco truck for authentic tacos  The first time I came I got el pastor tacos and they were superb. Also enjoyed eating the barbocoa  but I prefer el pastor. Two dollars per taco  truck owner is super nice and friendly and always has a smile.
Best breakfast burrito I ve had in a long time. Flavor on the steak and chicken tacos is amazing too.  Hot sauce is HOT.  Friendly and quick

I finally went to Super Burrito on Taco Tuesday.  I ve always had a burrito when I ve ordered from there  but half price tacos are hard to resist.  Their tacos are definitely hard to resist.  Not sure how the same things in a smaller tortilla seem to taste that much better  but they did.  I m still a little disappointed with their salsa.  I ll just have to drown my sorrows in another taco.

For a food truck burrito  this was pretty great  We stopped here on our peddle pub and I can t tell you of a better food truck burrito that I ve had.  I went with the veggie bean and cheese burrito as I was getting tired of a ton of meat. It did not disappoint  Super gooey and delicious. My wife got the carne asada fries. Both excellent choices. I finished it out with a churro and couldn t have been happier   A great stop for a quick burrito and churro. Highly recommend.

Customer Service 4 Quality Temp 4 Price Portion 4 Likelihood to return 3 1-5  5 Best   3.8  I used Lunch drop to bring my lunch today.  First time trying Super Burrito.  I ordered Super Nachos Beef  and a Chicken Taco.  The nachos were made with steak  not beef.  I should have investigated more.  They were good  but not what I was thinking they would be.  The chicken taco was loaded.  It was marinated in a yellow sauce.    The food was VERY good quality  fresh  and tasty.  My taste buds didn t connect with the food  only because of MY preferences.  Support Local

I was craving a burrito so I stopped by the smallest bar in Texas to give Super Burrito a try. I went with the asada super burrito and was excited to eat since I was so hungry. When I think of burritos I think of something firm I m able to hold in my hand and eat without a problem. The burrito I got was a bit runny so it was hard for the burrito to stay together. The tortilla wasn t tightly wrapped. The burrito didn t have much flavor and I didn t get any sauces on the side to put over my burrito.
The super burrito was delicious. Had the right amount of ingredients and tasted flavorful and fresh.  Will be ordering again.
If you re a true San Diegan  do not go here. You ll be full of nothing but disappointment knowing that some things simply can t be duplicated.

You simply can t get a decent burrito in Austin. It ain t a thing. I used to rely on this spot for the closest alternative to a Cali burrito  but what arrived today was sadness. I threw it out half way through.  It was a Super Burrito  but the inside of the tortilla was just ground beef and refriend beans... that s it. Everything else that comes with the burrito was  on the side  in containers - wtf.  It always was soft and sloppy and not that great  even when I parceled in the condiments and items missing from within. It was a waste of money and I regret it. I ll never order from here  or anywhere else in Austin  ever again. I guess I m on my own to roll my own burrito or only enjoy one when I m traveling. Bummer.
Seriously insanely good burritos. Don t order one if you don t have an appetite though.
These guys are friendly and make great San D Ahhh-Go burritos. Carne Asada Fries are also bomb.

I ve had the SD buritto  amp  a few tacos here on a couple different trips.  I ll say the buritto was pretty good  definitely closer to the Baja  CA style of buritto I ve seen in Austin.  My favorite taco was the sea monster.  Easy spot to come check out.
The truck looks really random but we got the poblano burrito and it was actually really tasty  Would highly recommend stopping by if you re in the area

Pretty solid burrito. The  1 off coupon from Yelp was a win  Calamari   potatoes   coleslaw   chipotle is a very good mix for feeling satisfied. The tortilla was good and stretchy. Beware everything will probably fall out but that doesn t make it less tasty
90  of the days I spend in Austin I spend here for at least one meal. It is my tradition to step off the plane and go here - best tacos in Texas

I moved here from San Diego about 12 years ago and was dying due to lack of real carne asada. Living near the border spoils you when it comes to Mexican food so when I got to Austin I was majorly disappointed  the Tex mex is good don t worry people . One day my friend who moved with me called.  I found it  he said.  Found what   I replied.  A California burrito   I didn t believe him until I showed up to super burrito. This is the one spot in Austin that I ve found legit carne asada and if you know about the  California burrito  then you must give it a try. It s a little pricey compared to SD I ll admit but it s as close to the same exact burrito as you can get. Point is  when I need a taste of the best Mexican food I run to super burrito.  Here s another story. I was dating a girl from El Paso. We used to always argue about who had better Mexican food. Was it El Paso or was it San Diego  One day I took her to super burrito and this was her comment   it s just like El Paso   I laughed because it was just like San Diego  Apparently they are very similar for you real Texans. Give this place a try    My only complaint is that I DO wish they had a brick and mortar again instead of the food truck that is super hard to access with parking. I also feel the quality went down a bit since moving into the food truck. They just need to reopen a location and put a ton of social media buzz behind it to let the world know about this hidden gem.

I had the potato egg and cheese burrito  I m vegetarian ... and there wasn t cheese. which might ve been fine  except that I don t think the potatoes or eggs were seasoned whatsoever. It was just SO BLAND. I m sure their burritos with meat are very flavorful  but I wish they made sure that all their menus items tasted good... vegetarians deserve to enjoy eating too lol

Cute food truck next to an Italian truck and the tiniest bar in Texas  so it does make for a nice stop to get food and drinks. I got a Tejana and their complementary sauces were good with a kick.  The tacos were a good size and will definitely fill you up  but it didn t blow me away. I only had one taco  so maybe the other tacos were better. There was an outdoor seating area which was nice  but besides the local business aspect  I wasn t super impressed.

GREAT Mexican food. I ordered their chicken nacho fries and a San Diego burrito  contains french fries  and I was not disappointed. It s hard to find a good burrito in Texas  so I was happy that I found one here. I will definitely be back again and again.

So don t get me wrong  I was excited to have a little taste of home aka San Diego in ATX but I ve had very different experiences going 2 times so far. I ve tried the San Diego burrito and the carne asada fries and I think the main issue is inconsistency with their French fries.  SD burrito  the French fries were way over seasoned and over cooked and the carne asada was a bit chewy - eek Carne asada fries  were muuuuch better and their saving grace but the fries were a bit undercooked  see picture . The carne asada was much better and it all went together very nicely. Also  their carne asada fries don t come with pico de gallo  so I would strongly suggest adding that.  I will be back

California claims without the California quality  and this critique is coming from a native Mexican-American Californian    The meat was dry  chewy  and the all around flavor of the burrito was bland.  The size of the burrito was laughable  being that I ve had larger frozen burritos from a grocery store.  To receive such poor quality coming from a placed called  SUPER BURRITO  is embarrassing and lazy. I won t be trying them again.  If you want a solid burrito with proper size  flavor  and texture akin to what you d get from a taqueria in the SF Mission District  I recommend a truck called Taco Brother on Brodie Lane near William Cannon.  It s kinda far south  but WOW do they do a burrito right

OMG  tan bueno. this mexican taco burrito nachos  etc truck is FANTASTIC   it s in the patio section of the tiniest bar of texas on 5th street and on the side of whole foods  next to the bowie high rise    i got 2 tacos the tejano taco...steak  pico and avacado the a.m. taco...sausage  potato  cheese  with red and green sauce   these tacos were awesome. i live in galveston and was so glad that i tried this place  FREE WiFI...password is sandiego  BUY LOCAL SUPPORT LOCAL

This place came highly recommended by one of my buddies. Very cool location attached to the same lot as the Tiniest Bar in Texas  just a little hut that serves cocktails  beers  whatever you re feeling.  Talk about Super Burrito  this place delivers when it comes to being filling as well as the quality of the burrito. Hands-down easily a top 10 burrito place in my books  I could see this place possibly starting a brick  amp  mortar shop one day. We each got a different burrito  but all were great  I don t think you can go wrong at SB

Was missing California burritos so I tried the San Diego burrito from here and was quite disappointed. The meat had an odd taste  the fries were completely soggy and also had an odd taste  there was just something very off about the taste of everything. The chips and queso were also pretty mediocre but better than the burrito.

Good tacos - also breakfast tacos any time of the day. So the tacos are good. Not great  but not bad either - just good. You can find good tacos in a  lot  of places in Austin  but then again  there are also a lot of  bad  tacos to be had in Austin - so yeah  it s good to know that these are good. The key tho  is to not worry about the menu - order them the way _you_ want them   carnitas  with avocado and no onions   or whatever  - and enjoy. Incidentally  you can get breakfast tacos any time of the day  and these are  good    Lastly  there is a pleasant outdoor area  where you can grab a drink from the nearby  smallest bar in texas   and chill to music.

I miss Cali burritos so I m glad this place offers them   San Diego burrito . I got mine with chicken  my fianc  got his with the normal carne asada. He used to eat Cali burritos weekly so he devoured his with no complaints  Mine was decent and came with guacamole inside. Chicken could have been slightly better  but for being in Texas  we will definitely be coming back for more  Glad they are open during COVID as well

I would not recommend this place at all at 9 30 I been trying to call them to place an order to go and they didn t answer and I drove there 18 min away to just get their burritos and I go to the window and they guys is like we closed they close 10 min before closing and I even told him I drove from far to just get get y all s burrito but still the guy said we already cleaning the grill which they haven t started u til 2 min of me asking and waisted my freaking time to just get their freaking food and now most of place close and I should have not went with them and the guy and window was so rude that I been there many times but now screw them of how they talk and don t care about their customer and really I would recommend stay away from this place and they are so rude to u as they should welcome each customer

I m from San Diego  Ca and I love good food. While in Austin  I heard about this spot so I decided to try. I bought the  San Diego  burrito aka THE CALIFORNIA BURRITO for  9.49.  First  the burrito is a lot smaller than expected although its in an OVERSIZED tortilla which is what filled me up... NOT much carne asada was in my burrito  the guacamole didn t taste homemade  the fries are the string fries NOT regular sized fries that we use in SD.  I also ordered a  2.75 churro. Unbelievably disappointed as there was NO SUGAR OR CINNAMON on my churro but it did have some type of filling    I fed it the local birds.... not sure why that s called a  churro  but that s what I got when I ordered a  churro .   Overall it was ok but not sure if I d return.

As a visitor to Austin  I ve found that the supply of Mexican food is saturated.  This quick stop food truck has ample outdoor seating and was a solid mid week  middle of the day lunch option.  This place was particularly quick in putting the order together probably less than five minutes.  I ordered a breakfast burrito because it was one of the only options with Chorizo on the menu.  The other burrito was al pastor because the savory pork worms with the sweet pineapple.  Also got a side of hot sauce.   Definitely great price and well worth it.  Would go back if I could.

Yoooo I am super stoked about my dinner tonight. I am in the  eat and drink togo texas page  on facebook and someone was looking for a  California burrito  which id never heard of but learned it has fries amongst a few other things in it. Being a huge fan of gyros with fries in them  I was automatically interested. 90  of the group recommended super burrito for your California burrito fix so I ordered the san Diego burrito with a side of beans and chips and queso.... one of the BEST burritos I ve ever eaten. I used to cook for a taco truck and our burritos were my fav until this. Damn yall  just try the San Diego burrito and be happy.   I ordered this on Doordarsh btw and got it quickly and it was super fresh.

Super cool outside dinning at this location  but parking might be tricky. We ordered the carne Asada fries and with a tip it was about  9.50. The fries were super good. Loaded with meat but too much meat that s why I gave them 3 stars but it would be a solid. The meat was kind of dry and had a lot of pepper so maybe if you asked for fries and a little bit of meat it would be even better. The fries come with guacamole  sour cream  and green  amp  red salsa. A good snack and easily shareable between 2-3 people
Absolutely delicious. All of our tacos were juicy and enormous. We went on taco Tuesday so each taco was only  2. Great deal  We ll be back

It s pretty hard to mess up a breakfast burrito  and at around  6.50  Super Burrito has it s pricing right. Unfortunately  the breakfast burrito with bacon I had was pretty flavorless  and they didn t throw any hot sauce in the bag. Went back today for the steak breakfast burrito and it wasn t much better  but at least I had hot sauce today. There must be better Mexican food in town  but this works in a pinch.

I guess I m not cultured enough to realize the magnitude of other burrito places but this one did the damn job in my opinion. We ordered breakfast delivery and I got presented with the tastiest breakfast burrito that ever lived. Eggs  cheese  potatoes wrapped up in a perfectly warm tortilla. A side of chips and queso  Yes please  the queso was so good I could drink it. The green spicy salsa to put on top of burrito  Dank sauce.  10 10 or 5 5  whatever  get yourself a casual burrito here

I have ordered from this Food Truck at least 5 times via Postmates. My personal favorite has to be the San Diego Burrito. Also  don t miss out on the Cream Filled Churros  All in all  Super Burrito on 5th is hands down the best burrito spot in Austin. Don t miss out

I m not a burrito fan but my Uber driver recommended and they were good. I had the fried calamari chipotle and it was exploding with flavor. Also had this steak one with fries-liked it best. Too many places to eat here to go back but it was pretty decent for  9 each.

This place has been bookmarked for quite some time and we finally came to try it and it did not disappoint.  I tried the Texas burrito and my wife got the Super Burrito.  We also split a Sea Monster taco.  Everything was spot on.  The prices are very good and the food came out incredibly fast.  The orange salsa was delicious and reminded me of the salsas from the taco shops in California.  The white sauce on the sea monster was amazing.  The breaded shrimp had a great crunch to it as well.   I can t wait to co.e back to try some of the other burritos as well as the breakfast items.  They do not serve any drinks  but you can get drinks at the Tiniest Bar in Texas right next door.  There are benches and tables to sit at  with music to enjoy while you devour your burrito.  I think the super nachos or carne asada fries might be next on my list here.

I so badly wanted to like this place. My husband and I were super excited to finally find a place that served a California Burrito  here dubbed a San Diego Burrito  and Carne Asada Fries since leaving California  so of course we had to try it out. My husband ordered the San Diego Burrito and I ordered the Carne Asada Fries  both which looked very appetizing. However  neither of us could get passed the carne asada. It was unpleasantly chewy and very very...peppery  My guacamole didn t taste  or look  fresh. The prices are pretty steep. You can get a much larger California Burrito for roughly  7 or less in California. Overall  the food was underwhelming. I am rating it 3 stars because the service was fast and friendly. Our order was out in roughly 3 to 4 minutes. I appreciated the shaded seating areas. I also liked the salsa. The search for an authentic California Burrito continues
wow even the Austin Tx police squad eats delicious here ... Thank you for keeping us safe  we thank you from the bottom of our hearts ...

Let me start by saying I love this place but I ve only had one thing on the menu    CARNE FRIES      Get them. You won t be sorry.   Just ask for no paper in your box. Not sure when they started doing that but they should stop ASAP.

Christians have Heaven Muslims islamic have Mecca  Buddhists got Buddha  Mormons got... whatever tf their up to  And alas  I have Super Burrito  I d take a small caliber round to the hip for this food.  But in reality  that bullet will surely be penetrated closer to the cardiac region. I digress  Fare the well  and until next time  my French fry impregnated maiden.  We shall meet again  Silly goose burrito  more like it

Austin has A LOT of options for tacos and burritos so you need to bring your A game. This is not A game material. I ordered the Super Burrito and Chips and Queso... the chicken sort of tasted like it had curry seasoning -- which was odd in this context and the queso was white velveeta. Do better.
Best burrito I ve ever had. The red salsa has legit heat. They aren t scared of the people who can t handle spice. I eat here 2-3 times a week.
I got the Jolly Green Giant. It was awesome   Great combo. It came out super hot and super tasty
Horrible asada fries. Nope nope nope. Not ever coming back. I miss the Oltorf location. 1 star bc the girl was really nice. But food is not good.
I got the San Diego Burrito and it is really good. Only place in Austin to get that style of burrito and it comes in a good portion size with some salsas.

Nice little food truck with friendly service. They have wide assortment of burritos.  The burritos are large and filling.  I had the California burrito with fries  asada  and the works.  It was large enough that I could not finish it.  If you are looking for cheap eats  it is a pretty good deal.  The burrito was decent but nothing made it standout from the numerous other Mexican food trucks in town.

Ended up getting an order of the super burrito and the super nachos.  Both were super big and very filling.  Wife had the nachos and I had the burrito.  Both of had leftovers for the next day.  Give it a try you won t regret it.

My boyfriend and I stopped by for lunch today. The name of the food truck might be  Super Burrito  but honestly there was nothing super about their food. We spent  20 on two burritos which were extremely bland. I wouldn t eat there again.

I never give 5 s but everything about this truck is right for me. Drinks at the tiniest bar in Texas  I always drink and use their seating  I always order the San Diego which is Fuego. Their red and green salsa is super fire  wtf... also  put your cell phone number in when you re filling out the bs on their iPad  hella rewards and they don t expire. I m sitting on a ton. Also   20 free stars  points if you join the mailing list  and their email blasts consist of coupon codes ONLY reminding you about them which is also another big win. Lol this place is bomb.

Pretty unremarkable. I had to order twice since they gave my Favor runner the wrong food. I was pretty excited for what had been described as a  solid burrito  but instead was let down. The steak was overcooked and served so scalding  piping hot that it turned the pico de gallo into half-cooked tomato sauce. Burritos are a delicate balance  and these folks just didn t get it right.
Great place for a quick meal  I got the San Diego burrito and it is so filling   In a good way  delicious for sure

I finally found a place in Austin that serves California burritos like San Diego  appropriately named the San Diego burrito here   It successfully satisfied my craving for non-TexMex Mexican food. Now  I usually don t finish an entire burrito in one sitting  but it s been a while so naturally  I devoured it. And felt disgusting with myself after. But it was worth it.   The burrito is filled all kinds of deliciousness  Mexican rice  guacamole  salsa  cheese  carne asada  and French fries. Please tell me someone drooled just reading that. You should.   The burritos here are a bit pricey though. I m used to paying around 7-8 for a burrito. Here it s almost  10. Just something to consider.

Ordered a pastor burrito today. It was the 1st time and the last time I ll order from this place. I felt fine before lunch. Ate the burrito and have felt like  h   since then. I m sure they used something that was at its expiration or had gone bad. Typical. If my condition worsens I will pay a visit to the location.

Back in the day I went to school in La Jolla and fell in love with the San Diego style burrito. Hard to go back to beans and rice as a filler when you ve had crispy french fries instead. After leaving SD I ve been hard pressed to find a good re-creation outside the city. Super Burrito was the first spot that does this fine delicacy justice. If you are looking for a good burrito in Austin make this your first stop

Maybe I got something wrong  But from a non-meat eater perspective  and dairy  maybe this place isn t meant for us folk. I got the nachos with refried beans  pico  quac and jalapenos. I felt the nachos were flavorless from beginning to end. I have done these types of nachos at various places and they have had flavor on their own. I was hoping the beans would have enough flavor to stand out and be delish.. but nope.   I do see that the San Marcos and other Austin location have more to offer. I did ask for Bell peppers on my nachos and I was told they didn t have that.. even though it was on their menu. So unfortunately I can not say this is a great place to eat .. but I see other people love this place. Plus I feel like I wasted  9.69 of my money.. like I wish I could get a refund.. but oh well

Just ordered the San Diego burrito off Uber EATS and boy it was delicious and way too filling..  The burrito came ripped apart because it was too stuffed so it was a pain to eat and the meat wasn t all that flavorful but I loved the healthy amount of cilantro  queso fresco  and sour cream -- also the french fries were a fun addition.   Definitely worth the money

2nd time been here i have the california fries they were good the only thing I have to say that California fries it would be taste better if it was a fresh guacamole it didn t taste like fresh to me it is more artificial guacamole I am at some onions and lemon squish and jalape os to my California fries they taste really good.

Stopped by to get the Texas burrito for lunch and it changed my life  SO good  They were also extremely nice and quick  My burrito was ready by the time I finished paying. That s service  There is street parking  but I wasn t sure and parked in the parking lot near the Starbucks. Pretty sure I wasn t supposed to  but they were so quick it was fine     It was around  9  but the burrito was huge and I couldn t finish it. It has carne asada  potatoes  cheese  pico  sour cream  and guacamole in a chipotle tortilla  Had just the right amount spice. They included sauce in my bag  but I didn t even need it. Love this place  Will be sure to grab lunch whenever I m in a rush or craving the best burrito of my life

My first meal in Austin was the Texas Burrito - it was fantastic and filled me up perfectly.  Service was friendly and super fast too.  I tried both the hot and medium salsa  I preferred the hot but both were delicious.
Not good. Food had no flavor  I was so excited to try this place because how good it looked but looks can be deceiving  They at least refunded me some of my money. But I definitely will not be back.

I love their breakfast tacos  It s been a while since I ve ordered from here  and this morning started off on the wrong start  I walked away with the potato taco and chicken taco noticing the bag was a bit heavier than usual  only to find they added an extra taco for free. Not sure why  but it really made me smile. Thank you

Being a California native and reading reviews that the owners are from CA I was very excited  beyond words  to check this place out and I ended up very disappointed after tasting the food. The carne asada was very bland  lacked flavor and salt. I figured this was an easy fix  so I asked for lime wedges  like they actually give you in CA when you order street tacos etc.  but I was told they didn t have any lime wedges. My husband went back to ask for salt to  fix  how bland the meat was - they told us they didn t have salt. Sigh. So you know  I ordered the super burrito with carne asada as my choice of meat  2 carne asada street tacos with corn tortillas  1 shredded chicken street taco on flour and an order of carne asada fries. The only taco with flavor was the shredded chicken taco my 4 yo. son had  but it was a little spicy so he struggled eating it . The burrito had beans that tasted as if they came from a can - goopy. Even our fries lacked any type of season such as seasoning salt or regular. I think you guys get the picture - it lacked salt and flavor. It s an easy fix but will they take the time to listen  Marinate your meat at minimum for 4-5 hrs  use lime when marinating  salt and garlic salt or powder. Offer lime wedges for those that want a tangy meat flavor and please purchase small individual salt and pepper packages or have one consumers may use at their leisure. I m not sure if I ll be back  I m still debating but as of now probably not. I m from LA so maybe this place is good if you ve never had CA   LA real street tacos. Check them out on your own and be your own judge - don t take my word for it but read the review of a person that actually knows and has a pallet for street tacos - the real kind.  I didn t mean to make this review negative  so here are some pros  Polite guy took our order  amp  took the time to read it back to ensure accuracy - big KUDOS  Very fast service  food was ready in less than 6 minutes They gave us a good enough amount of napkins and utensils  They gave us a lot of salsas   Try the green one it was delicious

So awesome to find a unique burrito place here. There s plenty of taco stands in town but these are big old burritos  So don t let the price freak you out. It s worth the money for the size. You ll only need one  or less than one. I tried the calamari burrito and it was lovely. Fresh cabbage  crispy fried calamari  and spicy mayo. 10 10 will eat again  especially after a few beers at Tinniest Bar.
I searched Yelp for  California burrito  and this place popped up. It s not close to where I live  but was worth the journey. It definitely satisfied my craving and I plan on returning

Cali style food. Burritos are huge and stuffed with a  lot of meat. I tried the San Diego burrito and it was delicious  It was filled with carne asada  grilled beef steak   French fries  sour cream  guacamole  pico de gio  and cheese. Hot and fresh. Def a must try  very good

My wife and I are traveling through town and decided to order in as we didn t feel up to going out. Selecting this restraint was a huge mistake. The food arrived very timely but it was huge disappointment.  The chips were stale  the guacamole was brown  the fries were old.  Food very much felt like false advertising.   Also the burrito which was not supposed to have guacamole also had very brown guacamole included.   I cannot encourage people enough to stay away from here.

Ordered a bean and cheese burrito via Uber Eats. I was hoping for beans and a reasonable amount of cheese with some guac  pico de gallo  and rice. What I got was a pile of overly cheesy mush in a soggy tortilla. Also got chips and queso. Queso was okay but nothing to write home about. Chips were standard. Overall gets a big shrug from me.

I went to SDSU and am from Cali-so of course I was stoked to have a piece of home  No lime wedges.....no salt...I was so confused and my heart was broken into a million pieces. It s good for drunk food but I won t be ordering again...the meat was bland and the fries just don t do it for me. GET SOME LIMES and some Mexican Coke

This trailer sized burrito truck is everything chipotle wishes it could be.  1. Delicious and doused in cheese  2. Awesome customer service and speed  3. Huge menu options  breakfast to vegetarian to seafood.  All are made fresh and tasty tasty  Will come back again

The San Diego burrito here does no justice to the authentic burritos you can find in San Diego. I ve been told this is the only place in Austin you can find such a burrito though  so I ll give them that.   For almost  10 what you receive in a San Diego burrito from here is an overload of French fries  a lack of carne asada  and an underwhelming amount of guacamole. All three ingredients that must be proportional in order for a California burrito to be enjoyable. Not to mention this burrito is on average  7-8 in San Diego anywhere you go  maybe even less AND for something extremely bigger. This is an extremely underwhelming burrito  but at least they re making it  I guess
They are fast  under a minute sometimes . They are cheap  all tacos are 2 dollars on Tuesdays . The employees are kind.  Quantity is more than fair.

NO CAPES   It s close and delicious  a winning combination for me.  These guys can put a burrito together faster than Gump can put a rifle together.  Super Burrito has carte blanche access to my wallet.  Huge fan of the Texas Cheesesteak burrito but for the most part I enjoy the simplicity of the shredded chicken Super Burrito.  Maybe I ll venture out and try other things on the menu but once I find what I like  I find it hard to stray.

One of my favorite places for a quick taco. Hard to beat breakfast tacos all day  especially at  2.59 each  my favorites are the am and the champ.  cute outdoor seating area with bar nearby. Only complaint is they are not open before work.
I loved them when they used be located on oltorf and now I m happy to have found them again   I love to order the signature super burrito with carne asada  so tender

I never got to experience their food.  I actually planned my Austin trip from Dallas to eat here  because I m from California and I REALLY missed Carne Asada fries and saw this place was the only place that basically had them in all of Texas. So I planned a trip all the way to Austin to come here and have their California fries.   Over the weekend I came here with my sister and we were walking in downtown Austin and we saw the place  but we weren t really hungry at the moment. So I walked over there and I asked the worker what time they closed that day  and the person said 6. So that was perfect.   We went around Austin for a few hours and it s almost 5  so my sister and I decided to start walking over to the food truck  I forgot to mention  we were only staying in Austin for one day . We saw the food truck was about 20 ft away from us  and I looked at my phone for the time and it was 5 14p.m.  and we were SUPER hungry from walking around everywhere all day  and when we got to the truck to order their California fries  everything was locked up and their  Open  sign was off and no one was there.   My sister and I were somewhat shocked. Because we planned this WHOLE trip soley to have their California fries  and they have such great reviews on here  and they LIED to us     I felt shattered  because if you re from Calirfornia  you know Carne Asada fries is basically life haha and I was really hurt they lied to us about the time they closed. Not to mention I was starving  so I was hangry. So was my sister. So even though we did other nice things during our day  our trip was basically a ruined now because we couldn t have their food.   That also says something to me about their customer service  they didn t care about the customer and just said whatever  whether because either they didn t care  or they didn t know  in which case they should ve asked to make sure.   I was really sad  and most definitely will not be returning  because I m moving back to California in about a month  where I can have some real carne asada fries  and most food places in California close around 2 a.m. Yay   D

That s gonna be a no from me. Grilled chicken was liiiike....The pre cooked stuff you get out of a plastic package from Safeway and it was seasoned with a microwave and black pepper only. Did I go on an  off day  maybe   The rest of the insides were a not so savory mix of rice  plain white    and refried beans and mystery.  Pros it was food and the tortilla was good.

Shocking to see this place only has 3.5 stars  Visiting Austin with some friends  and our Airbnb host recommended. In situations like these  I m kind of glad I didn t check yelp first to see what their overall rating is because I would definitely have pushed it aside.   We went at 12 30am  on a Friday night  because we thought we were going to go out  but we got really hungry and decided to eat instead. I think they close shortly after us though  so at 1am  Not sure why it says 10pm closing    Pre-informed biases aside  this place has the bet burrito I ve ever had in my entire life. First of all  I don t even like burritos because I sometimes feel like it s too much tortilla and slim fillings. Needless to say  this burrito did not have excess tortilla wrapping when I got to the bottom. It was evenly and strategically folded - there was never a point where I felt like I took a bite of 50  or more of purely tortilla and no stuff. Secondly  the  inside  was mixed very well. I got the Texas  and my meat  cheese  potatoes  comes w skin   and guac were all nicely mixed together  aka not just a bite of only potatoes  etc. Third  my burrito was so flavorful  it was like getting punched in the mouth with spices. Makes me wonder if the other reviews are reviewing the right cart   And lastly  it was PIPING HOT even down to the last bite  not hot enough to burn my mouth of course   so that definitely kept the entire burrito satisfactory.  Overall  a great experience  and I would definitely go again. It s like they have it down to a science.

Me and my husband were  super excited to get some real Cali burritos  but what we got didn t even come close  So we got the super burrito first off the fries tasted like they were reheated in the microwave from last night  The Carne Asada taste like peppered beef from china town  The food was tasteless  and nothing tasted fresh. I will never come back here again  and I do not recommend this place  I d give this place 2 stars only because they did have a lot of meat in the burrito and tacos
Delicious breakfast tacos and amazing salsa   Definitely recommend if you re in the area

Super Burrito is a great food truck  tucked away on the west side of downtown. Never a long line  so a perfect option if you re in a rush. Highly recommend the Chipotle Calamari burrito for dinner  or if you re there for breakfast the AM  with the AM - add a sauce  like chipotle .

So I convince my partner to move here from Southern California  which has tons of restaurants that serve California Burritos  WITH FRENCH FRIES . Do you know how difficult it is to find a restaurant that will put fries on a burrito in Austin  It s very difficult...until we found this gem. It s a little food truck off 5th near Whole Foods and the San Diego burrito did not disappoint. It was fat and loaded with all the Southern California goodness that we remembered and I m so glad that there is at least one Mexican restaurant in Austin that puts fries in their burritos.

After trying Lucky s Puccia s and Austin Habibi  I was looking forward to trying Super Burrito since its two neighbors are amazing  but I was a bit underwhelmed. Got the Super Burrito with steak and a chipotle tortilla  and grabbed a mexican coke from the bar. The steak was actually pretty good  but the burrito was actually a bit too cheesy for my taste. Mind you  I love cheese  but all I tasted was cheese and meat with the texture of rice. There was guac in there too  but again I couldn t taste it. Taking into account the price  I d call this place pretty average for a food truck. It s definitely good  but nothing out of this world.

Really impressed by the food trailer here  wasn t quite sure what to expect given the location .  We recently moved to Austin and this trailer is literally next door to us in a small lot with a few trucks trailers so I see us coming back often   Split the Texas Burrito and the Pollo Asado Burrito and neither of us could decide which we liked more.  The Texas Burrito was a bit soupier with a delicious mushroom sauce  the Pollo Asado was just the right consistency and flavor. The time it took to cook it from scratch was a bit longer than I had expected but was truly worth the wait.    Reading through some of the other reviews here  I m looking forward to trying other burritos  churros and fries

I looked on the Internet for their menu and seeing how great everything looked  I went to try it.I ordered the  Cali fries not good at all   very dry and needed sone salt badly. I also ordered a gyro burrito and that as well was horrible. The little sitting area was very sad and depressed looking.

I ve had the Jolly Green Giant  their vegan offering  about 4 times I think. I substitute fries for the potatoes  and it s just absolutely delicious.   Pretty great little trailer in a convenient spot near Whole Foods and Trader Joe s downtown. I expect I ll be back often.

This mom and pop restaurant has to have the most delicious carne asada burritos I have ever tasted.  They don t skimp on quality ingredients and the quantity of meat in their food.  Plus  they are cheap   It s the best of all worlds   My favorite is their Texas Burrito which has carne asada  potatoes  cheese  pico de gallo  and guacamole in a chipotle tortilla.  Are you drooling yet

I just ordered from uber eats. A few things 1. I hate when places have items with fries  like carne Asada fries  but can t offer fries a la carte  What s up with that  Also  the queso is  in fact  a ripoff. I thought maybe the past post was a one off but the queso amount is what makes this review a 3. Wish I had gone to torchys
My flautas in my burrito was burnt void of flavor and over priced      Not even what i odered   Food sucks

I paid  2  for queso on my nachos and got the tiniest drizzle of it  so that I could barely tell that there was queso on them at all. I asked if I could have more because I couldn t even really tell there was queso on them  and the woman working there told me it was a standard amount of queso and just shook her head. A clearly disappointed customer shouldn t be treated this way. Ironically  they have a  yelp us  sign out front. I intend to yelp  Zomato  and google review them. It s not worth losing customers to be cheap like that. Also the guacamole sucks. The  carne asada  came in little pellets. I wouldn t even eat such bad Mex food in Dallas  much less Austin. This place is a disgrace.

I ordered through postmates while I m about 15 min away and the food was still piping hot. I tried all 3 tacos other than the street and rate them on par with most other Austin taco joints. I ll probably come back
This place hits the spot   I can eat it everyday. Only problem is I wish it opened earlier.

I got the car nice out of fries after I asked a lady where they were from. There from California. Finally I can have carne asada fries. They are okay. Not bad. It s a good start   amp  I hope more places will start to make more carne asada fries. They re not hard to do  I don t know why it s not popular enough here its always hatch chili this hatch chili that..

Super Burrito.... meh. I really wanted to enjoy this place  but frankly I had a very underwhelming burrito.  I tried the San Diego burrito  but I ended up throwing away half of it because it just wasn t worth finishing.  I will say that the burrito was HUGE  I would have struggled to finish this had I actually enjoyed the meal  so that s something. My particular burrito was very heavy on the fries  with a small amount of beef  and I couldn t find any guac . That s not a good start  but I like fries so I figured no big deal.... until I took the second bite  and realized my fries were very soggy- as if the oil wasn t hot enough before they were thrown in  I tried to power through  but I couldn t find a redeeming quality about the burrito   I will also say that the staff was very friendly at the window  but frankly if the food doesn t cut the mustard  what does the service matter  Since this place was in downtown Austin  A time consuming trip for me   I likely won t give it another chance... oh well

I really wanted to like this place. I wanted it to fill my void for a good burrito like from San Diego. I ordered the San Diego burrito  obviously   the carne asada was really just over cooked steak and didn t have good flavor and the tortilla had a rubbery or waxy consistency instead of flakey. Otherwise it was good. I did get a breakfast taco too which was good.
Philly Cheesesteak is a solid burrito.  Quick  and relatively cheap.  I ll be back fo sho

Boyfriend and I came here today   2 17 17  he ordered the San Diego Burrito and I ordered the Monster Nachos. Based on the reviews and us being from Houston we trusted yelp. Wrong  The Burrito was trash  the guac was old  the overall taste was not pleasing. The ingredients tasted old  The monster nachos were cold  The meat was cold  the beans under all the nachos were cold  It seemed like they warmed up old food and gave it to us. We ordered our meals and they were ready in less than 10 mins  not exaggerating either. My boyfriend ordered our food and went to the restroom and before he even got back both meals were done  Tell me that doesn t sound sketchy. I wouldn t recommend to go. We always try really good food trucks when we come to town but this was a disappointment. Never going back. Hoping neither of us get sick.

Day two in Austin day two at super burrito  The Asada  shredded chicken and chicken street tacos are So Good Service is super fast and friendly. The Orange sauce a perfect compliment to the tacos with just the right amount of heat. We will be back for more.

The last four visits have been very disappointing. I have been a faithful fan of super burrito since Last summer when I moved here to Austin. I m not sure what has been going on to bring their food quality down so far as it has but my last four visits I have received cold tacos with cheese that is no where near melting and my beef feels like it was almost right out of the fridge. Beware when you order a churro because they are not always fully fried and some may not come with cream. They also haven t been very generous with their cinnamon seasonins
Really good and cheap  Quick option for lunch and dinner. They have breakfast tacos too. The super burrito is amazing

Heard about amazing Carne Asada fries and decided to trek down to find the truck on W 5th. Lady who took my order was very sweet and friendly. The menu was pretty expansive  every item sounded delicious. Sadly  was not impressed by the Carne Asada fries themselves. Wish there was more seasoning and or salt on the fries. The fries were really flimsy and not all that fried. Add to cheese and steak. Hefty amount of meat though which was awesome to see. Guacamole and sour cream and two small salsas  green and red. Overall  was bland and uninteresting. Decent amount of food downtown for  8.
We loved the carne aside french fries.  Great little courtyard to eat in.  Great service for a food truck.  Would definitely visit again.
Super awesome burrito. Seating is outside so be aware of that if it s hot. Other than that  it s one of my favorite burritos. Also check out the chips and queso  muy tasty

This place used to be the best when they were located off of Oltorf.  I would come every Saturday morning for their  1 breakfast tacos.  They moved to a food truck which should have lowered their overhead  but their prices increased significantly   No more breakfast tacos for me from super burrito.

Found this place on a whim. Heard a lot of great things about it and yes it s awesome. eggs  pottato  and cheese tacos are legit. The location is perfect in relation to whole foods  starbucks  and other find the establishments.

This place is right outside my building so I eat here a ton. It s ready super fast and A  quality every time. I stick with breakfast tacos and the chicken one is the best. I ve got an ongoing debate amongst my friends about this  but I think it s better than Torchy s.

For a satisfying late night meal  this place is perfect. The San Diego is a burrito with flavorful carne asada that s not gristly and French fries  The verde and red salsas also hit the spot. Tried a cream filled churro as well. It had good texture and was less sugary than most churros. Not a huge fan of the cream though. I ll be back for the cheap tacos.
This is probably the worst taco food truck in austin. Their Carne Asada is terrible. I will not be coming back. Eat at Habibi if you are in the area and want a decent food truck

I ordered the Texas Burrito and it was loaded with meat.  The service when I was there - admittedly early around 11 30am - was almost too fast.  My burrito was ready by about the time I was done paying.  I was almost suspicious that it had been made ahead of time but I ordered it without cheese and it was hot  fresh  and how I requested it so they just seem to be fast.  Our office just moved to the area so I now have a new place to go back to.
Reminds me of SoCal Mexican food. Carne asada fries are legit  and so is the San Diego burrito. Needing better hot sauce would be my only gripe  but other than that it s really good.

Pros - food was delicious and made quickly.  Location is perfect with outside eating area and near a bar.   Cons - I asked for military discount and the young girl said she didn t know instead of finding an answer. There was also a  1 off coupon near window on orders over  15. I noticed it after I already paid for the tab. I would ve thought she would mention the coupon. The burrito was a little small for  9.

Great burritos. I recommend the Texas or the San Diego for starters. This place is quick and is heavy on the meat in their burritos. My one complaint would be the hours. While it s great to grab a super burrito as you sit at tiniest bar in Texas  patio  these burritos would make great late night food after a Saturday on West 6th.
I had the calamari burrito and it was surprisingly tender and tasty.  The tortilla is soft and fresh  really enjoyed this place.
Instead of super burrito it should be sloppy burrito. There was barely any meat or beans. Basically mush wrapped in a tortilla. A Huge WASTE

Another great spot for a burrito   Great outdoor seating and a full bart  Tiniest Bar . All the burritos on the menu are great. The Super Nachos with shredded chicken are amazing as well. The red hot sauce is spicey but delicious. Another great location for Super Burrito

I was so sad when the Oltorf location closed. I finally had the chance to try the food truck and it is just as good as the original was  - . The menu is condensed but they have most of my favorites  including their cheese stuffed poblano burrito and the wonderful California fries. The location in the Tiniest Bar in Texas is great  the bar is cozy  affordable  and has the best margaritas I ve had in Austin.  To sum up  Super Burrito is probably the best burrito place in Austin and you should definitely try it
Super good. Got the Pollo Asado burrito - chicken seasoned in something yellow and savory with sour cream and melted cheese.

YUCK    I was starving- it was 1 30pm  I hadn t had dinner the night before  and had just a granola bar for breakfast- I threw half in the garbage. You re in Austin  you can do waaaaaayyyyyyy better than this place if you re looking for a burrito.
Awesome food  customer service and the San Diego burrito is the best   I will definitely come back here more often  as I like to travel and taste different types of food  this is a great place

I could not decide between the calamari and veggie burrito. The owners said they were both popular and I decided upon the calamari with added guacamole and no potatoes. My partner and son both got the Pollo Asada  using the bogo Austin Passbook  and we ate at the Summer Concert Series at the Long Center. Perfect summmer picnic. My calamari was soooo delicious I could not stop talking about it. I am craving another the following day. My son said his looked unappealing but laughed and said it was awesome. Their red and green hot sauces were a nice surprise. Both spicy and super yummy. The Tiniest Bar is a great spot to eat them as well. Sure wish they had been there when we lived next door. Will be back

I have only ordered the tejana tacos but they are always amazing   And they are also served super hot  in temperature . The perfect portion or meat cheese potatoes etc. The rocking chairs by the tiniest bar are also a plus
I m a southern California native and the carne asada burritos are close not quite. Missing the carne asada  juice  that makes it authentic SoCal.

Incredible burritos   Being from California  this place is as close as it gets to the real San Diego burrito   Solid burrito at a solid price.  Plus it s so fast  they normally hand you your burrito before you get your receipt

This is an awesome burrito joint   I m not usually into food trucks  but this one has great outdoor seating  amazing food  and so close to downtown  it s nice to walk off that delicious burrito at trader joes or Waterloo afterward.
Great burritos. About as close to real taco shop Mexican food as I ve found in Austin. Blows the doors off of tex-mex anything. Worth the drive from Round Rock.
Jolly Green Giant burrito is PERFECTION. Perfectly spiced  super healthy  and still warm when it arrived at my house. All ingredients were quality and flavorful. Highly recommend it

I was so excited to find a  California burrito  in Austin. Super burrito misses on the  Asada  part of carne asada. The burrito itself was great except for the meat. It literally tasted like boiled meat with little flavor. I want this place to be successful  but to do so  it has to actually marinate and grill the carne asada. The meat in the San Diego burrito is nothing like like you ll find in San Diego  where you her grilled marinated steak that really makes the flavor. Please guys  make real carne asada and you ll be unstoppable

They got too good for Oltorfand are now located in downtown. This really removes some of the charm. I m sorry  Yes  it s the same name. But I don t think they should be feeding yuppies who know where their next meal is coming from. It s almost fitting that their current location is currently a trailer.
