They gave up their loyal audiences for people who had never supported this local institution. The food is good and hearty  but I am just disgusted by the move.

Best Burrito I have ever had  Had the Jolly Green Giant Veggie Burrito. Loaded with beans  mushrooms. Great flavor  Would def come here again. Service was friendly. There is plenty of seating all outside though.
Best calm burritto I ve ever had  Whatever they put on the chicken...I take a spoonful of that everyday. Quick and delicious. Win-Win

I love super burrito  but the one on 5th isn t my favorite. There never seems to be enough effort put into the food. Unlike the super burrito on Cesar Chavez  this location never satisfies me. The carne asada isn t as flavorful  the fries are plain  and they even put leftover breakfast potatoes from an order before mine which really ruined the taste of my carne asada fries  and on top of all that  the only thing that was hot in my order was the breakfast potatoes. I ve never really wanted to complain for a refund at any location  until I went to this location. Overall I would recommend super burrito to any and everyone  but I wouldn t recommend this location.

so. fucking. good. sorry I had to cuss  but it s really good  I love the atmosphere. The parking may be difficult to be found  but worth it if you eat here. Their sauce to add to burritos is really good. I want to eat here almost everyday
Nice place and a Super deal in Tuesday...Taco Tuesday rocks and the service is great.

GreaT food- chicken and their chicken flautas and obviously their black beans are to die for as well as their green salsa  My parents love the chicken salad. I feel like you can t really go wrong with anything here. Also  the management and stuff is great. Brandon Garcia Is an incredible individual and thankful to have him at this location.l    also always love the environment  it s always very chill and an easy place to eat and hang out with friends or family and always clean
Love me Zuzu  Best salsa bar around  I always get the Zuzu chicken salad and it s topped of with a scoop of guac. Delicious Guacamole  Their preach tea is yummy too  Wish they were still in Dallas...

Yikes  Really bad experience. Right when we entered the server automatically said  dios mio  and gasp. i know what it meant but okay. Sat down and told us that we can t just sit there we need to order. Like talk about customer service. Food was awful. Rice was old. No meat on burrito. Extra avocado was a smear of avocado btw.. lols

Let me start by saying  the employees were super nice. Our order was to go  so we realized what we got when we got home. We ordered a chimichanga  which was supposed to be fried.  There is NO way it was  no crunch at all and it was covered in what tasted like Velveeta cheese. Not too authentic. We also ordered Super Burrito  the name is deceiving because it was rather small. We called to let them know the chimi was not fried  to which the response was  it was. We ve eaten enough food in our days to know it wasn t. Although the staff was great  we re  sorry to say  wewill pass on the food

Let me preface by saying that I LOVE ZuZu. I grew up eating in Dallas TX... when I found out there was still a location in Austin I was thrilled and I ve eaten here a HANDFUL of times since. I just wanted to say quality and customer service has gone downhill. I paid extra for a large chips salsa but was still required to purchase a large salsa at the register when I picked up my order. Maybe I ll try ordering in store next time to avoid further confusion and disappointment.
Been going her since I was a child and they always hit it on the nail  Love their breakfast tacos and refried black beans  Can t wait to make this place a tradition for my kids in the future.

This is a nice little restaurant hidden in the corner of a small business strip. They have well-organized ordering  with customers entering and immediately bring in line to order. Trouble is that at the register there is a bunch of  stuff  that partially hides the register.  The counter is simply crowded. They have a varied menu of standard Mexican food fare  tacos  burritos  nachos  quesadillas  fajitas  etc. Their vegetables are always very fresh and the various proteins are grilled and seasoned very well. They have fresh salsa of different intensity as well as fresh cilantro  pico  and other items to add to your meal. Currently  due to COVID precautions  they are individually packaged  and I find the servings to be more than adequate. I m a huge fan of their chicken tacos and chicken quesadillas. However  while always tasty  the quantity of chicken each time varies. Their steak tacos are really good too.  They are tasty and filling and the cheese is just right. There s nice outdoor seating that I recommend when the weather cooperates. If you re in the area  this is a good place to stop in. Odds a very good you ll be satisfied with your meal.

I ve been here quite a few times in the last month and I would say that the corn tortillas are absolutely amazing  Definitely an authentic Mexican casual stop in the corn tortillas let you know that this place is special

I would not use ZuZu for your future party or gathering.  I am a planner and don t like to leave things to the last minute so I went online  on Monday  to put in an order for 25 mixed fajita plates  for a gathering I was having on Thur.  On Thur I called  around 11am  to make sure that we were still  good to go .  I was assured that they saw my order and it would be ready around 5 45pm.  I showed up at 5 50pm to find everyone sitting around looking at their phones.  I asked if I could get my   order to-go  and they looked at me with blank faces.  My  order was not ready and no one had an idea of what I was talking about.  I showed them my confirmation on my phone and they then proceeded to call someone who might have a clue and then told me the order was never put in the system.  I was furious.  My party started at 6 30 and I wanted to get there early to setup and now I had no food and was going to be late.  The only reason I m not giving this one star is because they were able to get my order together in about 20 mins.  The food was so so but at least it was hot.  Whoever manages this establishment should consider a process change for large take-away orders.  Whoever owns Zuzu might consider hiring a new manager.

This food was sloppy and not genuine. The taco was not good and looked horrible  meanwhile the fajitas were not properly cooked and were not traditionally Mexican style. I will not order this food again and will look elsewhere for authentic Mexican food.

Finally stopped by for lunch and am very glad I did.  From the mixed reviews  I decided I wanted to try it myself and well - from the photos  the food looks delicious.  I am always a fan of fresh salsa bars   As I wanted to try a couple menu items  I decided to go a la carte - which I am also a big fan of.    Between myself and the hubby  we ordered   Mahi-Mahi taco   these were filled with grilled mahi-mahi  lettuce  tomatoes  and sprinkled with cotija cheese. All the ingredients were fresh and the Mahi-Mahi was superb.   Shrimp taco  this was filled with grilled shrimp  fresh pico de gallo  sliced avocado  and sprinkled with cotija cheese. They do not skimp out on the shrimp which was fairly good sized - also  very fresh and well seasoned.  One of the best Shrimp tacos I have had in Austin.  Picadillo Taco   filled with house made Picadillo taco meat. Topped with lettuce tomatoes  and mozzarella cheese. I have never had Picadillo like this before. Usually the Picadillo I have tried in the past is made with ground beef and sometimes peas and potatoes in it.  This Picadillo here was more like a stewed meat and WOW  so flavorful.  Both my husband and I were taken back with how delicious this meat was. Definitely recommended   Chips  amp  Salsa  Yes  you need to purchase the chips to go with the Salsa bar. No  this is not your typical sit down type Mexican Tex-Mex restaurant. It s more like fast food as you order at the counter so I did not mind the fact that the chips are not complimentary - except during Happy Hour.  The chips were fresh and tasty.   The Salsa Bar - OMG  so good   There are three different types of salsa. Visually  the Salsa bar was clean and inviting - as if to say  come try all of it.  I particularly favored the Verde sauce.  Another interesting addition is that they have a bottle of Crema and butter.  I am not ashamed to admit  I like butter on my chips. So between the salsas  crema  and butter - I was in total absolute heaven.  I look forward to returning to try more menu items.  Tip   Saturdays is free queso and Happy Hour free chips to go with the amazing salsa.  Let me add - customer service was good  the place was clean and the food came out hot and fast.
I have even had my husband bring me takeout to Houston. Fresh great peach mango tea  fresh salsa bar an assortment of sides great food served quickly.

Cashier manager had a very intimidating attitude while ordering. Not only to us but the couple before and after. Immediately ruined the first time experience there. Chips were stale  in terms of  Mexican food  this was not very good. Meat was old cold  rough on all four of our plates. Flavors were rushed and sloppy. Looks like they poured the salsa from the chips onto the enchiladas because it tasted and looked the same as the salsa and chips  Tortillas tasted stale and overall plate flavors did not satisfy my Latin roots. Not for me  wouldn t go back. On a positive note  the music playlist was good.

On 8 19 2019  my colleagues and I had food catered from Zuzu.   We ordered chicken  vegetable and steak fajitas as well as beans  rice and freshly made tortillas.  I tried all the fajita mixtures  but was the most fond of the classic chicken fajitas. The fajitas had tender chicken  saut ed onions and peppers. The freshness of the vegetables and meat make these some of the best Tex-Mex fajitas in the ATX.   A must try

This was the 1st time that I ordered here and I ordered delivery through Grub Hub.. I ordered the ZuZu salad with chicken and what I received was a box of lettuce with dry pieces of tasteless chicken. No dressing  no guacamole  no cheese  no tortilla strips. What am I supposed to do with this  So  now I will order a salad from somewhere else and try to incorporate this into that.

Ordered delivery for my first try of this restaurant--pork verde chili and spinach chicken burrito. Both quite tasty but very little pork in the chili  mostly liquid  and the accompanying tortillas were not wheat as I ordered.
This place used to be decent but the quality has sank and prices have risen. I guess they stay in business due to limited choices in that area. Bummer
Delicious roasted chicken--on par with  better than Fresas and way cheaper. Wonderful staff and always friendly. Highly recommend this casual neighborhood Austin original.

Every time I am in north Austin I decide to return to eat here and I do. Located off of MoPac you have to maneuver to get here.  The place is designed to order and food is brought to you.  I ordered the Migas Platter and coffee.    We met the owner before and quickly chatted with him.  Coffee was out and someone quickly started to make a new pot.  This place is much different from your standard Tex mex restaurant and always enjoyed the food here.  Soon the coffee was ready and our meals. The Migas was very good and tasted excellent.  The plate cans with tortillas  roasted potatoes and slice of watermelon.   I look forward in returning back for another great meal.
Very good service. Everyone was sooo sweet and the food was athletic    It was delicious

Just spent 12 minutes waiting for a way to salty  burnt bacon and a teaspoon of chorizo breakfast taco for  3.49.  So salty I  had to threw most of it away .  I eat there a lot  but after today will be finding another place.  Customers in the store should not wait for food for the afternoon to be cooked
Their chimichanga with chicken and shrimp tacos are my go-tos. Get the beans as one of your sides

My wife and I have picked up food a couple times during the pandemic and the service has been exceptional both times. We were even given a free large order of homemade tortilla chips which are amazing. The shrimp tacos seem to get tastier each time we order them. This past visit I finally ordered the Zuzu Sundae which was phenomenal.

I don t come here often but every time I do the quelite of the food is good. Staff is friendly. I liked the fish platter and my 54 cents homemade tortillas. Wish they had compostable to go containers.
First time ordering from here and half of my order was left off including the salsa for the chips and salsa that I ordered.

First time eating this restaurant s food. Ordered for delivery with door dash. If this is real Mexican food  then I am not Mexican American. The  cheese enchiladas in red sauce were cotija cheese wrapped in flour tortillas  slightly grilled and covered in what tasted like a pizza or marinara sauce. Definitely not real Mexican food. The charro beans were served in a small corn tortilla  bowl  but were dry. The roasted potatoes were okay. My husband had the mahi mahi tacos and he said they were  alright . Won t order from this place anymore.

I always enjoy coming here  It s a wonderful place if you are looking for good  clean  homemade Mexican food. Great salsa bar  high quality food  and for a great price  Casual and fast. A great  local spot

We were a group of 5 and tried a few dishes. Taco salad with grilled veggies amd grilled fish  avacado Tacos  veffies salad with grilled onions  chimichamga platter with chicken amd roast chicken plate.  Food was very tasty and fresh.  Upon ordering and paying  we took our seat and food came to our table.  Good customer service amidst busy lunch service. They have a table of sides which had dauces and salsa and jalapenos amd lime. It was very very good.  Overall a good lunxh experience.  Fast  tasy and yummy mexicam food
It s OK. We had a quesadilla and burrito  and it was fine. I wouldn t go back  because I d rather try something else.   The lady taking orders was nice and it looked like service was good too

My food delivery is extremely late. I called the restaurant  and when I asked when my order is goin to arrive because it s late  the guy who answered said   I don t know. Your driver isn t there yet   and hung up.  It was supposed to arrive by 11 09  and it s 11 27. I m hangry  assholes.
Good food  good value   staff is great  I appreciate how they are handling the current situation.

I typically am a fan of the food here  but this morning was clearly an exception. I ordered something simple  some breakfast tacos to go. When they brought me my tacos we went over the list and all seemed good. When I got home one of the tacos  a steak  egg  and cheese  turned out to be chorizo  egg  and cheese. And the chorizo soooooo greasy that no one could handle the taco without getting their entire hands covered with grease. So disgusting. Come on ZuZu it s not that early in the morning.

This has always been one of my favorite places to eat. The spinach chicken burrito on wheat was my go-to  but now I m stuck on the verde chicken enchiladas with the corn tortillas. Always fresh  great sauces and the fact that it s healthy is a major bonus.
Picked up food from take out this evening and we ve been eating at this restaurant for 13 years.  Fabulous as always
Great fresh food here. Excellent fajitas  breakfast  fresh vegetables and incredible guacamole.  All the sauces are homemade and super fresh.

I have been holding on writing a review due to laziness.  I have been here over 10 times and service always seems to be lackluster.  One of the gentlemen there is always very short and seems to hate working there.  Other than that  the food is decent.  While it s not the most flavorful food I have tasted  I do appreciate the quality of the food.  You can tell it s made with care and they do not overload their food options with cheese like most typical  Mexican  restaurants.   I do not feel  guilty  for eating here because I feel like this is not junk food  depending on what you get .  If you get their chicken corn tacos  then this makes for a good healthy take out option.  Kudos to Zuzu s for that.  With that being said  the gentlemen needs be more patient and not hurry you up over the phone or in person.  I recommend only if you are in a rush and want quick mexican food that s not that flavorful.

In town for the holidays and I decided I would visit since I frequently ate here for lunch during my Austin days. I always order the Verde soup and it s always good...today I encountered a rubber-ban. I chewed on it for a minute thinking the pork was a little tough. I mentioned it to the lady cleaning the tables she then went to tell everyone...everyone just looked at me. The manager did not come check on my at all. It seems as if this restaurant has gone down hill. Will not return here. Check your food if you can.

My boyfriend and i just moved to this area and we were looking for a place that was locally owned. Zuzu was 3 minutes from our place and since it was so close we were excited to try it and have a new spot for mexican when we had cravings. This place is byob which is awesome  I had the taco salad with steak and my boyfriend had a spinach salad with chicken. Everything was so fresh and definitely will be a new spot we plan to go

I came here hungry and ready to  really enjoy some Mexican food  but everything here really was just okay. I had two steak enchiladas and a chicken Gordita with a side of charro beans. The beans were the only thing that lived up to what you d expect from a good mexican restaurant.

I give a solid 3 stars. I ve been many times and though consistency varies it s always  except once  between good and really good. I ve never had a problem with the service or the wait time. The room is spacious with plenty of light. It reminds me of a cafeteria. There is outdoor seating which is quite pleasant if you can ignore the proximity to mopac and the parking lot. I like the choice of sides and the salsa bar. Neither are  knock-outs  but consistent.

Well  I finally had a unpleasant visit to Zuzu s. The food was still great  but the service fell apart today. I waited behind a guy who had gotten an incorrect order. He was fine with it  the server was not. She was upset at him and decided to take it out on me. She was rude  angry  and just wanted me to go away. My order was wrong and I was missing two items  one taco  one Coke . I was not in the mood to go back in and face her again so I just drove away and ate what I got. The owners of Zuzu are wonderful people who usually do what it takes to get things right the first time. Maybe they were not there  it was a Sunday  or maybe they just have to take what they can get in this labor market. This was my first disappointing visit to what is usually a five star joint. It happens. Don t let this keep you from visiting here if you are from somewhere else. This place is still the best non-Tex-Mex in Austin

We had Zuzu delivered via an app. We got nachos and a fajita. Both were the worst we have ever had. The  nachos  were chips with melted shredded white cheese and diced tomatoes. The cheese covered about 7 chips  leaving the majority as literally just chips.

Zuzu  I worship you Mexican God of   Gigantic menu   Fresh  colorful  handmade delicous Tex-Mex  Huge and inexpensive portions  Extraordinary service  Fun decor and vibe  Salsa onion bar  I am healed and converted to only pray to you  Zuzu when Tex-mex spirits crave me south of the border.  There are so many options here and you can even eat healthy with salads  lettuce tacos  fish  fat-free refried beans.  Let me elaborate on the lettuce tacos....huge dark green lettuce filled with grilled chicken  ground beef  steak  etc and topped with your choice of tomatoes  fresh white cheese  onions  guac  sour cream  salsa.  Grilled chicken was tasty juicy and ground beef was seasoned up all brown and perfect.  Gorditas  enchiladas  flautas  nachos  burritos  etc etc all dancing around the menu like tasty little heathens.    Service is top notch and dealt with my slow ordering and annoying questions like only professionals could.  When I get starved I tend to stare at menus like an alien who has never seen food before.   Regret not finding this Mexican idol sooner.

We go to ZuZus from time to time.  This isn t a true Mexican or Tex-Mex spot but it is good.  Friendly service  affordable food  and tastes good.  It has not always been consistently flavorful food  even with the same dish  for me to rate it higher.  Definitely worth trying if you live in the area and don t want to go far.  They have outside seating as well.
Our first time trying ZuZu and it was disappointing. The food was cold  the chicken tough  the fajitas skimpy and the mole sauce just didn t taste like mole.

Totally fine place to eat. It s a nice sized restaurant you walk right up to the counter to order and they ll give you a number hanger and come deliver your food when it s ready  like whataburger . They only have bottled beer and wine for alcoholic beverages. I ordered the blackened catfish taco and the pulled pork taco. They were fine. Nothing exciting at all. Quick service which makes it easy for lunch. Affordable prices. Just average

Ambience - very beautiful and colorful store. Everything looks handpainted and there is lots of bright colors. There is lots of natural lighting since 2 of the walls are windows. The vibe here was really cool and felt cozy. There is plenty of seating and a nice salsa bar at the beverage station. When I got there there was a bunch of boxes everywhere but I guess it was truck day so they got all their supplies. Overall I really enjoyed the way the dining room looked  it felt like a little piece of Latin America   Menu - their claim to fame is everything is homemade  so I m guessing it is a scratch kitchen for Mexican food. The menu sports both traditional Mexican food items as well as a breakfast menu. The menu is pretty varied and offers lots of options and choices. It hits the main staples of enchiladas  burritos  taco salads and entree meals. Some of the items on the menu are unique and they blend different cusisnes into traditional dishes. So there is some specialty dishes you won t find elsewhere. Overall the menu is pretty standard of what you would find at any Mexican food place but with some unique twists. Solid menu with plenty of options.   Service - as I came in there was gentleman unpacking supplies right in front of the register. He was clearly the manager and I m pretty sure he was the General Manager by the way he interacted with guests and crew. Anyways he seemed like a really nice guy. The teenager at the register seemed very nervous  so I m pretty sure he is new. It took him awhile to figure out how to run my card. But that s ok  everyone is new at some point. He was friendly and nice  he followed the routine of asking if I want this or that  but it was definitely scripted and it didnt flow naturally. There was 2 older Hispanic  ladies in the kitchen who said hello to me and gave me a warm smile. Bonus points for that. While i was eating a guest came in that apparently comes here all the time as all the staff got super excited to see this man. Always a good sign when you see repeat guests and guests that the kitchen know. This gentleman and the GM also apparently know alot about each other as they talked for a long while about business and life. So why is this important and in my review  Because that s excellent service there  if you have guests that you know on a personal basis then that probably means you are doing something great when it comes to food and service. So overall the service was very nice and very welcoming. It was like a family vibe going.   Food - so I got the Mexi-cajun monster burrito. I think that was the name  but it was a monster chicken burrito with cajun style sauce. I also got 2 sides  one was Mexican rice and then a corn salsa salad thing. The sides were good  nothing super special. The rice was a pretty standard Mexican rice that you find anywhere. The corn salsa was nice  had a nice sweet taste of the corn. I mixed them both together and they tasted really nice together. They were good but nothing to cream your pantied over. The burrito was a large burrito filled with all the wonderful veggies and chicken. They cut it at bias for you and it looked beautiful. The burrito was really good. The veggies were nice and fresh and had a great flavor. The chicken was still moist and had a great spicy kick. It wasnt like super spicy but it did pack a nice heat. It almost tasted like a buffalo sauce to be honest. But either way it was good. The mixture of all these things lead to a really great tasting burrito. Nothing overpowered anything and they all complimented each other well. This is one of the better monster burritos I have had anywhere. It was packed full and didnt skimp of anything. I really enjoyed how the chicken wasnt dry and how simple yet flavorful this was. Some places focus too much on a robust sauce or something that overpowers all the veggies and beans  so that basically all you taste is sauce. So overall my meal was really good. The burrito had a great flavor that was fresh and spicy.   Overall - gotta say that this was pretty good stop for me. The service was good  the food was tasty and the price was reasonable. Never been to a scratch Mexican food joint but I wasnt disappointed. I really love the decor of the store and the fact that the crew was just so unique and genuine with guests. It also gives props that they have regulars that everyone knows and loves. I drive by this place every day to work and noticed the bright purple and yellow letters but could never tell what it was because there are trees that block the view from the highway. But yeah  really great place with a solid menu and good food

This place has THE best tasting food   Their tortilla soup  roasted potatoes  salad dressing  and peach tea are unique and the best anywhere.  Their blacken catfish platter and cilantro Chile chicken are both outstanding   Their BBQ catfish tacos and gorditos are also really good especially when you add the fresh cilantro  onion  and a little of their homemade salad dressing.   If you order online  be sure to check your order to be sure everything is correct as you would with any take out order.

I have been a customer for 3 years and sometimes they get my order correct and sometimes they don t. Today  they didn t get my order correct and all they could do was refund me since I don t feel safe going into restaurants right now. They did refund me which makes me happy. They need to do a much better job of checking the orders and making sure they are correct  especially when the orders are being delivered. I did e-mail them and complain and it is going to be quite a while before I order from them again. I will say their queso is delish  They have issues getting my tacos correct even though I have made very clear notes on Grubhub and even when I have dined in  they have not made my tacos correctly. If you do order from them  especially on Grubhub  and you have special requests  make it extremely clear  amp  maybe even call them and make it clear so your order is correct. If I do ever order from them again  that is what I will so so my order will be correct
Fantastic food and service  plus you can BYOB  They also have their own modest selection of beer. This place consistently delivers a quality dining experience.

Talk about dissapointing.  I wanted breakfast my wife wanted lunch.  We get there at 1 55 wait in line get to the front of the line.  Get to front of line at 2 02 ask to order breakfast and told that it is after 2.  We say have been in line since before 2  and told it is already put away.  Part of the reason was at front of line after 2 was only person ringing up orders went to the back to talk to someone for a few minutes  I order chicken enchiladas with queso sauce  wife orders a salad.  My enchiladas came out room temp to cold.  Sent them back as wanted hot food.  Came out at room temp again.  Besides putting some more queso on top hard to see what they did.  Second time in a row for bad food. Previous time Chicken was so dry as to be inedible.  It is convenient as across the street from my office  but looks like I am going elsewhere

The quality of their ingredients is top-notch including the meats and vegetables. I love that one of their side choices is grilled vegetables. The staff is quite friendly. Their selection of salsas is amazing  and because they re all so delicious  it s hard to choose .... so I just get some of each. If you go onto their website  there s a link to order online and pickup.

Tasty  not expensive at all and friendly as can be. Gluten-free friendly  celiac friendly  kids friendly and vegan friendly.  Our family consists of one vegan  one vegeterian  and one child with Celiac disease  so you see it could be a challenge for us to find in a restaurant something for everyone. So Zuzu is absolutely great for us.

Quick.  Cheap. Reliable.  Not to heavy.  Always fresh.  Love the salads  amazing vinegrette  and the roast chicken is always good.  Tasty tacos but nothing super special.  Good refried beans.  Beans and salad are best side options.  Not where I d go for enchiladas.

This is one of my favorite locally owned Mexican restaurants. Food is interior Mexican  so a nice change from Tex-Mex. The grilled steak and chicken tacos are super delicious. They have great Veggie flautas  and most of their sides are vegetarian. Be sure to try the black refried beans and ancho chile new potatoes.Service is always excellent  and the food is super fresh. The grilled shrimp tacos are one of my favorites. So flavorful  and better than most costing a lot more. They have a salsa bar with 3 different salsas and house-made picco de Gallo. Queso is excellent also. Peach mango tea is an added bonus. They serve beer and wine  but you can also bring  your own. Give Zuzu s a try. You won t be disappointed

Quite often I find myself inviting guests to my home last minute with no thought of what I will serve    I do not panic because I have the best authentic from scratch restaurant in my neighborhood      ZuZu never lets me down   The mixed fajitas   Mexican style rice and black beans  fresh hand made tortillas   chips that you wish you could buy last minute at the supermarket and the salsas  from poblano   to pico de gallo  to red salsa all made from scratch       So reasonably priced   Such large portions prepared family style for a crowd if you ask    So fresh   A kind and welcoming staff  clearly talented chef and assistants ... and an accessible owner who actually cares about his customers   Sometimes you may get one  even two of the above but consistently I get all three    I love this restaurant

Regret stopping in to try this place. Let s start with their Peach. Mango tea bland  bland  threw it out settled for surgery soda. Mahi taco platter  the mahi is cut into bit size pieces  also bland and overcooked  drowned it with lemon juice and salsa to eat it. Couldn t finish the as second one. My sides were their grilled vegi 90  purple onion  5  red pepper and 5  poblano. Not really vegi huh  And the potatoes were probably the best thing on the plate  but dont ask me why   ....now my stomach is grumbling

I ordered migas for breakfast today. The flavor was good however this is the soggiest migas I have ever had  the menu said Corn chips. I am giving them 3 stars because the salsa bar is good and they gave me homemade corn tortillas. Also the potatoes were just eh. Very friendly staff and very clean over all.

I ve been coming here for years. Their food is very fresh. I really enjoy the grilled chicken salad. It s light  amp  fresh.   They have awesome guacamole. And their salsa bar is a nice touch. I m sure all the salsas are house made.
This place is amazing like no other great hand made food very professional stuff I love this place
Good prices  good food made to order. Clean and neat. fresh salsas. They actually have decaf tea and Coke

Good had no flavor. I added plenty salsa and cilantro . It didn t fill me up either. My food got to my table before I even sat down. I was getting my soda and salsa and the lady said here s your food. Less than 2 mins after I ordered.   2nd time here food was good service was good

This Tex-Mex restaurant is one of my favorite quick  amp  healthy lunch or dinner spots.  It s quick  but it s not fast food.    Their menu has all the standard fare you d expect  fajitas  enchiladas  tacos  quesadillas  etc.  The food is fresh  colorful  and well presented  eliminating that unhealthy  hues of brown and gold  effect that you often get with a Mexican food plate.  This restaurant offers sides like a green salad  made with real leafy greens  not shredded iceberg lettuce   grilled corn relish  and blended black beans served in a taco shell cup  my kids  favorite .  The fajitas include red and green bell peppers.  The fish tacos  my favorite  are made with mahi mahi and served with green leaf lettuce. There is a specials board with various selections that change weekly.  They have a standard kids  menu for 12  amp  under.  Salsas are handmade and are available on ice at a side bar.  They offer pico de gallo  diced red onions  and a delicious verde  amp  chunky red salsa.  For drinks  they offer bottled beer and Jarritos sodas from a cooler on the front counter  along with iced tea and sodas and lemonade.  Here s what makes it quick  You view the menu and order the food at the front counter  pay and get a plastic number tent.  Then you pick up your drinks  amp  silverware and choose a table.  They bring your food to you when it s ready  usually 10-15 minutes max .  The dining area is one large room with mainly 2  amp  4 top tables  with a few available for larger party seating  we ve also shoved a few tables together for larger parties on occasion .  They bus the tables when you leave.  All in all  a pleasant dining experience.
Love the food But need to have two registers going when busy. Or a separate line just for pickups. Food still is very good.
Walked in  ordered breakfast bowl  was only customer. They forgot it. Will not go back  amazing

It was  25 for 2 bowls  one chicken  one veggie  plus chips and guacamole. That is way expensive compared to similar places like Chipotle.   The bowls lacked much flavor and had very odd amounts of items like tons of lettuce and barely any rice. Nothing was seasoned well or very tasty. Also the black beans were refried for some unknown reason which turned the bowl into a big black bean bowl of mush.   No  just no.
Dry chicken  grease puddles and just not good. Thought it would be better. Disappointed.

Interesting take on the enchilada plate. Delicious green sauce  shredded beef instead of chopped and black beans are substituted for refried.   Creative interior Mexico cuisine with attentive  friendly service and fair prices.  You can t go wrong by dining here
Summed up as bland and overpriced  very let down. Polite staff and clean establishment.

The restaurant has a very nice decor on the inside the food was not bad and the service was very good  we got the pork taco special it was very good  and the beans  was good  it is served in a  corn cup shell

I will be honest  the only item I have had from their menu is their zuzu salad with shrimp. However  the salad alone warrants 4 stars. It consists of deliciously seasoned grilled shrimp on a bed of shredded romaine lettuce with a little bit of guac tortilla strips  and what I THINK is a sprinkling of cotija cheese. The dressing is a rosemary-lime vinaigrette with what I think is minced garlic. I wish they bottled that up and sold it because I would put that      on everything  It s THAT good   My friend had the avocado tacos on flour tortillas and he seemed to really enjoy them. There s also a salsa bar which is always a plus. I like adding a little of their red salsa and pickled jalapenos to my salad for extra spice and flavor.

I am a fan of Zuzu s because of the food. Atmosphere is one step above a fast food place  so I wouldn t come here on an evening that I wanted to dine out  but I have come here a number of times for lunch  take-out  and during the week in the evenings when I want something quick and good. The food is tasty  and they have an extensive menu. This week I got the green chile chicken  and it came with two sides--the salad and grilled veggies were great. It s seldom that I leave a Mexican food restaurant feeling healthy  but I do when I eat here  because they have some healthy choices.

While this was not one of the worst Mexican restaurants in Austin  it was one of the most mediocre. The food was incredibly bland. I  had the steak taco platter with black beans  salty  and  Mexican  rice. Ugh  no  that rice was NOT Mexican or Spanish rice. It was minute rice fluffed with some spices added for color with some peas and corn kernels tossed in for good measure. The steak was dry and flavorless. Nothing memorable about the food.  I was surprised that there were lots of people lunching there  but then I remembered the rule about ethnic restaurants  you can gauge the authenticity of an  ethnic  restaurant by the amount of similarly  ethnic  customers dining there. I was the ONLY Hispanic in there. My husband pointed out that there was a lady sitting behind us  but she was clearly an employee.   On the up side  I liked the salsa bar and the lettuce they used for the tacos was romaine so it was nice and crunchy. If y all want pointers on how to spice up your salsa bar  check out the salsa bar at Taco Palenque in Laredo  TX. The Taco Palenque salad bar is nothing short of spectacular.
This is a great little fast casual place. The food was fresh and tasty  the service was fast  there was a nice selection of salsas and we enjoyed all of it. Great value too

The menus and website prices need to be updated   I certainly didn t appreciate being surprised at the cash register with higher than listed prices.  When I asked the cashier about it he responded with confusion    Oh  I think they changed the prices  miss.   Really  dude   If prices were off by just a few cents I wouldn t be complaining  but this was a couple of dollars - that is frustrating.  He also didn t offer to do anything because of their error.  And while I think they re onto something with their breakfast bowls  they were actually pretty tasty through pretty greasy  I m gonna hold off on visiting again until they get it together.

One of my go to places for Mexican food. Is this really authentic Mexican food  nope. Is it delicious and well done   Yes  High quality ingredients and the best part is they are not afraid to flavor their food   The salsa is some of the best of ever had as well  Great place   Try the Tuesday special
The Burrito Bowl is to experience your taste buds exploding with fresh  natural flavors. Downsizing is not the game plan here. It s all about flavor and experience.
This is a filthy restaurant  and unsurprisingly  disgusting and disappointing food. It baffles me how they stay in business.
Was not disappointed  a bit small but great customer service and almost no wait  Food came out fast and fresh  Will for sure come again soon.

A hidden Austin gem   It is yummy  affordable  fast and super fresh      They have a bar of salsa  fresh jalape os  fresh onions  fresh cilantro  and limes. Highly recommend the tostados  but everything is good    Also the employees are noticeably kind to you and also to each other

Born and raised in Mexico City and the daughter and granddaughter of two of the finest cooks  I m spoiled and have high expectations. That said  there are so many places to eat excellent Mexican food in Austin - both Interior and TexMex - that there is no reason to spend one dime or one minute anywhere mediocre. Zuzu is mediocre in every since of the word. Sorry Zuzu.

This place is  in a word  amazing. I got the steak tacos and the carne asada so on point. All the ingredients were fresh  the veggies crispy. I got the pur ed black beans as a side. They were a little soupy for my taste  but then again  I ve never had pur ed beans before. So it s probably normal. Regardless  they were delicious.   The rice was so-so  but that could be attributed to the taco and beans out shining the rice. Also  the salsa was impressive.  The prices were entirely reasonable for a fresh  delicious meal.

Skip the queso...sadly it s the most bland and runny queso I ve ever eaten.  Luckily I got take out  so I added habanero and other spices to it when I realized what a struggle it was going to be to finish it all.

To start with all the tables were dirty. I wiped down my own. I regretted leaving something in the tip jar as no one could muster a thank you. My meal came after too long. One of my two sides was beans. They gave me about 2 tablespoons of beans. I left hungry. No one every wiped down any of the tables while I was there. It is clear they just don t care.

I went there in 2000  amp  had a problem with my large called-in to go order.  I was shorted my 3 side orders of chips  amp  salsa. When I got back to my office with order we saw that the chips  amp  salsa orders were not in the bags. When I called to inquire about the missing chips salsa  they gave my call to a Manager who boasted he was also the owner.    When I told him my chips  amp  salsa orders were missing  he laughed and said of course they are.  Unless you picked up your salsa at our salsa bar  you won t have any.  Our customers pick their own sauce from our salsa bar.    Being it was my first   amp  last  visit to Zuzu s I wasn t aware of their procedure.  I went back to Zuzu to pick up the salsa  since it was for 3 of my co-workers who ordered with me  the owner basically said it was my own fault I had to come back.  That I should have seen the salsa bar.  Needless to say it s 2012  I m still standing by my word to NEVER spend   where the owner of all people doesn t care about the customers.

We ve eaten here many times through the years  at least since 2008  I think   and we just ate there last weekend.  And we get one thing   the Spinach Chicken Burrito.    It was just a special when we first went  but was added to the regular menu shortly afterward.  We don t order anything else anymore  every other time we ve chosen something else  we ve been very disappointed and didn t like the food.  Sometimes even the spinach chicken burrito can have too much or too little chicken or the chicken is too dry or the vinaigrette is too little or the burrito tortilla is too dry and starts cracking and falling apart.  Fortunately  despite that long list of potential flaws  it s usually very good  which is why we keep going back.  Oh  and the green salsa in the salsa bar  it s fantastic and a great complement to the burrito.  The frequent diner program is weird  it doesn t matter what you buy.  It s 1-use  to get a stamp or use a full card  per whole-party.  It just feels unfriendly and rubs us the wrong way  though we eat there often enough that we do use it.  We have young kids now and have tried the children s menu quesadilla several times  but it s too-dry more often than not  and if not eaten quickly it become hard.   Our children are too young to understand they should just eat-it-up right away if they like it.   We do enjoy the chips and queso  especially the free  happy hour  chips and small queso on Saturdays.   Chips by themselves do cost  unlike a number of restaurants.   The men s bathroom does not have an infant changing table  there is plenty of room for one   which has been a 4  year frustration for me as a dad that often changes the kids  diapers.  Shall I put the baby down on the concrete bathroom floor for a change   The seat belts on the high chairs are usually broken.  On our last visit  I checked every one  every single one was broken.  Be careful when the floors  especially the bathroom floors  are recently washed.  They become very slippery

I m a big fan of Zuzu s for 5 specific reasons  1. Close proximity to home - perfect for take-out 2. The homemade corn tortillas are absolutely perfect 3. The chicken flautas are the best I ve ever had  and believe me I ve had my share. 4. The chicken spinach salad with their house dressing is my very favorite salad.  5. Last  but certainly not least  is the fresh salsa bar that has pico de gallo  3 salsas  fresh and pickled jalape os  limes  cilantro  onions and sour cream.   The menu has a variety of appetizers  combo meals  and Zuzu s specials. Please take note  this is not a Tex-Mex establishment.   In my opinion many of the visitors who ve written negative reviews could have improved their culinary experience by utilizing the flavorful treats on the salsa bar.

I m updating because I decided to give Zuzus another chance. My steak tacos this time were 100  better than my last few visits. The flour tortillas were soft and tasted fresh and there was a generous portion of juicy  flavorful steak. I hope this wasn t a fluke  and if they have indeed stepped up their game  they have regained a former loyal customer.
It s a-ok place. The salsa bar was  a little disappointing.  We ordered Flautas and a chimichanga. The oil had a little off flavor. I think it went a bit rancid. Nothing to write home about.

First time eating here and last.  I ordered the steak tacos.  The meat was tough  the seasoning was not good at all and the flour tortillas were cold.  High prices low quality food.  Not worth the stop.

I ordered a tostada  taco and a thing I never heard of before.  It was a small corn bottom with beans and all kinds of things on it.  I ate every bite of the entire plate and enjoyed all of it. The ingredients were high quality.  No iceberg cheapie lettuce here.  There was a scoop of guacamole on my plate that was delicious.  And the salsa  I will stop there anytime I am in the area whether hungry or not.  Sorry to Torchy s but Zuzu is now my favorite casual Mexican place.  I forgot to mention how affordable it is.  Crazy good food for little bitty bit of money.

The service is fantastic  Super friendly  very personable. The gentleman behind the counter was happy to take my order  and it made me happy to give it. It was an atmosphere that a person can really feel warm and welcome. It reminded me of going to a dear friend s house for Thanksgiving.   The food however  is very confusing.   The food is made with some care and thoughtfulness. I believe it was made with freshness being a priority. Very respectable but  lacking.   There was nothing in terms of flavor. Bland. Real bland. Perhaps that s what they are going for  Given that it s nestled in perhaps the blandest part of Austin  Even the 1.25  I spent for the always reliable Hatch chillies didn t help... Much.   Fine. Another white-bread Mexican place in a strip. Who cares  There s a million of those.   Here s my real problem... Mozzarella.   Mozzarella cheese is the cheese they chose to be their cheese of choice in all their choices.   Really  Mozzarella does not have the arm strength to hold up quesadillas  and enchiladas and every other Mexicanish dish that we all love. It s too lean  Not enough grasa  Not enough salt    Everytime I took a bite of my enchiladas it reminded me that I wished I was eating pizza. Or enchiladas. This is an uncanny valley of cuisine that really misses. I get the awful feeling that this restaurant is trying to outsmart everyone. Why  Have people ever complained about the cheese in enchiladas    But  I m rooting for you.

Abysmal. Bad Mahi Mahi gave my girlfriend food poisoning  Scombroid - see  hard time breathing  huge red rash all over upper body  bloodshot eyes  increased heart beat  dizziness  burning sensation of the mouth and throat  All the food we had was reheated and not fresh.  You could tell the chicken and the fish were both reheated or left out for God knows how long   6  guacamole and chips was one ice cream scope worth of guac. A trip to urgent care ended up making this the cost of a trip to Uchi.   120   The coupon they gave us to get one entr e free with the purchase of another should ve been a glaring red flag to the state of how the restaurant is doing. Shame on Russell  the owner for allowing such practices to go on. It should be noted the staff was courteous and prompt  but regardless avoid like the plague.
I was very dismayed to learn that only cash tips go to the workers at Zuzus. This is not right and there needs to be a sign           This is customary at any other place.

This place was a bit strange  but really good. They have traditional tex-mex entrees  but also much less traditional sides and some less traditional entrees.  I had the blackened catfish tacos which are a personal favorite of mine whereever I go and they did not disappoint. In fact  the blackened crust was more flavorful and spicy than usual. I got the corn relish and roasted potatoes on the recommendation of friends who had been there before and both were phenomenal. The corn relish was heavily garliced--read  tasty--and just all around good. The roasted potatoes were little red potatoes cut in half and actually roasted with some slightly charred patches on them.  The inside of the place has a very fast food feel to the seating area complete with soda fountain  but they also have an outdoor deck which has a much more relaxed feel.

I love this place for lunch.  The spinach chicken salad is my favorite. I also like their iced tea.  Service is always fast and the restaurant itself is always clean.  Great place for a fast yummy lunch

I ve been going to this place for years. It s delicious  plus there s lots of lettuce on everything. What s not to like   Gorditas are pretty kick-ass  and the black beans  and the steak salad.  They also get your order out super fast  and if you type in your phone number into the rewards thingy you get like constant free queso constantly
This place is so close to my work and I just discovered it today. I m glad I did. The food is good and fast  And I like all the configurability they offer.

Zuzu has fantastic picadillo  however it s a roll of the dice whether your taco shells will be fresh and crispy  or old and stale.  When they re good though they re spectacular.  If you have dairy issues be careful about eating here.  They re able to customize and not put cheese on things  but it seems like their food prep area has a lot of cross contamination.  If I order something with lettuce and tomatoes on it  I ll see bit of queso freso unintentionally mixed in.

Really good standard fare. The sauce bar has some good options  nothing too fancy. Quick service. The prices are fair due to the large quantity of food you get with your order. I had the chimichanga and would definitely recommend.

Omg I totally love this place... Been coming here for years ... The food is fast... Not fast food ... Everything is fresh made... And delicious.  The staff are all very friendly the decor is bright and cheerful. They have a nice area out side you can sit and eat if your  are so inclined...A highlight is the fresh salsa bar... They have several verities but the one we like the best is the tomato based chunky salsa... I could eat this as Gazpacho  If they would let me take home the extra at the end of the night I would totally come back in with a bucket    Great place for all ages...
Food is somewhat bland. Tortillas chips were stale  crispy  but oil was a little rancid .  Small portions.

Just popped in to grab a couple tacos after playing at the park  meat tasted off.  18 for two tacos  side of beans  flour tortillas and small queso. I don t know  I ve been here a couple of times and it s just not that great. Sorry. Owners seem really nice  place is always neat and clean  got to give them that much. They appear to have a lot of regulars I guess I m just not going to be one of them. Maybe it was just one of those experiences that isn t typical for a place.
I come here often  their burritos are amazing  I suggest the mexi jun burrito so good

Usually  I enjoy Zuzu s especially the verde salsa which is always fresh. Tonight however the service was mediocre and so was the food. I ordered the cheese quesadilla platter for the first time and was extremely disappointed. My meal came with only one small corn tortilla cheese quesadilla which was bland. The black bean side I ordered was a smaller portion than usual. Normally  the portions are properly sized. It felt like I got a kid s meal instead of the normal platter. As for the service  when my food same out I had to send it back because I was given a chicken quesadilla instead of the cheese which I ordered. The woman was unapologetic and seemed disinterested. If you go do not order the quesadilla unless you are ordering it for a child  or aren t very hungry.

I ve been going to Zuzu for about as long as it has been open and it has always been consistently awesome.  I love the spinach chicken salad  as well as all the tacos  and the breakfast tacos.  Zuzu is also allergy friendly   My son has FPIES  so even trace amounts of soy and dairy can put him in the hospital  and this is one of the only restaurants in Austin where he has never had any issue.  They re famous for their black beans  which make a great side  and are also good to add to the avocado tacos.  This is definitely one of the best Mexican places in Austin across the board.

I was pretty disappointed with this place. I saw  handmade  in the name and got excited and thought I d finally try it.   My boyfriend ordered the nachos to start. The plain nachos had chips  refried black beans  a little bit of cheese on them  served with a super small dollop of guacamole on top. No jalape os  salsa  cilantro  sour cream or anything else to make them exciting. The chips were soggy and overall a disappointing experience.  I ordered a burrito bowl with corn relish  black beans and veggies. The corn relish was pretty good but the chicken looked and tasted fake and the seasoning was a bit overwhelming.   My boyfriend ordered the cilantro chile chicken which actually wasn t bad. I think that s because you could douse anything with cilantro and it d be delicious.   Overall not very impressed. Other reviews said the breakfast tacos are the way to go. If I d go back  I d go back to try these.

This place has very good food and the WORST upfront cashier I have ever encountered..Horrible attitude and must hate his job..Has never gotten our simple order correct... Owners live in our neighborhood and I am shocked that they put up with this person...Tonight will be our last time there and you can know that I plan to tell everyone that asks me this simple statement-great fresh food and a horrible order taker.....

I have had chicken tostadas and chicken tacos for lunch. My friend has had fish tacos  fajita tacos and chimi. Personally I like it. It s always hot  fresh and plenty. He s not impressed with it but always eats here when on this side of town.

I like the atmosphere more than I like the food. Everything is OK  but not great. The chicken enchiladas are usually good  but the food quality could be higher. The salsa bar is nice. If you are looking for a quiet spot for happy hour to sit outside that won t be full  this is a pretty good choice.

Today was the first time I have eaten here in 15 years. I had the Cilantro Lime Chicken with grilled veggies and pureed black beans. My chicken was very tender  the cilantro sauce on the top very tasty. The grilled veggies just right. I have always been a fan and particularly like their fresh salsa bar. Not Texmex  but good food with sophisticated Mexican flavors.

The food is simply put  average  nothing impressive. You had better like fish though  everything I order had a slight fish taste even though I did not order fish. Cleaning the grill regularly during the day would greatly improve the food. If your looking for a great dining experience I would not recommend this restaurant. If you are just wanting to eat and get going this place would work fine for you.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. The food is tasteless  service is horrible  and definitely not worth the price. I went in for lunch with my husband and daughter today and do not plan on returning. My daughters food was made correctly  however ours was not. I ordered chicken gorditas and received steak ones instead. Which is a simply small mistake no big deal. Once getting my correct gorditas they only had TWO small pieces of chicken on them and a mountain of lettuce. TWO  I repeat TWO  granted I m not expecting a lot of chicken to begin with but definitely more than two. My husband ordered a steak QUESAdilla. Notice  I write the queso part of it in caps. Well upon receiving the quesadilla  we notice that there is no cheese in it. When we ordered his plate we asked for no Cojita cheese  which is the small powder looking cheese thats simply sprinkled on top as a garnish with the tomatoes. So imagine our surprise when the QUESAdilla comes with no cheese. Once I brought it to the waiters attention he took it to the back. Where another one of the kitchen staff loudly started yelling at him very rudely how we had ordered it without cheese and that s how they made it. Granted I was not standing nor sitting within feet of the kitchen. So the fact that I heard her from where i was at meant that she was being very loud and rude. So I proceeded to go up there and tell her that I ordered the plate with no Cojita cheese only  I did want the regular standard mozzarella cheese that comes in a quesadilla. I also explained to her why anyone in their right mind would order a steak QUESAdilla and not want cheese. If that was the case I could have just as easily ordered plain steak tacos. To make matters worse my gorditas were uneatable to say the least  however I tried to eat them anyways because we had already paid  25 for this horrible meal. As soon as I got to work you can rest assure it all came back up the same way it went down.   In the end  I WILL NOT be returning. Which is sad to say because my family and I have been loyal customers to this restaurant for 20  years  however the quality of the food and staff has deeply deteriorated.
Best little Mexican spot in the neighborhood. Amazing tortilla soup and their chicken is soooo good.

Pull up and it 8 30 and their sign says closes at 9 but doors are locked and I see people putting up chairs and one of them yells back toward the counter but all of them ignore me at the door... Totally rude and disrespectful.  Closing early and doesn t even the manners or maturity to let me   a customer who s standing at the door know.. I will never return... Way too many other Tex-mex places to choose from to put up with this..

This was really not great in the least. Every single item I had was soggy in some way. My burrito was leaking a steady drip of bean mixture out the bottom the entire time I tried to eat it  before complete disintegration   everything was fairly bland  and then as a really bizarre cherry on top of everything... someone came by and cleared my plate before I was even done  so quickly I couldn t even protest it... not that I would have asked for it back  but it did make me laugh  so two stars for that.

It s bad review day. Zuzu s has good if uninspired Mexican food. They use real lettuce and have very good grilled vegetables and black beans. You can get a nice nacho salad or fish tacos or a burrito  etc.  Salsa bar is nice too. Chicken is good.  Steak  is pretty flavorless. My problem is with customer service. No one is actively unpleasant  indeed  you generally get smiles. But don t try to get anything special. Some time ago I asked for a larger container for sauce than the tiny ones at the salsa bar. We d ordered guacamole and chips and sauce so that seemed reasonable to me. No no and no. Completely shut down. I took my lumps. Yesterday we did a  37.00 phone order. My friend that called it in ordered chips and sauce and asked for extra chips. The person she talked to said if we wanted more than they gave us to just ask and he would give them to us. So when I got there I asked. Oh man they weren t going to give me extra chips. I held them to it but it was very unpleasant. Rassled to the ground over  2.00. I can t imagine they thought I was lying.  I really hate losing Zuzu s as we have been getting lunch there for years but I m out.  When it comes to customer service people vote with their feet.

Have seen this place plenty of times while driving on Mopac. Was in a bind the other week and needed to pick up something quick and good to eat on the way to a meeting  thought I was going to get fed at the meeting  so hadn t planned my meals appropriately that day when the news came in otherwise  . Rather than going the drive-thru fast food route  I decided to pop into what looked like a neighborhood gem and I am so glad I did. The food was fast  cheap and handmade. I went for the quesadillas and then got all my favorite fixins at the salsa bar  onion  cilantro  pico and verde salsa . The food was hot  fresh and delicious...and I still made it to the meeting on time  but didn t have my stomach grumbling from fast food establishment grease or on empty. Thank you  Zuzu

I really  really liked this place and will be back soon.    We were in the mood for Mexican food but also didn t want to break the calorie budget.  I suppose I could pick at something somewhere else  but I heard yelpy rumors that this place was a  the bomb-diggity and b  pretty healthy.  I checked out the menu and it looked legit  so off we went.  Super cheap prices for what you got  and I got whole wheat tortillas  yummy chicken  not-fried fish  beans that were not fried in lard  a side salad  and it just tasted fresher and less artery-clogging than your normal tex mex.  My husband  who was paying a little less attention to his diet  got to get your normal fare and he absolutely loved his meal as well.  I would be back here more often  but it s just a wee-bit outside the normal commute-to-lunch zone  but I m about to make an exception this week  because now I m salivating on my keyboard thinking about my meal.  Thanks Zuzus

For a quick lunch  I sometimes pop in here and order the Black Bean Musical Fruit Nacho Salad. I am a bean freak so steer clear if you see me eating this salad. Actually  my body does not create gas. I m one of the few people in the world who does not pass wind. Cut the cheese. Toot. Okay  that s more than enough of my 12 year old boy persona.  This salad is truly delicious and begins with a layer of tostado chips  then lots of crisp romaine lettuce  black beans  fresh tomatoes  cojito cheese tossed in a rosemary lime vinegarette with a scoop of guacamole on top. Next  you have the option of adding anything you want from the salsa bar. Think about the addition of cilantro  onions  pico de gallo  red salsa  tomatillo salsa  jalapenos  lime and whatever else blows your skirt up. Oops  another fart joke. There I go  again  stinking up this review.

ZuZu is a 5 minute drive from my Northwest Hills home.  I prefer Taco Deli because the potato egg cheese combination here has always been a little oily and off somehow.  Also the  1 charge for adding extra avocado is a little insane.   But  when pressed for time I often ordered breakfast tacos for my husband on Saturday mornings over the years.  The service here has never been great.  On any given day  you can walk in and find 4 out of 5 employees sitting at a back table eating together  they often bring their children to work as well and the kids are standing up on chairs eating ice cream.  They don t like to get up and take orders to say the least.  When the head boss is around things are fine  but we can t plan our trips here around his schedule.  Earlier this year  I purchased 3 breakfast tacos with extra  1 avocado for  10.10.  The credit card machine was acting up and the cashier swiped my card twice.  She assured me that everything was okay and I left the establishment to do my normal Saturday shopping.  My card was later declined when I tried to buy  400 worth of groceries at Costco and I was shocked to discover that the mostly Spanish-speaking cashier had charged me  110.00 for THREE BREAKFAST TACOS.     We all make mistakes  but she didn t even bother to address it with me while I was waiting 15 minutes for the tacos.  I called in 15 minutes before arriving  but the tacos STILL weren t ready by the way.   When I got them home to my husband  they were stone cold.  We were forced to dispute the charges with our bank because she somehow never correctly voided the transaction and a lengthy 5 business days passed before our money was returned to the card.  I was more angry about her lack of transparency then anything else.  If you make a mistake  own it.  It was pretty embarrassing to have to put back  400 of Costco merchandise.  We called the ZuZu manager and left a message that was never returned.  Needless to say  we haven t been back since.

You re obsessed  a friend says to me as I chomp down on my fish taco.  Muwhat  I m mid-chew.  Obsessed. With the fish tacos. It s ridiculous.  Is not.   Why do you always have to act 5   Do not.  Exactly.   I can t have this conversation right now. See this  I point to the fish taco. This requires silence.   Lalalalalalalalalala   Now who s acting 5    Lalalalalalalalalalala   I hate you. But you  I look lovingly at the fish taco   I love.  Obsessed   Am not

Dear Zuzu-  A lesson in cultural cheeses.  When I get Italian food  I want it to include mozzarella. When I get Mexican food  I want it to include cheddar.  The opposite is NEVER true.  Why did you put mozzerella on my breakfast taco   Furthermore  what disgusting flavor combination are you using in your eggs   Just like Dana B  I had to remove ALL of the egg from my breakfast taco. My new go-to hangover food nearly made me sick from the odd flavor combination that I just WASN T interested in.   Thank you and have a nice day.  PS your tortillas suck too.

Zero stars. Ordered delivery on uber eats. Got a Holy chipotle and chimichanga  both with steak. Steak was BLACK. Literally burnt or just cooked re-heated 5 times. Ordered at 6 00pm. Disgusting and completely inedible. Waste of money. Who serves that  Was that burnt steak left over from yesterday  Been in restaurant business for 10 years. Would NEVER serve that crap to someone. Take the time to make a fresh batch. That s exactly how you lose customers--laziness.

In a town with so many tacos...so little time...Zuzu s is at the bottom of the list. I can appreciate the concept of  the healthy fresh mex thing...but somewhere along the way...the flavor fell out...everything taco I have had there is crammed full of green leaf lettuce. Where IS the beef    The salsa bar is not bad...if there were only a decent meal in this place to slather the salsa with...we might  have something.  Every time I have gone there  I have been underwhelmed...not impressed with their pricey over lettuced everything. The counter service is nothing to write home about...just snotty order takers.  The place is usually squeaky bleach and ammonia clean...which I guess is nice  but when the aroma of cleaners overpowers the food smells...me no likey.  If I want Fish Tacos I will hold out for La Salsa...another chain of the fresh mex movement but they leave the flavor in and leave out the attitude.

Zuzu s is very unique.  It s like they took Mexican food and built upon it.  It is Americanized  but not in that American cheese-food slices and Wonder-bread kind of way.    Everything here seems very fresh.  I could live off of their corn relish.  If you get the green salad  ask for the dressing on the side because they like to really soak that lettuce in oil  and it s too much.  I always either order the chicken tacos  highly recommended   or the veggie burrito.  Chicken tacos are wonderful with lots of lime  cilantro  onions  and pico.   The veggie burrito comes wrapped in a deep-fried tortilla.  It s like some kind of delicious burrito-donut.  A bit oily  but so tasty.     What I absolutely LOVE most about Zuzu s is the CONDIMENT BAR    I can help myself to all the pico de gallo I can stand  and pile mountains of cilantro onto every bite.   I love them forever for allowing me free access to cilantro.  Who else does that     Definitely take advantage of that bar.   Note to Zuzu s   how s about a second option of a larger container for the condiments   I always feel like I m generating too much trash having to fill up 3 containers of pico  2 of cilantro  etc..   Their iced tea is good  but they charge more for tea than soda  which seems a little weird  but that s ok.  I m not so sure how I feel about their breakfast tacos.  They re quite seasoned and the fillings are pretty roasted.  I got a couple potato egg cheese and thought for sure there must be meat in there because everything was so brown.   I wasn t particularly excited about it myself  but I bet a lot of other people would really appreciate these broasted breakfast tacos.

Zu Zu is a nice neigborhood mexi-food place..   they serve a variety of dishes  mostly standard items  it comes off as kinda west-coast style.. definitely not tex-mex  and def. not jalisco style.. maybe its just tailored to the west austin yuppie family crowd...this isnt necessarily a knock on the place since it doesnt come off as snobby or pretentious  just trying to give you a feel of the vibe..   the staff is mostly mexican though  so i guess that counts for alot..   my favorite part of ZuZu is their salsa bar.. they have a nice variety of salsas  the verde is spectacular   sour creme  fresh diced jalepeno  celantro  and a few other goodies that make nice free add-ons to your meal..   I usually order the beef chimichanga  its a fried burrito topped with queso.. a calorie packed  scrumptious meal.. the chipotle chicken enchiladas are also a good bet.. and they make really good breakfast tacos in the AM.. try the chorizo egg and cheese..2 of m and you might skip lunch..   the prices are higher than your avg taqueria  but still reasonable.. you ll spend.. about  6-8 on an entree.   overall  ZuZu is a good quick meal if youre looking for a place around 2222 and Mopac..  peace out  Chappy  a href   redir url http 3A 2F 2Fwww.tacotown.org amp s 7c8940a50440c86e97317a383ed950e9561b4cd1f042de102a73dfcc035130c6  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  tacotown.org  a

SUCKS - Staff wasn t very friendly and were to busy talking and hollering at other staff members.  The tables that were empty were still very dirty and no clean places to sit.  Prices were on the high side for the food.  The napkin holder was completly empty and everyone had to go to the cashier which was getting mad but refused to go fill it up.    Only reason for 3 stars is the Chips and Queso were good.  Not sure if I will return or not.

My second experience going here was better than the first  I m pleased to say.  This time I got the steak enchiladas  and boy were they yummy.  The portion size of the meal was enough for both my husband and I to share.  This time the sides were better too.  We got the corn relish and black beans.  Yum.  Also  I saw where they had a sign up that said  Monday-Wednesday night kids get two kids items free when an entree is ordered.   This is just another way to say kids eat free Monday-Wednesday.  I think that s cool.  Oh   I forgot to say that they also threw in a surprise free taco   Cool

I ve been on a Taco kick lately. That s putting it mildly. So  it was the notion of having a taco  close to where my daughter has her Saturday Activities that enticed me to come in. What I found was a lot less taco and a lot more....other stuff.  OK  NEWS Folks  Not every Mexican joint in town is really a taco place. Guess I had forgotten about that. In fact  with such a limited choice of taco ingredients  Zuzu is a bit odd. But not bad. The food is fresh here and is in the top half of what I have tried around town. The salsa is good  a pretty authentic tasting green. The chorizo is tasty. They have gorditas. I have found that the word  gordita  and the word  sope  tend to get used interchangeably around town. The Zuzu version was not bad. But it was a whole note flat of La Fruta Feliz. The chicken was a bit dry. Masa cake not quite as flavorful as I have grown to love at the other place.   They offer whole wheat tortillas  which is always a nice concession. I had one. Non-traditional but good. Prices are very reasonable. A 3 gordita platter for about 6 bucks can make a nice breakfast or lunch for you.  So you get fresh  tasty and reasonably priced here. What s not to love about that

This place has consistently good food.  I love the way the salad is always fresh.  My tummy always thanks me  so I can tell this is probably one of most health conscious mexican food menus in town.  The black beans are really good and I love the chip boat.  I usually order their quarter chicken meal.  It never disappoints.  I have eaten my way from the top of the menu to the bottom.  It s all good.  And the portions are just enough to satiate  not so much you feel guilty or sick.  I recommend you try a little of everything from the salsa bar.  It s not like the Taco Cabana where you have to worry about the cleanliness.  This place is always spotless.   I even tried to eat some of the chopped jalpenos  but they were pretty darn hot even for this native Texan.  Try the Mango iced tea  you won t be sorry.  It s delicious and it will put that jalapeno fire out in a hurry.  The service is great.  If you ve been coming here for the last 9 years or so it s been open  then you know that they have some of the same faces working behind the counter besides the owner  who is always nice by the way .  This says a lot to me about the working conditions.  The same girl that has worked the register since they opened has become a very confident woman from when I saw her for the first time and now.  I am happy to give them five stars.  They always come through for me in a pinch.  The restaurant lies in that comfortable zone above fast food but below a restaurant dining experience  but you sure can t tell once you start eating this delightfully light alternative to the usual Mexican fare.

I read most of the other reviews  and decided to at least give this place a try. Mainly because it s right down the street. The decor hurts my eyes. It s bright and tacky.   The salsa bar is great  and the best was the tangy green salsa. Delish. I had a bean  potato and avocado breakfast taco. It was just that. Simple. The tortilla was great  crispy and chewy at the same time.   The husband had a sunrise breakfast platter  it s like a burrito thing. A massive burrito jammed with eggs and breakfasty stuff. He said it was okay  exactly what it was supposed to be. No surprises. Except the huge chunk of watermelon on the side.   So  zuzu s is just that. A simple  tasty  cheap breakfast.

Came here for a groupon  didn t turn out extraordinary. I ordered the Mahi Mahi platter with black beans and roasted potatoes  but they seem to have replaced my potatoes with their  authentic  Mexican rice which consisted of corn and peas. The pureed black beans are served in a corn chip bowl. The beans tasted pretty good  but the chip tasted like it was months past expiration  Food kind of smelled like dog food when it was handed to me. If you want some tex-mex or some traditional Mexican food  I would try looking elsewhere.
Food was decent  but the meat on the tacos was very skimpy. The sides were generous serving sizes.

Got a breakfast taco  beans potato cheese on corn. Thought I d eaten a BRICK  or the wet mortar at least. The hot sauces  They look nice  but have no flavor  just like the tacos.   Plus really snotty people working there. I won t be back  and you should avoid it  too. Taco Cabana is better than this place.

If you re in a rush  have a hankering for tex-mex but want something fresh and not all greased up then Zuzus is the place for you  oh and me too    There are two things on the menu that I order  the grilled chicken tacos and the grilled chicken salad. The tacos come on flour tortillas  lettuce  tomatoes and cojita cheese. You also get two sides. I always get the rice and refried black beans. The beans themselves come in a little corn shell which is a bonus if you are super hungry.   Their salsa bar is great and their green tomatillo sauce is the best. I cover everything in it    I always leave Zuzus full and satisfied.

Has been OK in the past but today was awful. When we arrived for breakfast after 9 o clock  we were told potatoes were not ready yet. So we selected other items for our breakfast tacos. After paying our bill  including a generous tip   we discovered the lone coffee pot was empty. It took a few minutes before someone started making coffee. When it was finished  we discovered the container with cream was empty. Only after a few minutes did someone take the small pitcher back to the kitchen and refill it. After finishing a cup of coffee  I went back for a refill. The lone coffee pot was empty again. I told the young man at the counter about this. He looked at me and smiled. I sat down. Ten minutes later  no one had come forward to make more coffee. Only a few customers were seated. We left and will never return. Service was non-existent  The food was nothing special either.

Note  The food is pretty damn good here.  Had an issue with an employee here a couple of weeks ago  emailed the owner   a href  mailto contact zuzuaustin.com  contact zuzuaustin.com  a   with my issue and have never heard back.  If you re going to have a contact email address on your site - respond when there are customer complaints  especially when they re serious.    A shame.

I met a friend here every Thursday for lunch for several years  and it s funny how often I d see other people meeting regularly for lunch... so  this place is definitely a  let s get back there  kind of place.  It s dependable  the food s fresh and well-prepared  not too spicy and not too bland  the service is friendly  helpful and consistent.  Every now and then  my friend would order catfish tacos  go figure  for lunch  and it d take a little longer than usual for them to make it out to the table.  But what the heck  he liked them and it gave us more time to chat.      This place s quality and customer-friendly atmosphere is from the top down  the owner Russel A. is often behind the counter  and is a friendly host.  Most of the rest of the staff were the same for the years I ve been going there  which in today s world speaks volumes about how people are treated.   i.e. quite well   The food was always good  and there are a few things that stand out and deserve special mention     The peach mango iced tea is a flavorful treat  a departure from the ordinary run of the mill iced teas encountered elsewhere.  Mix it 50 50 with the regular tea to get your caffeine fix.  I never made it in the ladies room  but the men s room was always spotlessly clean and smelled like it had been scrubbed thoroughly with pine-sol about five minutes before I arrived.  It s nice to have clean restrooms when you re a grown-up  and when you ve got kids with you  it makes you feel good about bringing them along.    Really good food and a nice staff.
