I love you Zuzu.   I have loved you ever since I first laid eyes on your fresh salsa bar. Your queso is amazing...but that is not even the best part. You grill your tortillas so each breakfast taco has a little crunch to it...and the white cheese is all melty and delicious. You also make a mean chicken salad with yummy vinaigrette. And finally  as if it could not get any better  I read an article somewhere that you broke off from the Zuzu chain so that you could use fresh  healthy ingredients  like veggie stock instead of lard in the beans  for instance .

Actually 4.5 stars  but hey  I m feeling generous  since I just ate there and am in a happy place. Had the blackened catfish tacos with black beans and corn relish on the side. Usually fish tacos are made with fish and cole slaw  but these had an avocado slice and a delicious sauce  probably Adobo  spicy  smoky with a hint of chocolate. I didn t miss the cole slaw a bit.  The beans came in a small crisp tortilla bowl - a nice touch - and were wonderful. The corn relish was the only mis-step - it was okay  but a little bland. i think some onion  or some lemon juice would really bring the relish together. In any event  I d be happy to go back there again  and in fact look forward to going back.
Very small portions  low quality food and to top it off....overpriced.  I will never eat there again.

I am writing about Zuzu as I sit here and finish my meal. I have to say  I live up the road  was craving Mexican food  and still thought I d try  er out even though she has 3.5 average rating.  It s OK  not anything I d drive far for  but there sure were a lot of people enjoying themselves and their meals.  The service deserves 5 stars. They thanked me many times for my business and made me feel really welcome. I loved that. They made me feel like an important rock star. You know  because rock stars are important.  What I also liked about the place is that you order at the counter and they bring the food to you. I love that. I much prefer to do that than have a waitress.   The other thing that made me a happy camper is that I went out on a limb and tried their chicken. I only like white meat chicken  and sometimes you never know with Mexican restaurants. Sometimes the chicken is a little dark or slimy. Not here. It s actually pure white meat. And the texture is good. Not slimy   The food is OK. I felt like my portion was a little small and I m still hungry. But  the meal only put me back  6.50  so should I really be upset about that   They deliver  have happy hour and cater. They do it all. They have a big tv so you can watch the tube while you eat. Make sure you bundle up because it s cold in there

I found the food to be really fresh and lots of options for fresh vegetables. It s become a regular go-to for quicker  healthier meals out  although  not ordering the fried stuff and quesadillas is difficult

Decent place to meet up for a quick  order-at-the-counter lunch.  I love that they have so many vegetarian options  rice and black beans check out clean . My mango iced tea tasted pretty off  so the cashier said if I dumped it out  I could have a Coke. Uh  ok. The sides are key  since many platters come with your choice of things like corn or potatoes.  A pleasant change from the usual. Go  check it out. It s not really TexMex and it s not really Southwestern  but that s ok. Just know that you might get something different on your plate than you expected  but it ll be fine.  Key driving hint  it s next door to a McDonald s. And  if you turn north on Balcones  at the light behind the shopping center  you will have the chance to slingshot  aka fancy U-Turn  around to the front of the shopping center  which faces the Mopac frontage road.

Great food. Almost as good as the Original Bellaire  Houston  location .. The downside is that this place tends be overrun with self absorbed child worshiping parents with loud  little kids so you really need to pick your day to enjoy a good meal. Plus  the staff seems very put out and rude  I have had a problem with every to-go order so check it before you leave...

I used to work right next door  so needless to say I didn t lose any weight during that time period.   but there are healthy  diet-friendly dishes you can get here  I just didn t always exercise self-control ...   Zuzu is a very bright little establishment filled with colorful drawings in primary colors.  they have a nice patio  but it is kinda loud  cause mopac is right there.  They serve beer and an assortment of mexican sodas  if that is your thing.  Things you must try  blackened catfish  shrimp tacos  shrimp quesadillas  fajitas  cheese enchiladas  chicken salad... not sure if I forgot anything.  They have great fluffy corn tortillas as well.  Their sides are awesome.  I love their black beans  corn salad  roasted potatoes  and green salad with a wonderful rosemary dressing.    i like that dressing on the potatoes  too .  The only problem is  which two sides to choose     There is a condiment bar with three salsas  I like the darker  thicker  red one best   mexican crema  pico  fresh diced jalapeno  cilantro  and fresh limes lemons.  Threre is also plain iced tea and a peach iced tea that is refreshing.  Buy a ZuZu cup and get refills for a buck.   They also have awesome breakfast tacos.  I love the bacon  egg  potato and cheese.  Oh  and their flan is out of this world delish   And their ZuZu sundae  the one with the works  is awesome  it comes in a crispy tortilla shell with gooey cajeta  caramel   amp  nuts...  Mmmmmmm...  The owner  Russell  is great  as is most of his staff.  Boy  I miss working next door to ZuZu

I checked out ZuZu today for lunch and was pretty impressed. The unfortunate thing is that the rice and beans were better then my tacos.... that s good news if you are a rice and beans fan  but I would assume the majority of people come here for the main course. I wasn t that impressed with my first visit and I would have written the place off but   a  jessica s. says it s really good....   b The other food people were eating looking amazing. I just think the Tacos weren t the way to go.   c  It s decent Mexican food on the north side of town.   I will definitely be trying this place again. I got the Taco plate and a drink and it was  9.16... not crazy expensive  but definitely a lot more then I wanted to spend on lunch.... especially for tacos.  it also took a while for the food to come out and we were maybe 1 of 7 people in the restaurant and the only ones who hadn t been served food. I think we waited 20 minutes for one order of tacos....

I ended up lunching at ZuZu this past friday with my PIC and our friend  who had recommended the place. We found a coupon and somehow in the excitement of leaving the house for something besides an exam for the first time in days  I forgot to check the yelp status of ZuZu before heading out.  Feeling a little under the weather  and it having been a rather blustery day  I was determined to sample their Tortilla soup and possible some sort of taco salad creation.   ZuZu has a fast food feeling  but claims to have handmade Mexican food. All I know is that my tortilla soup appeared to be the salsa they were serving heated up  it had a very thick consistency  topped with the same chicken fajita strips that appeared in my PIC s enchiladas and on top of my chicken taco salad. The soup was inedible  the taco salad was lacking  when the menu described the salad as having  black beans  I was surprised when they were refried instead of whole- refried beans on lettuce is soggy and gross  especially when it s the main components of the dish. The fried tortilla bowl was sinful  but not good enough to make up for the extremely dry and tough chicken.  Basically  my PIC was pissed to have spent all that money  it s not cheap  Freebird s is WAYYY better for the price  when we could have gone to Polvo s  right next to our house. I was so disappointed I went to HEB later that night and made a big pot of MY tortilla soup which I served with a couple of Torchy s brushfire tacos  a much better meal than what we had at ZuZu
This is an amazing restaurant   The food is always fresh  The salsa bar is exceptional. The staff is courteous and friendly...

Food is GREAT... I mean... we ALL love it  It was a very nice change from the norm. Glad we tried this place.   However... the customer service... holy     Not pleased at all. Bought adult platters meals got kids free... the kids werent free  not the pizzas  rang it up and submitted while I was questioning it...even though Im questioning it he kept going until the order was complete. Why  You cant stop for a second and SPEAK TO ME    I just asked you if kids meals were free with adult purchase  you said yes.. then when I ordered pizzas you COULDNT TELL ME THEY WERENT INCLUDED   Just tell me. Fine then  let the kids pick out something else that IS included... we will STILL buy the pizzas.. ok  NOPE... cant do that.. it would be a separate ticket  this is within 3 minutes  Seriously  Horrible customer service.. all the while I stand there with ALL eyes on me  being as nice as I can be  and getting absolutely nowhere. I was so upset with ALL THAT... Im not sure if we will go back. Yes  the food was good... but hey. Customer service is the TRUE GEM.... and they lack it.

Good Salsa and Queso  Average Food  BAD customer service.  I had a groupon for Zuzus and used it and ordered extra... the cashier was extremely rude about the groupon and didn t give me a receipt or my change and started helping another customer before I was even done ordering    Good place to go when you re in a hurry  just don t bring a groupon or expect friendly service.

So  you really have to keep an eye on your order here. It took them three times to get my order correct. What was weird is I only asked for three things on my taco... Once I got it  it was average at best.
Their salad was oily and unimpressive.  Each leaf was covered with oil.  I would advise staying away from ordering their grilled chicken salad if you go there.
Quite decent. Place is clean  food is ok  prices are good. A little to tilted to the Tex side of Tex-Mex for my taste.

Not a fan at all. I got the chicken enchiladas w the roja sauce. all tasted the same to me and the roja sauce tasted weird. The mixed veggies weren t good and I actually saw three plates that left them behind too.  my husband had the chicken burrito and he said it was decent but nothing special. The service was nice and the open hot sauce bar was good. My fav part was the chips and hot sauce. I definitely won t be back

The breakfast taco is delicious my boyfriend picked up our food but he said there was a really good salsa bar.  He brought back all kinds of salsa and they were all tasty. I got the potato  egg  and cheese breakfast taco and I wish I had ordered another  My boyfriend got the sunrise platter   bacon on it and it had a great taste and it came with potatoes and a slice of watermelon that was sooooo good. It was super fast they said our to-go order would be done in 5 minutes and he didn t have to wait for it when he went in. We usually go to Taco Deli and Zuzu is now on my list of favorite breakfast tacos

I dropped in for lunch late last week after reading some decent things on Yelp.   Boy  was I disappointed.  Everything I ate was ok  but just average at best.  The tacos were bland  the beans had little or no flavoring and I just was no impressed.  I guess I ll continue my quest for a good  quick mexican spot near Mopac and 183.
Good food  fast and friendly service. Large serving with plenty left over. Get place for a quick meal.

I recently had lunch here and got a chicken spinach burrito special. Delicious  It was a bit pricey  but ultimately worthwhile. The downside was that it was extremely greasy. I ve eaten bacon with less grease on it. I know it was oils  but still...it feels nasty. Maybe I m getting old  but I hate having to use tons of napkins after a meal unless I m eating chicken wings or something...  I could really enjoy this place  if I can make it out for lunch with any frequency. And if my budget really allowed for it as often as I d like.

Zuzu is a fun family restaurant in the far west area. The food is a great price and is pretty healthy. The black bean pur e that can be selected as a side is really tasty. My fianc  and I love this place and will miss it when we move. Every Texas neighborhood has a great Texmex  zuzu is more mex than tex  and zuzu fills that role here.

I was recently introduced to Zuzu by a friend  and have eaten there 3 times in the span of one week . Had the grilled mahi mahi tacos twice  and the chicken enchilada platter once  with the green sauce . The food is VERY fresh  the staff is great  and aside from it s hidden location    tucked away in a strip mall adjacent to a McDonalds   this place is GREAT. It s not upscale dining in terms of atmosphere  or price but who cares  It s clean  bright and simple  the food is fresh  made to order and delicious. I was tempted to give it 5 stars... I ll test a few more menu items and revisit my rating.  This is seriously GOOD FOOD

This place is pretty much a once-a-week staple for my family. The food is very fresh  and high-quality ingredients are the rule. The place is clean and modest and the service is good. ZUZUs definitely straddles the line between fast-food and a sit-down restaurant  the food arrives insanely quick--maybe too quick if you re enjoying some free happy hour queso   but the quality of the food pivots the place squarely out of the realm of traditional fast-food.   I am very health conscious eater  and I appreciate that ZUZUs gives me the ability to dive into some Tex-Mex style food  but not finish with that high-fat  processed-cheese  lard-based guilt-inducing coma most Tex-Mex restaurants leave me with. The Rosemary Vinaigrette salad is a standby side  as is the corn salad  and the black bean puree. The fried veggie burrito platter they serve is one of my favorite plates in town  and the grilled chicken salad is a standby too. Not to say you can t go traditional as the Mole Enchiladas are incredible  and the Mole is handmade and very nice and smoky. The Holy Chipotle steak burrito always delivers moist and tender shredded steak and veggies that are perfectly seasoned in a huge  tender  flour or whole wheat tortilla.   They have an amazing free salsa and pico bar and great homemade tortilla chips too. The restaurant is non-pretentious  it s in a quiet strip-mall   and the decor is pretty bland  but the staff are very friendly and they get to know their regulars.  And families with kids seems to be the rule on weeknights  an ideal place for dining with younger ones . It s not trying to be the next classic tex-mex dive like El Patio  or powerhouse local chain like Maudie s  but ZUZUs does occupy a unique spot in the Tex-Mex pantheon that is Austin  healthier Tex-Mex. If you re looking for high-quality  great-tasting  less expensive  less waist expanding Tex-Mex  that doesn t break the bank  try ZUZUs.

I like this place.  I don t understand why so many bad reviews.  This is not a fancy restaurant so your expectations need to temper down to a fast casual level.  Their salsa bar always has been good.  Their enchiladas are consistent.  I like their potatoes.  I like their Spanish rice with corn in it.

To put it simply  Zuzu s is quick  fresh  and tasty.   I ve been here for lunch twice- the line always moves quickly  and the food comes out in  5 min. The waitstaff great you with smiles  and the food isn t particularly expensive.   I m not a huge fan of the decor  but hey  everything else makes up for it. They ve got a fantastic condiments and salsa bar. You ve got jalapenos  pico  onions  and anything else you could want up for self-serve. I really appreciate this  and it s incredibly fresh. The salsas are nice a tasty -salsa verde  Yes please  I d like some tang with my food.   The mahi mahi taco platter was a little bland  but the cilantro-chile sauce served with it makes up for the lack in flavor. I ordered the achiote-roasted chicken a while back  as well. I appreciated the portion and flavor  but it was admittedly a little dry. This should  probably lower my review to 3 stars  but hey - the self-serve bar will solve all your flavor and juicy needs     The sides are  pretty dang solid. The black beans are great  and the grilled veggies are tossed in a tasty rosemary-lime vinaigrette. I think I ve ordered the  average  food items thus far - I should just go with the trusty enchiladas next time.   Overall  the staff and food are great  and the convenience factor is through the roof with the quick service and the condiments salsa bar. Simple  no frills  Mexican food.
Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.  If you happen to know the owner or have a conflict of interest  please don t review.

We went to ZuZu s for breakfast tacos. Our food was great. I loved the refried black beans. The atmosphere is nice and the people who work there are friendly. They have a good happy hour daily and all day on Saturdays  a decent selection of beer  and are getting ready to add margaritas at this location.  They have a good outdoor seating area for when the weather is nice. I d plan to work  and eat a late lunch  here in the afternoons  but I had to score them -1  for not having WiFi. Too bad  would be a nice place to go and a break from my usual routine.
One of my favorite places to eat mexican tacos and fajitas.    Their flan is dangerously good
Yummy avocado tacos with great black beans. Didn t care too much for the  Mexican  rice  though. Will definitely get those tacos again

Completely disappointed. Rice was mush and had a  weird  taste that I can only describe as  not right . The corn  which I can only assume was expired  was nothing but lime flavor and soggy texture. A waste of time and money.

ZuZu has been around for quite some time  but I never made my way over either for breakfast  lunch  or dinner. But I certainly had to give any joint with capitals mid-title a shot. It is totally hip and conducive to a cult following. Ex.  Hey  how about ZuZu for lunch    When I actually went over to this iconic Tex-Mex eatery to grab a quick bite in the wee hours of the morning  I found it to be quite solid. They are even doing something that I have longed for  though it is not very traditional  a breakfast taco... without the hefty tortilla  corn or flour. The bowl is quite the winner.  For  2.15 you get a whole mess of stuff... meaning 3 ingredients  the 3 of which typically find themselves in tacos. I don t always want to invest my daily meals into pressed Mexican staples  so this was awesome. The potatoes were heavily seasoned  almost salty  which is totally OK   the refried blacks were hearty and creamy  and the sliced avocado was fresh  not brown in the least.  Salsas are fresh and vibrant. The tomatillo is tart and light. The red is crisp  and the onions allow a good bite. The pico was fresh chopped  for good cause.  Other than tacos  they are offer much in the way of plates and platters  with your typical fare i.e. queso  burritos  fried grub. They are doing Tex-Mex fare one notch higher here because they know what matters to the individuals who care to drive out to this odd location off of Mo-Pac. That being said  patronize this eatery and see what they have to offer.

I am such a stick-in-the-mud when it comes to ZuZu but they have the best tortilla soup ever and so that is all I ever order.  I love it along with chips and the green salsa.  Add a ZuZu cup filled with ice cold Dr. Pepper and I am in Heaven     When I was pregnant with my first son  12 years ago  my husband and I would always go to ZuZu before attending our childbirth classes at Seton Northwest.  Food really wasn t my friend during either pregnancy but ZuZu s tortilla soup helped me make it through.

we love this place for breakfast. Love the gorditas  amp  the picadita platter. they serve roasted veggies and fruit as side options so we get a lot more nutrition than the usual taco joint. tacos are on the small side  but everything is fresh. the salsas are great and the spice bar is loaded up and clean.   i m always surprised but it is never really crowded  and the staff is nice. its counter service  and good for a low stress  fairly healthy breakfast out for the family.
Fast service in a great atmosphere. Wide variety of food choices. You won t be disappointed

I was out running errands and had driven past this place a zillion times so I stopped in to get some lunch on the run.  Here in Austin  we have a plethora of wonderfully delicious mexican places-so save your money and go to Tacodeli  Torchy s or a great little taqueria.  Hell  even Taco Cabana is better if you are desperate and on the run like I was.  I had some kind of weird combo plate and the only thing good was the chicken flauta.  So  I basically spent like  15 to eat a chicken flauta.  I will never return and I wished someone had warned me.

The food here is fresh  and the service quick. Given all of the Mexican choices nearby  this is not the fanciest  but one of the best in the quick-serve category.  I trend toward the salads and the spinach chicken burrito  which is filled with fresh slightly sauteed spinach. Great flavors  and the lime vinaigrette added to several menu items is fantastic.  Get fresh salsa from the salsa bar  and enjoy the TVs  which have the volume low enough that your conversations are not drowned out.  Never a line here  and the staff is friendly  helpful and quick.

Was really in the mood for enchiladas the other day  had heard a few good things about them so I thought why not give them a try.   I was completely let down. The food was average  sauce tasted odd  and there was hardly any cheese in the enchilada. The queso  I am pretty sure  was velveeta and rotel  though they did have some nice salsas.  The rice was ok  but the pureed black beans were just weird. They served them in a tortilla bowl  not something you would put a liquid in  and as it got soggy the beans leaked out.   Basically it is 3 steps up from taco cabana. A friend raved about the shrimp tacos  so I may go back to give those a try.

Great lunch spot   Love the salad topped with grilled chicken  or the fish tacos w  corn tortillas. Also LOVE the green salsa from the salsa bar. The red s good too  but I LOVE the green  The only thing I ve had here that I really didn t like was the corn relish that comes as a side dish. Very oily and unappetizing.
Yumm.  Migas are tasty but rubbery.  Oh well.  10 different hyperfresh condiments.  Friendly staff.  Really clean place.  Comfy and convenient.  I will try the mahi mahi tacos next time.
Place is amazing and no matter how many years go by it stays amazing   If U are a true austinite U no about this place and I don t even have to explain why it s 5 stars

I usually love this place  I ve never had a bad experience-ever. And then I went back after about 6 weeks time. I can t say enough how disappointed I was this last visit. The red salsa tasted like it had fomenting for a few days. The chips were stale  and the Chicken flautas were recooked and had bad meat in one of them. I can t say I ll be going back anytime soon after that extremely bad experience.

What can I say  just not very good.  I always judge a mexican food place by the beans and rice.  I figure if they take the time to make good beans and rice  then they probably put that kind of effort into the rest of the food.  Zuzu s beans and rice were totally bland.  Flautas are lack luster.  The chicken nachos are pretty good  the chicken has good flavor and the mexican pizza is okay.  Not great  not terrible.  Probably won t be back.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I had a burrito  and it was delicious. The sides were pretty blah  but it might be my fault since I pretend I m on a healthy kick every other day  so I ordered the salad and corn relish. Neither were bad  but nothing interesting at all.   No free chips makes me cry a little  especially when they had such a fun little salsa bar. Tease   Anyway  I really liked the burrito  the rice and beans were yummy and the cheese really stood out nicely. I was worried when I read other people s complaints  but it s actually a nice little deviation.

As a lover of Zuzu s for almost 20 years  I ve tolerated the lackluster service but yesterday was the final straw. Called them at 7 50am to order breakfast tacos for my son. Showed up at 8 08am  sign says they open at 8am  and doors were still locked. There were also two guys waiting who said this was a frequent occurrence. Doors were finally opened at 8 10am and they hadn t even started making my order. First  don t answer the phone before opening if you are going to ignore someone s order. Second  if the sign says you open at 8am than shouldn t the doors be unlocked but more importantly  shouldn t you be ready to start cooking then  Lastly  the response of the person at the register was so apathetic that I wonder how many others have had this experience and walked away. For a locally owned business that has to compete with the likes of Taco Deli and Torchy s  you need to step it up in a big way.

Pretty decent place. There are loads of good veg options and the food comes out really fast  that s a huge plus. The only negative would be the  specials  don t really change... So they aren t so special.

I have always raved about their food because its Real  Fresh Food. My review has to do with their environment... while I was there   they had Ridiculousness on MTV- and it made me sick to my stomach  seriously- I had to leave the restaurant. I wanted to throw up. Maybe that show is popular- but you should think about people that are eating food... and certain stuff like bloody doctor shows  or gruesome pranks are not great. I wasted my money and I can honestly say that it will be a long time before I try them again.

The owner has tracked down and confronted -IN PERSON-  2 reviewers of his restaurant and banished them from his restaurant because they did not give him a favorable review. I will not be going back to this establishment and I don t think you should either unless you ONLY give them 5 stars.

Pretty decent Tex-Mex for those in a hurry. It s technically a sit down restaurant  but you get your food fast. There are your regular options as well as more healthier ones. And they have a really good salsa bar. That s the good. Here s the bad. Like URWhatUEa T says  there s plenty of out of control children. I d expect that at Chuck E Cheese  but ZuZu s  Not so much. I had a hard time biting my tongue every time kids ran by my table. If you don t mind that sort of thing then no worries.
I usually have the catfish tacos or the grilled chicken salad  and it s always good. The people are always friendly  amp  the food is fast.  A reliable standby

When I moved to this area  ZuZu sent me a coupon for a free entree or 2 free tacos  so I decided to check it out.  I got 2 breakfast tacos  which just seemed pretty standard to me.  But the salsas were excellent. That was the really memorable part of the meal  actually. I ll definitely go back for lunch or dinner sometime. I like the casual atmosphere and counter service  the prices seem very reasonable  and the food is fast and fresh.
Barely above Taco Cabana quality of food at twice the Taco Cabana prices.

I have been going to this restaurant for years. The food is great for what you would expect. It is a casual fast food restaurant where you order at the counter and then seat yourself. The food has always come out as I ordered and fairly quickly. I really enjoy the food. The queso is excellent.

i gotta give zuzu this....always dependable.  i ve tried a variety of dishes from both the breakfast and dinner menu.  nothing has disappointed me yet.  breakfast is quite yummy with good sized portions.  i adore the mini taco bowl filled with black beans.  i could eat 5 of them if my tummy wasn t already stuffed with other zuzu goodness.  one thing i am always surprised about is the patrons.  families with kids are everywhere.  the decor caters to the children...so maybe that s what attracts the kiddies.    the pick-up wait can be pretty long if you go during dinner hour.  be prepared.

I like cheap greasy Mexican food  but the oil slick coming off my sides here tasted and smelled like an Exxon spill. I m not sure how they roasted the potatoes or what chemicals where in the corn relish  but it s been two hours and I still feel sick.
I love Zuzu s     Best fresh mexican food ever  There is nothing to complain about  I love it every time

I can sum up the breakfast tacos with a simple word... Yuck.  I have tried the breakfast tacos at ZuZu s twice and both times I have been very disappointed.   My eggs were overcooked  dry  brown and tasted like chorizo.  I slathered on a ton of salsa  which was good  so that gets them a star  and I still could taste overcooked eggs.  I ended up throwing out the eggs and having a potato breakfast taco.  Ummm... not at all what I wanted.

My husband and I are Zu Zu fans. We really like the Grilled Chicken Salads and the salsa bar. This is not traditional Tex-Mex  which is why I think its very good. It s different and fresh feeling  everything doesn t have to be fried with queso all over it. Its also nice to have other side options because Austin has so many Mexican Food and Tex Mex options. The staff is friendly. The food is fresh and always feels fresh  not like it was sitting in the back for hours before being served. The dining area and kitchen look clean. The patio is cared for and tables are usually ready for you to sit at  and don t need to be cleaned off before you sit down. Also  the food is usually are mark each time we visit or take out. They are consistent with the product  service and environment. I would recommend it to others looking for a different twist on salads and salsa. Its reasonably priced also and the peach tea is amazing  Give it a try. It is worth it and it is different.

I ate there for the first time today at lunch.  The order was brought to the table and they had gotten one of the sides wrong  but the server fixed it right away.  The food was fresh and very tasty. I had the steak chimichanga  the corn salad and the roasted potatoes.  All of it was wonderfully delicious.  I will be returning  I m quite sure.

Update  After being contacted by an apologetic manager a few weeks back  my wife and I returned to Zuzu this week. The food and service was good  and the queso free   so they are getting a 1-star bump up.  My wife and I are looking for a good replacement for Willy s Mexican Grill  in Atlanta  and stumbled across Zuzu.  First time in  we were definitely not impressed by their service  - Took over 10 mins for them to take our order with only 2 people ahead of us.  - We were charged a couple of dollars more than the prices on the menu for our two items - and they supposedly cannot give a detailed receipt showing what we were charged for each item. They could only give me a copy of the credit card receipt. - Then  they would only give us one  stamp  on their frequent-buyer club since we paid together - even though the card reads one stamp per entree.  But  we got free queso and chips under their  Zuzu happy hour  and the food was good. So  while we were irked by the poor service  we were determined to try again.  So  tonight  we are on our way home and deciding between Zuzu and Rudy s  quite a difference  we know... . So  I call to inquire if they are doing the free queso thing tonight. I am told yes they are  come on in    Well  we get there and are told rather rudely that no  they are not doing the free queso tonight  can t you read the sign  Oh well  we are here anyways... so  we order separately - this time paying with separate credit cards to get our two stamps. And  nope.. doesn t work  they refuse to give us two stamps - even on separate frequent-buyer cards.  While my experiences may not seem like a big deal...  and they aren t a big deal .. there is just too much good food in Austin to waste time at places like Zuzu.

Zuzu is an pleasant place to get a fast and potentially healthy lunch. I recommend the bbq catfish tacos. The catfish is lovely  the sauce isn t overpowering  and the corn tortillas are to die for. I get the corn relish as a side and put a bunch in the tacos. Most excellent

Been coming to Zuzu s for years. Love this place  always friendly helpful staff. Great  fresh  fast mexican food. Fills you up  doesn t cost a lot and its fresh. Not off of some truck  frozen and reheated. I love their Spinach Chicken Salad  chicken bbq tacos  and their chorizo breakfast tacos.

Stopped in here because it was on the way to my appointment and I was short on time. I only had the spinach chicken salad so I can t review on the burritos or tacos. My salad was just okay. The chicken on top was swimming in grease. That s reason enough for me to not go for another visit.

The service is non existent.  I agree with a previous reviewer that although there are many employees in the store  no one is in a rush or happy to help you.  No real greeting and you get some eye avoidance.  I have yet to go in and not observe an employee on their cell phone or in the dining are  I think I typically am there at non peak time but you would expect a more attentive staff .  They get three stars because their food is fresh and I enjoy their breakfast tacos.

If allowed  I d probably give 3.25 to 3.5 stars. While I m sure Zuzu isn t the best Mexican or TexMex that can be found in Austin  I must say I enjoy waking up to hot breakfast tacos when I stay at my dad s. It s nearby  fast  cheap  and pretty tasty. I haven t had much else on the menu beyond the aforementioned  but it s just because I m always so satisfied with what I order  I have never felt the need to.
Overall  Zuzu s is pretty good. I LOVE their Grilled Chicken Salad  Some of the other dishes are a little bland  but still good.

I m a sucker for soft chicken tacos and these are among the best I ve ever had. I think their salsa bar is fantastic and I ve tried all the sides they have and my favorite are the black beans in the crispy edible bowl and the Mexican rice. All fresh stuff here and affordable. I also think their soda selection is a breath of fresh air. They have the most interesting variety. I m a tea fan but I consider the sodas here.

A very nice place near far west  Good food  had a chicken fajita  wherein the chicken had nice flavor to it  and very tasty salas. The sides were good too especially the black beans and roasted potatoes  again very flavorful . My friends too liked their burrito and sides. I would definitely return to this place to try other stuff.

I love Zuzu  I stick with the chicken tacos  covered with extra cilantro and onion and one of their great salsas. Everything tastes so fresh here  and I love the sides. The salad is dark green and leafy  with a light rosemary dressing unlike anything else in town. The black beans are pureed and come in a little crispy corn shell. Perfect. Everything they bring to your table looks really good  and is even more delicious. My husband always gets the steak in his tacos  and it s great. I can actually feel good about eating here. This is always a treat. They do a great job  and I hope they stick around  as I never tire of this gem.

Horrible place...food is very tasteless.  You will only thin that this is a good place if you have never been to any other Mexican food place before.  Only went here because I had a Groupon...won t be going back.   STAY AWAY

An extra star for the staff and the service.  Even during an extremely busy lunch  they were friendly and prompt.  That being said  the food was bland.  The salsas were boring and my burrito was less-than-memorable.  I would pay less for a tastier meal at Taco Bell.
This place has been a favorite of mine for several years now. With good food  friendly faces  and decent pricing I eat here at least once a week.

Went with family to eat at Zuzu s for Sunday lunch. The food was authentic and good.  The restaurant was a mess. Very few customers but a lot of dirty tables and no one working to clean up.  The staff was disinterested.

Helpful hints to make your experience at Zuzu s better   Go on Saturday for the free chips and queso  Saturday all-day special .  Next  get a  1.75 import beer  also a Saturday all-day special   and order a taco or two a la carte.   chicken was pretty good   Next  go to the salsa bar  and dump some pico de gallo  onion  cilantro  and a little salsa in your queso and stir.  Munch repeatedly.  Get more beers and queso refills.  Sit outside and be glad you in Austin.  Enjoy.    Their breakfast can be good as well  but it sometimes turns out to be hit or miss.

Meh. I like the idea better than the execution. Fresh ingredients  locally-owned  bright paint  how can you go wrong  I m not sure  but Zuzu manages to do it.  I had the Mexican cheesesteak  super burrito  - not sure what was super about it  because it was pretty small and didn t seem to have all the ingredients the menu said it did. I m pretty sure the menu listed beans  rice  meat  cheese  lettuce. All I found for the most part was tough meat - and I mean REALLY tough - hard to chew - and a LOT of lettuce  with a very tasty sauce that was only evident in about 1 3 of the burrito. It almost seemed like the burrito was rolled the wrong direction because one side was so saucy it got all over me  and the other half didn t have ANY sauce evident at all. And the only melted cheese was at the very bottom of one half - it was really good with melted cheese  I sure wish that had been included throughout the whole thing. The menu also mentioned it was served with queso  but there was not anything that resembled queso on my burrito. Overall  it was small  tough  inconsistent  seemed to be missing half the ingredients  and not worth the price at all.  The bf has been a loyalist of this place  and he says he has  gotten used to  the food. I don t want to have to  get used to  the food. It s either good or it isn t  and this just isn t. He had a blackened catfish platter of some kind  and there was so little fish he had a hard time finding it under a pile of finely chopped veggies. It was a SERIOUSLY small quantity of fish.  I tasted his corn relish  and didn t care for it at all. Just had a flavor I didn t like. I didn t try the rice he got  but it looked ok.   He tells me I didn t like it the last time we went either  which I don t remember. I guess that s to be expected  since the food really is not memorable. But the paint is nice

This is my go-to worked too late  had no lunch  I m famished so feed me quick place. They are fast  efficient  and totally satisfying. I usually get the fish tacos with black beans and corn relish  however  I totally love the spinach chicken salad. It has hard-boiled eggs  tomato  and guac in it as well with tortilla strips for crunch. I usually skip their dressing because their vinaigrette is crazy oily. I sub at home a L F smoky ranch chipotle instead. This is a special on the chalkboard  not on the menu. I just discovered their chicken fajitas. Very good and packed full of grilled veggies. Pretty much everything here is in the  7- 10 range  so the price is right. They have good iced tea and a stocked salsa bar with my favorite  avocado tomatillo salsa. It s fast food with fresh  healthier flare.

My favorite place to eat for a daily lunch or dinner.  Problem is since the owner is not there lately the place has gone a little down hill.  The food is great but the manager  I think she s the manager  spends a lot of time on the phone and ignores the customer.

I just finished a 24hr fast and the first place I wanted to eat for lunch ZuZu    had the beautiful Blackened Catfish  with roasted potatoes and vegetables.... Oh so good   Got chips and Salsa because the SALSA is amazing  sweet  with just enough spice and salt and perfect amount of CILANTRO oh what a way to end a fast. Thanks ZuZu
Nice bright clean and colorful addition in an area that doesn t have many good fast food options.

Zuzu was a favorite place of ours in Houston and we were happy to find one here when we moved  8 years ago  I live in the past  apparently .  Pretty much everything on the menu comes with two sides-- we invariably get the black beans  comes in a tostada bowl  and salad  curly romaine and tomatoes tossed in some kind of vinaigrette .  The food is fresh  healthier than standard-issue Tex-Mex  and consistent.  You order at the counter and they bring you your food.  There s a simple but good salsa bar.  The flan is fantastic.  Good place to take kids.

I enjoyed the friendly customer service and good value.  I ve lived in the area for years  and I was surprised I hadn t noticed the location until coming across it in an online deal.  The blackened catfish tacos were delicious  and I was impressed with the amount of fish in the taco.  I m usually left disappointed with portion size when I order fish tacos at the few Mexican restaurants in Austin where it s available.  Beef fajitas were not anything out of the ordinary  but the price was good.  It s one of the few Mexican restaurants in this part of town  and I m looking forward to going back.
It s very OK. We excused a lot for being local owned and fresh. We did not like the thick tortilla soup at all.We do like the corn tortilla tacos

Had a happy accident discovering Zuzu  Homemade corn tortillas with the migas were excellent  The salsa bar was full of options and delicious  and the freshly brewed mango-peach tea hit the spot. I appreciated the clean restaurant  friendly service  and the fact that we could have a conversation with our friends because music wasn t blaring. Will be back soon

I can see how a lot people review this restaurant as great   love this place   fantastic   etc. .. but like to review restaurants based on how the food is prepared  and how it tastes.  I  would like to give a lot of the restaurants a 4 to 5 rating but that s hard to do.  I m sure that other plates are hopefully better than the  Machado Plate I had  the eggs were over cooked to the point of tasting very dry. I  hope they were not leftovers from earlier that morning but they sure tasted like.  Scrambled Eggs do not need to be cooked like meat items   you can turn off your burner 1 2 way into the cooking and let the residual heat from the pan complete the cooking   carry over cooking .  Please watch your cooking no  need to go over bored.  Sorry but as a personal chef I will critique your cooking skill and knowledge.

I m always amazed at how fresh the food is   and how fast it comes out. It s a bit unassuming as far as location  and it may be hard to find if you haven t been there  but it is definitely a great place to eat

I was a little disappointed at the food at this location.  It was good  just not as good as it was the first time I had it at the Bee caves location.  I ll try something else next time or I ll go back to Bee Caves.  The person taking our order had some problems understanding what we wanted  which always has me a little concerned.  The music they were piping was Nortena  I m okay with listening to music in Spanish  but I don t think Nortena fits with the Zuzu atmosphere.  Also  I don t know if it was the wet weather  but the floor in here the day I was there was really slick.  I almost slipped a couple of times.

The service was really good. Honestly  I think this is probably not the place for us but is really a family place  seemed geared for folks with kids in tow . Put it this way  I have never before in my life seen green peas and diced carrots in Mexican rice. I am not a Mexican rice expert -- maybe I just haven t had real Mexican rice before. It just kind of threw me. The portions were small for what we paid -- we were still hungry after we ate. The flavor of the sauces on both of our dishes was actually pretty good. On the other hand  the roasted potatoes on the side were pretty bland. Black bean puree pretty good  tortillas just OK. Meat was overcooked. Definitely not worth it for the money for us.

I was a regular patron of this restaurant for several years.  But two months ago I ordered a grilled vegetarian burrito.  What arrived was a white flour tortilla with very little filling.  It was saturated in some kind of foul tasting oil...far from the healthy meal I was expecting.  I wrote to Zuzu twice about this  hoping it was just a fluke and was ignored both times.   That gives me the impression they are covering something up  so I haven t been back since and won t be returning.

The food is a cut above  fast food  mexican. The potatoes are a bit greasy but they can be avoided  or drained . The salads are great and the specials and variety. Our kids love the food  which is healthier than many other choices. We go back every week or so and haven t gotten tired of it. Friendly staff also.

The mango iced tea was great but I was expecting a lot more from a restaurant that describes itself as  handmade Mexican food .  The egg and potato breakfast tacos which are usually a no brainer for anyone who makes Mexican food were worse than awful. I left them on the plate. Taco Express is an absolute winner. I ll never go back to Zuzu.

Neat place that s hard to find.  We are fans of the tacos  beans  rice  and salsa bar   The enchalidas were pretty good too.  The variety of sodas was the most interesting we ve ever seen   Cool   The price was good too so we recommend it.

Last 2 times I was there  2 years ago  they messed up both of my take out orders.  I didn t want to go back.  Two years later  when a Groupon appeared  I thought I d give them a try again.  Once again  they messed up my take out order.  I saw them make the order  then deliver food to people that came in behind me  and then ALL stand around talking while I waited on my food.  Finally  I asked about it.  It was ready  bagged  they just forgot to give it to me  not the first time this has happened .  I asked did it include silverware   Yes.   But wasn t really sure the guy that answered really spoke English.  Asked the cashier  she said   Yes.   Got out to the car  checked my order  which I ve learned I HAVE to do with take out from ZuZu s   and there was no silverware.  Had to go back in for it.  Bottom line  they really stink at doing a complete job on take out items.  Dining in is better.  Shame  because the food is good.  It s even worse when they give me the wrong food and I have to wait around all over again for them to make  AND GIVE ME  the right food   Alas.

Reviewing just take-out.  I have had lunch from here a bunch of times via free lunch at work perk.  I m usually looking for a healthier option  so I usually end up getting the cilantro-chile chicken.  The chicken is kinda dry but the sauce makes up for it.  Granted I get no cheese so that would help too.  I love the cilantro-chile sauce    Rice comes under the chicken.  I ve gotten it as a side too.  It s always moist and flavorful.  I like the black beans.  The charro beans are good too  but I m not too thrilled about the bacon in it.  The beans come in their own little mini taco shell containers.  Fancy way of serving it but all soggy when it gets delivered to us.  I have had the corn relish  grilled veggies  and potatoes as sides before as well.  I remember them being really good except one of the sides being very spicy... can t remember which.  Overall  I do like their food.  I d give it a 3.5 stars if I could.  However  it is not a place I think of going to on my own outside of work.

My husband and I ate here last weekend and will never return.  After waiting over five minutes at the counter for the staff to stop staring at us and come over and take our order  we finally got some service.  We asked the man working the cash register for some recommendations and he didn t have any suggestions.  My husband ordered a burrito that was the owners favorite  and it was a mixture between bland and crunchy  due to the tortilla strips inside of the burrito .  I had fish tacos  that came with stale tortillas  flavorless fish  and cabbage.  The sauce they served on the side wasn t bad though  although my husband co-opted it to make his burrito palpable.  Too bad  we just moved to the neighborhood and were looking for a new place to eat.  This will not be it.

The food is fine. Not great  not bad  but the guy who takes orders at the counter is a jerk. I don t expect great service from a restaurant where you place your order at the counter  but I do expect not to have to fight with them over getting kids meals free  as is advertised on their website Monday- Wednesday after 5 30pm .  The first time we went here we had 5 adults and 2 kids. It was on a Wednesday night  and kids meals are supposed to be free with each adult platter purchase. After ordering and paying we looked at the ticket and noticed we were charged for the kids meals. When I went to talk to the guy about it he tried to tell me he had not charged us for the kids meals. I don t know what kind of idiot he took me for  but I could clearly see that the kids meals were paid for. After going back and forth with him a couple of times I finally got my phone out and added it all up in front of him. Sure enough we were charged for the meals. Rather than give us back cash he offered to give us vouchers. I said that was fine  and thought it kind that he gave us vouchers worth  10 for around  6 worth of food.   At that point I didn t really want to ever eat there again  but about a month later we decided to try it again and use the vouchers. It was again a Wednesday night. Again we had 5 adults and 2 kids. After I placed my order and my two kids  orders and the rest of our party was about to order  I asked about kids meals being free  he said yes  but they have to be on separate tickets. I said fine  take one of the kids meals off the ticket and I ll pay for my order and get one kids meal free. He took one kids meal off  but tried to charge me for the other kids meal. When I questioned this  he finally took the price of the kids meal off. So my husband placed his order and the other kids meal order plus one other adult order. The other two in our party were about to order and pay when the guy said they could not pay for the food and get the kids meal free because the kid was not theirs. WHAT  Why does it matter who the kid belongs to   Anyway  my husband paid for the food that was already ordered  kids meal free  and the other two in our party placed their order.  Now  some may think me a cheapskate  but I don t think it isn t a huge deal to have to pay  6 for two kids to eat. I just don t think we should have to fight just to get an advertised deal. If they don t want kids meals to be free  they shouldn t offer the deal on their website. It is crazy. I will not go back to this place just because the service is so AWFUL

I decided to take myself out the day before my birthday  and yes I could have chosen a nicer place but I have given up trying all the terribly complicated and greasy mexican food in town and I wanted something fresh and healthier. I have the cheese enchiladas and  they were perfect and I didn t walk out feeling like I needed a crane to pick me up.

I ve been going to ZuZu since it opened.  I love their food  but some dishes are better than others.  Love their migas  chimichangas  salads  soup  roasted chicken and of course  mahi mahi tacos.  Their food is always fresh and they have a nice salsa bar and great iced tea.
Best basic Mexican food in town. Super good food for very reasonable prices.  Love the salsa bar

The food and the service were bad.  With only 4 customers  they couldn t make taco plates as listed on their menu.  Left cheese  avocado  and real grilled shrimp out of the Shrimp Tacos.  It was a fake shrimp mixture in tortillas for  8.25.  3 of the 4 employees were sitting down eating  and socializing.
BEST fresh and healthy Mexican food in Austin   This is definitely an Austin favorite.  Their mahi-mahi tacos are great and full of flavor
On 9 24 2013 at 12 30pm we bought a chicken salad to go.  When we got home we found a roofing nail in the salad.

I can t imagine anyone having any service or food issues at ZuZu. I have been eating here for years and have never once had any concerns. In fact  I have been there for many lunches and the amount of people I see coming to this restaurant tells me they must be doing something well. I think it is the food  salsa bar and Mango ice tea. Yes  they can be busy but the food comes out quick and fresh and the there are always clean tables to sit. I recommend the Spinach Chicken Salad and Mango Tea  wow  what a meal  Kids all love the frozen lime drinks and who can pass up all the fresh stuff at the salsa bar.  Yummy   For those that want to fuss about this restaurant have not given ZuZu a chance to show you why some many people eat there every day. Cudos to the owner  You obviously have many fans  Keep doing what you are doing.

Me and my very picky wife love breakfast tacos. She always orders egg whites and they make her tacos exactly like she likes them. The bacon is crisp. I mean the crispiest bacon you ever had in a breakfast taco. There potato is so good. So good.... Anyway  this place has incredible breakfast tacos. There Chirizo is also incredible  Also very crispy little charizo crumbles. I m obsessed with this place. And the green salsa is one of the main reasons this place stands out against other breakfast taco places. LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. Been there for lunch too. Great food. Enjoyed the whole chicken. Fed me twice  Great place incredible value for what you get.

My boyfriend bought a groupon for this place and so we went to try it today. Let s just say we were glad we had a groupon  I dont think we ll be back here again. He got the shrimp taco plate and I had the blackened catfish taco plate and it came with two sides and two  drinks. For sides  I had the corn relish and a salad and my bf had roasted veggies and potatoes.  The shrimp in my bfs taco were so small he literally said  Where s the srhimp.  Everything seemed to be covered in oil...hopefully it was olive oil. The  corn salsa  tasted like canned corn with no seasoning  doesn t  salsa  mean something more  . The salad was literally lettuce and three square bits of tomato...no dressing and flavorless. My blackened catfish tacos were so bland as well that I just piled everything into it to give it more flavor. I added the corn relish  pico de gallo  salsa  and jalepenos and it was way better. This was a big disappointment. This is not  handmade Mexican food  unless you like opening cans.
lunch was pretty good  will go back and try the breakfast tacos to make a final decision.  would have been 4 stars but my steak burrito had chewy overcooked steak.  but the flavors were very good
I ve been to Zuzus in other cities and those were much better than this location. Everything was tasteless- watery salsas  blandly seasoned meats  etc. What a disappointment

Finally went to this place. OK  decent enough food. Not what I want expect from Mexican food  but not bad. I d only go there again if I had some sort of gift certificate or discount.  Otherwise  I d choose other Mexican food places.
Kinda bland.  Not really Tex Mex or Interior Mex.  Maybe Cali Mex

I have only ordered a few things from ZuZu s in my life. In the mid 90s  one opened in West Houston around the block from where I went to school. Several times a week my Mom would get ZuZu s for dinner  and I always got the tortilla soup. Their tortilla soup is so different than most- it s thick and creamy rather than traditional broth based tortilla soup. It has a tomato-paste taste that has just stuck with me for years. The always two strips of clean  grilled chicken strips and all the right spices. The one in Houston closed and when I first started making road trips to Austin when I was 18  and still almost a decade later I always got ZuZu s tortilla soup to go- several containers  and freeze them for later.  I m serious  it s like pre-teen nostalgia for me. I can t say a lot about the rest of the menu.... but this is still my favorite tortilla soup  ever  and I m glad that they re still in Austin.  To top all that nerdiness off- I hope that someday I ll get the recipe.

I love the food here  The beans and the quesadillas are amazing  However  the reason for only four stars is that the wait service isn t that friendly and the atmosphere is lacking. Also  it could be a bit cleaner. So  to recap  food   amazing  but service  atmosphere  and cleanliness   ok.
Great spot   Family owned with fresh mexican food.  My favorite breakfast tacos in town.  The Owner stopped by table to chat...one of the most friendly people I ve ever met.

Visiting Californians  amp  we loveeee Micheladas  the drink .  This place had a great  famous Michelada  and even better brisket. The service was stellar  amp  the ambiance was perfect.  Love the atmosphere - would definitely go back

Okay y all  This place is amazing  We belong to a group that meets every 2nd Sunday of the month and this was our first visit to Micheladas. We had more people attend than we had thought but the team here was on target. The owner was so generous and accommodating and she organized the wonderful team to help us. The drinks were perfect and the service was 5 star. We were impressed by the service and quality of the food. I had the spicy margarita and shared the TexMex nachos  So happy with everything and everybody that helped make this 2nd Sunday a success. Incredible place we will be visiting again  Wow  Amazing y all
I visited this restaurant while in town for business. It was a great choice  The food was excellent and so was the customer service. I highly recommend if you re looking for great Mexican food
Came here for lunch and the service was good and fast. I tried the tacos derados and it didn t disappoint. The salsa was kind of bland but the chips were good.
Came in later in the evening  sat outside in their outdoor terrace. Food was great and they had margarita flights which were tasty  Our waiter was super nice and attentive  had a table of 5.
Hidden gem located in downtown  indoor seating outdoor seating with a bar showcasing all sports. Good food not that pricey. Drinks are good and so is the food

Upon arrival  the restaurant smells like mildew. The waiter was nice on the phone when I ordered three breakfast tacos. However  I experienced horrible customer service when I was in the restaurant. My tacos were in a bag. The bag was full of grease. I opened the breakfast tacos and I saw nothing  but grease. I decided not to eat the greasy tacos and gave them back to the waiter. The waiter was extremely rude  I asked him for help ordering something else and he kept telling me  one moment.  I asked the other waiters for assistance and I kept getting blowed off. I decided to leave. I am so disgusted because I was looking forward to trying this restaurant. I will not be back

Place is big and beautiful as well as service. Sadly the food is not the best  in fact  pretty bad  - Tacos were plain  no flavor  no sauce or at least lemon lime juice.  - Super basic quesadilla and poor quality chicken.  - Guacamole was too salty.

Will this become my favorite tex-mex spot  Probably not  but they did everything satisfactorily  so they deserve 5 stars. It started out as what looked like a quiet grey Thursday night  but as soon as I sat down two tour buses unloaded across the street and a huge group descended on the patio. Based on this and past reviews I lost all hope of fast service. However  the servers kept up alright. With my Yelp check-in I redeemed free queso. It was just ok  a little too spicy. For my main course I got the Taco Salad and substituted bell peppers instead of meat. I m glad they made this special modification even though it wasn t on the menu  It was generous and delicious  They ve got a happy diner here

Margs were really good  service was horrible. I had ordered a flauta plate and strawberry marg  amp  only received my marg. Waited a couple minutes just in case and then had asked waiter about meal and he said  he forgot.  It wasn t even  rush hour . Greasy floors  when tried to wave down waiter was ignored  amp  we live in Austin area and are right across the street for a volleyball tournament  you would think they would be more hospitable with incoming crowds. Will definitely not be back at this facility

Viva Tex-Mex   I really enjoyed this Cafe y Cantina  We came in here for a brunch  and left full and happy  We were instantly seated in front of a fountain that featured a statue of a drooling bull who filled an overflowing chalice. Scenic  There s televisions on the bar- three big screens so you re sure to be able to catch the game while keeping an eye on the other game and that episode of Golden Girls while you re at it.  The bathrooms were all individual little rooms around a communal sink  which is always a cool concept that you don t see too often in Texas. The furniture all looked like it had been brought over the border- it was roughly carved wooden statues and giant pots. Things that you see at the mercados on the border.  The food was wonderful  I got the chilequiles  which were served norteno style  with three different types of cheese  scrambled eggs  with a chipotle smoked salsa mixed in  and a tomatillo and jalapeno green sauce on the top. The chips were neslted in with a ranchero sauce  bringing together a variety of textures- the creaminess of the cheese  the fluffiness of the eggs  and the crunchiness of the tortilla chips.  The service was fantastic- they kept coming around to make sure we were happy and the food was to our liking. Prices were decent for a brunch crowd. We didn t opt for their delicious-looking drinks  but they have a full drink menu and a full bar.  We didn t get to sit out on the patio  they weren t offering service out there due to the high winds.  I ll head back here again

Received the most horrendous service at this business  Also  was charged an additional  14.00 for ordering an item from the child s menu with no prior notification. such a rip off... Spoke with manager who was very rude. Called the number on the receipt 512-320-0300 to speak with the owner  and  the message states the number is not in service.
Unique authentic Mexican food in Austin downtown   the watermelon salad is the best

Came here the night before the Austin 1 2 Marathon and while the service was great  the good was mediocre.   We were a large group- 7 adults and 2 kids  only 2 households   everyone is vaccinated  don t come at me   Our server was very attentive and ensured our water cups remained filled and our chips  amp  salsa were never empty. As for our entrees  they all left something to be desired.   Check in on Yelp for free queso

5 stars for service. Our server was kind  attentive  and our drinks and food arrived in good time. We appreciated the pepitas in the ceviche  but our fajitas were under-seasoned and required salt and pepper to add flavor. The outdoor space is cool though  with a tall roof and a Big Ass Fan that has definitely earned its name.

Good food and drinks but place was very crowded. Seats were back to back to the person behind each other. Drinks are small sizes for the prices.  6 bottled beers and  4 mexican cokes. But it is downtown so prices are expected to be higher. Ribeyes we re super good  Wish I had more garlic potatoes with my order though bc they were BOMB
Amazing atmosphere for outside dinning and good location. Drinks and appetizers are all we had and they were delicious. I don t think many will be disappointed.

We ordered nachos  FYI served on tostada shells  that were average. We also ordered two presidentes that were decent. The staffing and waitress  were a little hectic and was a bit difficult to order. Overall was average.

Horrible hospitality for a city that is our State s Capitol  amp  hosts families from all over  Hostess was extremely rude  even the manager. When you have thousands of families visiting for a volleyball tournament  you would especially like to appreciate  amp  be more than hospitable to the amount of potential revenue your business could profit from. Not the exact opposite. Zero tolerance for such abuse

We had such a great time here  the owner was attentive and spoke to many tables ensuring satisfaction. We will definitely be going back  it was delicious and a good atmosphere  plus it is right by 6th street.

Was in town for work and this place is right across from the convention center   Amazing food   I didn t take pictures but know the chili con queso is bomb and the seafood enchiladas is amazing   Service is a bit slow but definitely nothing horrible   I ll definitely hit this place up again
Atmosphere was nice  Nice location  did not eat any food  but they had some great mimosas

Very good food  drinks  and service  handled our large party well. A little expensive for Mexican food  especially when there are Mexican food trucks everywhere in Austin where the food is just as good and much cheaper. Maybe best for celebrations or special occasions

I really want to like this place. It s got a nice ambiance  a good location  and the food and drinks are pretty good. So why could I possibly not like it  you ask  Well  the service has just been bad. Every time. And I ve been there a handful of times.   It s almost like they don t really want to succeed as a restaurant. Long wait times to be seated  when they have plenty of open tables   long wait times to order  slow response time on refilling drinks  etc. Also  I frequently get the feeling I m imposing on them just by being there--Especially the people manning the host stand. All in all  I don t think I ll ever go back here just because I hate giving my business to establishments with poor service.
Had the carne guisada. It was good  but for the price I expected better. The beans weren t very good and tortillas a bit dry. We never saw our server. I did get the churros and I liked those a lot.
Was looking for a spot to fill the hangry feeling I was having. Went downtown snd found this place. This place has some great food snd the service was super good. Will be back when in Austin

Margaritas we re good and food wasn t too bad. The staff is a little slow to greet me  both times I came this weekend...  I would return if at the convention center again but just out of convenience but I won t go out of my way to dine here.

You have to cut restaurants some slack now  because they are short-handed.  We arrived on a Saturday for lunch  and there were several large parties on the patio celebrating birthdays and drinking shots.  So  we were patience  and the server did a good job trying to be everywhere at once.  The patio is very nice  and the Tex-Mex brunch items were delicious.  The queso was nice and thick with chilies.  Next time  I ll try a margarita.
First time visiting and the food was awesome. A little loud but worth the trip. I recommend the tortilla soup

DO NOT go here I repeat STAY AWAY  The building looks really cool from the outside but that totally changes once inside  The atmosphere is dead  like non existent  It s so quite and with all the wood and giant pieces of furniture it s like walking into a church   The staff have no energy just zombies walking around aimlessly     They can t make a decent margarita  it s all sour mix    The food  OMG  I got the shredded chicken tacos.  If you really want tacos go to Taco Bell   The chicken  at least I think it was chicken  was GRAY   I think I was dark meat  and shredded it was not    Huge chucks on the tacos  Took one bite and had to spit it out in a napkin I almost Vomited

Visiting Austin and stumbled upon this beautiful restaurant. They have ample seating both inside and outside. I chose to start with a Prickly pear margarita. It was garnished with a blackberry and strawberry. The rim had chili powder. Delicious. The house made salsa was served with warm tortilla chips. When I asked the charming waitress about lunch recommendations  she suggested seafood stuffed avacado. It was outstanding. I will describe it as follows...1 2 of an avacado stuffed generously with large pieces of shrimp  crab and cheese. That was breaded lightly and deep fried. It was served on a nice white sauce with cheese. On top of it was a large shrimp. It was accompanied by rice and your choice of beans. Every bite was delicious.. We also ordered a chicken taco salad. Lettuce was fresh and a huge portion of chicken was provided. I would highly recommend this awesome restaurant.

I was craving Mexican  so I found this Mexican spot around the corner from my hotel in downtown Austin. And let me tell you......Food is DELICIOUS     Ordered  the bacon wrapped shrimp stuffed with cheese and a jalape os.....sooooo good and cooked perfect    It s served with a delicious spicy jalape o sauce that is amazing. Also ordered the grilled chicken enchiladas....were soo good and chicken was excellent   I had to order the shrimp fajitas and again I wasn t disappointed. Large shrimp cooked to perfection with well done onions. Living in Cali  I m used to AMAZING Mexican food and this place delivered and made me fell like I was home.   On another note  they have in place all the Covid-19 safety measures and you must wear a mask for service.   The staff is so attentive and friendly with great customer service.   The outside patio is amazing  with sans lounge furniture in a great ambience.   Highly recommend this Mexican restaurant for great food  amazing service and a awesome atmosphere.

Visiting Austin for a conference this is next to the convention center and I love Mexican  so a no-brainer. It is a super huge restaurant on two levels with a lot of outside seating. When I walked in at lunchtime I  was a bit nervous because there were only two people at the bar. But other people came later.  Usual menu items offered. I got the chicken fajita taco salad. It was fair  nothing to write home about. The chips were warm  fresh and yummy. The salsa was on the hot side  I don t do hot .  This place is clean but seems a bit old and in need of serious updating  at least the chairs and bench covers. They are all cushiony  but the  pleather  is all worn off and horrible looking.   Super fast service  ok food. I d come back.

Food is decent. The corn and poblano crab dip and tacos dorados were our favorite appetizers. The suiza enchiladas weren t bad either. However  with good Mexican food you want good strong drinks...but our group wasn t satisfied with the margaritas and Mexican martinis. Couldn t even taste the alcohol  which is a bit disappointing for the price of the drinks.

I ll agree with a former reviewer that this place either changed management or turned around somehow. We had brunch and it was fantastic. The Mexican Benedict is great. I would definitely recommend this place.

My husband and I came here for a Friday night dinner. It was very disappointing. The chips are fried in a rancid oil  you could taste it. I ordered the chicken fajita salad  it was bland and boring. My husband had the chicken enchilada plate and it was the same  bland and boring. We were hoping for some great flavors and were strongly disappointed. We will not be returning.

I would give 3.5 I would.   No one greeted at the door  so we had to kind of make our own way in. The hostesses were sitting at the bar talking to the bartender.  -1    The chips tasted weird and burnt almost. They had minimal salt. The salsa was the only thing that kept me eating them.   -1    Our waiter was pretty attentive and we got our drinks promptly.    .5    I got the Margarita Flight   12  it includes original  strawberry  mango and prickly pear. They were all lacking in flavor except for the mango  barely   -1   For the entree I ordered Georgies tacos  they had a nice flavor with the meat and the peppers were oh so nice.   1    Grand Total  3.5    Might return but it s not a must.

Server was great and the food was great but the MANAGER WAS THE WORST     5 adults and 1 child - we place order.  Took awhile but we weren t in a hurry so no biggie.  Order finally comes and the server gets hit by another employee dropping this huge tray of food within inches of the child.  Pieces of food and broken dishes hit her and she scared and crying.   Server apologized but MANAGER NEVER CAME OVER TO APOLOGIZE.  Waiting for our new order took forever to come.  Was not made a priority - we were now behind other customers that came in. Then it comes in pieces.......2 meals come  about 5 minutes later  another meal comes and then about 5 minutes later  the 4th meal comes.......everyone is eating and I am still without my meal.  MANAGER NEVER CAME OVER TO APOLOGIZE.  About 10 minutes in I catch my server s attention and he tells me that another server took my meal thinking it was one of his orders.  About 10 minutes later  I tell my server to forget the meal but at the same time I am telling him  my meal finally comes.  Everyone in my party was done eating and we had already been sitting over 2 hours so I told my server that I didn t want the meal.  From this point on  we never saw our server again - he was embarrassed with it all and so our water glasses never got refilled  we were not offered dessert  etc.  Finally another server came over and asked if we needed anything and explained that our server didn t want to come back to the table - REALLY       Due to everything that had happened  I figured they would comp some of the meal but the bill came and nothing.  I went to speak to the manager and have never been treated like this.  He basically told me dropping a tray is an accident and he didn t feel he owed an apology for it.  WOW    When reiterated that food and pieces of broken dishes hit the child  he still didn t apologize.  WOW    When reminded him that I never got a meal because another server gave my meal to someone else  he still didn t apologize.  WOW    When I said our meals  my late meal all should have been a priority to make and give to us  again  he didn t care  people who came in after us were served before our orders were remade.  WOW      I asked for some type of comp to compensate for all that happened and the manager  who refused to give me his name  again was nasty in his response and stated he owed us nothing.  He said we ate the food so he owed us nothing.  My daughter even spoke to the manager about the food and broken dishes hitting her child and all she asked for  from him  was an apology and he wasn t willing to do that.  WOW    That s great customer service    My daughter had worked for a chain restaurant and said his reactions  attitude and actions were unacceptable.    I will say the service and the food was great but the Manager made the experience the worst   All he needed to do was to come to the table  apologize and compensate in someway to make his customers happy and he did nothing.  If this manager speaks to other customers like this  the restaurant will go down the tubes.    I told him I will write a review and his response was  go ahead  I don t care  - WOW

Wow  Due to weather  most places were closed  so we finally found an open place and didn t have any high expectations for brunch from a Cantina... but boy  were we wrong... all four dishes were amazing from American more alike cuisine like biscuits and gravy  and Americano breakfast  to Migas Enchiladas and Mexican style Eggs benedict.  The venue however was too cold  but I guess Austin s buildings are not meant for below freezing temperatures.  Our waiter was phenomenal. He s a keeper
Yum  Good chips and salsa to start  Fajitas were tasty  good steak  nice portions... house margarita was just ok  smallish  weak
I had the nachos and my wife had the chicken flautas. Both were really good. The service was great. Would definitely be back again.

First time here. Disappointed to walk into a Mexican restaurant with no chips. Can t order brunch when we re within the brunch time limit. I understand maybe short staffed but to run out of chips and breakfast items on a weekend

Was looking for a cool  comfortable place with good Mexican breakfast food.  I was pleased to come upon this place.  I ordered the Mexican Benedict with chorizo and eggs sunny side up. I also ordered a side of Waffles.  Both delicious and came out very fast.
Did Saturday brunch.  Brunch burger breakfast tacos sopapilla waffles were all outstanding   Service was great.  Cocktails hit the spot.  We will be coming back for sure.
Beef fajitas  were delicious - service a little slow  but wait staff were nice.  The portobello fajitas were not that great and the margaritas were very small.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  If you appreciate good service this place is not for you and the owner doesn t care if her service is bad. She knows that being in a location across from the convention center guarantees business no matter how crappy the service.  And the food is definitely not worth the wait. We had a reservation for 12 00 and had to wait and then was told their was no brunch available this weekend. We had 11 people which included two kids and waited over 30 minutes to order and that was after we asked to order. At 2 00 we finally got our food and that was after talking to the owner.  She had said some of the ticket would be comped and then she said we misunderstood.  If you are a local like us and have a choice stay away. They do not want your business.

Lots of recommendations from the people in Austin. Was wary of the 3 star rating  but they may have had a switch in management in ownership because it is much higher than 3 stars.  Service  Pretty good  middle of the road. Since we speak Spanish  the staff were much friendlier and helpful since they struggled in English. One DIDNT even speak English. Yikes.. Also  their bathroom locks are not super functional so one of us had the door opened on because they don t seem to work well. Beautifully styled though..  Ambiance  Very empty inside and outside which is a shame because it is pretty on the patio and it was cool to be apart of the city. Very peaceful.   Food I liked my fajita meat enchiladas. Their beans were very tasty because they were very spicy   We love that. Wish they had a bean dip.... chips and salsa were excellent as well. Hot and tasty  Parents enjoyed their fajitas and their chimichanga. All the food was very yummy and filling. Perfect portions.   Good  solid sit down Mexican restaurant in the middle of the downtown. Not many Mexican restaurants nearby so this is a great option.   Passes the California test. We enjoyed it. It is much better than the poor reviews. Recommended.

This was one weird experience. We stopped by for a bloddy as it s a bloddy Mary Sunday kind of day. I m not inferring that s it weird to have Bloodies on Sunday at all.  We were seated at the end of the bar and had a fan blowing air right at us. This was not a gentle breeze. I asked to move and our bar tender suggested that she would turn off the fan. Not wanting to inconvenience others I suggested that we just move to a high top.   Our drinks arrived sans straws. Politely asked for straws and was informed by our bartender that she doesn t serve straws. WTF     Scanning the bar I noticed others had straws. Well she noticed my observations and stopped by to say there are indeed straws in the back and would we like 2... ummm sure..
