Well I wish our straws magically morphed our Bloodies into a good cocktail but that was not the case. These were without a doubt the worse Bloody Mary s I ve ever had. You could do better with bottom shelf vodka  V8  and Tabasco.    One star rightly deserved...
One our favorite spots  The food and the drinks are always on point  We love the atmosphere and their patio
They are proud of their rudeness  I have never experienced such horrible treatment from a restaurant before
Didnt even sit down to eat. The hostess looked me and my friends up and down and rolled her eyes at us and was rude. Immediately walked out  don t even want to try it anymore.

This was a hidden gem.  Wow    The first restaurant all weekend in downtown Austin where quality and customer service were a priority.   We were a party of 12.  They had our reservation.  Our table was set when we arrived.  They kept our table full of chips salsa without having to ask.  Our drink orders were perfect...fast and all served together.   All 12 brunch plates were served hot....correct and all at the same time.  Food was fantastic   Go here   It was hands down the best food and service we had in our 4 day weekend

My God this place is good. We had a party of 6 wait time was 2 minutes. Got there around 11 am on a Saturday. I cannot say enough about the micheladas. Along with the salsa and cheese dip you can t go wrong. The food was great. All 6 of us had different meals so we could see how it was. The list will take too long to type.  Go there and understand what I am talking about. Can t wait to get back.

This place is gorgeous and has a delicious Tres leches cake dessert. We were walking back to our hotel around 11 am. We passed through a breakfast place that was selling crapes but the line was long so we decided to go to micheladas and I ordered a Tres Leche s cake and coffee. It was delicious. I m happy that I made the choice to skip the line in the other restaurant and come here for dessert and coffee. I love that our waitress was attentive and refilled my coffee more than once.

I m a Mexican food snob and so entering my expectations were low. I was blown away frankly. It s not authentic Mexican cuisine but it was very good TexMex. Salsa and Chips set the tone  incredibly fresh. Appetizers of guacamole and queso did not disappoint. Our kids were happy  the margaritas were perfect. This place is on the top of our Austin list

I stopped by today during brunch.  I was waited on my the cute waiter Moses.  He made sure I didn t need anything during my meal.   I got the chicken and waffles  michelada and chili con queso.  It was so good.  The waffles very fluffy. The jalape o syrup was good but I was thinking that it would have a bit of a bite to it and almost asked for some jalape os as I like a lil bite to my meal.   The chips.  salsa and queso are very good and would be a great start for any party.   I ll have to come back and try out there Mexican food.
It was okay. The atmosphere was nice but the food was very sub-par. Disappointing for mexican.

First time here FOOD  shared the roasted poblano corn crab dip as the appetizer it was lent bad I was exited to try this but it was bit bland and the chips that came out with it were the same and a bit stale. For the main course I ordered the wedge salad and asked for blue cheese as the dressing but got ranch both times. Maybe they don t carry blue cheese  Anyway I had it with chicken that wasn t cold and wasn t warm  also not sure how it was supposed to come but it was seasoned well. I wasn t a huge fan of the lettuce I was given  parts were a bit sour and dirty tasting. However it wasn t terrible but I don t think I ll order it again. Next time I ll try the taco salad. My friend had a shrimp quesadilla it looked good but she agreed it was mediocre.  DRINKS We ordered the margarita flight and wow the presentation was amazing  We shared the drinks but couldn t finish because it was very very salty and sweet. The manager was nice and took it off our bill and after we ordered a house bottles beer and I ordered a mimosa. It was good very fizzy and strong. Only 5   The atmosphere was really cool I had never been and wondered what it was like before covid  I m sure there were more options but it would be nice to hold an event here like a party or anniversary.  SERVICE service was decent  I know the employees were all doing their best and always looked busy. It was a bit hard to understand our waiter  I don t think he spoke much English but Also I m not complaint because I did go to a Mexican restaurant. Everyone was kind and it was very clean I might come back once things get back to normal

Mixed fajitas were really flavorful  fresh  and hot  The chips and salsa tasted authentic. We got a queso dip on the side  which I recommend. Strawberry margarita was a bit small but fresh as well  Awesome place and good ambience for a night out.

We are staying at the Marriott and they recommended this restaurant which was right next door. The chips were good but as far as everything else it all tasted the same. Wouldn  t recommend  especially for the price.
Frozen margaritas were sub par. Enchiladas were okay. If you are looking for decent and expensive food  you found the place
Much better than previous reviews.  Great service and food.  Outstanding patios and convenient to everything downtown.  Very good salsa.

Walked in with a couple of associates from a convention.  No hostess  so we walked to the bar to get a drink a what seemed to be drunk employee stopped us and said  what are you doing  I said we are going to the bar. He said  you can t just go to the bar  you have to be escorted by the hostess.  I said  there is no hostess . He lifted his hand and said  she s doing something she will be back but you have to get out

I love the atmosphere of this restaurant. Its Spanish influence is seen throughout the restaurant decor. If you are able definitely sit on the patio.  I ordered the fish tacos with barracho beans.  While waiting for my main entree I noshed on the chips and salsa. They bring mild and spicy to the table. I prefer the spicy one  it has kind of a smoky flavor to it.  Took a while for the entrees to arrive. They were quite tasty though. I d definitely come back here if I visit Austin again.

Went here thinking they were going to have coffee since in the name it says cafe and cantina figured they would have coffee options  they do have a regular kind of coffee. This place seems nice with the lights kind of dimmed. Gave them three stars since they just kept staring at me and my friend from the moment we walked in up until our table  we pretty much met the whole staff and each one kept asking if everything was good. Didn t really have much things on their menu not sure if it was cuz we went during a later time but was pretty much out of everything. Did get to try their churros which were a bit different than I was use to since they were really soft in the middle I thought they might of been undercooked but not sure if it was just a different type of churro  we re still good. Probably a good place to go for drinks only not really sure but you really aren t missing out if you decide to skip this place.
First time customer here. Loved this place   Micheladas are delicious. Would recommend the migas  chilaquiles and huevos rancheros  Def coming back again
For someone out of town and no wait time for brunch on the weekends  I highly recommend this spot   So delicious  I recommend the  Americano

I wish I could review the food. Unfortunately we sat at the bar for 15 mins and never received any service. We couldn t even tell you if the water was cold as we never got any. We were spoken to once after we asked a server if we could get something  to drink and his response was   are you asking me if I can take your order  I m a little tied up right now. I ll take it when I get back if you still here .  Needless to say  we weren t there. And we won t go back or encourage anyone else to either. We were at the bar and There were at least 3 people behind the bar and we were never acknowledged .

Man oh man let me tell you this place was legendary. We read some of the reviews and thought   how bad can it be  . Have you ever been served the drinks that you ordered 30 minutes ago as you are walking out the front door  Oh you haven t  Well give this place a visit  How was the food and alcohol you ask  It doesn t flippen matter because you don t come here for the food.... you come here for the experience  And what an experience it was. After waiting for our drinks for a solid half hour we got them. Another 20 minutes later we got our food. Some of it was hot some of it was cold. 3 out of 8 of us didn t get their food. The waiter took their orders not once again  but twice again. But let me tell you their water game was straight fire. Water girl did a phenomenal job so God bless her and I know that one day she will run this place. Our host was also our waiter and most likely our bartender and head chef. Anyways you come to this place for the reviews  but leave this place with stories for the ages. 10 10 highly recommend
Loved the food and the service was amazing. I highly recommend the Alhambre tacos   Best tacos ever

I did some research as far as where to find the best micheladas in Austin and this place popped up. I m not going to lie  it was pretty underwhelming. The micheladas are not that great and there is less than half a beer in it. It is typically made with Dos XX but you can substitute with any beer of your choice.   The food  on the other hand  was authentic and pretty delicious. They do offer pretty speedy service. We got drinks right away and once we got our order in everything came out pretty quickly.   This is the second restaurant we visited in the city and once again we had a super awkward experience with the waiter. The first time he approached the table he spoke English but when he came back he was speaking in Spanish  I speak both so it s fine but I was just so confused. He kept switching it up and was super shy and quiet. Overall any interaction with him felt strange.
The food is delicious  my favorite is the chorizo gravy on ANYTHING    Service and food have been amazing every time we ve gone.

The only thing good here are the chips and salsa.  We had a margarita and it came in a rocks glass.  I asked the waiter what his favorite thing was and he told me a  17 shrimp.  It was disgusting. The sauce was old  probably leftover from a couple of days past.  The rice was also old and really mushy.  My S.O. had crispy beef tacos and he said the were o.k.   45 for crap. Yuck    Wish I had waited and had a chicken fajita taco from Whataburger.

We came for a lunch and sat outside on the patio  which was very nice  We came during the lunch hour and it was steady  but not too busy  and were promptly seated  The service was great and very friendly  I ordered the chicken flautas which were very good. The chicken was tender and the lettuce  tomato and avocado on top was very fresh  I liked how the tortilla was crispy but not overly crispy. I was the chicken flautas down with a frozen margarita which was also delicious. Great place to sit outside and enjoy the nice weather  Pro tip  if you order an entree you get a free small queso with check in  you re welcome
Great Mexican food.   I usually get the tortilla soup  amp  every time it s been great. I ve never had an issue with any of the servers  as they re all very attentive and make sure we are set.

We went on a Sunday close to closing after leaving Zanzibar. We sat on the patio which is really nice. The staff rushed to greet us and seated us immediately. The chips and salsa are wonderful and complimentary even for refills. The salsa was spicy which I loved. In our group of 5 we ordered the vegetarian burrito  chicken burrito  chimichangas and taquitos which were all tasty. My food came out wrong but was corrected immediately and happily. I wasn t in love with the wine selection my Sauvignon Blanc tasted like Gallo or Sutter Home. Very good service. Fantastic location.

I arrived late to join a party of about 15 coworkers--and the wait staff scurried to get me a drink and food quickly so I could catch up with the group.  I was impressed.  My margarita was tasty  My tacos were flavorful.  Good meal.

First time in Austin. Getting friendly service everywhere and knocked out by this awesome city. This place was right next door to the Convention Center  a most fortuitous location. They have a really good and spicy michelada  and you can choose your own beer. If not for that  this might have been a one-star rating. The service was slow and on the level of pulling teeth. Good luck with that. We decided not to order food after seeing the pulseless and uninspired service  mirrored by management as we left without so much as a thank you.
Patio seating very nice   service was good and staff very friendly meal was very affordable and drinks were very good

Not gonna lie..... I came here when I was already intoxicated  so any food I had  was delicious. I do recall having the smothered beef burrito... which was HUGE. More than enough for one person.   Asked the waiter what I should get for my alcoholic beverage  he said he was an alcoholic and loved to drink  but didn t have much of a suggestion for me. I went with the classic margarita. I will say that the food was served in a very timely manner  considering I was with a party of 14.   It s alright in my book. Nothing more  nothing less. Just your casual  Tex-Mex restaurant.    gopriz

If I could give zero stars I would do so.  The owner is also the Event Planner and was amazing when my fianc  and I looked at her rooftop as a reception site.  She first met us at Pecan Street Cafe and we would later learn she owns this  as well.  The venue was not nice and there were many homeless persons and we did not feel safe due to the ambience and scenery.   We met her inside to be courteous.   She took us to Micheladas and while it was not our first choice  she was so sweet and easy.  We said yes.  What followed in the next few months was horrible.  She was dishonest  refused to speak with our hired wedding planner because she informed Brenda Woody that she was asking for fees that were not industry norm  I.e. a 20 percent gravity on top of another 20 percent just for alcohol  and it ended with her calling me and asking if I was trying to start problems with my wedding planner and her.  Just like that. She was rude and vial.  She name dropped and said that she worked with Kanye and Justin.    After months we were unable to pin down a contract with her because of her antics.  I was frantic. 10 weeks left until my wedding and we could not trust her.  She did not follow through on anything that she said she would. Once she has you  she will lead you on because you feel like you need the venue.   We were shown pecan street cafe and their menu with cake prices one month before we gave her out deposit for Micheladas.  The cake was advertised on their website for 425.00.   She insisted it was over 600.00 when it came tome to pay and order.  I showed her the website.  They get all of their baked goods and pastries from pecan street since they own it. She said  oh  those Prices are outdated .   I said  from one month ago   And they re still on the website btw even now.   You showed us these prices when we met you to book the venue     It goes on and on way beyond this.  I will prove it to her or if it will help you decide on this venue.  If she responds to this  message me privately.   I have an entire paper trail to prove every single thing I am claiming about this venue and this person.   I will prove it all and gladly to help someone avoid the loss of money and stress that she caused us.  If she refunds our 1500 deposit I will also take this review down and not pursue further collection.    We never received our deposit back and in the end  it was worth walking away from 1500.00.  We were married at The Driskill Hotel and wanted something more open and laid back like a rooftop terrace for the reception.   We decided to have it at a museum in the same area and although we paid much more  we chose to do this.  That s how horrible she was.  Hope this helps.

Let me just say  I love Mexican food  chicken enchiladas are my go-to. These were the best restaurant enchiladas I ve ever had.   My dad and I stopped in here on Saturday night - Selena was our server and she was so pleasant and very attentive even though  I think  she was the only server for our half of the restaurant. I ordered the chicken enchiladas  green sauce  with refried beans and it. was. phenomenal. I already knew I was going to be writing a review because the guacamole was the best restaurant guacamole I ve ever had  So I made sure to snap a picture of my food when it came - literally 10 mins later I took a picture of a clean plate. I used the warm tortilla chips they set on the table to scoop up the last of my beans because there was no way I was leaving anything on that plate. My dad had the Burrito Supreme with fajita beef and the whole time kept saying   This is so good... Holy cow this is good.    Selena checked on us multiple times and any time the manager walked by  or someone came to clear  our drinks were refilled. I was impressed with the service and blown away by the food. I already can t wait to go back

Talk about false advertising on their Menu    It s really inconvenient to see a price online and receive a completely different one when you go in. They stated this  Google  website is not secure so why isn t it removed or updated with Google... Hello manager do your job  be professional and own your mistakes... BEWARE enter at your own Risk  very disappointing.... Don t recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This place was nice not to many people inside and the waiters were nice and came to fill up our water and the food didn t take long I got the Tortilla soup which was really good  amp  there chicken and waffles were pretty good too big serving  I would get the chorizo gravy on the side.

Stopped in early in the week to watch some sports  was seated at the bar and had a great experience. The service staff was attentive and the food was all prepared perfectly. Had a hard time not taking the chips and salsa to go as they had the perfect crunch and spice combo. The only reason they didn t get 5 stars is they beers that I ordered were frozen. Not the worst but less then ideal  if your looking for a nice dine in Mexican food restaurant this is the place

This place has amazing service  Ava  the bartender  made our experience perfect. Our food was delicious  my son raved about the quesadillas. My husband and I enjoyed the margaritas on the patio. I had the flight which was a perfect sampling of 4 flavors  mango  prickly pear  strawberry and traditional lime. We also had enchiladas  which were superb.

Don t sit in the bar unless you want to hear every detail of the bartenders social life  I should have sat in the dining room  but since it was just me I thought the bar was a good choice. The bartenders friend was seating at the bar and they chatted the entire time while I sat two seats down  where the hostess sat me. Not a single other customer in the bar.     I didn t want to be rude and ask to be moved.  I definitely should have  I felt awkward the whole time I was eating my fajitas  Food was good though

The bartender didn t guide guest through the happy hour menu. Rather just gave us the most expensive option for the drink that we ordered. Charged me  12 for a Dos XX Michelada during Happy Hour. When asked why I didn t get the happy hour version  they simply said because you didn t say  happy hour   and finished up with  that s just how it is chicka.  So thanks for nothing douche bag.
Found this spot that is a bit off the beaten path by locals but the service and staff are great   Any other negative reviews should be negated.  Bob Woody has this one solid

Group of 4 hungover 20 somethings stopped in here to bring some grease and brunch to their lives. We got sat outside and were the only ones enjoying the beautiful patio. The server showed up to fill our waters and hand out menus but would disappear for long periods of time. The menu here is extensive and there is truly an option for everyone  especially for brunch. I went with the totrilla soup and the huevos rancheros. The rest of the group went for a hodge podge of tacos  nachos  and chicken and waffles. LOL at the fact that the Chicken and waffles come with a  jalapeno syrup  and when asked how spicy it was  the waiter told us thats actually a lie and he has no idea why its labeled like that. Interesting...  Margaritas here are pretty small but tasty and the food portions are massive. The huevos rancheros were basic but damn was the tortilla soup good. Fresh avacado on top and everything. This place is pretty decent but wait staff needs to not go on 20 minute hiatuses  especially when we dont have silverware or need more water.
Here on a work trip. First time in Austin. Impressed so far.   Not many places can make Paloma s.  This place is by far a great one.   Definitely recommend

Ate here while attending a conference in Austin. It was convenient for us as a lunch option. We were quickly greeted and sat when we walked in. Salsa was great. Too hot for my friends  but I loved it. Our food took a little longer than I expected. But it was really tasty. My taco were wonderful  fresh  and cooked well.

The food was good but nothing special. Same goes for the drinks. The outdoor patio was probably the best part of the meal. Visited this restaurant during covid. We were social distanced from others and all staff had on masks.
The michelada isn t that good.  Kinda blend.  Service sucks.  And are rude.  Restaurant wasn t busy and we waited 30 minutes to order.

This review is based on their Micheladas and yelps list of best Micheladas. Best is at Buhos sports bar. It s not even in Yelps list. Secondly why name your bar Micheladas when you only offer one kind of Michelada  No shrimp   cucumber options on the rim   There s northern Mexican Micheladas  Gulf of Mexico Micheladas and southern. Step it up I really like the place and I wanna go back Update  On Friday s polvos downtown has the best Michelada by far only thing it lacks is the Tamarindo stick.

Micheladas most likely relies on convention crowds to fill seats. The restaurant is usually empty.  They have good brunch deals and the salsa chips are a decent snack. Anything deep fried usually comes out too greasy compared to the dry look some places can achieve. For example  the waffles and fried chicken are just too heavy to eat on your own. The chicken soup however is actually very pleasant. Other things we ve tried are just ok but they tend to cost a few dollars more than other Mexican places.  One thing that isn t so great about Micheladas is the wait. Considering how empty it is  it s ironic that the waiters are never prompt.

Came in for lunch. Glad I did not pay attention to the low average rating. The food was excellent  in fact they mad a dish for me not on the menu  pollo enchilada a la crema  It was outstanding. The Staff was friendly  service great even at full capacity. Prices reasonable.

Stopped by yesterday with my G F for lunch and picked up six tacos  3 chicken  amp  3 beef fajitas for about  35.00 and it worst I ever had. This was my first  time and I m sad to say  possibly my last time. The beef was extremely tuff and chewy and the chicken was bland and flavorless. I was thinking it was because of the situation everyone was in and I do appreciate y all being open.

We had brunch today and my bf said  this might be the best food I ve ever had  it was pretty freakin good  I had a Michelada and migas with extras and ate every last bite  We sat near the bar and Ava took great care of us. She was very attentive and friendly. My only suggestion is since it is called Micheladas they should have a mini menu with different styles of them. But we enjoyed and will be back next time we are in Austin.

WOW   Is all I had to say after leaving Micheladas . I had the snapper veracruz and it was to die for   It was so flavorful and yummy I went into  a food coma   I could not stop myself. Oh and let me not forget about the wonderful appetizer Texas quale knots the presentation was just so beautiful and the taste was even more to die for  Would definitely come back and I highly recommend  One of the best valentines dinner by far

Terrible experience here for lunch while at a conference at the convention center. Party of two  we were sat and our orders taken. It was 12 10 and we told the server we needed to be back at the convention at 1. He assures us no problem. We order 2 watermelon salads  raw fruits  nothing cooked  and 1 beef fajita appetizer. 40 minutes later still no food  but we went ahead and paid the bill. I asked the server to pack our food to go and all he said was it wasn t his fault. More time passes and we ask to see the manager and get waved toward the front  but no one is at the host desk. Another party had been waiting to be seated and just walked out. Note- restaurant was NOT busy- lots of empty tables and staff everywhere. Server brought our food as we were walking out the door and get this- fajita was chicken instead of beef.  Terrible service  terrible restaurant. Too many other places in the area to spend your money.

I m giving it a 2 because I didn t get to try the food but the service was horrid. My husband and I had wanted to grab a drink or two and we asked for a table. We were about to get seated when a service man comes rushing to us saying we can t bring food from the outside. I said that the box was leftovers and we just wanted to drink. He was unsure and said ok  like he was doing us a favor. We decided to walk out. Service is the worst  you have a restaurant bar that has almost no customers and you would think that would motivate them to keep the few new clients that stop by. Instead we got treated like we were an inconvenience to them.. so I took my money somewhere else.

This appears to be a nice family style restaurant. The owner was so gracious we stumbled in 30 minutes before closing and he was nice and courteous enough to take his time allow us to order and fix our food to go. That is what I appreciate about Austin Texas hospitality. We ordered a fish taco platter that includes beans and rice and a shrimp taco platter to go. Great Texas hospitality and delicious food and this is from a person who is not into Mexican.

Deplorable. We were sat at a table at 5 45 for 12. We were served margaritas  chips and salsa and at 7 05 we were asked to get up because they mistakenly sat us there and then decided they didn t want to sit us elsewhere because we didn t have a reservation. The manager was very aggressive. I don t understand this kind of treatment.

Their pricing is a little silly for what they are but their fajitas are pretty good and queso is done right. They give you 2 tortillas and charge for more which is weird. They re like  1 for 40 of them at H-E-B lol so I m confused. Not the most friendly group but if I have a reason to come here I won t be too sad about it while I eat fajitas for one at  20.

They put this sign outside but don t be a fool Micheladas cost  10.The manager said that if they have a convention it doesn t apply. How stupid  Then they shouldn t put the sign in the first place. It s located across the convention center. I guess happy hour never applies. Also  he was really rude  he just said  you misunderstood the sign and have a good day  the food was ok and the Micheladas were not the best I ve had.

Across from convention center so there s that. Service was weird - on one hand they were overwhelming with the check ins   all good here  you guys good    Uh  yeah  but how  bout a menu   followed by  how  bout you take my order  bring my food  drop a check..    but slow as hell to deliver. Food was food  we re in Austin so the Tex-Mex needs to be strong but here it was just meh. But again  across from the convention center...

If it s busy  beware. I went with a friend for an event  so I understand it was a little busy  but the service  food and drinks were terrible.   We ordered our food and drinks before the event started because we knew it would get busy. We got our food before our drinks and didn t see our waitresses again for about 20min. We had to ask someone about our drinks. I got a paloma and my friend got a mimosa. The paloma tasted like a glass of margarita mix. I ended up having to take it back to the bar because our server never came back to our table to check on us. I went to the bar and saw that our waitresses was making drinks for the bartender. The bartender had her remake my drink and had to give her instructions on how to make it. It was still not great  but I took it anyways.   After the event started we decided to try one more easy drink  a strawberry mimosa. We got our drinks about 15min after we ordered. It tasted good  but again I think the waitress made it because the presentation was awful. I had to ask her to bring us strawberries for a strawberry mimosa. Everyone around us was getting drinks that looked amazing. Ours looked like they were thrown together.   I finally spoke with the manager  and she didn t do anything about it. She said she would send someone to check on us  but no one ever came by. The waitress finally came by so we could pay.   Oh  and the table by us had to share a fork because the same server never checked on them either.   The food was meh.

I would give zero stars if possible. I literally made a yelp account to complain about this place.  Absolutely ATROCIOUS service. First of all I got a  water  cup with lipstick still on it. Fine shit happens. I used to be a waiter I get it not on you. We had call ahead for a big party  made reservations we get there they had 4 different tables for us. Covid we get it  trying to be responsible even though we called ahead saying if it was cool with the amount of people TOGETHER and was guaranteed a yes  they said no  fine maybe it wasn t possible  not what we planned  we asked and told we could but we get it  maybe the hostess didn t know. BUT EVERY THING AFTER THAT. Look i don t look like I speak Spanish but I do I was born in mexico the way they talked about us  thinking we didn t understand  was so terrible and rude. Orders were wrong  a friend is allergic to avocado she mentioned it  they said don t worry. Her food came with avocado she said I m allergic  they took it away  brought it back out  guess who got hives shortly after. It wasn t a  oh I don t like it  but a  I am allergic to it . I tried to be as understanding as possible but between the attitude  rudeness  and disregard for everything. I have never EVER in my life had such a ABSOLUTE TERRIBLE experience as this place. I would never recommend this place. Would actively tell everyone I know to skip it.

Worst restaurant experience EVER  First off  if you are a restaurant next to a convention center you need to be prepared to handle volume and get people in and out quickly. We waited 45 minutes for drinks  were told it would take 50 more minutes to get our food  asked for our food to go and didn t even get all of it but had to leave. We were in the restaurant over 90 minutes and saw our waiter once. It s a good thing gratuity was included because I would have not tipped him at all and I always tip.  No apologies from the manager for anything.   Definitely not enough staff. Two servers to handle a large outdoor seating area. Awful awful awful. Everything was just awful.  If I could ve given it no stars I would.   If you are at a convention do not waste your time here.
Great place  Drinks are good and food is tasty too. I like the environment and friendly staff at the bar and restaurant.

Sunday brunch breakfast tacos were small and dry. My corn tortillas were hard and stale around the edges. The chorizo was little  dried  over cooked crumbles. My husband s migas were such a small portion  they looked like an appetizer.   The most uncomfortable bathroom layout in Austin  the stalls are clearly visible from the bar.   The ambiance is beautiful and the service excellent.

Great service   Friendly and attentive staff   Clean restrooms.  I had lunch here while in town for a conference and arrived right after they opened the doors as I had an extended break between sessions.  Lunch menu is awesome   I had the chicken flautas and my free queso.  The queso was amazing

Ummm.... I gave this place 2 stars to be nice..... food was pretty bad. Service was bad. Pricy for the food you did get.  We ordered the ceviche and it was cubes fish with tomato and some flower seeds.... it was creamy and very fishy. Do not order.   We also had he fajitas and they looked like they were boiled then maybe tossed on the grill for a min. Pretty bad too.   Chips and salsa were good and their micheladas were okay.  Would not go back.  I guess the empty restaurant should have been our first clue.

Place looks cool and fun. Maybe if you only drink then it s ok.  Bartender on Sunday night was super slowwwww. I order a drink while looking at the menu too about 15 to get my drink and then finally put my order in.  Chips are great.  Salad is very spicy.  I got fajitas and they were ok.  I think I might have been just as satisfied if I went to taco bell. I didn t yelp this place first but seeing the low marks I understand.  I should have waited the 20 minutes for Gus s world famous fried chicken right next store.   Come with low expectations and thinks will be fine. Or get drunk and have no expectations on food and service and then it will be ok  Oh yeah I had to ask for chips and salsa also   And with Austin tap water boil in effect they made me pay for bottle water. When our hotel and most places comp it especially since the mayor is working on state of emergency and reimbursement for businesses.   That was pretty lame of them

LEAVE ME HERE  JUST GO  SAVE YOURSELF    The ceviche is no bueno. About 3 ounces of fish for  16 and the price wasn t really the issue. The menu says citrus based  it was bland and creamy. Creamy  Yuck  I didn t like the michelada either but I must say I am very picky about my miches.   3 stars for my bartender  she was cool.

3 Stars for location  amp  beautiful covered patio.  Food is fresh but seriously bland.  My husband ordered the burrito  I ordered the chicken tacos... nothing special and I was a little taken back by the bright yellow color of the cheese on top.  The best part about the meal is the tortilla chips and a Borracho beans.  Slowwwww service.  Will not be returning here... Too many other awesome restaurants in Austin
Amazing food. Great location. Friend of the owner is an amazing host. I highly suggest...

I am happy that i did not read the reviews  for i might have bypassed this kitschy little tex mex place  and i would have missed what is probably one of the best pork dishes i have ever had  ever.   My colleague and i had reservations at a place across the street  with excellent yelp reviews   but  after seeing it  decided we did not have the right shoes  or hair  or at the very least we were not cool enough. We looked across the street and both said  Margaritas l and in we went  we did cancel the other reservation  we are not cretons .   Our server recommended this pork dish  don t remember the name but it came with stuffed jalapenos and had some jam broiled on it . My colleague asked about fish tacos to which the server politely said  you can have fish tacos anywhere  this  the pork  you will probably never have anywhere but here . He shared some facts about the origins of the dish and from where the pork is sourced. The guy knew his stuff  and was as professional a server as i have ever had. The margarita selection is very good  and they serve ice cold Modela Negra fully dressed.   I ordered the dish. I ate the dish. I loved the dish. I may go back tonight.   Nothing else about the place seemed special  and in fact it is probably just a good tex mex place in Austin  but this dish  this dish made all the difference.  Just looked it up on the website   DON CHAPPO  Brined pork chop rubbed in chorizo spice with blackberry-ancho gastrique. Served with mashed potatoes  seasonal vegetables and 3 bacon wrapped stuffed Jalapenos.  Slap your momma.

My company that I worked for rented out a part of the restaurant and they gave us the best service  ask for Justin M. he s the best bartender  was the friendliest and nicest staff I ve encountered. The food was amazing but the staff is what makes it s makes you feel like family

Came here after another nearby place had decidedly terrible service. I decided to get a couple of breakfast tacos  chorizo  egg  and queso fresco. I asked the waitress if they still had coffee available  it was already past 10 30am   and she said she wasn t sure  but she said she could brew me some if I didn t mind waiting. I said of course  and I appreciated the extra effort.  The place was practically empty  very quiet and cozy. The chips and salsa were very good. I had to add some salt to the chips  but they tasted fresh  not stale   and the salsa was on the medium side. Not too mild and not too hot. I almost drowned myself in it  it was so good.   Food came out piping hot  and my tacos were delicious. I ate them all even though I was past the point of being stuffed. Our waitress accidentally charged our card incorrectly  but she fixed it no problem. I d recommend this to anyone wanting breakfast or brunch in a sort of quiet secluded corner of downtown. It s right next to the convention center.

I was warned not to go to Micheladas but it s close to my residence and I like the way the bar spills out onto the outdoor patio. I also wanted to check out the rooftop patio. What a disaster to wit   STRIKE ONE  Went in and asked to see rooftop patio. Hostess said it was close  so went bar. Not only did nobody wait on me  no one would even make eye contact  so I walked out after 5 minutes.  STRIKE TWO  Came in next day and inquired about rooftop patio. Was again told it was closed.   STRIKE THREE  Again went to bar. No one waited on me. Server walked up who had a section elsewhere was ordering drinks and I asked him if he could tell me where to find a drink menu. He gave me the one on his trey and I thanked him. I decided what I wanted to order  but bartender was at other end of the bar  on his phone and or talking to co-workers making no gestures he planned on waiting on me or making eye contact. After 5 minutes  again walked out and nobody seemed to notice.  YOU RE OUT   I ll never go back  no wonder I was warned not to come here.

Ok I truly dont understand some of the other reviews and am glad I did not pay attention to them. I am a Michelada coneisur so I really had to check it out. First off let me start out with the friendly host who greeted and sat us. He was very nice. our waiter was very nice as well and very helpful with helping me decide on entree. I chose the chipotle enchiladas and my friend the beef fajita nachos which were both delicious. My plate came out hot and was MMM sooo good. I also got to taste friends nachos and they were just as great.   I feel bad because I always require refills. My waiter along with the other staff were all over it. I did not have to request a refill at all. Not only did I have tea with my meal but it was now time for me to try a Michelada. OooooMmmmGggg     This absolutely was the  Sexiest  most delicious Micheladas I have ever had hands down. Trust me I have been having Micheladas since before the were popular here in the states. Used to have them when visiting in Mexico over 25 years ago. This wayyyy out beats anything I have had even back then. Having them here just the way they came out was awesome. Being that I love spicy I ordered one EXTRA spicy. was not disappointed at all    Actually I was blown away. Usually when I order extra spicy the bartender would just add extra Tabasco sauce. Not here. They infused it with Jalepeno and Serrano peppers. Whaaaaat    Why didnt I ever think of or ask for this before. It was so amazing that I had to go meet the bartender who made this Amazing Sexy Michelada. Her name is EVA and she is truly talented at what she does and can tell she puts in everything I to her drinks and just not dump things together.   If your looking for great food  great service  and the Best dang Bartender in area  you have to come to Micheladas. Don t forget to request a drink made by Eva     I came from San Antonio and have several great places to have good food and drinks but without a doubt Eva and crew blew me away. Total staff was great and I am so glad that my friend brought me here to celebrate my birthday. Had an Amazing experience and will take the hour trip down here weekly. Cant wait to come back and have my next batch of Amazing Micheladas      Thank You sooo much Eva    You are truly the  a href   redir url http 3A 2F 2FBomb.com amp s 716853a54974befb18bd2a2079d876386c9ebd876290947c699fc1e3eaccf129  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  Bomb.com  a

We visited this restaurant in the late evening in July 2017. From the outside  it looked like a fun restaurant. Unfortunately  the furniture and decor was old and staid. The chairs literally had cracks in the upholstery. We were initially sat in a booth and there was a huge fly in the window. We called our waiter s attention to it  but he seemed unconcerned  merely swatting a towel over the table at it.   We asked to be seated elsewhere  and that ended up being okay. However  it started raining heavily while we were eating and gentleman who was presumably the owner came over to tell us that he was closing early because it cost too much to keep the kitchen open while it was raining. I have never heard of such a thing  but by that time I was more than happy to leave.   I must note that the food itself was good. We had the Michelada s sampler  but the restaurant was out of the quail that was supposed to be part of the sampler. The restaurant s solution  Extra beef nachos. The queso sauce was delicious and the crab dip clearly did have fresh crab in it.   Overall  a so-so experience outside of the food. Worth noting is that the menu says you can order a round of Coronas for the kitchen for 12. I can see how this would be a nice compliment to the kitchen  but for me  the front of house needs to do much better before I would spend extra money on that.
The bar staff could be about 15 less disdainful  but their salsa is on point. The ambiance is a nice blend of casual and formal and the menu offers several options beyond the standard Texmex fair.

We came here on a 75 degree Sunday afternoon in February  and had the beautiful outdoor patio to ourselves. I was shocked    The indoor space is dark  cozy  and designed to look authentically Mexican. The outdoor space is just perfect.  Okay  it could be a bit more perfect if it didn t overlook the convention center - but I m happy with a bright and cheery  nice size patio any day     The food was yummy and the service was on point. It seems like this side of downtown is never really too busy  but I love it. It s quiet and there are tons of good spots to eat and grab a drink. We ll be back for sure

At a convention and decided to try this place.  It was a nice day and sat on the patio.  It was pleasant.  The only negative part of their patio are the huge tour buses that are idling outside the convention center.  I rather not breath in exhaust while eating.  Not the restaurant fault but something to be aware of. The patio is huge for a downtown restaurant.  I got the chicken enchiladas with rice and beans.  Good portion size.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Food was delivered quickly.  The sangria was tasty as well.  If back in this part of town  I would eat again. Pre tip for entr e and one drink  20.

Just stopped in to Micheladas while on a walk downtown. To be honest we hadn t eaten here before because it got mediocre reviews. Have to say that it was a very pleasant surprise. Patio very nice--shaded with huge fans that really worked well. Dog friendly too and they go above and beyond for the pooches. Excellent service for the humans too. Food was really good. We just had appetizers but everything we got including the salsa was delicious. Will definitely go back

At first glance this place can look like a charming  breezy respite from the maelstrom of SXSW  but it s actually kind of a dump. The food is just...not good. I had the Eggs Benedict for brunch and it was underwhelming in every way. The eggs weren t even poached  There is literally no other reason to order Eggs Benedict than to enjoy the runny deliciousness of a perfectly poached egg.  The biscuit it came on looked like someone smashed it with a sledgehammer a few times before plopping the other ingredients on top. Totally unappetizing. And the hollandaise sauce was basically just queso dip. So not what I was expecting  and quite possibly the worst Eggs Benedict I ve ever had.   I did not enjoy the Bloody Mary at all. I m a picky bitch when it comes to Bloodies  so it might not be worth mentioning  but there you have it.   The margarita was fine. The free tortilla chips were okay. Not the best I ve had  but not  like  stale or anything.   My biggest beef is with the service. The bartender was fine  but the servers were just insufferable. It s like this place is their stage and we  the people who are just trying to spend our hard-earned money on a decent dining experience  are their plebeian audience. If you sit at the bar you will be privy to their loud ruminations on last night s debauchery. Staffers who aren t working might just pop in just to hang out and have loud conversations literally one foot away from a customer just trying to enjoy their damn  mediocre  food. If you are super  un lucky  you might even get to listen to one of the servers sing     while rolling silverware two feet from you.   Listen  I was once a server. I understand they are human beings with thoughts and feelings and personal lives. But I also know that the best dining experiences are the ones where the service is so smooth you barely notice it. The service at Michelada s is so noticeable I could not focus on anything else.   In short  food  meh. Service  hot mess

Went there for brunch before heading  out on a wine tour. Sat in the bar area and Ava our bartender and server was absolutely amazing  So friendly and nice  The breakfast migas tacos were the best I ve had  Highly recommend the restaurant and the wine tour

Visited this place for the first time while in Austin for my bachelorette weekend for brunch on a Sunday before heading back home. I must say I wish we had one in Houston  Food was so delicious with flavor and texture. The Micheladas are  a href   redir url http 3A 2F 2Fbomb.com amp s bb4f996415a9c2f21137e27cfb68f439a48cec2652b53e9b50dd7e766dbe177e  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  bomb.com  a  We were a group of 14 and were sat right away the waiter was so nice and friendly I wish I could remember his name. I will make sure I visit this place again when in Austin
Great drinks and the BEST Tortilla Soup I ve ever had  Sorry Mom . Staff was awesome and the location was close to our hotel. Also had the Pork Belly Tacos which were so good.

Sat at the bar and had the coolest bartender. She offered ala carte everything  so I tried all the enchiladas. Beef with Chile con carne won the contest  but all were good. Atmosphere was amazing and the patio  although hot outside  was completely shaded by the upstairs patio. I never had to wait for a drink as she always asked before I was completely empty. Gave this place 5 stars because of the bartender s excellent service  but the food was also amazing. Will definitely come back again the next time I m in downtown Austin.

Went to Micheladas while at a convention because I was tired after a long day of travel and didn t feel like walking further to find a different restaurant. Unfortunately  that was my mistake. My advice would be to keep walking. While the service wa good  hence the 2 stars   the food was not... it s food like this that IMO gives Mexican food a bad name.

I was left speechless.  Went there to meet a group from Texas Winos  ordered two  4 tacos and asked for a water to wash it down.    2 for bottle water  she says.  I said sorry I meant glass of water.  Without hesitation it was  we don t have glass water for you   2 for bottled water only .  But I just ordered  8 worth of food...  So I walked outside w my  8 worth tacos and will likely never return to patronize.  Texas Winos should reconsider who they partner with.      edit  Tacos were good and manager reached out w an apology.  Changed from 1 star to 2.

First of all let s say this experience is the worst myself and co-workers have ever had here.  We were seated quickly but unfortunately that s only one of the only positive things that occurred.   Our waiter  Barry was busy but he seemed bothered by our table from the moment we ordered our food.  When my food arrived it was wrong  when I had it sent back to be fixed  Barry came by and acted as if it was my fault that my food was wrong. Apparently my asking for my flautas to be plain wasn t clear enough.  Then as my new plate arrived  my co-worker found a hair in her food that was clearly not hers. When she told Barry this  he took her plate away. He then comes back to tell her that the kitchen is remaking her food. She has already lost her appetite so she is forms Barry  no thank you I don t want it remade.   Well Barry was less than impressed by this comment  he proceeds to walk back to the kitchen clapping loudly.   There was no apology for the hair in the food.  I do not recommend eating at this place.

The salsa was only okay  but the queso is excellent   It is homemade  not Velveeta  and they put big chilies  serranos   in it.  Their barracho beans are probably the best I ve ever had - and that s saying something because I ve never had bad barracho beans   They had a nice smokey flavor.  The rice was a little above average.  It could ve used a bit more flavor  but the carrots and peas were definitely a nice touch.  The fajitas were excellent   Tender with a good smokey flavor  same as the beans  .  There was a real big lunch crowd  but service was good and the noise level was relatively low.  They seem to be a locally owned business  which I like.  I ve eaten here before and I ll definitely be back again

My best friend and I were wandering around downtown Austin after our stint at SXSW and right outside was this restaurant. Without checking the reviews first   gasp of horror    my friend and I were hungry enough to just sit down and eat.  Right when we came in  we noticed that it wasn t as packed as it definitely should be- being RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET from the convention center. But there were still people. And no one was giving me the  get away while you can  eyes  so we barrelled through.  It wasn t horrible. The patio was cute  with umbrellas to block out the Texas sun. We were greeted- took a while  but I think they were trying to figure out what server got us in the rotation- and we promptly got our order in.  If you re looking for great food  this is not it. If you re looking for conveniently located  average  won t-give-you-the-runs food- this is your spot   We got the guacamole- which had no flavoring and was literally just mashed avocados- and the fajita beef nachos to share. The nachos were not impressive  or really very good. Just cheese  beef  beans  jalapenos. But  They weren t horrible. So  at least there s that.  They have a prickly pear margarita which was pretty good  and definitely very pretty.  Server was okay. Hostess was stand offish.  3. A-OK.

This establishment will cut you off after 2 rounds of beverages just because you are not ordering enough food from them. After 2 rounds and an appetizer  we were cut off from ordering beverages until we both ordered entrees. As most places are closed  Micheladas was going to earn a majority of my business over the next three days. Now  they ve earned nothing. Well done  Micheladas. Please go to an establishment that will respect your business.
This place sucks. Service is horrible especially at the bar.. Avoid coming here totally not worth it    Stay away

Visiting Micheladas for the second time this week. Excellent Mexican food with excellent customer service.. I can t say that enough.. if your like me and appreciate good service  please give this place a try. It truly deserves more stars.

They will make you sick.  Beware         Asked for corn tortillas brought flour.  I did not initially realize this due to the way they were cooked.  They caused me a serious 12 hour plus Crohns flare up.  Bad service ie slow  drinks brought after the meal.  One of the worst dining experiences ever.  So if you have dietary concerns or Gluten free stay away from this place.  My friend asked for chicken taco salad.  They brought steak.    I told them no onions on the tacos.  Of course they had........onions.

I don t understand why people do great reviews about this place  it s not good...why do people get happy with poor service  - it takes forever to have your food on table - waiters look confused and their attire look dirty - food is not  the best in town  as manager stated when we entered  party of 8 ...is not even close to Mexican food at all  - by the time food arrived to our table everything was warm  didn t even look fresh cooked. - server spilled drinks twice  one on table and the other on my friends chest. Then he decided that cleaning the glass with his fingers would be the best to do    - waiter didn t know what the ingredients in two of our plates were  he assumed everything so we ordered expecting one thing and getting another. - manager   Oh my... If you praise about your restaurant being the best  dress up like you own the place  Not in sandals and white shorts T-shirts. That to me speaks lots. - bathrooms are weird  I know Austin is supposed to be like so  but bathrooms need to have a main door. I need some privacy and I have the feeling that germs fly around bar  amp  restaurant with toilet rooms being that open  - there are many options in Austin close to the convention center  this one is one to avoid. It looks nice from outside but service and food has to improve LOTS

Because I happened upon a bad experience  I d like to start with what s good about this place. The chips and salsa... yummy  I checked in with Yelp and got some free queso dip. It s a big open restaurant with a lot of seating and a great bar area. My waiter was  Andrew  and he was very nice and easy going.   Unfortunately when I walked in around 12 45  there was no one there to greet me. I even left for a few minutes and then came back because I decided nothing looked better that was also close to the convention center. The second time I walked in at the patio area hoping someone would greet me. No one did... I walked back inside the place and finally just asked the bartender if it was alright if I sat down. Someone new  a newly trained waiter who seemed nervous sat me down. I sat there for a while until I heard some mumbling about how I wasn t supposed to be sitting there. Shortly thereafter the nervous waiter came back and apologized for being new  and he didn t know I wasn t supposed to sit there... Okie doke...   I continued to sit there as no one told me where else to sit. I stopped a busy waitress and asked for a menu. She retrieved it for me and didn t seem concerned I wasn t getting service.   Finally Andrew got to me and I ordered. I got the cheese enchiladas. They were a bit funny tasting  I didn t really enjoy them.  So that s it s. That s my pathetic story. It all took about 40 minutes and my contact with a human employee was limited. I don t know what was going on at the time... But... Man did I feel like a shadow on the wall. Not a good feeling.
The food was pretty good  but for the price  eh. Although I will say the beans were delicious  Go for the whole black beans. The outside patio area is very lovely.. makes up for the price

Service was the only good thing. I ordered two tacos  which came with rice and pinto beans. The Tacos were  ok .   Their sauce  rice and beans didnt really tste like anything.  Even the coke was bad  because the water tasted really awful  tap water . My friend said his broccoli tasted like the tap water they served  which is disgusting.  The place is dusty and not comfortable  so overall  I wouldn t recommend anyone to go there.

Bartender looked like he got his ass kicked night before and was very rude. Food was terrible and drinks were weak. Im here with a client and it was embarrassing how bad everything was. I do not recommend at all.

Looking at the reviews  I guess I m glad we came in late on a random Tuesday night near closing time  We were immediately greeted and provided with chips and salsa  both very fresh and flavorful. Our waiter provided an awesome suggestion for a margarita and did just the trick for what we were hankering for.   We conversed for a long time and he allowed us to take our time. We finally ordered and I got the shrimp tacos with corn tortillas and a side of black beans. After a short time they came out and I was more than excited to eat at this point  albeit hunger curved by margaritas and chips. The corn tortillas were warm and the shrimp was perfectly cooked  not overdone. It was topped with a slaw of jicama  avocado salsa  and crispy tortilla strips.   Some others at our table got the stuffed pork chop and another got the pork belly quesadilla and none of us were disappointed. My favorite part though  Ending the night with the tres leches cake. OMG. Amazing and mouthwatering  so indulgent and sinful but at that point  there s no return  Hey  at least there was a few berries on the cake  so it s healthy...right
Awesome restaurant  Had a nice dinner w my family  food  amp  service was great  Excellent atmosphere with tasty food  10 10 would recommend in Austin
Great food and good service. I had the Pepper stuffed with chicken and the best drunken beans side dish  English interpretation . Medium price range  drink and a tip was about  20.

It really doesn t make any sense how horrible the service is at this restaurant. I can t even comment on the food because after wasting 45 minutes of my life waiting for just some nachos  I decided to leave. The waitress at the bar slammed a glass of water in front of me after 15 minutes of waiting  and just shrugg d her shoulders when I said I was leaving. The only reason I went there was because it is right across the street from the convention center  and I wanted to grab some lunch quickly between conference sessions. Boy was that a huge mistake. I could have gone to the market  bought the ingredients   and made my own nachos in the time that I got NOTHING here. STAY AWAY

Wow  This place was terrific. Great food and great service I was pleasantly surprised. My experience was at the bar where I had the fajitas and enjoyed a few drinks all the creation of the bartender Chrissy. I wasn t sure what to drink so she whipped up some of her own creations which were all delicious.   Thanks to the staff who were all very welcoming. Lots of fun times and great food. I will certainly return.

I have never been to a more poorly run  unorganized restaurant. I understand it was busy and everyone seemed to arrive at once however you are directly across the convention center in downtown Austin. You should be better prepared. I m sure this wasn t the first time that s happened and it certainly won t be the last.   I ordered and food arrived quickly. Unfortunately my silverware did not. I sat there for 10 minutes trying to get someone s attention with no luck. It took the lady sitting next to me to request it when someone finally came by to get her order.   The food was nothing special. Standard tex mex. not worth returning for.   After I finished it took about 15 minutes to get my bill and then about 10 minutes to get card back.   Not worth it.

Food is good but the staff is not. We ordered something very simple she charged everyone wrong even blamed the manager for just charging it and after he did the charge we couldn t fix it. So idk how much common sense they have here or what but if you come just bring cash and know what you ordered
Terrible margaritas.  They do not use fresh hand squeezed lime juice    Very avg fajitas.  Take a hard pass on this place.
Our bartender here was absolutely amazing   Justin thank you for making our 1st visit unforgettable  Your drinks were fire  So delish  We will deff be back   hangten

I was in Austin for a conference and decided to stop here to grab a bite. Me and my friend enjoyed the chips and salsa. We got the free chili com queso and it is really spicy. There was not any meat inside but overall it was okay.   The margaritas were not strong. I added sangria to mine which made it a little better but my friend was highly disappointed with hers.   Would I come back. Probably not.

Terrible experience  This place doesn t even deserve 1 star.  Came here with 6 people around noon on a Friday and the place was empty.  Should have known. They had a sign out front saying they could host 800 people when realistically they couldn t even handle one table.  Margaritas were all mix and no Mexican beers on tap.  Asked for the tableside guac which was on their menu and the server barked at us saying they were too busy to do it  so we ended up with a side of guac delivered normally. Then 1 person got 2 fish tacos and it took over 30 minutes  but the server wanted to close out everyones tabs. Food was cold and not tasty. Definitely do not recommend.

Just spending the night here in Austin and accidentally came upon this restaurant. I had Chicken Burrito Supreme with Black Beans. Also chips and salsa. Delicious. If I m ever back in town I ll sure to stop by.
This is a pretty bad restaurant as my opinion. I really think they dont cook their food really good. i think this is a bad restaurant.
Food is good but the WORST SERVICE EVER. If I visit again I won t come back. Got up THREE times to get the check. And they forgot drinks and food.

Our first time there today and was pleasantly surprised. A waiter sat us and was a bit abrupt but pleasant enough.  The queso was amazing with slices of jalapeno in it. I had the shredded chicken tacos and the meat was well seasoned and tender. We will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

This is really average to below Mexican. Got the chicken enchiladas and they were room temperature. I suspect they are pre-plated and the cheese is later nuked on top. The waiter was friendly but the chef needs to kick it up a few notches.

Horrible service    Food was ok. Waitress was slow  amp  was MIA for over 30 minutes until we flagged down the lady that serves water to go find her because we needed refills on our drinks  Then we asked for our check  amp  it took over 30 minutes to bring it. We literally had to go look for the manager  amp  ask him for our check  We are definitely not coming back here when we visit Austin again. I don t think this place will be open too long if they don t get better servers.

I had lunch here 2 of the 4 days I was in Austin.  Yes  I am a bit boring. Or it could be that this really works if you re at a convention. I met up with a woman from Australia  we decided to dash across the street when classes got out. We got there before noon  got a table immediately and were eating quickly.  I had fajitas the first day which was good  not great  but good. The beans were spicy and the iced tea decent. I was so surprised that they did not carry Mexican coke   The second day I had a chicken enchilada and was nervous that the salsa verde was already applied before I received my lunch. But it was deliciously tangy  not hot spicy. I really loved that enchilada. Probably the best one I have ever had.  Nice breeze  clean and comfortable room with efficient service. Add to that great lunch deals and some superb food  if you order the chicken enchilada.   And enjoy your convention to boot

Tried the Famous Michelada and also the El presidente margarita and they were Meh and under average. The salsa was also watery and disappointing. I see this as more of a touristy just getting out of the convention center kind of place to go.
Best freaking enchiladas I ve ever had. Soooo good. And my water cup was never empty.

Nice place  big  comfy chairs. We were seated right away  water and chips right off. They forgot salsa for s while  but the fresh chips were great dry  Our sever was very nice  refills came fast.   We were a party of four  fajita plate was GREAT  Pork belly tacos GREAT  Quesadilla plate real good  but it s hard to mess those up  p enchilada just so so. We all shared so everyone was happy.   Taco plate was a little small. If you re HUNGRY double down. Everything else was a very generous portion.
The service is great and the food decent. Our waiter was kind and respect  but i probably won t be coming back for food. Also don t get the famous Michelada it s not worth it for nine bucks.

Pros - the place is huge with plenty of seating  both indoor and outside. The food is delicious and our server was on point. Great place for a weekday lunch with no wait.  Cons - the parking  Street parking near the convention center is limited at best  be prepared to circle the block at least a few times.
Thanks Ava for being awesome   We stopped in for a quick drink and Ava took excellent care of us. They had just been hit hard and she kept it fresh and was thoughtful on my drink.

It s a shame that this place is in the downtown area and has good decor. Service is slow  we order a margarita and a beer the drinks came out 28 minutes later had to stop the manager to put in our food order. Waitress are not well trained seems like their hurting for experience staff. Don t waste your money here.

Rude servers and slow service. It doesn t get worse than that. Unless you are there to spend a lot of money  they don t want to bother with you. We were there in the morning to wait for a tour bus and ordered a bloody Mary to share. Instant attitude from the server. Twenty minutes later  he brought the drink which was only five dollars so my husband gave him a ten. He never came back with the change  We finally caught up with him and said we wanted our change. He pulled out his wallet and there was our receipt. Aren t they supposed to turn those in   We went again that same evening when the tour bus dropped us off. We just wanted some queso and drinks. Got the same attitude from the server so we ended up walking out. Too bad. Heard the food was amazing.

Went on a Saturday afternoon. Place was empty and I was skeptical of the 3 star average rating  but was pleasantly surprised. Great service  good margarita and the fish tacos were delicious  aka NOT tilapia . A tad pricey but hey it s downtown Austin.

Just went to Micheladas  read previously reviews and was a little bit Leary  but we were PLEASANTLY SURPRISED. Eat in the Bar  bartender Baker was very personable  and friendly. Gave us many recommendations  for food and drink. I ordered the Alambre tacos. Very good  a little spicy but excellent. My friend had Chimichanga carnitas. She enjoyed her meal too. Would definitely recommend
These were some trash ass micheladas. That bitch tasted like white ppl spaghetti  -brandon  drinks 10 micheladas a day  is trustworthy
How are you gonna only have 2 servers on a Saturday on ROT rally weekend at that.  Wanted to just have a nice relaxing dinner on the outside patio.. pictures were way better than in person.

We were the only people in the entire restaurant and that should ve been our first warning sign. The service was great but the food was AWFUL. Also our booth was dirty. There was dust or dirt or visible chunks of something all over my seat that I had to wipe off. The margaritas were too sour and they had to remake them. The chips were literally the worst I ve ever had. I couldn t eat them. The oil must ve been old  it tasted disgusting and had a bad aftertaste. The queso was so spicy it could not be enjoyed. The tortilla soup has these giant ears of corn - with the cob still intact - like giant round pieces of corn cob you can t eat and have to dig out. Why not grill the corn then cut it off the cob and put it in the soup  Truly  how are we supposed to eat it  We had to take them out and nibble the corn off the cob. It was awkward.

Staying at the convention center and stumbled upon this restaurant. No customers were present during lunch  a clue we ignored  as we were hungry and pressed for time. Server took way too long to refill our drinks  which are necessary if you dare to try their fiery house salsa. Ordered the chicken fajitas  every pepper was burnt and stuck to the cast iron. Won t be coming back  there are too many other Mexican places to try nearby.

Ordered the Chicken Fried Steak with chorizo gravy    The chorizo gravy is awesome    It s very interesting with great flavor...     Sat outside and enjoyed the weather.     Since it s by the convention center I could see this as a tourist drop  but on a Sunday it was smooth sailing.  Ordered the Basil Strawberry lemonade cocktail and was really good...  I d recommend anything that gets the chorizo gravy   Great salsa and get the free queso when checking in
Great tasting food  I had the shrimp tacos that tasted so amazingly fresh   I will definitely be retuning again for more local cuisine.

7 pm on a Monday....was there 20 minutes before I got a menu and 30 minutes before I got a glass of water.  My order was never taken.  Bartender was very rude.  Said they were busy.  Will never  ever  ever go back.  Will share experience with all of my friends.  And even strangers.  End of story.
The food was bland and the service was slow. The only good was the decor and friendly staff.  I wouldn t recommend this restaurant.
Really good fajitas. Good portion of meat and veggies. Coconut mojito is very refreshing. Everyone is friendly and helpful.

When they stop by and talk to you 30  minutes after you order to tell you that it will be about 15 more minutes  they actually mean about another 45 minutes. Poor communication is a bad thing when people are trying to make meetings. The chips and salsa were good.
I only had drinks and appetizers  but the drinks were good and the pork belly quesadillas were pretty tasty

This was a decent restaurant with pretty good food.  The waitress was attentive and kids were happy with their food.  They went out of their way to feed our very picky eater son. We sat outdoors and it was comfortable and sunny.  Nice dinner.

First off  prepare for a very long wait for your food. We came during a convention and the wait would ve been expected if the place was really busy  but it wasn t. Within view  there are 5 tables open  so no excuse for the long wait. It took about 40 minutes for us to get our food after we ordered and the table behind us was told  we do the food in order so it ll be at least another 20 minutes .  Once our food finally did come  it was amazingly bland. Zero spices  zero flavor. Tasted like chicken from a can mixed with cheese from a bag. So prepare to ask for a lot of salsa and sour cream or avocado or whatever else you can find to soak your food in.   So basically  go somewhere else.

Ugh this place is awful. I don t know how they are even still in business. The waiter was trying to sell us some cd he was working on and won t even leave us alone to have a conversation. The food was subpar and the drinks weren t strong. there s a reason it s always empty.

The service at closing time was excellent. We were looking for a place without having to wait roo long. We could take our food to go since it closes at 9 and we came 30 before closing. Hopefully the food is as good as the service.
This was a great choice for dinner. It s best to get a reservation.  Micheladas Cafe y Cantina fills up quick. I recommend the pork chop. The service and food was great.
Awesome bar  Micheladas are on point and the staff is super nice  Really great music and environment too

Took 15 minutes to get a seat at the bar  10 minutes for them to take my order  despite menu closed and eye contact   and over an hour for veggie enchiladas. Put in the wrong order which took 45 minutes and over 30 minutes for a replacement. Not a great place to grab launch while at a conference. Food meh. Large portions one of the only redeeming factors.
Great shrimp tacos. Good Sangria. I love the atmosphere.  Friendly and attentive staff. And their salsa was amazing.

Food was great  we had a variety  queso esperanza  jalape os rellenos  delicious    amp  some sort of dip with crab in it  I personally had the carnitas chimichanga. Very statisfied with the food. The restaurant was really busy when we went so drinks did take awhile. When we ordered a Michelada we noticed they were served in the tall glasses  we asked for them to be served in short glasses instead  our waitress told us that it wasn t possible because they only serve them in a tall glass. So once we finished our waters we poured them over into a short glass.  Aside from that random moment  the food was great  I will be stopping by again on my next Austin visit

Stop by Micheladas after a day of kayaking. By far the best Micheladas in all of Austin. Special thanks to Eddie the manager. He greeted us  check on us without being over bearing. Great ambiance and beautiful patio Everything was Great
Got a free drink  staff was nice but this place is completely unorganized  Didn t get our food on time  wasn t good at all  and it was cold. I don t see myself coming back here

We had a great experience for brunch here at Micheladas. Memorial Day weekend and we were sat quickly and the staff was very attentive and quick to our needs without being overly intrusive. Fresh flowers on the table  delicious drinks and food  I will be coming back to Micheladas when we re in town

I give this one star for the fact that the service was good. My food was 45 minutes late and was incorrect. I ordered beef enchiladas and got pork instead. Even after complaining  only received 25  off bill. I would have walked out if it wasn t a crime. Very disappointed. Excuse was something to do with kitchen staff. Will never go back.
We were in Austin for a convention. This restaurant was 2 blocks down from Hotel  the margarita was excellent and the food was good. We had a part of 6. We will be back

Hmmm  you would think that being across the street from the convention center  a downtown restaurant would be better equipped to handle a small lunch rush on a Monday at noon. They aren t. No one even greeted us. Several tables were seated before us  we are a table of three  even though they arrived 10 minutes AFTER we did. 40 minutes later and we are still not seated even though there are plenty of tables open and unused. I am so  extremely  thoroughly disappointed in this restaurant. I would avoid until they get it together.

The food was decent. Nice atmosphere  but for lunch they offer limited seating   15 buffet  or sit out on the patio. It is 52 degrees outside  Not wanting to pay  15 or freeze outside we choose to sit at the bar....but then they left the door open leading to the patio so we froze anyway  We asked for the door to be shut  but they denied us.   Even other patrons could be heard saying   it s colder in here than outside     Little uoset and pretty cold. Probably wouldn t come back.
Poor bar service. Bad drinks. Avoid the margarita Martini. Good tableside guacamole.  Stinky restaurant. Not good.

This place does not feel mexican at all. Menu was has a  small selection and only had key tex mex dishes like fajitas and enchiladas. The michelida was served in a glass that was ment for a fancy mix drink and the rest of the beer next to it. The service was good but the way the restaurant was set up didn t make me feel like it was a real Mexican place.

I was pleasantly surprised by the food and service at Micheladas.  We were greeted right away and seated.  Waiter was friendly and prompt with taking our order and refilling water and chips.  Enchiladas were very tasty and margaritas were strong and yummy.

Crab stuffed achiote chicken breast was excellent.  I did not think the jalape o emulsion added anything special  I think it was just right without it. The achiote rub on the outside provided plenty of flavor. The creme brulee for dessert was  good   but didn t quite live up to the hype provided by the waiter. His description made me expect an out of body experience  it was good  but no out if body experience IMHO.  Will definitely return  maybe try b the tres leches cake for dessert.  The Pescado Veracruzano is definitely on the must-try entree list.
We really enjoyed our dinner. The waiter was very patient and offered recommendations. I had the Green Chile Pork Tacos... Fantastic.... And during Happy Hour was even better... Loved it.

Such terrible service. Went in a large group with a reservation. We all had very simple orders. Everyone got their entrees after waiting quite a while  although the restaurant was empty. I NEVER got my meal. The waiter finally realized I didn t have it and came back and asked what I ordered AFTER everyone finished eating. I told the waiter that there is no point of putting my order in after everyone cleaned their plate and was ready to leave. Absolutely horrendous customer service  and they didn t seem to feel bad about it at all. Didn t offer anything to make up for it. I sat with my large group and watched them all eat until they were ready to leave. Might have been the worst dining experience of my life.

In spite of the fact that I m not generally a fan of tex-mex  I know   I did like this place. The gentleman working- his name might have been Gus  - greeted me with  Welcome  family   I felt so comfortable just walking in.   I was on my way to a session for my conference so had only a little time for a quick dinner. I got guacamole and the daily drink special- a Texas tea cocktail. The guac  made table side  or barside in this case   was great. The drink  I didn t care for it  but I don t think there s anything wrong with how it was made. I just don t much like Texas tea  but wanted to give it a shot since I try to sample local items when I travel.  I really loved the space- it s open  airy  and extremely comfortable  due largely to the fact that the staff  or Gus  at least  seem really glad you re there.
Great food  drinks  atmosphere and service  The table side guacamole was some of the best I have ever had. Definitely a go to
Food is good  nice atmosphere   but service sucks in bar area   No structure on which bartenders are working sections.   When busy they bogg down.

The food was pretty good  and we enjoyed the meal.  Food arrived pretty quickly and was hot.  The downside  the music is so loud you cannot hear the person across the booth from you  and the service was pretty slow and drink refills scarce.  We could see cleaning products and brooms from our booth  I would think they would put these somewhere in the back.    I would not go out of my way to eat there  but it s convenient to the convention center  and again  our food was good.
I was here in Austin and visited here  by far the best experience    Barry the bartender was amazing  Clean and fun    Definitely a place to visit  Can t wait to go back
