The worst place and service ever. They should not have signed up to do an event if they don t have the staff or intelligence to do so. A restaurant who has never had a full booking should not do an event. Got here at noon and it s almost 2 and no food. Complete fail. Couldn t give it zero stars.

Food tastes ok  but is absolutely overpriced. Service was terrible  flat out. You walk in and it isn t clear who the host is. Figured it out eventually  asked the host who I should speak to for a table and he hesitated a little before he asked if I wanted to sit by myself at the bar. I walked over to the bar and no one acknowledged my existence for a while. Finally someone asked if I wanted water and chips  and I told her I wanted to order. My food came out before my drink - had to ask for the drink. The margarita tasted like syrup.
Enjoyed this restaurant. It was within walking distance of my hotel and the service was great. I ll definitely try it again if I return to Austin.

Service was very slowwwww. There was hardly anyone there. We got there 5 minutes before happy hour ended but by the time someone waited on us we couldn t order off the HH menu. I gave 3 stars because the margarita was good once we got it.

I was nervous at first because of the 3 star rating  but it was close to both the hotel and convention center so we gave it a try. I m really glad we did.  The salsa was very fresh with heat that builds and sneaks up on you. Three of us ordered the chicken flautas and they were awesome. You get your choice of beans -- black  pinto  refried black  refried pintos or drunk beans. Order the drunk beans. It is pintos cooked in beer with onions and bacon  served with fresh cilantro. They made the meal. The rest of the group ordered nachos  fajita salad and the such  but we all agreed the food was great and were  glad we went. Give it a try.
Conveniently located near the convention center and plenty of room inside or out for groups. The food is pretty good.

Found this place while wandering around downtown Austin.  We were looking for a Tex mex place before the 4th of July fireworks.  Micheladas has a nice outdoor patio so we decided to stop in for some drinks and a snack.  We ordered the chicken enchiladas and margaritas. We also got a free order of queso with yelp checkin.  The mango and strawberry margaritas were yummy and made with fresh fruits.  The enchilada was pretty good and the chips with queso were great.  The waitress recommended the tres leche for dessert and we could say no as its made in house and very good.  It was light and fluffy.  Micheladas was overall pretty good and reasonable priced.
Brenda  the owner  is my new bff  For serious. She s lovely  and she s generous  AND her food is delicious.

If your server recommends their daily special of a  carnitas chimichanga  - for the love of all things delicious  Put down your menu and get that. Don t even look any further. Best carnitas I ve ever had plus the way they made the chimi so light and crisp on the outside without making the lettuce and pico inside is almost unfathomable. An absolute MUST try if you like tex-mex. Smothered in their just spicy enough chili con queso  this dish is now on the long list of must haves when I come to Austin. Highly highly recommended. Also  had a few bites of my girlfriends flautas and they were just as good as my chimi. Don t waste your time anywhere else. I never give 5 stars but the good here speaks for itself.

The food was actually quite good. I am rating one star because of the disrespectful service we received. Please understand that I spent 10 years in the service industry so I understand what it s like to be on the other side of the apron.   My father and I went on a wine tour to celebrate Father s Day. As part of the tour we received an email offering free queso upon showing our wristbands . We decided to take advantage of the offer and stopped in after the tour to top off Dad s special day with a good meal. When we explained the offer to the server he explained that he had been there a number of years and had never heard of such an offer. He even checked with his manager to confirm. This was all fine.   My father then double checked his email and was able to pull up the offer and then showed it to the server. This is when things took a turn. Upon seeing the offer the server should have alerted his management again and allowed them to handle it. Instead he continued to cite the number of years he d been a server there and insisted  no such offer existed. At this point it was no longer about receiving something free but the principle of the matter. The server became defensive and even insulting stating several times the queso was very cheap  as if we could not afford it. We had already ordered drinks and food so I m not sure why he continued to harp on the price of the queso.  Upon questioning the server about the email the server stated the third-party making the offer was lying so as to be more advantageous to their own company.   Now  perhaps the offer was not cleared by both companies prior to being distributed. We actually noticed a nearby table having the same issue. However  their server responded to the situation in a much more polite manner. I do not agree with the statement that the customer is always right  but I do believe it s fair to say the customer should always be the number one priority. While the server did reluctantly deliver a bowl of queso he did so by then stating yet again how very cheap the queso is. He was demeaning and ensured that neither my father  myself nor anyone we know will visit this establishment in the future.   I should note the server told us more than once that if we really wanted a bowl of queso to check in on yelp. I hope this post serves to vindicate the bowl of queso he felt we did not deserve.

This place was terrible. We walked in  the guy that sat us said that there were no small tables left so we HAD to sit at the bar. Once seated at the bar  the bartender practically ignored us for a few minutes. Once he did address us  all he did was brought water and said that the chips and salsa would be right out. Didn t ask us if we wanted anything to drink or anything. We asked to move to one if the smaller tables once it freed up because at this point the bar tender still had not come back to ask us if we were ready. I asked another server if she could wipe off the other table and she said sure. After waiting ten more minutes  no one wiped off the table. At this point  we have been waiting twenty minutes and still nothing. SO................ We walked out. Didn t have time to wait around and see if anything else would happen.   Terrible service Terrible bar tender- He favored to one side of the bar And terrible wait staff.

We sat down in the bar area at 9 on a Saturday night while a playoff game was on. My cousin cheered and the manager Rudely told him to use his inside voice  like a child. A few minutes later a large group of guys came in from outside and yelled as well and the manager came out and automatically told my cousin that he was being childish because he was yelling while there was a family sitting close by. He never said anything to the large group of guys yelling because they were on their way out. This was the worst experience I ve had at a restaurant and I was only there for 15 minutes. Very rude manager and very bad wait staff. Also there was a gnat in one of the drinks we ordered. Never again will I return here. If I could  I d give zero stars.
Was in Austin for a conference we had dinner with a client here. Food was ok.......margaritas were great.

Food is great  service is just unprofessional. Management and employees don t seem to carry a filter on their language. Some of them have used vulgarity  managers included like the taller one wearing a blue shirt. Just overall improper. Bartenders and bussers were friendly  servers and managers were just sorry.

Service was great.  We felt like old friends of both Barry the Bartender and John the Manager.  Drinks were delicious  and the food was amazing.  We enjoyed it so much  that we went back several times over the course of our short stay.

Had breakfast here.  Food was good.  Cleanliness could have been better.  Had dried queso on the side of our table and on one of our plates.  Our table was very rickety as well so we asked to be moved to a new table.  Service was great.  The micheladas were good too.  If they clean things up a bit and fix the table  I could give them a 4 star review.  I would come back again.

Came here for lunch. As a vegetarian I was disappointed to see not one vegetarian item on the lunch menu. Even the cheese items came with meat on top. Stayed for guacamole and a cocktail. The cocktail was okay. Guacamole was underwhelming but not horrible. Might give it a try again at night  but most likely will steer clear of it in the future.

Horrible.  We did the buffet and it was obvious that the buffet is just a way to take advantage of a busy convention center with limited food options.  Plates were dirty  food was mediocre  had to wait for silverware  glasses and food to be replenished so we could eat. Not worthy even half the price we paid

i WISH i could give this place negative stars  it was THAT bad. first of all  lunch hour and the place looks closed its that empty  red flag right there  should have left immediately . walked in sat down at a dirty booth with chips and food remains on the seat and table  mosquitos everywhere on the INSIDE not patio area. The server is out of it  there s only one other table of 2 people there. he brings us water then leaves and 20 mins go by. he finally comes back and takes our order. we finally get the food which is bland and over cooked. within 20 minutes he comes back picks the plates up on top of the food which we still had OVER HALF of still left  and then just walks off with all our food    INSANEEEEE. he comes back with the check and just walks off. not sure what was wrong with this guy. no manager on site  no help. worst service we ve ever experienced. 20 bucks for fajitas that the waiter trashes midway through - this place is HORRIBLEEEEEE. the manager john is the rudest person possible in the restaurant industry. overall - garbage food and garbage service.  got bit TWICE by those disgusting mosquitos. this place is the absolute worst. never again. stay away.

Had lunch there yesterday. Bartender waiter was super attentive to our group of seven. Hubby and I split the Seafood Enchilada plate - was a touch cold but I figured we were just first out. It was very tasty and contained whole  large size shrimp.  Yes I was surprised about that.   The Mexican Martini s were perfect. I m very picky and this place was fantastic about catering to my needs. Plus they had the playoff game on WITH the volume on  Loved that. Not many bars will let you listen to the game as you watch. I will be back.

We came to a big convention  and they management was aware but not enough staff   and the only staff was running like a chicken without head. food is good  this place has a great potential. I will come next year and I m sure my experience will be different.

We went by to check out Michelada s patio and food as a potential venue for an upcoming event. I was actually quit pleased by the location  downtown  right by the convention center  and drinks   3 happy hour margarita s  and their food.   I think that construction in the area is hurting their business  because on a Friday  for Happy Hour after work  the place was practically empty. But parking is available if you park at the convention center garage instead of trying for street parking. I think they need to consider some kind of valet service until this construction is completed  so that their customers can find visiting Michelada s easier.  The patio is a great place to sit during the evening. The heat of the Texas summer sun can make the patio a little oppressive before the Sun goes down because there is no shade to be found. But after the Sun is down  it s great.  I had the chicken fried steak for dinner because I wanted to try it. It was tasty and the potatoes were good. For a twist it is served with a yummy chorizo gravy instead of a cream gravy. I liked the twist. The cost was  14 for a very small steak  but this is downtown  so it s to be expected.  My friends had enchiladas. They liked them. The also liked the sweet salty spicy Lucas-like chili mix on the rims of their drink glasses. It s not Lucas  since they make it in-house  but it is a good imitation. Tasty  tasty  tasty.

So disappointed. Came in for a bachelorette party that I planned  booked in for a party a month in advance and they were super accommodating. Came in tonight  they didn t put us on the patio  which we requested a month in advance  our food came our lukewarm an hour and a half later  the manager challenged me when I met with him about it and tried to act combatively towards us. He also refused to run our checks because it wasn t his job  the server needed to do it.  It s currently 11 00 and our reservation was at 8 30 and we ordered before 9 pm. We will NOT be back. The best they could do was 10  off and he challenged me when we placed our orders. There are maybe 5 tables full here and his blame was on last night being too busy. Taco Bell might be better than this.
Great staff  amp  attention to detail. Food was awesome for a mexican place. Great place for quaint brunch  lunch or dinner  Would not go here for special occassions. More so for a date night
Location was perfect for us. The fajitas and chilequiles were quite good and fresh.  Service was outstanding. Just what we were looking for
Do not eat at this place if you want your food in a reasonable time.  45-minutes after placing order got up and walked out so have no idea if the food is any good or not

So was out and about around Town Lake a couple of Sundays ago. My lady and I were looking for a place to get some margaritas and possibly hang out on a patio to while away the afternoon. I saw that two of my Yelp friends  Errol M  and Stacy M.  had recently checked in here that day. I always love an opportunity to hang out with fellow Yelpers  so I decided we should try out this place. We got there around 3 and a waiter told us that they were closed.      But the hours of operations on your Yelp page says 10-9. The only saving grace was the bartender said he could fix us up with a drink still. But we were looking for a place to hang out so we declined.   Fix your info  I will give this place another try. But I rarely get down that way  so until I do this review will have to suffice

SO RUDE   Worst service and horrible  manager . Terrible drink and food service. Manager lied about being 2 hours behind a reservation on cinco de mayo.... when the restaurant had 2 tables.... would NEVER come here again. Biggest waste of time AND money. Beyond disappointed.

The food was very good but the service is super horrible and slow. They never gave us chips n salsa  we waited for 25 minutes for our drinks and then couldn t get a refill. I ordered table side guac and the waiter literally took 39 minutes to bring it then didn t give me any chips. Then got snippy when asked for a refill on Dr Pepper for the third time
Sat at the bar. Great service  Loved the Michelada. They do make them well here. The queso is very good and my tortilla soup was the best I ve had in a long time.
Wonderful place to try Great Tex-mex  came with friends and family . Service was wonderful and everything was at great speed

My lady and I went to this place before a concert to get some food.  The atmosphere was nice...not a bunch of tables crowded together so I didn t have to wonder if anyone was eavesdropping on the conversation.  The margaritas were amazing...I wish they were bigger  but I wish that about all of my drinks.  We started with half dozen oysters...topped with cheese  cilantro and bacon  which are my three favorite things in the world  and as someone who s not an oyster fan  I actually enjoyed them.    I had the flautas...they re not like Chuy s flautas.  They weren t greasy and gross...they were crisp  delicious and topped with crema and avocado.  Absolutely wonderful.  My lady had enchiladas...chicken with the sauza and cheese with chili con carne.  The con carne was amazing  as was the sauza.  The salsa was fresh and wonderful and perfect in my opinion.  Our waiter  Russ  was so knowledgeable about everything on the menu and offered up recommendations.  Probably one of the most attentive waitstaff I ve come across in Austin.  If he s working  you should ask to sit in his section.  You won t be disappointed with service if he s taking care of your table.  I ll definitely be back.

The drinks at this place are really good  the staff was really nice. However their food needs improvement. I would recommend this place for drinks and maybe appetizers before you go out  but not for dinner. Their flautas were extremely greasy and I didn t like them.
Great patio brunch. Awesome food  enjoyed the Benedict and break fast tacos. The free queso and check in was the bomb.

1 star for the Bloody Mary  Met here this past Saturday for the Texas Wino Tour. The profusely sweaty  cursing  loud server manager made us so uncomfortable that we moved out of the bar area to the front of the restaurant. He also announced to everyone that water was not free for the wine beer tour groups. It was a very unpleasant start to the day. We really hope Texas Winos reconsider their meeting point.
Everything was perfect. The guacamole is prepared right at the table and is delicious. Tacos were awesome too  Erika served us really really well. Thank you  I can totally recommend this place

Probably the worse meal I and four of my co-workers have had in a long  long time.  Cons  The salsa was bland and watery.  The waitstaff seemed confused.  The food was way over priced  even for downtown.  The menu was very limited.  Our meal took 45 minutes to come out and almost all of our orders were wrong.  Almost everyone thought their food tasted boiled and bland.  The waitress was not attentive and there seemed to not be manager in sight.  I got the carne guidada taco.  The tortilla was flour when I asked for corn.  The sauce was strange and maybe from a powder or a can    and the meat was so bland I couldn t finish my second mouthful.  The food took so long that half of us had to leave early and go back to the office.    Pros  They spent all their money on decor and it shows.  The queso was yummy and spicy.  Don t go there.   Unless you are there for over priced drinks and queso.

Had a great lunch while at a convention. Bartender was great  food was delicious  I had the chicken fajita taco lunch special  my mom had the tortilla soup  which she says was AWESOME . Will definitely eat here again if I m ever back in the area.

We were very very disappointed in this restaurant. Especially after all the amazing food we had enjoyed in Austin.  1st let me say the server was fantastic and completely overwhelmed.  We were a larger group and they were not prepared to handle us.  It appeared they were at least one server short for our group.  But that didn t seem to be the issue as much as the kitchen s ability to get the food and drinks out in a timely manner.  Our table was trying to pay and we noticed the 3rd table in our group was just getting their dinner. The food was marginal at best too.  We thought the service was bad because the restaurant was so busy.  But we walked down to the main dining areas and the place wasn t even 1 2 full.
If I could post a negative  star   review  I would.  The food is mediocre  the wait staff is awful  and drinks are overpriced.  Go to El Chil

It was fine. Empty on a Sunday afternoon and the wait staff was nice but not overly attentive.  I just had a beer and appetizer at the bar  so giving a rating on food wouldn t be fair ... food was ok but not a lot to ruin with chili con queso.  The Austin pearl beer was good and I m not much of a beer person.  Average price point. Lots of restaurant options in downtown Austin so probably would not come back.  But you may want to try it if you have a craving for Mexican food.  I saw them bring some food items out to other tables and it all looked tasty.

Uggh. Went to Michelada s yesterday in between SXSW parties. We were in need of food and drinks and it was right around the corner. The queso was meh  the tacos were mediocre  at best  and the michelada was downright disappointing.   But honestly  we could have handled all of that if the service had been at least adequate... unfortunately it was terrible. We were the only people in the place  but our server disappeared for for about an hour and then completely screwed up our checks -- a friend ended up paying double her bill but by that point we just wanted to get out of there so we didn t even say anything.   Also  the bathroom is weird.   This place s only hope is convention traffic because there s no way they ll be able to rely on locals.
Service was almost non-existent. Food when delivered was average. Chicken tasted fresh. Guacamole and salsa were fresh.

Service was quick  flavors were decent  chips didn t taste fresh but the salsa was good. Queso satisfied me. The tacos I had were aight.   Place is MASSIVE  like absolutely huge. Oddly it wasn t insanely packed during SXSW. Also feel bad judging the food  they had a very small selection to chose from during the conf.

This is one of Austin s most promising new restaurants. Reasonable prices  great food  and and an amazing atmosphere  I m looking forward to them opening the huge open top deck.    Chips and salsa came out immidiately when we sat down  followed by our friendly waiter  who recommended a few things on the menu. My michelada with chile salt complemented their tasty queso perfectly. I started with Oysters  tasted fresh and had a little spice. Then I got down with one of my favorite Tex-Mex dishes next  verde enchiladas. They have a unique spin on verde sauce  it s dark with a smoky poblano kick. Refried black beans were awesome  get them. Also save a little room for their creamy tres leches.   I m not a food citric but I know what good Tex-Mex tastes like. This is a good spot and a great addition to the vibrant restaurants in Austin.
Paul provided exceptional service  Great micheledas  Will be coming back next time we are in Austin. Thanks again Paul

The food overall was pretty good and the service was good as well. Only a few things that I bothered me  1. The salsa was way to hot  why not have some options in heat so my kids can eat the salsa too.2. The option of kids meals are pretty much just chicken quesadilla.  The location Needs major updating  the men and women s bathroom is labeled with blue painters tape.

I d give this place negative stars  if I could. Service is terrible. We had to ask for chips and salsa 3 times... And still waiting. 30 mins after ordering  random person tells me they are out of my order. Two other tables seated after us were served before us cuz apparently it takes an hour to make tacos.
Guacamole  salsa  and our entrees we re all very good  amp  authentic but the service was very very slow. Not very busy so can t explain the slow service. Waitress seemed to be just having a bad day.

I came with a party of eight and the first thing the waiter said was  I apologize but I am the only waiter for all these tables . Is that code for  you need to expect bad service   The service was average and the food was above but the real kicker came after the check. I tipped 17  in spite of the average service and the server texted a complaint to the person who had set up our reservation.....really   He complained that we didn t tip more....since when does average service demand above average tips

I ll start with saying the food is good and chips are addicting. The problem is the service is terrible and we were one of two patrons. Absolutely ridiculous. Micheladas are NOT good which is ironic. The location is awesome. It s sad bc the food is actually good. They need to up their service. Our waiter had zero personality and didn t even bring us utensils and napkins until we asked for it.

The micheladas are tiny they use a tall cocktail glass not the goldfish mugs that I m used to in other places.   In other words you could pour 2 or three of this places micheladas into the ones that they have a most Mexican restaurants. Same price also no thanks

First time to this restaurant. Celebrating daughters 21st Bday. 5 in party-Monday evening. Wasnt sure at first   just because of some of the reviews on this website  and I m picky. I work hard for my money and dont like to feel as though I wasted it. Birthday girl wanted a dinner downtown and talked me into trying it... GLAD WE DID. We were greeted and seated right away. Atmosphere was nice and warm.  Russ was our waiter. He was fabulous and knew all entrees like he created them himself.Very attentive  but not overkill.  Dinner was great. We had  Beef fajitas w  onions  tri colored peppers and all the fixins  Seafood Stacked Enchiladas  Pollo  Caliente   Chicken Enchiladas. Everything was delicious and flavorful. We also had a large queso  FYI- it comes w sliced jalepenos stirred in it  which would easily serve 6  and guacamole  made tableside . Salsa w  chips was fresh made I believe. Really good w  a little kick. I had 2 Mojito drinks. The flavor was spot on  but they definitely lacked alcohol. No warm fuzzies over cocktails for sure     Oh yeah  if you like black beans  try theirs. Mine were the bomb. The way they are prepared caused them to be in kind of a creamy broth rather than black beans in water. Almost like a black bean soup. Really Good  All 5 of us had dinner plus 4 cocktails total  for a little over 100 bucks. Very reasonable  Check it out. You will  be glad you did

Food was good. Nothing to complain about. Comfortable  clean. Ample outdoor space. Dog friendly.  Brought a water dish out for the pups. Waiter was a little awkward  but friendly and helpful. Will come back but next time will order tres leches without chocolate.

My friend and I walked in because I am in town visiting. And I have a service dog. We were greeted  by the hostess and decided to sit at the bar because there was no one anywhere but two guest at the bar and didn t seem to be bothered. As we were ordering drinks  then I assume manager both motions and tells us that there are no dog allowed. He doesn t ask if it s a service dog or politely start conversation with us about it. Plus I had already told the hostess that he was a service dog and even have my ID card on me to show them. He insist that my dog is still not allowed in the restaurant. As we walk out the patio door  the other manager insist that he had to have a vest on. When in fact I don t have to have a vest on my dog  nor even show his ID  which is both on his collar and behind my ID In my phone case. They both continue to jester that my dog and I must sit on the Patio. So we left. Very rude. If I could give 0 stars I would. Because it s crazy how Jw Marriott welcomes my dog and I  but I can t walk down to a place that is dead and give them business.

Great place  Staff was attentive never had to ask for anything. Tortilla soup was by far the best in Austin even beats The Mansion in Dallas  Decor is top notch and fits the downtown area. Wanted Texas sweet tea and they made it special for us. Oh but the Mexican martini with chili salt was a perfect pairing. We will be back

Had some time to kill before our flight back home to San Diego after a weekend of debouchery at ACL fest and how could we resist stopping for a michelada.  So glad we did   Sat at the bar ordered two micheladas served w dos Equis beer.Sip pour sip pour   Yumm      They serve free chips and salsa.  Chips were fresh and light.  Our waiter  Nico  an up and coming music producer in the hip hop scene  was so nice and made the BEST micheladas I ve ever had.  That s saying a lot since I live in a town bordering Mexico.  Thanks man   Good luck to you and we ll see you next year for ACL

I live walking distance so that is part of the charm but this place is never packed and service is pretty quick. I love their breakfast tacos  they are tasty and simple. I have been there for lunch once and dinner twice. I haven t had anything there that I haven t enjoyed.
On a whim we tried it for the first time today and loved it. It was a beautiful afternoon so we sat outside. Service  drinks and food were all wonderful.
Great place  great patio  tasty food  amp  drink and great service. Our server was very attentive to me and 16 month old. Watermelon margaritas .... Yum
Really enjoyed their Michelada  Chips and salsa we re great too  Will be back to try their food.

This place could be much much better if mgmt hired more attentive waitstaff. Had to ask for silverware  not a huge deal but it was never brought to me  picked up my own from neighboring table. Was never offered a refill on my non alcoholic drink  had to get up and walk to the bar for refill. Took ten min for my friend to get a beer. The food itself was great. No complaints on that  the staff however were clueless. Seems from the other review left earlier tonight I m not the only one who felt this way. To management  you could have a great thing going here... Perhaps pay more attention on who you have serving your guests.

I don t know what to make of this place...  it was odd.  we attended a  grand opening party .  free liquor brings out all sorts of people  myself included .  but this crowd...  I was half expecting a fist fight to break out any minute.  we had a few odd exchanges with people that needed a refresher course in manners.  some guy taking chairs from our table as his girlfriend yelled behind him  JUST TAKE  EM  JUST TAKE EM  YOU DON T NEED TO ASK    and some guy that got all upset because I was trapped and had to say  excuse me  about 6 times so I could get out.  then the table next to us chain smoked  one after the other  all four of them.  the girl closest to us held her cigarette over her shoulder  away from her own table and closer to our table....  I d really like to see smoking sections for patios and decks.  most people do not smoke  but it only takes a few to create a bunch of second hand smoke.  they easily smoked a whole pack in the 30 minutes we sat there.  we finally gave up and went to Fleming s  across the street   if I were to rate the people...  one would be too many stars.  so I ll talk about the food.  the food was really pretty good   we had a couple tacos and some guac and some samplings of their salsas....  really good stuff.  the tacos al pastor had the seasoning down perfectly  just like I remember from when I used to travel across the Yucatan  I was a young man back then   drinks...  the margartias were free when we arrived and they were pretty good too.  the drink line was long but the staff worked hard to make it move fast.    while in line  I heard one guy say  what is that about grand opening   this place has been open a while .    then the free drinks dried up.  but sort of how a dealer will give you that first hit for free  the people were already feeling good.  they stayed to pay for their drinks.  I thought to myself   this is genius   they could have a regular Grand Opening party where people are lured in by free drinks  but end up staying to spend a bunch of money   we later met a guy that used to work there.  his opinion was that the owner wants to be open for big events but doesn t care so much about being open full time.  maybe that is about to change.  I ll agree their location is more convenient to the convention center than it is to locals.    I m not saying I won t go back...  but I certainly won t go back for a free drink party.

Stumbled into this place after going to an event at the convention center. We were pleasantly surprised  We didn t expect anything next to the convention center to have much soul  but this place is great  Charming atmosphere inside  lots of wood and leather chairs. Spicy salsa  and my migas were delicious. We enjoyed our lunch

My husband and I were visiting from out of town and we found this place on yelp. Very happy we did  The food was outstanding  really great flavors. We sat on the upstairs outdoor patio and it was a great environment. The strawberry basil lemonade was delicious

Food was excellent  service was excellent  but I deduct points for three reasons. 1  no free parking  even though there s an open lot right next door that isn t used 2  a little pricier than the nearby Mexican restaurants - lunch special is  10  prices not listed on website  and 3  here s what pissed me off the most - I dined in with a co-worker  but ordered a third meal to go for another co-worker who couldn t take a lunch  all on one bill   and they still charged me the carryout fee. I could MAYBE  not really  understand adding this charge if we took all our meals to go  but we dined in. Honestly  I ve never been charged a carryout fee ANYWHERE before and that rubbed me the wrong way.

Just left. We waited 30 minutes  for a table in an empty restaurant and sat at that table for another 30 minutes with out being talked to by a single server. Awful. While walking out we were finally spoken to and said  where you going . Pitiful service. We wound up at PF Changs were sat right away and hat waters in 5 minutes. Stay Away.

Who else gives you oysters for brunch   And Riptide oysters  not Gulf oysters  at that.  Sure  they re not on the brunch menu  but the entire menu is available during brunch  so go nuts  The salsa is extra fresh  and swimming with cilantro. I m a cilantro fiend  so this works well for me. I went through about 2.5 bowls of salsa  without finishing a basket of chips  . That s telling.  My partner had some sort of extra spicy steak enchiladas. He said he had to suck down mimosas to balance the heat on that dish  and that s find because the mimosas were  2 and bloodies were only  5. Oh  and because we love spicy stuff. I was half expecting Micheladas to be a  safe  bland Tex-Mex joint   but the fact that they kicked things up a notch made me extra happy.   I ordered a shrimp taco  great price   and loved it. I felt uber healthy  and uber happy after having it. I only had the one taco  but that s all I needed. I was full  and my partner was STUFFED.   Go on a weekend  or even for happy hour. The frozen margs are nice and tart  and the patio is HUGE

We really wanted some good tex mex while visiting and found this place. The inside is very nice as well as the patio outside.  What I didn t like was the salsa.  It was just like spicy water to me.  It had no flavor and fell right off the chips.  The chips were good though.  I got the chicken tacos and they were actually really good.  The chicken was juicy and tender  however the rice and beans were not that good.  The rice was bland and the black beans were also very runny.  Seems like they like to water food down here  Overall I wouldn t go back if in town again.

This place is big and impersonal looking but it is close to our condo and is dog friendly so we decided that we should at least give it a try. We are glad we did because the outdoor patio was pleasant  the wait staff was efficient and most importantly the food was very good  excellent even.  As expected we were served chips and salsa shortly after sitting down. Our dog was also brought a bowl of water  which was appreciated. The chips were good but the salsa was outstanding  very fresh and bright tasting. We both ordered a bowl of tortilla soup which was tasty and a bit different from the other versions we enjoy around town. Here it had roasted corn and chunks of carrot in addition to the usual chicken  cheese  avocado  and tortilla strips.   We tried a michelada which my husband liked but I just don t like the drink whereas I do like margaritas a lot and they served me a nicely balanced one    We will go back and try more soon. We are glad we tried the place.

As far as tex-mex goes  this place is pretty darn good. I played it safe with enchiladas but I wasn t disappointed.   I m only giving it three stars because of the service. Maybe our waiter was new but he forgot to take a few of our groups food orders  forgot drinks  and even lost the piece of paper he took our order down on.  We got to eat eventually  when he remembered we needed forks  and that s all that really matters

I ordered the Migas and my husband had the beef tacos . The migas is made with scrambled eggs   peppers topped off with avocado . It was little disappointing  I was expecting tortilla chips and  jalapenos cooked in  with the eggs. I had this before at a different restaurant and it was superb . The tacos were very good per my husband. The rice and their black beans was to die for . The service was fast and friendly. The restaurant is very spacious and looks like it would be a lot of fun at night for drinks.

I really hate writing reviews like this for new restaurants.  Let me state right out that this place is not bad.  It s not   But it wasn t good either.  If I had to sum up the experience in one word  it would be bland.  We ordered micheladas and they were bland  even with the chili salt lining the rim of the glass.  I m pretty sure they used bloody mary mix instead of Clamato  which is fine when you re serving someone with a known shellfish allergy  but otherwise it takes away from the classic michelada flavor.  The chips at the table were good  but the table salsa was bland and over salted.  We asked if they had any other type of salsa and were given a small container of salsa verde that was likewise bland.    For our entrees I ordered flautas and the husband ordered the chile relleno with beef.  I was confused when I was given my plate because the flautas were not fried crisp.  The tortillas the shredded chicken was in were soft  making it seem like I was eating enchiladas with no sauce or cheese  which was not very appetizing.  They came with lettuce  avocado  and a bit of cheese on top  but it was pretty flavorless.  The rice was good with a hint of cilantro and lime  but the black beans that came with the meal were awful.  Bland and mushy.  The husband s chile relleno came with sauce on the side  but even with the sauce it didn t really taste like anything besides unseasoned beef stuffed into a serrano pepper and deep friend in unseasoned breading.  Again  none of the food was bad  except those horrid beans   but this was one of those situations where you eat everything on your plate because the flavor is unsatisfying and you are desperately searching for flavor pockets or at least trying to find satisfaction in fullness. For two micheladas and two entrees we ended up paying close to  50 with tip  making us feel like we definitely did not get our money s worth.  The disappointing food is a real shame too because this is a gorgeous restaurant.  Both the indoor dining area and bar areas are open  bright  and airy and they have patio and rooftop seating.  The service was also good with a waitress who was almost a little too attentive since we were one of only a handful of tables at lunch.  I feel like this place has potential  but in the way that a blank canvas has the potential to become a painting.  If they could get the kitchen to up their game and start taking some risks with flavor then this could be a great restaurant  but as it stand now it s a bland  expensive meal in a pretty package.

This little place  hands down  has the best margaritas. The frozen Sangria Margarita was the best I ve ever tasted. The service was top notch. The waitress recommended the queso with our chips and it was wonderful  not your typical melted block of cheese.

The new Micheladas restaurant in downtown Austin is wonderful. If you re a vegetarian like me  there aren t a ton of options  as with most Mexican restaurants   but you ll find the huevos rancheros are fantastic. The ambiance is quite nice as well. Give Micheladas a try  You ll be glad you did.

Okay here s my brunch menu guidance  - Potatoes are  seasoned   frozen  variety.  Not my bag  but if you are nursing a hangover  they might help you absorb whatever needs to be soaked up. - Migas - not even close to what I ve had elsewhere in town. If you ve never had Migas  then I d still avoid - I don t want you to get the wrong impression. - Queso - likely base is nacho cheese from a can  dressed up with some chiles.  It is not good. - Biscuits and chorizo gravy. They are okay.  Gravy was very salty.  Biscuits were dry but made a great vehicle for absorbing over easy eggs so... - Bloody Mary - was spicy  Observations of stuff I didn t order - fajitas or other sizzling items looked a bit more appealing.  This is a locally owned business so I may give it another shot.  Patio was nice. It is literally across from the convention center and for the price point  is not a terrible option.

Very good  I enjoyed the chicken enchiladas with suiza sauce  Excellent   Also had a margarita presidente which was excellent  Got a free con queso dip with a yelp check in...delicious   Service was great  Overall a great experience    Would recommend to anyone

Had lunch here today between sessions at a conference. One in our party was a vegetarian and some of us just wanted something light. Our waiter  Russell  was wonderful  Very friendly  attentive and accommodating. We were able to alter a couple of dishes to make them vegetarian. The quesadilla without the pork belly but with added veggies was wonderful. Our vegetarian friend enjoyed her black bean and veggie Nachos. The service was outstanding. The food was delicious. The decor was comfortable and inviting. I would definitely return. Very convenient to the convention center.

I have now eaten at Michelada s twice and I m here to tell you it is great.  It s also way under priced for the quality of food served.  I m a bit of a restaurant snob  but not in a bad way  I just know high quality food.  I can tell the difference between fresh  amp  homemade and something out of a can.  And this place is fresh - and seriously good.    I read the other reviews and was really surprised by the one star review that commented on how the salsa was  watery  and the food tasted  boiled and bland .  Makes me wonder if we went to the same place.  The salsa is fantastic.  You can see and taste all the individual ingredients as just that  individual ingredients.  It s not a homogenous brown soup that s been sitting since 5 a.m..  The same quality is evident in the guacamole  which they make up fresh at your table according to your wishes.  Oh and the tortillas are not out of a pack  they re the real deal.  Everything I ve had was loaded with flavor and there are a lot of really nice surprises if you ve grown a little weary of the same Austin Tex-Mex every night.  I eat LOTS of Tex Mex and Interior Mexican cuisine.  We eat regularly at Curra s South  Serranos  amp  Julio s  I have also eaten at Fonda San Miguel  Chapala  Manuel s  Maria s  Enchiladas Y Mas....I could go on all night with Mexican restaurants across the quality spectrum.  The quality of food here is on par with Fonda San Miguel - the prices are on par with Enchiladas Y Mas.  It s a bargain.     My favorite entree so far is the shrimp taco.  The street corn is really good too and has a lot of complexity in the flavor  going from tangy at first taste  to slightly cheesy  Queso fresco     to slightly barbecuey and then you get some fire in the after taste.  Really Good stuff.   Shared a Mexican Martini my first trip in and it was good too.  Plenty of alchohol  but not so much you couldn t drink it  and most importantly  not loaded up with cheap  sweet syrupy mixer.  The only downside I can see is you can t park two steps from the door.  It s downtown across from Fleming s and the convention center.  We park in a public garage about 1 2 a block away.  It was  5 to park on a weekend night and free on a Wednesday.  With the price of the food as low as it is though  the extra  5 is nothing.

Really like this place. Tried the Mexican Martini  it has a bit too much OJ but otherwise its good. My partner had the jalapeno poppers and said they were EXTRA spicy since the seeds werent removed. I only had the queso and focused more on drinking since it was Happy Hour. I also tried the house margarita which was good. It was rather warm inside for some reason and there is construction going on but it doesnt affect anything as we walked since our hotel was 2 blocks away. I will return here every time I stay in Austin no doubt.

I was really excited to try this place. However  when we first walked in we felt very unwelcome. We immediately were told there were only two servers for a Saturday night and we arrived at 7 30pm. They said it would be a 25 minute wait. We decided to wait anyways  about 5 minutes later we were seated. This made me think that they originally were just trying to get us to leave. The waiter was very attentive  but the food was just okay. I had the chicken tacos and they weren t anything special. No seasoning at all. I give it a two because of our waiter  he was great but other than that  it wasn t worth it.

Meh...  Our dinner started off on a bad foot when our when our waiter complained about being tired and wanting to go home.  Surprising since there was only four tables in the main dining room including us  and it was still early. . Margarita on the rocks tasted like a mix despite the description indicating otherwise .  Salsa was the best part of the meal.  Oh well   we won t be back.

OK Guys.  This place came highly recommended.  And maybe they were having a very bad day.  But my office group reserved a big table several weeks in advance  and confirmed the reservation the day before.  We got there at noon on a Wednesday - they do have a table for us  but apparently that s all.  After 25 minutes someone came to take drink orders - we all ordered water  which took another 15 minutes.  They were slow to take our doers and very oblique as to why it was all taking so long.  Anyway  I had to leave after 2 hours - never having received my meal.  My compatriots brought my order to me at work and I ate for dinner that night.  Can t really judge the food  but because of the slowness I won t be going back.
The only good thing about my food was the fajitas the rice was hard the beans tasted old they gave me corn tortillas instead of flour and my girls soup was cold it was bad
although it took them a while to seat our large group in a nearly empty restaurant the food was worth the wait. The pork chop was AMAZING

I m not sure why people are hating below. Most likely they are the angry types with personal problems and giving negative reviews get s them off. Glad I am not wired that way....  I went here on Saturday night for dinner with a party of 8 and everyone enjoyed their dinner. I was able to visit with the owners and get a little insight. This is a brand new restaurant and they never did a soft opening so they are still training the staff. AND EVERYTHING WAS TASTY  WHICH IS IMPRESSIVE IN MY OPINION     Most of our table tried a few differnt types of tacos with nothing but positive feedback. I had the fajitas which is my way of judging a mexican restaurant. Beef was juicy and tender  refried black beans were really good  too.  Things are looking up...  I actually thought the drink prices were pretty reasonable for the area  you are drinking downtown  cheap-o s  this is not a cantina in San Marcos specializing in dollar beers   strong  and were not oversweet like a lot of places. Oh and those ballers on a budget  they are serving brunch on the weekends with two dollar mimosas.  The deck upstairs is amazing and will be one of my spots for happy hour whether I am with friends or colleagues from work.  Once they are fully up and running  I can see this place win a five star review. Exceptional atmosphere  food  drinks  just working out the training kinks   Please do disregard the bad reviews and check it out

Group of 5 coworkers came here for lunch today.  Food was cheap - but you get what you pay for.  VERY small serving sizes.  The kitchen put the wrong beans on the wrong platter  so we had to play switcharoo.  The server  Barry  appeared upset we didn t order alcoholic beverages during our work day  and it seemed that it was too much trouble to get straws and limes for our water.  The server had a real problem with leaning over the table instead of walking around the table.  He pretty  much wrapped lime in a napkin and tossed it across the table to my boss for her water.  Is it really too much trouble to walk around the table   The coworker to my left handed him the menu around the back of my head so I wouldn t get smacked in the face  and that apparently irritated him  so he retaliated by refilling everyone s tea glass but hers.  Chips never got refilled.  He also dropped the cloth napkin he had tucked into his back pocket on the floor.  He walked over  picked it up  and put it back on his pocket.  Gross.  He wasn t that busy  so I don t understand his attitude.  This was my second time here and I won t go back.  I thought the first time I went and had bad service from the bartender that it was just a fluke.  Nope.  I guess the only reason they re in business is because they are downtown near the convention center.

Seriously over priced and not even good. I got chicken fajitas and they were rubbery and not worth  15  The  famous michelada  wasn t even a real michelada  It was just Bloody Mary mix and they put ice in it    I can t get over how expensive it is.

We had to wait a while before our order was taken. We ordered the chicken taco plate. The ingredients were pretty basic  but everything tested fresh and well cooked. I would come back just to try something else on the menu.
Amazing. Best queso I ve never made  Staff is wonderful  and the atmosphere is very relaxing. I truly enjoy everything about this place

To be fair we had a large group for a friend s birthday so when the wait staff took about 30 minutes to take our order and informed us they were overwhelmed we were understanding. Unfortunately when the food came out  half the group received it when the other half had almost finished. I gave an extra star after hearing from friends that their dishes tasted good but I ordered the steak fajitas and after eating one had not one but 5 different people try it and the consensus was a sour face and a   what is that   comment. So overall recommendation is do not go with a large group and do not get the fajitas

Service and food were amazing. Felt really well taken care of. Plus  delicious free queso on check in  Will definitely be back to try some of the other menu items. Had the mixed fajitas and they were AMAZING. So much food.
Staff and service were great   Food was awesome as well. I ve worked downtown for a couple of months now  and it was a great place to go after work for somewhere nice to hang out  and miss traffic.
Me and boys DollarSign and Garrett C. ate here for lunch. Huge boss sized tacos and spicy salsa  GG M8

was here last week and it was so good  The Queso and guac are to die for and  I will be thinking about them until I return. The pork chop plate was amazing and I think it might have been designed just for me  Great service and our server was very nice and friendly. Will definitely be back and enjoy that patio when it is cooler  Thanks for the queso

Wonderful recommendation from hotel staff. The tortilla soup was fabulous  My dad said his Mexican Benedict was the best Benedict he has ever had  and the carnitas was the best I have ever had. Soooo good

Welcome to the neighborhood Meech.  So I ve been waiting for this place to open for a while now  I work around the corner and always noticed the what seemed to be  awesome rooftop patio.  But now it finally has opened so me and my co-worker went in after work.  We just sat at the bar to find out what was going on with the place  the place just opened so we were nt expecting 5 star service or anything like that.  The bartender told us about there happy hour and future plans for it.  We just went with the michelada and their margarita.  Both were made with an in house recipe that you could tell was right on.  We then got a couple tacos  I got a shredded chicken taco for  3.50  and my friend got the pork belly taco  I never was a fan of pork belly  but my friend liked it and he said it was pretty amazing.  Definately a good size taco and did the trick for me.  The decor was well done and the open door windows flow from the entrance all the way to the back deck.  Huge tvs were behind the bar  I guess i would tell my boyfriend to come in there for a game and cheap drinks if he wanted to wait for me to get off work one day.  The bartender kept telling us about their upcoming huge grand opening party on the patio  he took us up there to show it off  it looked pretty cool  3 more bars  more tvs  and a nice view of the downtown skyline  definately will be going back when that opens.  So I liked them on facebook to get the invite for it  cant wait.  The good thing also is they do industry service discount  so we get 20  off everytime we go.  That I can live with  we will definately be back with more friends.

Tired of the run of the mill Tex-Mex  Looking for great  handmade margaritas  Then this place is perfect. The salsa was fresh  chunky and full of flavor. My market fresh fish tacos  snapper that day  were great  and big   Everything tasted fresh  with a hint of heat. The interior of the restaurant was festive  and the waitstaff quick and friendly. They ve only been open less than four months  November 23rd  I think our server said  so be weary of poor reviews written on 12 1  They ve really gotten the menu down.

I reallllly love this place and the queso is awesome   The ONLY reason I m giving a 4 is because I was a little upset the online prices are not correct.  So getting the bill when I called to order for a pick up  was quite a surprise  since I had an estimated total in mind.  When I asked the GM Robert about it  he was more than helpful and fixed the problem.  Still love this place
Expected way more from this place.  They have great atmosphere and location  and then they serve you the worst tasting Margaitas in Austin  food is just ok would not go back.
Still the best tacos in Austin and they just changed their flour tortillas to house-made  even better.   Open every day for breakfast and lunch.

Great breakfast tacos  amp  service. I come here regularly  amp  enjoy the picadillo tacos especially... As well as their crunchy beef taco plate- the shells are next level crispy   Love the spicy salsa  amp  chilaquiles Verdes as well.  Consistent  local  amp  tasty  so I will keep on coming back

This little joint is located in a strip plaza off of South Congress. Their menu includes breakfast and lunch options. They do serve beer and margaritas  we were there for breakfast  so we stuck with coffee . We ordered the Juevos a la Mexicana and the Migas Especiales with chorizo. Both were fantastic. They were served with tortillas and salsa. Everyone who worked there was friendly and accommodating. It was a very inexpensive and satiating meal. Definitely a  no frills  spot  which is always nice.

The tacos here are good  we use to get them when we were kids so it s sort of nostalgic for me.  With this said their queso game is unfortunately poor at best. First of all 6  for this little cup and for some reason the cheese sauce looks separated  and the taste is of something I melted in the microwave as a after school snack.  Just not great or good.  Tacos are great  Queso not so much.

All the food here is so yummy    I m a fan of the vegetarian plate and the al pastor tacos  I know  I m complicated . Ask for a little verde salsa for your chips because it s awesome.  The waitstaff is friendly but can be a little frantic when it gets busy. I love that I can walk here from my house and that it is near the park.  I ve taken stuff to go and ate in the park  on a swing  like a child. Try it.   The salsa is some of the best in town and the iced tea I would like to inject directly into my veins. This is a common lunch spot for us.
I really enjoy the food and good costumer service  I like the authentic Mexican food And that it s not Tex-Mex..finally I found a good place to be a regular.
i recommend  very scrumptious i like their burritos and quesadillas quite a bit and they have big red  best drink ever
love this spot  will drive in from Buda bc it s one of the best Mexican restaurants in the south Austin area in my opinion. Everything here tastes great

2 stars just because the tacos are really good  However  customer service   Piss poor. Yesterday 2 20 was my first time trying these tacos and they were good and took like 5 min tops. So today  2 21 when my coworkers said they wanted breakfast tacos  I suggested San Juanita s.   My coworker called to place our order and afterwards said the person was rude.   I personally went to pick up the tacos order and I can attest to the other reviews about their rudeness. Specifically the short rounder lady with short hair and wearing red.   I walk in   not greeted  . I stand at the counter and ignored for a few months. I tell her that my coworker called in an order. She tells me it s not ready yet. I stand there because I would assume she would want to take payment. I asked   okay  do I pay  instead of being polite about it  she bluntly states   I ll call you when it s ready  . I tried to say again that I can pay . She says   I ll call you when it s ready  ... okay. I ll sit down and wait.  I kid you NOT  I sit down and 45 seconds later she rings it up and tells me the total... after I just stood there trying to pay  she lets me sits down and immediately after tells me to pay     Like granted it s just a few steps  why couldn t you do that 1 min ago     Not a single smile on this lady s face  como una bruja  I sign the receipt and not tip. She looks at it and throws it in the trash and literally gives me dirty looks all the way until I m in my car.   No way am I going there. There are seriously 30 other places in a 5 mile radius where I can get tacos
Literally best breakfast tacos ever. And the salsa is better than good definitely a 10 out of a 10. They sale the salsa too so definitely recommend taking some home

I ordered the shrimp tacos and they were tasteless. The tortillas weren t heated up so they fell apart and has no crisp what so ever. The rice was ice cold. I also used the bathroom which was filthy  They say a bathroom resembles a places kitchen and that really terrifies me especially with this corona virus. The toilet didn t even flush  and it has brown stuff all over it kinda like rust  There are so many taco places in Austin and this is by far the worst.

You d expect a down-to-earth establishment like this place to serve authentic cuisine at reasonable prices. Unfortunately  the average-priced food is simply underwhelming  and the service is highly suspicious  bordering on racial profiling.   Food  The breakfast tacos were wholly unremarkable  tiny-but-decent-enough tortillas  exceedingly bland fillings at anemic portion sizes  we ordered egg bean  egg ham cheese  and egg ham   and just one completely flavorless salsa available.  Service  Our server brought us a check that included items we didn t order. The total was  5 more than our actual bill  but fortunately we reviewed the list and caught the error before paying. When confronted  the staff said it was an accident and gave us a corrected bill. I found this to be highly suspicious because my table was one of only three tables at the time of service  and were the only group which did not appear to be Hispanic.  This city is rife with taco joints  so I find it unbelievable that this place is still in business. Save your money and time  and skip this place.

I am tempted to not share how much I loved this place  but I guess that s not fair to the greater Yelping good. A friend recommended the breakfast tacos here  so I stopped by the nondescript location in a gas station strip mall parking lot and was blown away. SUCH flavorful bites in warm  amazing breakfast tacos. Poblano peppers  potatoes  eggs  chorizo...simmered in sauce and love. The servers were very friendly and helpful and the food came out fast.  Sit there or call ahead and take to go. Limited parking in the lot  it fills up fast  people love this place .

LOVE this place  My go to place for breakfast tacos  Always so fast. I got the migas a few weeks ago and have been craving them  The ranchero sauce is AMAZING and the meal it s self is authentic. The staff is also my favorite  Keep up the good work.

Boom  Best Mexican breakfast in S. Austin.  I love the Migas here. I get the Migas especial which includes traditional Migas with choice of meat  the chorizo or sausage are my favorites. It includes tortillas  potatoes that are perfectly seasoned and cooked and refried beans. The red salsa  sauce is amazing and flavorful. Total price less than 8 bucks and you will be full until dinner.  Friendly attentive staff. A great place to try if you haven t been.  Plenty of parking in the rear if the front is full.
I love this place  Great food  Friendly  efficient service  Best Picadillo tacos  I ve been loyal since 1996  and they have as well  concerning their menu and service.

Wow  I was very impressed with this place.  When we decided to go out to breakfast with my daughter and her friend I couldn t figure out why she wanted to go someplace so far away when there are so many places closer. After we got our food I could certainly see why. It was absolutely delicious  reasonable prices  good portion  great service. It was really hard for me to not get Migas because that s my favorite breakfast whenever I come to Austin for a visit but I saw that they had Nopalitos on the menu so I couldn t resist and I wasn t sorry. It s pretty hard to make beans distinctively good but somehow this place does it. I just kept eating those beans until they were all gone. In fact I don t think I had any leftovers at all but my daughter gave me hers since she figured she was going to be too busy wrapping up the school year to have time for leftovers. I enjoyed them the next day. There are many good places to choose from in Austin but I hope I get back to this one another time while I am in town.

Very boyfriend and I come here every week for breakfast  Their tacos are super yummy and they have great prices  I m surprised by the reviews that say poor customer service  because even since the first time I ve been impressed by how great their customer service is  I love love love this place and look forward to coming here every week. Since moving to Austin it s my favorite taco spot. If you re looking for authenticity and delicious food  come here  You can t go wrong here.

You ll find us at San Juanita s at least once a week. The food is plentiful  delicious  and the ranchero sauce is out of this world. The thing that brings us back is the staff though. The service is attentive without being intrusive. After just few visits the team knew us and our drink orders. They get really busy on the weekend so we try to get there by 9am. They are not open for dinner  breakfast and lunch only. I really love that it is always a diverse crowd.

First visit at restaurant ...ordered beef enchiladas and crispy beef taco plate  1 on lunch menu...very good and generous portion of beef filled enchiladas and taco...probably best ground beef in a mexican restaurant in some time..very flavorful...could have had more chili gravy and cheese...crispy taco wasn t saturated by beef grease and didn t fall apart. Salsa bowl was small but salsa had some heat which is somewhat unusual...some places have to cater to yankee gringos so as not upset their sensitive palates...All in all was a good meal...wish they d offer some better tortilla chips...

Delicious. I got a barbacoa taco and the meat was so tasty  a lot for a little taco  and not greasy at all. Same with the spinach and egg taco - they used fresh  not frozen  spinach - a nice touch.  Variety. There were a lot of different dishes available. I found this to be a pleasant surprise especially for a smaller place.  Chips. They were a little meh  but the sauce was definitely a very nice flavor - not vinegar-y at all.  Overall  a good find.

Best greasy spoon taco shop I ve been to. The prices are right  the food is fresh and the service is warm and friendly. The moment you walk in  the amazing smell of meats  toasted corn and spices envelop your senses. The dining room is cheery and colorful and kinda feels like a family breaskfast room. A must stop whenever I m in the Austin area.

This place took way to long to bring our tacos  Then when we finally did get our tacos they weren t what we asked for  Mind you the place isn t even busy  If you want good Mexican food this place is definitely NOT THE PLACE TO GO TO

Too bad this place is so far south. I live in north Austin but drive down to San Juanitas 3-4 times a month. I ve only eaten their breakfast tacos and they are very good. Other items on the menu look good  too. Good prices and good food. I ll try something different at some point  but until then I ll keep making the long trek south for the breakfast tacos.

Amazing customer service. Food is always fresh and the breakfast tacos are to die for  I would recommend the bacon  egg  bean and cheese  I ve been eating here for the past 20 years and the tacos have constantly tasted great  if your looking for a breakfast spot in South Austin I would highly recommend
Great spot for breakfast or lunch. There micheladas are pretty good as well. Definitely recommend this place.
Great early morning and lunch spot    WONDERFUL service - Marisela - totally delightful
good food for good prices  and they always play good music.  Sometimes they give out free cake on holidays    mmm que rico
BEST TACOS EVER   Big  tasty  cheap. The line is long but it moves fast and the service is great. 10 10 recommend
Excellent  Had the migas breakfast tacos  flavorful  delicious salsa  very tasty  We were looking for a quick bite in the neighborhood  and this was a great random stop in. Great service too.
BEST migas breakfast I ve had in Texas    There s nothing else to say. Can t wait to come back to Austin and eat here again.

I usually have a good experience here. I don t recall names  but I like it here. Reasonable prices  good customer service  and good food. I am well aware of the hours  demand  busyness of the breakfast traffic  and cooking time. I ve been trying to call in an order for more then 20 minutes. Sometimes the call is busy and sometimes it rings and rings and rings and rings. This happens quite a bit when I call in.   I have great customer service when I go in and sit down. The to go orders is what gets me. I ve seen it when it has been busy  i see that the employees work hard. They even answer the phone when they are checking someone out on the register. So I m little discombobulated why this phone call thing is an issue.  Taking in a to go order takes less then a minute.  I am okay with waiting for the food. I am frustrated that the phone hasn t been answered. Calling in an order is very convenient for me in the mornings. Again  I am usually very satisfied here. I ll be taking my business elsewhere this morning.
Tried several breakfast tacos. Great flour tortilla and really good fillings. The salsa was really good too. Super friendly staff. Worth a visit when you crave a tasty quick bite.
The ground beef looked and tasted like something over than beef. It had the texture of canned dog food. The staff was rude  and I will never go again.

This place is great. It s very simple  straightforward Mexican. My husband and I ordered the migas  queso  and lemonade. The migas were really good. Very authentic migas  i.e. not drowning in sauce and queso. The queso was the yellow kind. Very tasty  but super liquidy. The lemonade was awesome. They make it fresh  and it had the perfect balance of sweet and tart. Great service too.
The best breakfast tacos . Potato   egg   amp  white cheese on corn tortilla is my favorite . Oh and the hot sauce that comes with it  is so spicy  good

I love this place so much  Such genuine  friendly people  The food is always fresh and tasty  and their barbacoa and chorizo are the best in town  lots of flavor  moist but not greasy . Feels so good to support a local family business

Best tacos I ve ever eaten  and I ve eaten LOTS of them across Austin over the past 33 years .  The Gringa and Grilled Fajita tacos are to die for.  If I m on death-row and have a final meal request  San Juanita s tacos will be on my list
Their barbacoa and egg taco is one of the best tacos in town. The service is fast and friendly  and I just love this place.

Visiting Austin we were lucky to find this place for breakfast.  We both had wonderful filling meals of eggs with..... stuff.   I m not sure what I ate  but the eggs were provided on a bed of tortilla chips soaked in sauce.   Beans  avocado and more.   The waitress was helpful in choosing our meals.   The restaurant was clean and bright.   I feel lucky to have found it.

I had the breakfast tacos here. Ordered the sausage  potato  and egg. Solid    Terribly hot inside. I felt like I was cooking and not the food.   Also  cleanliness doesn t seem like a priority because it s pretty dirty. I m not sure how I feel about coming back due to the cleanliness issue.   They do have other breakfast options if breakfast tacos are not your thing.
Best breakfast tacos  EVER   Best local joint in the south Austin area to order ahead and swing by to pick up breakfast tacos.

Went here for lunch because of the ratings and the fact that it was right down the street from the seminar I am at.  I have a rule about ethnic food.  If there is no one of that particular ethnicity at that restaurant.  I become suspicious.  I was the only white person in the restaurant when I went in.  This built my confidence.  The server was fast and friendly  which was good because I was on a bit of a time crunch.  The only reason I m docking this restaurant at all is because the salsa was a little over pur ed.  I m not a fan of chunky salsa  but I also don t care for liquid.  Aside from that the flavor was good  and it had solid spice. I ordered the crispy chicken taco plate  because I figured it would come out fast.  I wasn t wrong.  The service was fast  the food was hot and the tacos were excellent.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  Also the price for 3 tacos was more than reasonable.  I left a big tip  and now a good review.  This place is worth a visit.

Love the brisket and rice tacos  Pretty much all the breakfast tacos are really good and the main reason why we come here for breakfast multiple times a week.   Tortillas are not fresh but the food itself makes up for it. Salsa is really spicy but good if you can handle it.   Oh and make sure you sit by the AC if you want to eat comfortably.  Its really hot in there otherwise

This place is upsetting... I ordered 2 bean and cheese tacos with napales and my total came out to 6.80  Talk about jacked up prices... They then tried to charge me a dollar for cilantro and onions... Bringing the total up even more... I was mind blown since these tacos aren t even that great... The tortilla was soggy  the women were rude when I told the I didn t want to pay a dollar for cilantro and onions  2 of the cheapest things at the grocery store ... Seriously though... Almost 7 dollars for 2 half assed bean and cheese tacos with cactus is a complete joke. I m never going back... There are better tacos for better prices almost anywhere else nearby. Chapala or Casa Maria... Well pretty much anywhere but this place.

We went for breakfast.  Ordered the chips and salsa  coffee  water  and two menus as soon as we arrived.  Did the waitress tell us that the chips and salsa cost  2.50 before 11 am   Nooooooo.  Service was slow  coffee was cold  and chips and salsa weren t that good.  We ordered the Migas Especiales with beef fajita meat.  Reviews made it sounds really good.  Noooooo.  Not much egg  most chips  sauce  and overcooked veggies.  And instead of putting the fajita meat on the side it was chopped up and put in the migas.  If it had any flavor before that  it lost it in the cooking of the eggs.  Second round of coffee arrived  and at least it was hot.  All in all  I m not sure why people say this place is great.  I found it to be barely acceptable.

Extremely unprofessional  I went in there to pick up an order. She said that she did not have an order in that name and started to help the next customer. Horrible customer service  When I asked if someone else was going to take my order because I was there before that customer she said no and told me to leave  I will never go here again and will make sure everyone knows how rude they are

We live nearby so we are at this place every weekend  but I d probably drive to get these tacos even if we weren t close. The service is casual and very friendly  coffee is decent  and the tacos are on point. My go-to is the beef fajita with nopalitos or the migas especiales. The potatoes and beans that come with the breakfast plates are great.   When it s busy the tacos are very good  when it s slow the tacos are GREAT. The salsa has a nice kick and the food is never undersalted or bland. We always take visitors from out of town here because it has a great atmosphere and is very consistent. We don t bother with  brunch  places anymore when we can just go to San Juanita s. The younger guy that always waits on us is very sweet and often remembers our order. Even when we move  this place will always be a great memory for us. We have a large group of friends in the neighborhood and this is our version of Monk s from Seinfeld. Great spot
Super sad as I drove up the place was closed. Luckily  they only moved and they didn t close down    They are now at 4406 S. Congress. I love their breakfast tacos  Soooo good

We love this place and we ve been eating here or getting take out for many years. Their new location is the nicest yet. The hot sauce is addictive. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is the friendliest you re find.

Been here about 4 times now for breakfast.  Service is friendly and prompt.  The food is good and generous portions  they use real eggs and fresh nopales.  The salsa they bring with the meal tastes fresh and mild heat. The tortillas are store bought and steamed or micro-waved not griddled. Soda is by the can  no refills.  Coffee is weak.  Hot chocolate is good.   This time around our booth had food on it  not clean and the salt and pepper shakers were disgusting.

Only been for breakfast.  They have a bigger selection at breakfast than most places.  They offer beef fajita and egg so that is a winner for me as I do not eat pork.  So getting the offer of beef at breakfast is all the better.
Moved out of my hood 11 years ago and still come back to San Juanita s. They have one of the best Fajita with beans  jalape o and onion taco  THE BEST
I love the service here firs time and John was great great food great atmosphere  and good prices
Amazing food  fantastic service   I always call ahead  and the order is always correct and delicious   This is the Enchiladas lunch special  no veggies. Fantastic
I had been going here for years but the last time I visted the customer service was unbelievably horrible. They lost my business forever  I will never step foot in that facility.

I ve only had their breakfast tacos and they are Y U M M Y  I ve ordered the chicken fajita tacos which are to die for  bean and cheese taco which is good  and egg  cheese  and potato. They sure do over do it with the eggs on these tacos. They put mountains of eggs on the tacos and only small amounts of potato or meat. But they are still good. Wish they had more sauce other than red. They should look into getting green sauce. Service is OK. The Mexican chick at the counter can be pretty short sometimes. Like I went in today and bought a couple of chicken fajita tacos. When it was done she just flopped the bag on the counter and turned away. The other lady doesn t even speak English of course but she s nice. I plan on going back for their lunch menu and trying some enchiladas some time soon.

I ve been eating breakfast tacos from San Jaunitas for almost 20 years now  They have the best breakfast in south Austin  To be honest I ve never eaten lunch or dinner there just breakfast  Even my wife of 3 years who moved from Leander to south Austin loves the breakfast .....reminds her of her mother s
Best barbacoa ever  Coffee is very good. Waitstaff is ok. Ordered a menudo to go I ll let ya know.

if you want fresh tacos and hearty quesadillas  with the power to mend broken hearts  cure hangovers  and soothe any cravings of the stomach and soul  this is the place for you. the service was wonderful  the flavors were fresh  the portions were just goldilocks right and there s plenty of parking in this complex  the breakfast tacos were soft and warm and fresh and i added poblano peppers on  got the chicken quesadilla with a side of guac. highly recommend the tacos - we ate them faster than you can say guacamole.

Vegetarian-friendly  reasonably priced  served by friendly and helpful staff.   We went for breakfast on a Saturday morning. The server was friendly and helpful. The salsa was yummy. Between the two of us  my husband and I tried these tacos  migas  ranchero potatoes  nopalitos and spinach  amp  mushroom. They were all excellent and well seasoned. Coffee was perfectly adequate. The servers all help lookout for each other s tables so drinks stay full. I would definitely go back.    The address on Google listed the 5000 block of S Congress but it s actually 4619 S Congress  in a strip center on the corner of S Congress and Sheraton.

We drive by this place all the time - it s on the southeast corner of Stassney and Congress.  The exterior yellow paint looks like it used to be sunshine bright  but has now faded with time.  It appears to be a tiny shack  a step up from a taco stand.  We d always say   One day we ll go to San Juanita - before it gets replaced by an Office Depot.   And so we did.  Upon walking in  we knew we were somewhere special.  It was a bit larger on the inside than appeared from the outside.  The floors were concrete  the tables were covered in colorful oilcloths  and the TV was blasting terrible Saturday morning Mexican game shows - you know  with scantily-clad women doused in foamy soap.  Although most of the customers appeared to be Mexican families from the neighborhood  there was still a diverse clientele.   The menu explained that San Juanita has always been family owned and that the daughters who work there will get to know your name and what you like to order.  It s true - Paloma took our order  and she made us feel as if we were welcomed guests in her home.  The menu was none too exciting - standard tacos  enchiladas  and gorditas  they do serve menudo on Saturdays .  To try one of the more exotic things on the menu  I had the carne guisada - the rice was cooked to perfection  the refried beans were flavorful  but the meat was a bit tough.    I ll go back there  not so much for the food  but for the genuine  family-owned atmosphere.  And the game shows on the TV.   Just kidding.   p.s. they do take MC and Visa.
