Out of curiosity  I braved San Juanita  the post-apocalyptic  Spahn Ranch-esque shanty of a place on S. Congress Stassney   thinking there must be a hidden gem in there. No place this scary looking could stay open unless there is something special going on. Well  there isn t  unless it s something I don t know about. Human trafficking  Meth lab  I watch too much Breaking Bad. Anyway  the whole place smells like burned fish--and everything tastes like it  too. Nothing seemed clean. My salsa bowl had crust on it. The salsa was from a can. My glass had a lip imprint on the rim. I half expected a goat to come wandering through the dining room. I played it safe and got crispy tacos  and if they hadn t already absorbed the burned fish bouquet  I would still say they were the worst I have ever had. This is what Tex Mex tastes like in hell.  I did it so you won t have to. Believe me  it s a gift.

Nopalito tacos  No bueno. Migas  I wanted them to be good. I really did. Barbacoa  guess not EVERYONE includes onions and cilantro. My taco looked like a turd in a tortilla.   The service was friendly and fast and the prices were fair.   It s not too easy to elaborate on.   I do think I ll buy tires while waiting on my next taco. Maybe I just got an off day.
Great Austin icon to grab some good food. Really good Menudo. Now located at  4406 S. Congress Ave.  443-9308 M-Sat  6AM--3PM Sun  8AM--3PM

Crap food..  I live nearby and used to go to Villa Mexico all the time. This place I have tried several times. Breakfast tacos soggy potatoes.  Lunch- ask for carne asada  amp  get beef brisket with again soggy potatoes. Dinner-beef enchiladas red sauce nasty super dry bean and rice...  Again each time food is crap... Don t bother..

San Juanita s  You get 5 stars for being awesome. Having awesome food and for always being open on my way to work for a breakfast stop.   They are open normally from 6am-3pm. They use to have a location in Kyle  TX however not anymore.  I love their taco s I have yet to get a breakfast or lunch plate.  They are very reasonably priced  and I think everyone should at least try them once.   Very friendly staff and their new location is a lot better and more seating.   Now  go get you sum .

Spent a year in south Austin and recently moved to another part of town  and San Juanita will easily be the south-side restaurant I miss the most.  This place is so very much the real deal . Co-located in a state inspection   body shop  the building is covered with ridiculous lo-fi murals - I can t decide if the frog strangling the crane  the arm-less woman in front of Niagra falls  or the Butt-Head-style rendering of Willie Nelson is my favorite.  Charming servers bring you luscious staples -- Huevos Divoricados is my favorite  complete with a large slice of candied ham. The guisada lunch special  or the adobo pork ... both have a special place in my memory. Right up there with the cacophonous Mariachi band that graced the place on Mother s Day   Great place  I look forward to visiting again when I have occasion to be down south.
Called in the order beforehand since we were in a huge rush really early in the morning. Waited a few more minutes once I arrived. Cheap tacos  pretty good.

First time  great place   We had take out delicious breakfast tacos  Nopalitos  chorizo  potatoes with eggs  pancakes  and French toast. The food tasted the way my mother made it.  Good friendly fast service  good food portions  reasonable prices  clean well lit eating area. One can see this is a family friendly place  the place was packed with a stead line of people picking up food.  I live near by and now I can see why the parking lot is always full. Only problem I have is they are open Monday - Saturday 6 - 3 pm  Sunday 8 - 3pm and I work till 5 week days  but I will find away to stop by on weekend to try out the other dished. Second time doing a review  wish the owner and her group a long good future.

We were looking for a good breakfast place. He wanted pancakes and I wanted a good breakfast regardless of where what. Yelp showed hill cafe had 3 stars and I trust us yelpers so I saw San Juanita s had a better rating and we opted for more stars than pancakes. Guess what  Juanita s had pancakes and french toast   We were happy about that. So I ordered the Mexican taco and poblano taco with a side of French toast and he order a couple tacos and pancakes. We were pleasantly surprised at how good all of our food was. And the salsa was really good too.

Great place to stop in for reasonably priced breakfast tacos  2 for around  4 . The lady at the front was very nice and I got my tacos in minutes. The migas and bacon egg were very good. Just wish the salsa was a bit spicier and that the tortillas were homemade. Can t wait to come back and try more tacos
Meh. Decent pastor  soggy migas  bad coffee  watery queso.. Not terrible  but I wouldn t go back. They should probably invest in central AC.
The BEST place for authentic breakfast tacos. Get the chorizo with egg and potato - you won t regret it.
The wait staff is always very welcoming and happy to serve. The barbacoa tacos and coffee  are the best  Excellent breakfast place
By FAR the best breakfast tacos in Austin. I drive from Georgetown every Sunday just for these tacos they are THAT good.

San Juanitas is amazing. They have the best breakfast tacos in Austin  I never have a bad experience. Staff are nice. Tacos are fantastic and its just an all in all good place. Family owned and operated.
This place is horrible. The food is gross. Been there once and will never go back. Horrible service too

I ve been coming here for years and they never fail to serve only the best. I often get breakfast tacos for my employees and they love knowing the tacos are coming from sanjuanitas. Plus the service is amazing. I m always greeted with a smile and my coffee never runs low.

I love San Juanitas   I always get the bacon  egg  and cheese. They aren t incredibly friendly but that s not a big issue for me and the lady at the front is usually pretty busy.   I recommend calling in your order ahead of time and they re usually ready in 10 mins. The food is great  the salsa is nice and hot  and prices are low. I just wish they were open later.

I too have drove by this place an uncountable number of times without stopping. I love little hole in the wall mexican restaurants. My husband on the hand who btw is mexican thinks they re dirty and I m just a strange white girl who likes going into these places. However we went to San Juanitas and it even got his approval  In fact I can t even mention their brisket  amp  rice tacos without him insisting we go get like 6 of them  They are delish  They consider them spicy on the menu  but you can handle it  I ve also had there enchiladas also delish  So next time you re craving some wonderful greasy tacos head down to San Juanitas  the little yellow building next to the old tire store. Call ahead if you d like to indulge at your home.

Excellent breakfast tacos. I usually get the potato  egg and chorizo but my dining companions have been equally pleased with their selections. What really makes it is the salsa  though  which is both spicy and flavorful.  I get sick of glorified tomato sauce.
I went to this restaurant for breakfast and had some really good Chiliquiles  Not as good as back home but still some really good ones  Will be back again if I am in the neighborhood

I lived in Austin a few years back and this place was the bomb.  It has changed a little over the years still a hole in the wall.  The hot sauce is the bomb  They also scramble the eggs together with the  bacon and potatoes on the breakfast burritos.  Stop by every time I am in Austin.

San Juanitas is delicious  Their old little shack was demolished and they moved a little North on Congress  just past Hills. Their breakfast tacos are great and always make Sunday mornings easier  I have been eating here for two years and don t plan on changing that anytime soon  Yum FYI  They only take credit cards for orders over either  5 or  10

These tacos are unreal. And so reasonably price. Customer service could be improved  but they are always so slammed  I understand why it s hard to build a personal relationship with your to go guests. I also wish they were open later.

San Juanita get s 4 stars only because they do not have agua frescas but they have everything else  good flavor  decent price  clean  bilingual  fast service  and quality sized tacos.  Beans are on point   The enchiladas are worth a try and will not disappoint but if you are looking for a good breakfast taco than look no further.  Tacos we have ordered at San Juanita  fajita and bean  napales and bean  chorizo bean and bacon  brisket and bean tacos.  We have been eating at San Juanitas for a little over 3 years now.  Worth a try if you are ever in south Austin.  Come early because unfortunately they close at 3 p.m. everyday.

Good and CHEAP   I live right around the corner and I go here a lot. The migas here sooooo good. They re full of not just eggs  cheese  and chips but peppers and jalapenos and I like to mix a little of the beans in there. Breakfast tacos are very good. Tortillas are soft  not stale like some taco joints by my job that shall remain nameless. Barbacoa was very tender  egg n bacon taco is always outstanding  and the salsa is great. Some folks say the salsa is inconsistent here and I will agree with that but in a good way. I kinda like that some days it s garlic-y and some days more spicy  if it s different all the time then to me that means they re churning out fresh batches all the time. I don t eat manudo my brain can t get behind the idea of tripe  but my Dad loves it at San Juanita s they make it fresh every Sunday and when he gets it I usually have some of the broth because it s so good. My ONLY complaint  and I hate to do it because I love these girls that work here they re friendly  they tolerate my flirting  and they re bilingual for my non-espanol speaking puerto rican ass  but OMG this place needs help with the coffee. It s ditch water coffee. It s baaaad. HOWEVER  I do live around the corner just a 5 min walk so the ladies always let me bring my home made cafe con leche in here to drink with my own mug. I think they know how bad the coffee is lol. Other than that it s a great place with awesome tacos that are really cheap.
I may not know authentic mexican  but I know GOOD and this place has some good food
Called ahead for a large  short notice taco order and they had it done in 20 minutes. Tacos were delicious and saved me so much time

Love it  I just moved here from Boston and after hearing from many people and reading other people s reviews of this place I had to try it out. First thing I tried were the lunch tacos with guacamole and they were amazing. I tried the breakfast tacos another day and they were the best around  Since I moved here I have tried as many breakfast tacos as I could and so far they have the best   I got the migas and the barbacoa tacos. If anyone is looking for an amazing tacos look no further then San Juanita s
Great place for lunch and cheap  Tacos are filling and the service is fast.
one of my favorites places  lenque  rice and  brisket  carne g tacos

This little shack is right by my apartment and I always go there the morning after a long night of drinking.  I really like the breakfast tacos  but I have found them to be extremely inconsistent. Their salsa  is hot sometimes  and then extremely mild and bland sometimes.  The people there are extremely friendly and I would suggest going their if you live close and want breakfast tacos.

Was in the area so tried some breakfast tacos. They were fine but not good enough to make me go back. Had the migas taco and the mashed potato cheese taco. Both were okay as was the  Salsa.  Too many better places around for me to give anything more than 3 stars.

Visited Ma Coco on a cloudy Wednesday for ladies happy hour and I absolutely loved it  The only reason I m not giving it five stars is because the food was a bit cold once it reached our table. However  all the food  including the three different salsas  the chips  the burrito  and the cocktails were all freakin delicious  I ll definitely be going back with friends for a HH dinner situation.  First  I love the SoCal aesthetic and menu - nothing like a bomb burrito filled with French fries and guac. Yummm. Those are definitely difficult to find in Austin. In fact  I don t think most people know what they are  or care lol . However  it is a bit strange that this is street food served in a really neat manner   15 for the California burrito . This is all stuff I d grab from a food truck or taco stand. I know it sounds like I m complaining  but I m not lol. I m happy it exists  Especially when everything was tasty and flavorful. Just thrown off by this new wave of SoCal cuisine lmao.  Anyway  shout out to all the wonderful staff who made sure we were taken care of all evening - they were on top of it  See you soon  Ma Coco.

Came across this  hidden in plain site  restaurant last week. I had a short break and was not very hungry but wanted to try them out.   I ordered the Ahi Tuna Tostado. It was the most amazing thing I have tasted in quite a while. Generous slices of raw Ahi Tuna with avocado salsa and salsa negra on a crispy tortilla. Exquisitely good  So good I didn t take a photo till halfway through...  I had to go back again to try more the following day. I ordered the Emoladas. Chicken enchiladas smothered in a Mole sauce. The mole sauce was very tasty reminiscent of visits to interior Mexico. The shredded chicken was a little bland. I think this dish could be perfected if the chicken was tossed in mole sauce prior to being rolled into enchiladas. Mole inside and out.  I will be back to try more

So this was a very lack luster experience.. the ambience is nice but the food and drinks are underwhelming. We started with guacamole . It tasted flat which is interesting for guac  never knew that was possible  and they only gave us like a small scoop of it for  10.00. I ordered the surf and turf quesadilla... they didn t bother to crisp the outside at all and I ended up just eating the inside of the rubbery quesadilla. The inside consisted of mostly onions  but the potential was there.  Lastly I ordered the spicy watermelon margarita and it was mostly juice . Scratch that. I don t think they put any alcohol in the beverage.  As someone who frequents California  I would say skip this place because what you pay is not equivalent to the quality of the food   However.... Ma coco has potential to be a big hit if they put a lot more care into the dishes they prepare and serve up some Texas size portions. Even a third of a texas size portion would do in comparison to their current appetizer portions.

I ve been to Ma Coco twice - once for a girl s night happy hour and the other for date night  and it was great both times  They have a pretty decent happy hour menu  and the fish taco on there was a good size. I got 2  but probably would have been fine with 1 after the chips and salsa. The second time I went  I got the soup  and it was perfect on a cold  rainy  winter day

The place for starters is super cute never been to a Baja   La Paz  mexico  inspired restaurant before  we had a michelada  tostada de ceviche and chilaquiles and everything was amazing  authentic and Mexican  our least favorite to keep it real was the churro doughnut  don t get me wrong it was great just didn t taste like churro to us. Carolina helped us out and her service was impeccable too. Amazing place

I loved this place so much I went twice in 2 days   First  the restaurant is so cute. What a hidden gem. Very Cali  modern and great decor. Staff is very nice and accommodating  big table of 12 people unannounced and it worked  even though the place got super packed an hour later .   The food is really good and the prices are fair. I had the  14 California burrito and loved it  Who would have thought to put fries in a burrito  Californians I guess. Sign me up.  Appetizers   The appetizer sampler was disappointing  3 tiny small sauces  I wouldn t get it again.  The guac was good  not outstanding for atx The fries with meat... yum  Get that     A friend got a special salad and it was HUGE  Someone else was a little disappointed in the flautas  so maybe avoid. But why would you even get the flautas to start   The marg was also very good    10 for a marg  seems fair for that side of town.   Overall  I personally love this place and will be back.

Went for a early dinner on 7 2 22  The place is on the small side but is very nice inside. The staff was great. I personally thought the menu was a little to small for my liking. I do not eat Mexican very often and did not see much besides a Taco that interested me. My family all got food that they really liked. The chips and salsa was a hit with all of us. They will give you more chips if you ask. My taco was not very warm but was good. I ate a few pieces of fajita meat from my sons plate and it was very good. I would get that the next time for sure. It is the most expensive thing on the menu.   Save some room for the donuts. They are delicious.

The wait staff is phenomenal. Super friendly and amazing service. The food is pretty tasty.  Starters   Loaded Fries - 3 5  Tacos   Nopal - 4 5 Shrimp Gobernador - 4 5 Ensenada Fish - 5 5  Dessert   Churro Donut - 5 5  The churro donut is an absolute must order. It s amazing  Fish tacos were super tasty. Nopal taco was okay. Sweet flavor. The shrimp was okay as well. Disappointed with the fries. They came out cold and the carne asada was over cooked  too chewy. The flavors were good though. Our waitress was phenomenal. Great place  Definitely will be back to try the carne asada burrito  the sauce for it looks bomb.

Phenomenally great traditional tacos Tijuana style. Great staff and super cool vibe inside. Need to come back after work to enjoy a margarita with my meal.   This will be on my go to list when I m Austin   Greg P
Nice local neighborhood restaurant in East Austin. Good drinks  great service and ambiance. Good is also very good  must try the octopus taco and fish s tacos  good flavor and taste.

Visit day  05 06 2022  A little backstory before the review  almost every Friday two friends and I get together for dinner in something that has already become a tradition since the beginning of 2020  we like to call it  Fine Dining Friday  FDF   on this occasion we were very excited to visit this Mexican inspired food restaurant based on Yelp reviews and because it is located in East Downtown Austin where most businesses usually leave a good impression  unfortunately our visit had a very bad experience based on the next   - The restaurant  although it is in a good location  was clean and has good lighting  the noise level in the environment is too high to be able to carry on a normal conversation while eating  it is also worth noting that the A C system during our visit was not working  that coupled with the humidity of the Austin climate  even at night  caused one of my friends to have to leave the restaurant for a moment to get some air.  - The quality of the food was excellent  very good flavor although the service time took too long during our visit.  - The service rescued the night what could had been to be a total disaster  the quality of care despite not having enough staff  something already common in Austin  was very good.  - The price was in the range of average restaurants in East Austin although the portions were small.  Un poco de historia antes de la rese a  casi cada viernes nos juntamos a cenar dos amigos y yo en algo que se convirti  ya en una tradici n desde inicios del 2020  le llamamos Fine Dining Friday  FDF   en esta ocasi n nos encontr bamos muy emocionados de visitar este restaurante de inspiraci n en comida mexicana basado en las reviews de Yelp y por que se encuentra en la zona Este del centro de Austin donde la mayor a de negocios por lo regular dejan una buena impresi n  desafortunadamente nuestra visita tuvo una muy mala experiencia basado en lo siguiente   - El restaurante aunque se encuentra en una buena locaci n  estaba limpio y tiene buena iluminaci n el nivel de ruido que encierra en el ambiente es demasiado alto para poder llevar una conversaci n normal mientras se come  tambi n cabe destacar que el sistema de A C durante nuestra visita no se encontraba funcionando  eso aunado a la humedad del clima de Austin aun siendo de noche provoco que uno de mis amigos tuviera que salir por un momento del restaurante a tomar un poco de aire.  - La calidad de la comida fue excelente  de muy buen sabor aunque el tiempo de servicio tardo demasiado durante nuestra visita.  - El servicio fue lo que pudo evitar que la noche terminara siento un total desastre  la calidad de la atenci n pese a que no ten an suficiente personal  algo ya com n en Austin  fue muy buena.  - El precio se encontraba en el rango de la media de restaurantes en el Este de Austin aunque las porciones eran peque as.

Loved this Baja style gorgeous spot so much  The decor is stunning - takes you somewhere tropical   We went for an early lunch time one weekend right before the crowd and got some stellar service since we were the only two people inside.   Highly recommend the spicy pineapple marg  chile relleno taco  fish tacos and the tuna tostada. Every bite was mouthwatering and I d definitely order everything again.   I need to go back in for their burritos  They look killer.   They re a tad bit pricey but nothing that would keep me from going back.   They have indoor and outdoor seating options. They don t take reservations but I don t think you d need one anyway. Maybe in the evening on a weekend

I ve been eyeing Ma Coco since they opened and just now went. I was surprised that the sunday brunch wasn t crowded- we walked in and were seated immediately. I loved the experience and am looking forward to going back soon.
Two words you need to know... WATERMELON MARGARITA   Drinks are amazing and this was a perfect  refreshing summer treat

This is an underrated spot. If your from California looking for some similar Mexican food  this spot right here  The carne asada fries was the best thing I had  My other half had the fish tacos and she loved it. Also some of the best cocktails  they may be a lil light but they still good
Best chips and salsa I ve had. Best burrito I ve ever had. Chips and salsa could have been cheaper but I mean  you get what you pay for.

Interesting new spot off of E 6th and Comal. Stopped in for a quite bite over the weekend  was sat quickly. Service was interesting  seems like maybe they don t have their timing nailed down. They were super friendly  but maybe a little overbearing at the beginning - literally asked us if we were ready to order before I was in the seat  and just generally not giving enough time in between breaks. But then when we did order stuff  they didn t come back for a long time and never refilled my water the entire meal. The drinks were good  Cadillac and Paloma pictured  and the carne asada fries were massive   Good amount of meat and toppings - we planned this as an app and ended up full. I ll try it again for a HH before making a final decision on it.

Good-ish food when it comes out  if it comes out   absolutely terrible service. Not sure if it was an under  staffed night or what  but it took 20 min to Just get water and reminded them 2x.  And everything from there only got worse.  Was just 3 of us. I never got my dinner so unfortunately I m writing this with only a drink in me and no food to kill my angry buzz.....and gave a  1 tip.  I feel like a B but man  that was just all around not acceptable and no communication- literally they didn t know my food never came out and we got a plate of 7 chips with our  18 of salsa and guac .   Took 2 hrs to get my whole meal that didn t include my dinner so....... Yeah.     Time to order torchys. Stay away unless you are really patient to get your expensive instagram moment.

Service was great  food was not. Carne asada was cold and horrible tough. Tasted like it had been cooked days prior and was reheated. Ambiance was fun and trendy  but the food missed the mark.   While more expensive  Suerte down the street is a million times better... if Mexican is your vibe. While hard to get a reservation  you can put your name down. I recommend popping over to Whistlers while you wait  usually 30 mins .

Had lunch here today and first I want to say that I absolutely recommend coming here  It s very cute  the inside is bright and light and that have a lot of outdoor seating.   The only reason for my 3 star review is because I feel like they re having some growing pains -- I ll definitely be back and anticipate amending this to more stars  3 big groups all arrived at the same time as my party of 2  and even though they weren t full  the staff and kitchen were definitely overwhelmed. Our food took some time to come out  and they kindly gave us complementary churro donuts for waiting -- which were delicious   my carne asada was over cooked and tough. The guacamole was delicious  but came with far too few chips  they did bring more when we asked . I also got a shrimp taco which was FANTASTIC  though a bit overfilled and spilling out my tortilla.  My dining partner was thrilled to get a california burrito  but agreed it could have been a bit better -- though also said he would be back  And finally  I didn t have a margarita with my lunch  but that would be the true test for a 4 or 5 star review    Overall recommend  a great add to the neighborhood

This was a super cute place found in the side of the town that I have not been to before  I love mole and haven t really been to a lot of places that serves a good one so it was nice to see it as part of the menu. My friend tried the nopal taco so I also got to try it for the first time in my life  shame  because I grew up in a border town . Everything was good except the service was a little slow and I got only rice instead of rice and beans. I assumed that maybe they were out of beans and didn t complain because I like rice anyway but I saw the next table get rice and beans so it was kind of disappointing that they didn t notify or communicate with me. I d happily return though

Having lived in San Diego for college years I always have a yearning for carne asada fries. This place just looks a lot fancier than your traditional Baja California shack. The carne asada fries were great  and we particularly loved the hot sauce which had a unique taste.   Also  they were short staffed but were hustling hard to take orders and bring food to all  definitely a sign that they care about their customers here.

Stopped in at 11 30 on Friday. Easy street parking. Place was empty except for one table. The bartender was the only server. A fan was loudly blasting air but still a little warm.   Chose to sit outside. In the shade  even at 92  outside was great. Had a delicious michelada while looking at the short menu.  Was several things I wanted to try but settled on the chile relleno taco and the octopus.    Food came quickly. The relleno taco was just amazing. Nixtamalized tortilla was slightly crunchy  the sauce was a great add on. The relleno was cooked well  not soggy  batter stuck to the chile and a great cheese filling. Very satisfying.  The octopus was cooked right  not chewy. The sweet peppers were a good compliment. The salsa negra was a little funky  but not off-putting. I might try the asada next time.  Service was fast and friendly. Hope they resolve their AC problems soon.
Hands down the best spot in Austin. Drinks and food are top notch and the staff is the nicest in the city
Cute new spot. Drinks were very good.   Food  Guacamole - decent  Fish tacos - good California burrito - ok  could ve been more flavorful and the meat could ve been juicier

We loved Ma Coco while visiting Austin for a long weekend. Everything we tried was so delicious and the staff was very friendly and attentive. We tried elote asada  carne asada fries  Salsa Verde Enchiladas  the Cool as a Cucumber cocktail  and took a churro donut back to the AirBnb to eat with some vanilla ice cream. Great meal  great atmosphere  can t ask for anything better.

The service was good our waitress was named caroline and had radiating happiness they were out of the burrito which we really wanted so that was unfortunate. The tacos were pretty average but the drinks were great

We decided to stop by at this cute spot for a lunch date on a random weekday. We shared the salsa sampler with chips  the taco pulpo enchilado and the ensenada fish tacos. The salsas were spicy enough and oh so delicious. I really enjoyed the amount of octopus in the taco and the flavors were just right. I ordered the Cadillac and thought it was quite watered down by the time it got to our table. The restaurant was pretty empty when we were there so I don t think it was sitting at the bar for a while so it was odd. I d give them another try if I am ever in the area and there s a wait anywhere else  lots of great options close by .

I just wandered in because there was no food at the dance establishment across the street. I was very pleasantly surprised. I m not a big fan of tacos but the shrimp taco which my very sweet waitress recommended was out of this world. And it came very fast.

Cute restaurant  the interior is fairly small so I would recommend getting a reservation. The food and drinks were great - we got the Classico margarita  the spicy watermelon mint margarita  elote  and flautas. I do wish the menu had a few more options or variety  but everything was delicious.
The fish tacos might be the best in town aside from maybe Ensenada. The churro doughnut with the strawberry and fresh cream is so good and picturesque that I forgot to take a picture.

We ve gone to Ma Coco for dinner twice and loved it both times. Their burritos are the best we ve found in Austin - in general this is more of a taco town  but Ma Coco s burritos are an exception  The tuna tostada and agua frescas were also delicious. To top it off  the plates look great aesthetically and the atmospheres inside and on the patio are both fun. We certainly plan to come back again.

I am shocked by all the positive reviews of this place.   It was extremely overpriced for the serving sizes  the chips and tostadas were stale  and several menu items were out.  I would never go back.

I love Ma Coco  Not sure how you can trust these one star reviews. They might have just had a bad day. Ma Coco is authentic  delicious   amp  fun. The best margarita I ve had in a long time  We got the taco gobernador  chille rellano taco   amp  cadillac

Terrible.   Smells bad when you walk in.   No AC. No fan. Front door closed.   Ordered fish tacos. Looked HUGE when delivered. Took a bite and found nothing but disappointment. The fish was big because it was 50  batter. Like 3 4 an inch of batter. So much batter that the fish wasn t cooked. Felt queasy a few bites in.   Such a bummer as the location is good and pictures seem delicious.   Do not eat here.

This was quite literally the worst experience that I have ever had in a restaurant. We were seated fairly quickly but had not seen the server for fifteen minutes  meaning we were sitting there waiting. Upon ordering and receiving food  I was handed extremely cold food. I didn t make a fuss though. The cherry on top was waiting a whopping twenty minutes to get the staff s attention to pay the bill. Ridiculous.

The food was very good but the restaurant is small. When we went last  they ran out of ice and we had to wait over an hour past our reservation. Even with these problems  the waiting staff accommodated us and gave us a lot of complimentary drinks and desserts and apps. Food was excellent but I don t recommend the beef tacos.
Chips and salsa were fire  Drinks were fire  Carne asada plate... fire    Everything was fire.
Great fish tacos. Lovely ambiance. The spicy watermelon mint marg with Carabuena was fantastic

Enjoyed it for lunch. There is a charge for chips and salsa which normally is an issue but other than that everything was fresh and tasty. The chips are thick and crunchy which I like too.  Service is nice and friendly.

The worst dining experience I ve ever had in my 7 years living in Austin.   We made a reservation for 8pm and didn t get seated until 8 45pm. We ordered our food at 9pm and it didn t come out until 10pm. Asked for waters at least four times  but never got them. One of us found a piece of HAIR in our food.   But what made this experience the worst was the lack of service recovery and rude attitude from the manager. She was condescending and acted very inappropriate. When we showed her the hair in our food and explained that this hasn t been the best experience  she replied with  I m not sure what you want me to do  we ve had a busy night . She then brought us some complimentary doughnuts and made inappropriate jokes like we didn t just tell her we were unhappy. I work in the service industry. This type of response from a manager is truly shocking.   This place won t last long.

Best Fish Tacos in Austin     They make real Southern California Baja beer battered fish tacos and they are amazing   My wife got the chili relleno and Nopal tacos and absolutely loved them too.  Did I mention Margaritas too    Fish tacos and Margaritas  my new favorite place on the east side

Drinks are good  service is weird - everyone is super nice  but kinda slow. Second time here our app  just chips and salsa  came out at the same time as our meal. Drinks are good  green salsa is good. Tacos and enchiladas are just okay. Refried beans tasted bad which was a bummer because I usually love them. Might be worth stopping in for drinks and maybe apps.
I loved their home made tortillas when I first came here about 3 months back. Last night  I had really bad tortillas. It was soo greasy and extremely cheesy. Please bring the old tortillas.

Zero stars- I would not recommend eating here. Terrible experience all around- From the awful smell upon entry   like a camp ground bathroom  to lazy staff hanging around the host stand checking social media. The over priced drinks were weak and spilled all over our table with no offer to clean up. We had to ask for fresh water because something was floating around in the glass-  The food is bland  un-inspiring and presented in a half hazard way. Our cactus tacos were plopped down in a plate with barely edible tortilla and the carne asada was so bad we had to send it back and we told the manager that we thought the meat was rancid. They just brushed it off and took it off our bill. Why waste your money here when there are so many good options within feet of this place. The food is certainly not worth it.

Underwhelming and overpriced. Cute cafe vibe and cocktails were enjoyable but that s where the fun ends. Food was disappointing and carne asada tasted like low quality taco cabana with little to no authentic Mexican flavors.

I really loved the food here  but I have to agree with everyone else- the service is so so bad.   We were the only group in the restaurant  and our waiter spent most of the time sitting at the bar with his friends  which is totally fine had we ordered and received everything.  He took his time taking our orders  making our drinks  seeing if we needed anything else  etc. He forgot one of our friends orders and then brought it out like 30 minutes later when we were all done eating  even though we were the only ones there.   Anytime I suggest coming here for happy hour and tacos  bc I LOVED the food   it seems everyone who has been here has had the same experience and would rather go somewhere else.

I actually really loved this place when it first opened about a year ago. I was super excited to come back however the place has REALLY gone downhill. From the weird smell when you first walk in  to the extremely greasy and cheesy tacos  it was just not pleasant at all. I d definitely avoid this place until they get their act back together  so many other lovely places to try in the area.

The food is definitely subpar. The carne asada was so overcooked  we couldn t cut through it and the waiter s first recommendation is he d bring us a sharper knife... I m not someone who sends food back but it was inedible. Otherwise  the cocktails were decent.

First  I want to say that the service was awesome and the servers are not apart of this review   I came here on a Friday night to grab some drinks early dinner with my boyfriend. We both love Mexican food  him being a native Southern Californian  so we were excited to try it out    I hate giving negative reviews but this might ve been the worst Mexican food I ve ever had. We started out with drinks which were below average. Order some guacamole which tasted like pure lime juice and salt due to the lack of seasoning. Only to end with a shrimp taco that had rubber like unseasoned shrimp and a steak taco that had Taco Bell like overcooked steak. We rushed to eat a few bites and then leave because we felt bad for our server. Overall  the place needs a major revamp because idk what they re serving. The only good thing is the customer service

Not going to lie I m dieting and I was starving when I came here. I always ask for recommendations and the server gave me some good choices. I enjoyed the tuna tostada nice cold fresh tuna and bold flavors. The carne asada taco was good  and the Chile relleno was good  interesting. I didn t know what to expect but it was literally a Chile relleno inside of a tortilla.
Great food. The California Burrito is gigantic. Ceviche is good as well  Was impressed by their Michelada

Good but not great. Both my friend and I agreed we won t be back. The tacos we ordered did not come with any salsa strangely so it was missing that kick. While you could tell the corn tortillas were homemade  the tacos themselves were tiny and could have used more vegetables  aside from the fish taco which admittedly was packed with vegetables - good job there . Salsa and chips review  chips were super thick  didn t really enjoy. Ate about 2 and stopped.   Suggest more menu items besides just tacos for now.   Also suggest masks for employees... it was strange that in August  even with CDC guidance now recommending masks in COVID heavy areas due to Delta spread  basically the whole county besides rural areas  amp  most definitely Austin .. none of the restaurant employees were masked. We sat outside which I thought would be OK  but I still felt unsafe due to how close the waitress kept getting to me. Yes  I know masks are not really comfortable  etc. but I was surprised to see a restaurant where the workers themselves were not masked during this challenging time. It s kind of the nature of the work  unfortunately  just like we expect doctors and nurses to wear masks.

As a dreaded California transplant I love that someone has brought proper Baja-mex food to Austin. Ma Coco is located off 5th street  right across from the White Horse. This is the family s second location with the original located in Bastrop  which is currently under renovation. Their menu is large enough to have all the things you d want from this style of Mexican food  but not overwhelmingly large. The food is authentic to the point that the owner gets his tortillas for the burritos from San Diego. If you ve ever had a burrito in SD  you know what I m talking about. The perfect tortilla for the perfect Cali burrito.   I always start with the salsa sampler because the salsas are fantastic and the chips are made fresh  in-house. Other item menus not to be missed are the tuna bites on happy hour  the pulpo  octopus  taco  and the holy grail  California burrito. If you re a cali transplant  eat here.   They also have a full bar with a great margarita selection. Everything is fresh  light  and delicious. They have bohemia in bottles and I recommend The Dude.   Go have some good baja-mex to carry you over until you get back to SoCal for your next visit.

Sat outside which was nice and they have a nice interior as well. The food was really great  highly recommend the fish tacos. And all the salsas in the trio were very yummy which sometimes is not the case elsewhere. The drinks were ok but the food is what stood out. They are a very new restaurant so the service definitely needs work. We were never served water after asking 3 different people and getting our orders taken was kind of a disaster but we weren t in a hurry and got good food so it was fine. Once they improve the serving I think this place will be closer to a 5 star

Great new local spot  They make the tortillas by hand on site  and they re the best I ve ever had. The food here is really great...but I gotta say  the service is even better. It s a family owned and operated business  and you can tell by the dedication and passion of the folks here.   Definitely a must try

3 if us came here for lunch on. Saturday and the place was empty. We ordered the fish taco  pulpo taco  and chicken flautas. The fish tacos were the star of the show. The portion is generous  tastes fresh  and we can t wait to order it again. The pulpo taco was also tasty  although a little small  although it had a lot of veggies . The chicken flautas we re a total disappointment. The chicken was over cooked and dry - they should figure out how to make it juicier or at least provide a side of salsa. I wouldn t order this again. Lastly  the restroom was a MESS  No toilet paper  the lock didn t work  and it was filthy. I hope the cleanliness of the kitchen is better.
Love the aesthetics of the restaurant  The Food never fails to impress and always delicious  Definitely check it out

The complementary chips and salsa  all were fantastic  had the carne asada plate  amp  was soooo delicious. Not to bash on Tex Mex  but coming from California  this is some of the better Mexican food I ve had in the 4 years I ve lived here. I will definitely be coming back soon
The food is delicious. I highly recommend it. Order the Ahi Tuna  Asada Tacos or elote. Those are my favorites. I loves the Carabuena Tequila margaritas too

Don t think twice. Ma Coco is the real deal. In the old location La Matta  this Cali-style mexican eatery is primed for big business with all the apartments and work buildings around. Popped in there today and while they re still on a limited  soft opening menu the owner told us  but the plan is to be full menu in the near future. The build out is beautiful  very clean white and blue vibe  photos of San Diego and Coronado line the wall  and the wood grain feel of the tables bar vibe nicely to give off that beach-eatery vibe.  The tuna tostada was fantastic. Fresh tuna  avocado  a delicious spicy sauce  and some fried julienne cut shallots  I think   on top... it was big time good. I also had the nopal taco which was fantastic. Could use a side of sauce or something  but a spritz of lime did the trick to really bring the flavor fully out.   My co-worker got the battered fish tacos and said they were really good  very fresh  and the batter was delicate  crispy  and all around good. A bit messy to eat  but just hit that Chicago Italian beef stance and you ll be fine.   Excited to see this place thrive and to get the Cali burritos in there and take in a Friday work Cali burrito and michelada s . Until then  we ll be back for the limited menu and will keep enjoying what we re given  5 STARS

Hidden gem in East Austin  This is such a cute place  The food is amazing and service is outstanding   Started with drinks.. Cool as a Cucumber and Ma Coco Clasico - outstanding  We ordered the chicken flautas and fish tacos... SO delicious  Everything is made fresh when you order it and you can tell they care about their customers. Great service  great drinks  great food  great environment  Will be coming back very soon
Service was terrible limited drinks  small menu and mediocre food and a premium price.
Love this place  Went for a date night and the food was delicious. I loved the civiche. Meredith was the best server ever she was super cool

Great new spot that just opened up  Was in town from Idaho visiting a friend and came across this new spot. Place is very inviting and has a great vibe  Sat outside and soaked in the sun and drank margaritas. Great food  great drinks  great new spot to try

I live right down the street so when I noticed this place I was stoked on a new fun neighborhood spot. While the food is pretty good  the service is not. My friends and I went in and asked for the happy hour menu. We ordered drinks and food from the HH menu. When it came time to pay  we were all confused by how high the bill was. It turns out we ordered the regular flautas and not the happy hour ones   She said we got four when the happy hour flautas only come with three.. not sure how we were supposed to know that ahead of time to clarify  I also remember my friend physically pointing to the item on the happy hour menu when she took our order. She was condescending and rude to us when we asked for this to be sorted out. We were scammed  Tricked  Taken advantage of  Not cool

Really nice restaurant  Has a great outdoor patio and really nice inside as well  Loved the carne asada fries  Amazing flautas    So good and crunchy  Loved them  Churro donuts are delicious as well. Really friendly helpful staff as well  Great place  We will be back for more flautas

Amazing restaurant   Food is phenomenal... I am vegetarian and the staff is always super accommodating. I get the carne asada quesadilla with no carne asada  and of course there are other delicious vegetarian options as well. The quesadilla is just my favorite  The drinks are so tasty  Classico is my favorite  And the staff could not be more kind and fun to be around. This restaurant has great energy with awesome music  ambiance  people  etc. I would recommend to anyone and everyone looking for a delicious Baja Mexican restaurant in Austin  Oh and you must order the churros... they are to die for

So disappointed. Really wanted this place to succeed  but they just keep shooting themselves in the foot. First went to their Bastrop location  and it was good. As a San Diego girl  I was really excited about good SoCal Baja Mexican food  and have told lots of people to try them. We ve driven across town at least three times when their social media website says their open only to find that they re closed.  Like  normal times a restaurant should be open  nothing crazy.  Made a reservation for last night. We were the only people  there except for two people at the bar. Got our chips and guac pretty quickly. The salsa sampler is three tiny  like 2oz each  servings of salsa for  6  which lasts about a minute for four people. Tried to order the carne asada burrito and they said they were out of burrito-sized tortillas. Ordered the carne asada quesadilla instead-it had a couple of pieces of meat. Our friend ordered the carne asada plate. The pile of meat looked like it had been set out in the sun for awhile and was dry and tasteless. He took it home to give to his dog. It was that bad. The service was ok  but our friends who had arrived a few minutes after us finally had to go to the bar to order a drink after waiting several minutes for a server to take their order  and remember  we were the only people in the restaurant.  Sorry to say we re done trying Ma coco. It looks like what we thought were the  new location bugs  are permanent features. There is way too much good Mexican food in this town to serve up subpar food and service repeatedly.
I had a cali burrito craving. I almost drove to California to get a burrito but decided I could try a place close to home. Well  I m glad I tried Ma CoCo because the food is great

Highly Understaffed. All of the staff was relatively nice but it seemed that one woman was working hard doing most of the tables while the manager    was just chatting with guests. It took an hour to get chips and salsa out to the table and we had not even been able to order our entrees yet.

Went on a Saturday for brunch. Was treated so rudely at the door that i won t ever be going back or recommending this place. No idea how the food is but the person at the hostess stand was nasty. In my two years in Austin have never experienced anyone so rude. Sad.
Been here multiple times and have had great food every time  Carne asada fries are my favorite

If you are looking for a place to eat  you MUST try this place. One  it s beautiful  Two  the food is delicious and price conscious  The owners are so friendly and welcoming  You can try everything on the menu and you will not be disappointed. My favorites are the ceviche  taco gobernador  and taco pulpo

Such a cute  fun  clean find  We literally stumbled on to this place and couldn t be happier  The food was delicious  good size  priced low and served quickly.  We had the enchiladas  salsas and quesadilla.  Wouldn t change a thing   Great bar menu as well  Servers were attentive and kind

Came here on a Saturday night for dinner. It s SO pretty on the patio and the inside is soooo cute. Definitely a good spot for a date night. Got the fish tacos and they were great. Lots of flavor. The service was fast and our waiter Javi was friendly. Def going back
Super fresh ingredients and bomb house tortillas. We got the elote  carne asada fries  and a few tacos and all were excellent. Excited for this place to join our neighborhood
The Elote is bomb   The owner knows a thing or two about hospitality. He came and chatted with us for a bit and even brought us out something for the table. Thanks for being such a great host

Incredible menu    I ve tried 80  of it and there s not a single  ordinary  dish.   Everything is delicious      The Creative flavor combinations and beautiful presentation make Ma Coco my very favorite Restaurant in Austin       And  the cocktails      HomeRuns  - Every One      The Dude  is awesome

It s newly opened but def worth checking out... so good   Great cocktails  tried their margarita and paloma. Came here after seeing fried fish tacos on Yelp and got those but a sampling of other stuff also. The salsa sampler and guac  chips are so good and different. Ahi tuna tostado was cool and refreshing but had a nice spicy kick. The Mexican street corn also awesome  Didn t get a picture of the tacos but they were perfect. We left feeling so full but not like shit  everything was so fresh and flavorful. Probably one of the best meals I ve had in a while.

Ma Coco is such a great addition to the town. The food  drinks  and environment are amazing and The service is even better. If you haven t tried this place yet and be sure to get a marg and the tuna tostada

Unfortunately when we went there they were understaffed so I never got to try the food. We got there around 6pm on a Friday and we re seated. We watched the poor server tending to other guests and we never received any acknowledgement from her. After thirty minutes of nothing we decided to leave. Maybe we will try again in a few months.

Adorable atmosphere and good food. I would love to give this restaurant five stars but after my visit today  I feel as though I have been taken advantage of. My group was handed a happy hour menu when we sat down and were told it ends at 6 30. We all ordered items that we saw on the happy hour menu and thought it was very clear we were ordering off of that menu. When it came time to pay we noticed our bill was much higher than expected. Our waitress told us that since we did not specifically tell her which menu we were ordering off of she assumed it was not the happy hour menu and charged us the normal price being  6 above the happy hour price for an item on both menus. When we asked about this she was not friendly or willing to hear us out in regards to our confusion. If you choose support this restaurant during happy hour make sure you specifically state that you are ordering off the happy hour menu or else you will be taken advantage of.

I can t say enough great things about this place  this is exactly what the East Side needed. I have been a couple of times and have tried to really explore the menu. It s hard to pinpoint my favorite item because EVERYTHING IS SO GOOD  but here s a couple recommendations to get you started.  All of their drinks are on point  try The Dude  and you cant go wrong with their Ceviche for an appetizer. Also  they have hands down the best Fish Tacos in Austin and you can t leave with out trying the Taco Gobernador. The last time I went in I tried the Churro Donut and that alone will make you come back.  Great place  great location  great vibes  and stellar service. 10 10 recommend
Delicious  fresh food. Finally  Mexican food for  foodies  like us. We liked everything we ordered - enchiladas  fish tacos  flautas and churro. Welcome  Ma Coco from CA.

My friends and I went to Ma Coco after Ramen Tatsuya was too busy and God are we glad we did  The elote asado was an excellent appetizer  the taco gobernador was delicious  flavorful  and perfectly sized  and everyone who had the enchiladas loved them  Beautiful plating too  If only I d taken a photo. The owner was so friendly and our waiter was great too. Highly recommend  We ll definitely be back soon

Absolutely delicious      Owner and staff are incredibly kind and down to earth. We ordered the California burritos  fish tacos  carne asada fries  and the churro donuts. We also had really yummy margaritas  10 10 recommend.
Super good spot  Inside of the restaurant feels like Tulum vibes. Definitely recommend checking out

This place is the best in austin. Not only is the customer service exceptional  the food is DELICIOUS. We had the chili relleno taco  california burrito  flautas  to name a few  and we had no complaints. I found this place randomly on Yelp and am so impressed. A must try

Absolutely delicious  We tried a little bit of everything and nothing disappoints. The chips were freshly fried and the salsa sampler was amazing. Elote was perfect and the carne asada fries were delicious  Fish tacos are perfectly crispy. Chili relleno taco was yummy and something I had never tried before. Try the dude spicy pineapple margarita as well. A   on everything

First time in Texas and I came straight here ... let me tell you the drinks were mouthwatering and refreshing the margaritas were amazing I had to try them all. The food if you want a taste of authentic Mexican food come here every bite was bursting with flavor I couldn t put my fork down damn near licked the plate lol DONT FORGET THE CHURRO DONUT FOR DESSERT
This is the Mexican food Austin has been missing. Ma coco has only been open for a few weeks and I ve already been 3 times.

Great place and vibe. My friends and I found this restaurant as we were driving around. The food was delicious. Definitely recommend the carne asada fries and fish tacos. Great atmosphere with wonderful music. The owner is super nice and checked on us throughout our meal. Overall  great experience
Beautiful space  great food AND super nice and attentive staff and owner. 5 stars all around

Brand new spot and already highly recommend  Got the chips and guac and carne asada fries both were incredibly fresh and sooo tasty  Can t wait to see what more they add to their menu  Highly recommend trying this place out ASAP

The birria was flavorful and juicy and and served with a great verde salsa. My only qualm with the food was that I asked for a corn tortillas  for which I had high hopes  and was served lackluster corn tortillas. My reason for the 3 stars is for accessibility. All they had to do was put a small ramp up to the  ordering platform  and use mats to make a path covering the deep gravel that is very hard to push through in a wheelchair. If I drive by in the future and see they have made the space more accessible I will come back and bring my friends.

I LOVE the tacos here    Discovered on Nextdoor  a neighbor advertised their family s humble taco truck several months ago  but I hadn t stopped in yet... And then La Tunita closed down over the summer  leaving a birtia-flavored hole in my heart.  Fast forward to now  I ve gone to these guys at LEAST once a week for the past 6 weeks or so   They have a large covered on site patio seating area  or will bring your order to your CAR if you re taking it to go    I ve tried the following and it s all delicioso  migas taco  suadero  bistec  birria  quesabirria  consomm   bacon  amp  egg  adobo  chicken.  Pro Note  The red salsa is the spiciest of the 3 they offer  the 2 green are more mild   and I split HALF of the little container across 3 birria tacos  and then add green to it ... Their red is spicier than tacodeli s salsa do a ... You. Have. Been. Warned    P.S. you can ask for a specific salsa when you order  but when I haven t specified  I get only red with the quesabirria.  THANK YOU to these guys for bringing tasty food closer to our Del Valle community

Fabulous roadside taco stand. Parking. Tables in shade. Delicious tacos on homemade corn tortillas. What more could you want.  I order Al pastor  quesobirra and the compechanos on the recommendation of the sweet kid working the stand. All were bomb. Al pastor was my favorite.  Salsa was good. Service was fast.  Excellent in every way.   Love a family run home run

The Al Pastor taco was the bomb and best one I ve ever had - tender and juicy morsels of pork that explodes with flavor in your mouth. The Suadero was also well seasoned and had a good crunch. The Pescado was a bit bland and subpar compared to San Diego Baja style fish tacos. The Quesabirria lacked a crunchy cheddar crust that I was used to in other taco shops. The consomme was rich and complemented the birria well. The corn tortilla was a bit thicker and larger than I preferred but at least they also filled it with a lot of the meat. 3 tacos is good enough to make a hungry person satisfied. Ask for the super spicy hot sauce  It will make you sweat and gulp down a bottle of soda but it s so worth it.

We loved CJs so much for lunch  we went back the next morning for breakfast and once again were amazed.   We both had the Migos and I added Chorizo. With or without the Chorizo  they were wonderful    I won t write more here  only want to say give this little taco trailer a try  morning  noon or night.
Great tacos and the orange sauce is hot  Go easy on it when you pour on it s deceiving but oh so good  Like the pineapple on the chicken tacos.  Tried the beef one too.  All good.  Will be back.
I really like this place. I m working on a project right down the road  and this place has become my go to taco spot. Their tacos are great  and the read salsa is freaking awesome.

Great spot and the service is great as well. When the food was ready  I noticed they were exciting the truck and delivering the food either to people in their cars  or at the tables. It s a little thing but I don t see that often  or at all  at places that have the similar type of set up. The food w and fresh and the prices are great

Deliciously yummy filling homemade corn tortilla tacos  Migas and Potato-bean with bacon  for  2.99 each     Fresh ingredients  authentic tomatillo salsa and they brought the tacos to my car when my order was ready--that s top notch service  Can t wait to come for lunch soon

I went to a nearby auto shop and stopped by here during morning time. Tacos are so fresh and tasty. Al Pastor was so good I can come back again just to have it. Chicken tasted good too and their red salsa is very spicy just another great taco food truck of Austin.
Absolutely amazing food  great seasonings and amazing service. Best tacos I ve had in Texas
This place is legit. Their generous portion of migas tacos will melt your face off but it s worth it. You can text in your order as well.

That mango with the pico on the chicken taco is the BEST combination EVER  These tacos were so filling and on the way to the airport  so I had to stop by. There s places to park  so that s convenient. Staff was super friendly. If I come back to Austin  I m heading here first.

Oh my goodness  What a great place to grab a quick breakfast or lunch  quesobirria    The chorizo is perfectly cooked with the right amount of spice.  Don t even get me started on those delicious tortillas and spicy salsas

I think this location had previously shut down and then re-opened because I had some friends tell me about it before...  Just recently the food truck is back out there and serving food.  Stopped by and got two bacon egg potato and cheese tacos  they were  2.99 each.  Not the best tacos  but they were pretty good.  I wish It had came with some better salsa or hot sauce to go with it.  Can t wait to see what other kind of goodies I can score of this place.
Good knight this place was good. Their Birria tacos were absolutely incredible. That s all I got l  but I can t see myself ever ordering anything else. Seriously. This place is legit
The only reason why four stars is because the food is good.  pricey but good food. Why not five stars this is the second time I go and they forgot an item.

We sampled almost everything on the menu and they did not disappoint  Each taco was overflowing with meat and toppings. The flavors were amazing. The salsa was on point. The price is great and service was friendly. My favorites were the al pastor and suadero tacos  but all of them were amazing. And did I mention the most delicious homemade tortillas     Highly recommend this place
Awesome tacos with great flavor. The staff has also always been so helpful when ordering.

I just tried CJ s for the first time as I now work close by. I must say  it was love at first bite   I got beans  migas and avocado on corn tortillas. Each ngredient was super tasty and extremely fresh   Shout out for their homemade corn tortillas. They are nice and thin and tasty and have just the right amount of chew and crispness to keep them from falling apart. Their salsas are authentic and if you like it HOT  ask for their hottest salsa. They told me to be careful with it. I was impressed as many  Mexican  places only carry mild to medium salsas. If you want to knock your socks off with flavor and heat  you will be glad you asked for the HOT kind.
This place is so damn good. I crave it multiple days out of the week but sadly only make it a few times a month even though it s on the opposite side of town from me.
Authentic and great flavor  Loved it  They weren t greasy and we liked the ones w pineapple in them
Super awesome tacos. Birria was worth five stars and the pastor and suadero were worth four. Great service  homemade corn tortillas  well worth a stop.
Super accommodating service  excellent food  and amazing salsa options. The value for the volume is undeniably good and the taste is a top 5 taco spot in Austin. I ll be back for sure.

THE BEST TACOS IN AUSTIN TEXAS    Omg they are delicious  Everything is freshly made on spot  The owners are AMAZING  And so kind and sweet  Not to mention the price range is amazing  So cheap and the amount you get is so big   I always have to take a Togo box home everytime  They won t let you leave hungry that s for sure      They also have breakfast tacos that are a size of a burrito and sooo goood  The presentation is amazing  outstanding  Highly recommend

CJ s quickly became my boyfriend s and my favorite taco place in Austin after we discovered the brisket tacos and birria. We now pick up CJ s multiple times a week and have even eaten it for lunch AND dinner in the same day because we crave it so often. If I am ever asked what I want my last meal to be before I die it s probably CJ s.

Loved my vegetarian tacos  I asked him to make them spicy and he delivered with the sauce and tacos. Everything good you read is true. The food  the service and the sauces are amazing   I do wish they had vegetarian friendly beans.

I haven t had a single thing here that hasn t left me wanting more. Their Birria tacos left me in awe and the breakfast tacos hit the spot every single time. Customer service has always been great here too. Overtook my favorite breakfast taco spot in Austin.

One of my favorite taco spots ever. I ve been 4 times this week for lunch  tried 4 or 5 different types of tacos and they ve all been great. Price is great and 2 tacos is plenty. Even the presentation is great  definitely recommend you try something new every time.

The best breakfast tacos I ve ever had. Stopped here after leaving the airport. It was pouring rain  so he brought the food right to our car. I d fly back just for another one of CJ s chorizo breakfast tacos.
C and J work the truck and the food is awesome.  Their Birria is on point  great local business  support them

I moved from San Diego in 2016 and try as I might  I haven t been able to find a good California Burrito in Austin. Granted  choices were few  but all of the recommended places left me disappointed. Until now.   This place is legit. Tell all your San Diego expats.   The prices will make you gasp  but it s absolutely worth it for the taste of home. I will definitely be back.

Been searching for a good place for rolled tacos and this place is the spot. Being an expat of San Diego searching for legit Mexican food without beans is far and few in between. Don t let the prices deter you  I d happy pay to stratify my cravings. Wes is the man

So happy to have found Daygo s   The one and only thing we miss about CA is good carne asada  This is what we ve been searching for in TX over the last 3 years   So delicious  huge portions and great hot sauce too. We ll be back soon

Absolute Fire coming out of this tiny food trailer  ..The guy running it has a passion for the plates he puts out. Located in there new location  at Oskar Blues Brewery Taproom...although the address is listed as Energy drive...there is a small road on Metric that leads you behind the building..look for the Oskar signs and waving banners. Everything is made to order  super fresh ingredients...A buddy who had visited the old location brought me here for the Daygo Fries..we both went with Carne Asada...man these plates are huge..Hot crispy fries with tender Carne  fresh Guacamole  Sour cream  Pico And cheese ...2 types of hot sauces...orange being my favorite this was one killer tray of food..Do yourself a favor and try it you will live it...and support small and local  ...and yes...I ate the whole thing  ..Dang good food

Im not one to leave reviews often  but after trying Daygos  i was simply moved to do so.  Ive been stuck in Austin for a week for work. I live in Dallas  but i am from California  so i am always on the hunt for great mexican food. After searching for burritos on yelp  I stumbled upon Daygos  saw a pic of the asada fries  and headed that way.  I got there on a thursday about 12 05pm  right after he opened. He  i assume the owner  was very polite and easy to talk to. Got a great vibe from him. I ordered my asada fries and he instructed me to go to the website to pay.   Long story short  and the important part of this review... BEST CARNE ASADA FRIES I HAVE EVER HAD  EVER . After seeing the price im not gunna lie i almost cancelled the order  but  everything tasted SO fresh. From the cheese  to the guac  the fries  and most importantly the beef. It definitely was very filling  and overall im glad i stuck with it. Excuse the picture  as i was halfway thru eating when i snapped it.   Reason im only leaving 4 stars and not 5  Number one and main reason  PRICE   20 for asada fries from a small food trailer  plus a mandatory tip of minimum  2  to me is a bit steep. This isnt the state fair  and thats his everyday price. In my opinion the website asking for a tip from a food trailer that doesnt serve food like a restaurant  is strange. That would be my main deterrent from coming back here if i was in town again. Second reason  paying on the website was not very easy or quick. I think if he had zelle   paypal  venmo to send money  that would be much easier.   Overall tho  great tasty fresh authentic food and good service.
I d never had San Diego style Mexican food but OmG here we are. Their food is the perfect culmination of flavors and their salsa is to DIE for  and hot as hell . 5 stars for sure.

Looking for that Baja style Mexican food perfected in San Diego  look no further.. Been living n Austin 10 years after leaving San Diego and really haven t had a great burrito in that time  until I found Daygos  all the flavors and textures I remembered were there.  I had the California burrito and wasn t disappointed  it was gone before I left the parking lot.  Will be back to try the rest of the menu  Thanks Wes   Only had 2 minor issues  it was a little confusing to find without a street sign on Metric  was impossible to get to from Energy Blvd  secondly  No Jamaica  Get some Jamaica guys  it s a must.  Thanks again

As a born amp raised San Diegan who recently moved to Austin   amp  who had carne asada fries as part of my weekly diet   I was seriously missing San Diego s Mexican food. This came close to scratching the itch  but it was nothing to write home about. What I mainly dock stars for is the absolutely absurd pricing   amp  I see the prices have gone up even further since my visit . You d be completely laughed out of SD if you tried charging  19 for a standard carne asada burrito  amp   20 for fries lol. To put it in perspective  one of the places in SD that gets criticized for being way too expensive still only charges  14 for a Cali burrito  amp  you at least get free chips with that. Here  they couldn t even give us a fork  haha  he made us go ask the bar . But you do you  Texas.
Truly enjoyed the carne asada fries  great taste and loaded with steak  The serving is generous and enough to feed two people or share as an appetizer. Great taste and service

Just go  You won t be disappointed. Southern Californian  San Diego  Mexican food. The rolled tacos were excellent and the California burrito was amazing  The meat was dripping with flavor. My husband never eats the whole burrito  but there was nothing left but the wrapper. I never eat 6 taquitos  but I did. I would ve licked the box clean if no one was looking. The owner is a great guy. I ll be back for my roll taco fix next weekend.  Good  good  food

I ve been missing a great burrito and carne asada fries and haven t been able to really find any decent ones in Austin at all until I found Daygos  If you are looking for great California Mexican food  this is the SPOT. Their burrito is one of the best I ve EVER had  my husband LOVES their carne asada fries  and their rolled tacos are also delicious  And the green salsa is so flavorful  it is a must try  The owner is also really nice and genuine. We will stop at Daygos every time we are in this area of town
These are the best Carne asada fries I ve had since moving from CA. It s a little on the pricey side but still better than most I ve had here in Austin
Every-time i come to ATX I m definitely pulling up.. the chicken was delicious and the fries was crispy. And the toppings   OMG.

I ordered the California burrito  amp  my friend ordered the street tacos.. Mind you  we re both from Cali so we re picky about our Mexican food  The food tastes just like back home  It was sooo yummy. Definitely worth what I paid for. I d totally eat here again whenever I m in Austin.
California burritos were massive and so good with the carne asada. Never had French fries inside my burrito but it was amazing.

How did I not know about this place sooner  My fiance and I ordered the Daygo Fries  The Rolled Tacos and the Chips  amp  Salsa.  This is every bit as good  and I d say better  than the rolled tacos and carne asada fries you ll get in San Diego. The portions were very big for the cost  the flavor was incredibly delicious and the chips were fresh and well salted. Somehow the fries managed to stay crispy even after my drive home to eat.  And beside the food  the gentlemen manning the window when I showed up was extremely polite and courteous. It s the little things that really put this place over. My fiance described it as a 10 10 and I agree
This place is a hidden gem  The tacos were amazing and it s outside a brewery so there is some seating. Can t wait to go again

The weather was perfect today  so it was a perfect day to see what all of the hype was about at Daygos.. the San Diego style food truck. The guy at the window was friendly and helpful. I ordered the carne asada fries and also got the Cali burrito  which was for my kids so I didn t try that. These fries are seriously life changing. This is one item that I will add to my rotation of my weekly cheat meal. I highly recommend

Ok  I m from San Diego and I ve had about a million California burritos. This is the best I ve ever had. Yes  it s a little more expensive than what you re used to paying  but this is a gourmet California burrito. Next level. Go and treat yourself

I d like to post a picture  but I ate my burrito too damn fast. Having grown accustomed to the carn  asada burritos in San Diego  and very much missing them in TX  I had been wanting to try this place. Sadly  they did not receive their beef delivery  so I tried the 619 burrito with pollo asada instead. You know what  It was delicious  I will 100  be a repeat customer. Great food  great customer service

We re trying to eat a bit less these days  thanks to those extra Covid 19 pounds  and started with the California burrito to share. I was a bit skeptical of fries in my burrito  but it was delicious.   I d probably try the other burrito without fries next time just to cut out some calories  but if that doesn t matter to you then go for it.  We hung out at Oskar Blues a bit longer which meant more beer and another order via the Daygos app from inside the brewery. This time we got Mucho Nachos with chicken. Ingredients were evenly distributed and again everything was so tasty that I found myself not wanting to share.   Sorry  I can t post photos because we gobbled it up too fast  but I promise everything we had was IG worthy.   I d easily order out from Daygos if we lived closer  but I ll just have to settle for Tuesday night open mics.   PRO TIP  Daygos ONLY accepts orders online so make sure you get a confirmation text if your order.  Don t opt out of texts upon checkout otherwise you won t get the notification

Some of the best tacos and burritos I ve had in Austin. Trust me when I say the carne asada fries don t miss  Right next to a brewery so perfect location. There is a reason this man has a two hour wait for his food well worth it.

Daygo s is legit   Hands down the best in town for authentic Mexican food coming straight up from my hometown of San Diego  CA. Dre is the best and he brings back the hometown feeling when you have conversation with him. The food is   California burrito  carneasada chips  amp  fries  quesadilla -   Everything is made to order and fresh. Dre will not let you down when it comes to Mexican food.
Passionate food truck owner  kind and generous  and of course  delicious food. Daygos was a perfect pairing with the beer at Oskar Blues Brewery. I will definitely be back.

Might cry about the existence of this food truck  Ever since we moved away from California I ve been looking  in vain  for a good burrito in Austin. This is it     We got the chicken to be healthy  ha  and I couldn t believe how good it was. Definitely getting the carne asada next time. Owner was super nice and it s in a parking lot with some other good looking options  soul food  vegan nigerian . Happy to have this place so close by on MLK.

Tried this after a friend who has lived in San Diego recommended it. Got the carne asada California burrito which was delicious. I immediately destroyed it  and lamented that I did not order a second one. I will be going back here soon to try the nachos and California fries
Best burrito I ve found in Austin for sure. Very friendly service too. We ll be back soon

I lived in San Diego for 27 years and grew up on  authentic San Diego Mexican food  as this place claims to have.  This place has a lot of nerve taking frozen taquitos  throwing guacamole and cheese on them and claiming they are real rolled tacos. Take from someone who grew up eating California burritos  this place is doesn t taste like home. Just another Texas Mexican food truck.

This place is impossible to find and once I did I was told I had to order on their website. There was no one else there so it should have been easy to take my order especially when it s so hot outside. I went and looked at the menu and everything is  20 and  7 for chips and salsa  Insane prices for any burrito. Real tacos in California are dirt cheap.

Y all I found a small piece of home right in the heart of Austin   This place is phenomenal      I ordered the Daygo fries  carne asada fries . I encourage all my cali friends that moved to Texas and have been missing our southern cali Mexican food And my Texas local friends that have been wondering what we are talking about to go check out  daygossandiegotacoshop    You won t be disappointed I promise you  I live so far away but it s worth the trip  Even with the gas prices lol  supportsmallbusiness  blackownedbusiness  southerncalimexicanfood  daygosandiegotacoshop
Delicious. Carne Asada fries and California burrito are both amazing. Will be going again.
Delicious and great service. Light and crispy chips seemed homemade. Awesome nachos. Very fresh  authentic California Mexican food.

Such a rip off.  20 for a burrito less the length of a subways foot long and half the girth of a chipotle burrito. It tasted like a generic burrito. I usually don t leave reviews if the food is bad  I just don t go back but this is a flat out scam. Our fries were also soggy and the size of a shriveled shoestring fry.
Best CA style burrito in Austin. Got the California burrito with carne asada. Great value and service.
As close to an authentic San Diego burrito as you re going to get in Austin. The carne asada was well-seasoned and delicious. Definitely will be returning here to try out the other dishes

Being from San Diego and moving to Austin was hard in the first place. One of many reasons why it s hard leaving San Diego is taco shop food. So glad we found this place today 4 23 22. It s like we never left San Diego. Food is bomb  Check them out
This place us great. Really. You re missing out if you don t eat here. The portions are big. The food isn t just some other taco truck. It s really great.

First time coming here and honestly I got lost trying to find it but the food was AMAZING    Loved the service as well  had a great conversation and time there  I tried the California burrito  best one I have tried so far  I will be coming again and will recommend it to friends as well

No Lie..... Best  quesadilla and Burrito  in ATX hands down  We went to Oskar Blues  and saw the truck and was glad to give it a shot. Portion wise  was on point  Food was amazing.... I normally don t do reviews  but I had to with them.... Service was top notch too. I didn t get his name  but he even brought my food inside to me. Thank you again  I will come and grub some more in the near future.
I will make sure to stop by each time I m in Austin for the Daygo fries and rolled tacos. They are just that good.

Finally got to come here with my friends after weeks of trying to find the time.
