I got the California burrito and we shared a order of daygo fries  and let me tell you  they were both by far two of the best pieces of food I ve ever eaten  and easily the loaded fries and burrito s in the city aswell. The fries were full of such rich flavor topped of with perfectly cooked carne asada that left all three of us completely full  but the burrito was something else. The burrito was beautiful  it wasn t just big but it also tasted amazing. The carne asada was cooked beautifully and the flavors of the burrito were rich and full and will have you feeling stuffed. Lastly  I wanna give a massive shoutout to Dre  your hospitality made eating here a great experience I won t forget. Definitely looking forward to coming and back and telling everyone about y all. Y all are up next

Born and raised in SD and this was easily the best Cali b I ve had in Austin and it s not even close. Honestly better than some of the local places in SD  very authentic. The owner is extremely friendly  a must try if you re looking for Mexican food that tastes like San Diego.
The best tacos u Habs had since moving to Texas. I have been searching for someone to make rolled tacos just like San Diego. Can t wait to go back
Tiny  amp  perfect little food truck in East Austin. California burrito was incredible and you could tell how much love and passion went into it. Making Daygos our new spot

Amazing carne asada  We had the California burrito and carne asada tacos and both were so good. The meat was tender and full of flavor  super high quality  definitely worth the slightly higher prices . Chips and salsa were great as well. I cannot wait to try the carne asada fries. Totally recommend if you are missing southern California style Mexican food.
So yummy and great price   Their pozole hits amazing after a long night of drinks  Tacos are 3 for like  4 great price  amp  servers are the sweetest
Old school spot. Really good food  good customer service as well. I ve been coming here well over 20 years.
Friendly and helpful staff  they always go out of their way to greet the customers and have a small but pretty great menu.  Highly recommend the Chiliquilas with eggs and the tacos.

Me dieron un pinche pescado crudo  yo creo hasta vivo lo tenia  nomas le echaron la salsa a la diabla y me lo dieron  que horrible que tengo que hacer extra y venir hacer un review porque siempre me gustaba venir aqu . Me quede sin palabras porque la prob   Espero ver el cocinero en el infierno conmigo  pinche culero.   I just took a bite of a completely raw fuxking fish. I m speechless for the shiiii they just pulled on me  it just makes me mad because I actually loved this place and location  but that cook must be on crack for bathing a raw fish with salsa and having the audacity to serve it to me. I ll be seeing his a   in hell with me.

I love this restaurant so much  The ladies always have such a positive attitude and coming here always helps me feel like home. Their restaurant is so cozy and the food is such a great price point  A party of 2 can eat for around  25 and I ve taken a party of 6 here for about  80 which isn t bad at all - especially considering the food portions  If you want authentic Mexican food this is the place to go
This is probably the worst place I have eaten in Austin. My boyfriend and I went around 2pm and were starving so this place really disappointed us.    Service was okay and prices are cheap.

Basic no-frills San Antonio-style Tex-Mex  and their best location. Big portions  low prices  simple tomato-y salsa  I love it. Everything is tasty and well-made and they have great service. When my uncle came to visit and asked for Tex-Mex I gave him a few options and he chose this one and just couldn t get over how good and simple everything was. Ignore the bougie low reviews here and go try out some awesome plain Tex-Mex.

Worst food ever ...Small hair in my plate undercooked shrimps i can say they must have microwave and served and most importantly michelada was the worst.lots of chili I cannot even taste my beer ...avoid going to arandas server did not even serve us water she forgot .poor quality and service.
I had to go all the way to Austin to get the perfect birthday burrito. The horchata was so refreshing in the heat. Our waitress was super nice. Also a good location next to congress st

Feels like a neighborhood place to me and it always seems like there are families or small groups of friends here to share a meal. This place isn t huge and has colorfully decorated high back benches and tables along the ways and larger tables in the middle. The food here has been consistently tasty.   If you re getting fajitas - don t expect big thick strips of beef or chicken. It s more like marinated chips of meat that are tender with food flavor. I also like the pastor and the guisada. The retried beans are a unusually lighter color but have a sweet savoriness that I really like. Add that with fresh clean crisp lettuce  tomato and avocado slices and it s a good meal. I also like the salsa because it unapologetically has a kick.   Service was friendly and courteous.
The service was great and the food across the board was flavorful and very authentic. Large portions make this easy to split. And  I loved the salsa
Local spots live on  I grew up in here on sunday mornings. Great food and people.

Didn t leave Austin before stopping by for another local fix.  Arandas was pretty good.  The prices are reasonable.  The salsa is delicious  but the tostada chips were not fresh.  I had the torta de pastor and my husband had the gordita.  The torta was ok.  I ve had better in El Paso.  Too much bread.  The pastor meat was delicious though. I tried the horchata because of a previous review  but I was disappointed.  It is made from a powered mix and not authentic.  We ll probably come back next time we re in Austin  but to try some other menu items.
Great price  food is really good. Can t beat 4.99 for a chorizo and egg plate that comes with potatoes and beans AND tortillas. Service was fast and friendly

The staff doesn t speak any English whatsoever. Nice staff  but it does concern me a little bit when the staff doesn t speak English in an English speaking environment. The food was good. I have no complaints on the food itself  however  the tortillas are NOT homemade. I can tell they are store bought. I find that interesting since this is a Mexican restaurant. I know this place comes up as Tex-Mex. Its not  it s an actual Mexican restaurant. The food doesn t resemble any Tex-Mex at all. Again  the food is good and I think it s just the right amount for a person. But Tex-Mex restaurants have taco salads  this place doesn t. I m really on the fence between rating this place a 4 or 3 star. But  because I m in a good mood  I ll give it a 4.
Food was good. Very authentic so authentic they didn t even know what mild salsa was. The salsa was very spicy but delicious  my poor little taste buds couldn t take the heat. Would definitely return
my bf and my favorite place to get authentic food and yummy drinks  definitely a hidden gem

So sorry but this place really has the worst tacos I have ever eaten  I order 3 crunchy tacos and they brought them with a crunchy HEB tortilla cold and disgusting nothing to do with a Mexican taco. At then end a fly got into my horchata and when I told the waiter she said they can t prevent this to happen and I think that is not the appropriate answer with the right actitud for a customer.  Definitely I will not recommend or come back.
It s friendly-it s the best homemade red salsa I ve ever had. The staff is friendly and the prices are good. Definitely worth a stop.

Wasn t really as impressed as our friends and other reviews made this place out to be. Maybe it s because we didn t come for breakfast  but either way this visit will be our only one. We had a quesadilla  pork burrito  chicken enchiladas. Okay if starving  lacked flavor.
This place is terrible. We went there for breakfast and the potatoes and eggs looked green. The tamales were made with cornbread. Very wrong for Mexican food. Never going back.

My husband and I went here today because Torchy s Taco parking situation wasn t great and we didn t feel like walking from multiple blocks to eat so we went down the road and saw this place and I must say  for the price  it was great  I got the pork burrito with double rice  the pork was flavorful but the tortilla was kind of hard to cut through. I ended up having to dump all of the meat out of the tortilla because my knife wouldn t cut it properly. The rice was bland but the flavor of the meat made it good  Our waitress was super quick and helpful during our meal

I liked the Gordita.  It was big  tasty  fresh and reasonably priced.  It s not your traditional Gordita but never the less  good.  The staff is wonderful and speak English.  They are attentive and friendly.  I recommend all around.

Came here on a night when I desperately wanted a cheap plate of food and a margarita  The dream  right   This place did not disappoint. Margaritas were delicious and our server was very kind. I got the enchiladas and they could have used some more seasoning but they weren t bad in general. I ll definitely be back.

If you need a quick fix of good and cheap Tex-Mex food this is the spot. They have really good breakfast tacos which wont burn a hole in your wallet. Never had bad customer service here they re all great from the servers to the owner. They have some of the best chips and salsa in Austin. I highly recommend the al pastor  beans  rice  burritos  horchata  and flan. That being said don t come in expecting authentic Mexican food because it s not this is a good and cheap Tex-Mex restaurant.

I have somehow managed to go here twice and hated it both times. The food is bland and the waiters hate their job. The first time there I tried the quesadillas which were not good and overall lacked flavor. The second time I got the flautas which were cold on the middle. The rice was gross and you could tell that it came from a can. The aguas frescas are made from powder and are not actual agua frescas. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant.
Damn good Tex-Mex - dirt cheap prices  Awesome salsas  Can t go wrong here. Good food  great service  awesome prices  The trifecta

How is this place listed at 4 stars   Food was bland. I m pretty sure the chili con queso was actually velveeta cheese.  Ordered a margarita  but were out.  This place is a dump and the bathrooms are disgusting.  Not sure how this place is in business.  But please beware-this place is nowhere close to a 4 star rating.

I had a four-dollar chicken gordita  little fattie   that tasted like heaven and completely filled me up. It was hot and fresh...made with high quality ingredients and perfectly seasoned. The chips and salsa are fabulous as well. The iced tea was fresh like it was made from mountain spring water. It was 11 30 on Saturday morning and we were seated immediately...our food was out within 5 minutes. We were one of only 2 or 3 non-Spanish speaking tables...our waitress seemed perfectly happy to lead us through some stilted Spanglish attempts at ordering. She was very friendly...and you pay at the counter  Please do NOT tell anyone about this awesome place.

Nice place  larger restaurant style setup with a full menu.  I had 2 tacos steak fajita  amp  2 tacos pastor. Pretty much the standard yum level of Mexican food  not mind blowing but satisfying and very good tasting. Didn t give 5 stars because the tacos aren t  taco trailer  level.  The place was clean and super friendly and attentive staff  even at 1130pm   By the way  the chips and salsa are very good. Will def be going back for more.

Just moved to Austin the staff was so sweet and amazing  Food was perfection  Enchiladas Verde s and horchata   I would totally come here again. And the price was great  And the food was fast  didn t wait long at all.

I can safely say I have eaten here more than most other restaurants in Austin. The food is super reasonably priced and regardless of how busy it is  the food is QUICK to your table. Not the strongest English speaking staff  but everyone there is super friendly. Make sure to get an horchata to go before you leave.

3 stars if you come here for dinner.  4 stars if you come here for breakfast.   The breakfast plates and tacos are definitely a bang for your buck  I mean 3 tacos for  3.75  yes please    The tortillas don t seem particularly homemade and the machacado was a little too beef-jerky in texture  but for the price point  I really can t complain.  The enchiladas were a little bit of a miss. For  7.50  that is only marginally cheaper than any other Tex-Mex place on S.1st that does it better. Enchilada sauce tasted straight out of a can  tortillas were chewy and rice was not flavorful. I think you would have a much better bet ordering something more authentic  like the carne guisada or caldo de res.   I like this little spot but will only be here for breakfast from now on. Note  Margarita machine was switched off Sunday around 6pm
Simple and bright  the food is great. Low prices. Second time here  and tried Migas and Huevos Rancheros. Family had chorizo. All delicious. Fresh salsa was great.

Part of the reason I like this place so much is the power of suggestion - the taqueria is Jalisco style  which is the neighboring state to Aguascalientes where some of my roots are buried.  Aside from that  I ve never been disappointed by the food.  I used to prefer Tapatia on Ben White  amp  Banister  but they are cash only.  Arandas  however  takes credit card  even though I often feel foolish putting  2.17 on my credit card for breakfast tacos.  Bring change for the jukebox  though   TIP  you don t have to order the breakfast tacos exactly as they list them  e.g. bean and cheese  potato and egg  etc.   I always order a bacon potato cheese and a nopalitos eggs  and they re more than happy to customize my tacos.

This place is just a few blocks from my house  and I m determined to find the best Mexican food I can in the area  so me and the girly decided to give them a go.  The place is nice  bright and clean. The wait staff  while short on English are all very friendly  The menu  both in English and Spanish  is uncomplicated and easy to make your mind up with.  The food... well  they have outstanding salsa  though the chips were on the stale side. I got the barbacoa and lengua plate  and both were bland. The beans and rice were tasty  so wrapping the meat in a tortilla with the veggies made it much more palatable... but really  unless you are just really not in the mood to look further - try some place else.

Best damn crispy chicken tacos in Austin. I like it simple sometimes and this place does it perfectly. The chicken has a great roasted flavor and is juicy.  The ladies are always really nice even when I try to order in Spanish for practice  hope I m not too terrible .   Huge bonus  Price tag  Lunch for 2 people with a drink around  14 with chips and salsa

Absolutely love this place  Have been coming here for years with my family they know us very well. As soon as they see us they put our appetizer in and the service is so fast  The girls there are amazing  And the price is right

Pretty darn awesome. Al Pastor seems like the perfect meat  BBQ spicy pork.   Had the combo plate with fajita meat and Al Pastor. the fajita beef was a bit chewy and the flour tortillas a bit stale. The Al Pastor made up for all that  The soda fountain is deceptive since when I ordered a coke  I ended up with a can.  Fast service. WiFi didn t work when I visited yesterday  locked on but no Internet .  Like I said Al Pastor made up for all the rough edges...

Really good food.  Original and different from the other Mexican restaurants on the street   which is a good thing. I had the cheese enchiladas with salsa verde   he had migas and tacos al pastor. The chicharons were tender.

This is my favorite Tex-Mex joint in Austin.  It is also the best of the 5 Arandas locations.  My favorites are the fajita beef tacos and their cheese  or chicken  enchiladas with verde sauce.  These are some of the best tacos and enchiladas I ve had.  The price is obviously great and this location is the nicest with big wooden tables.  I ve been to the original location on E 7th many times and the other 3 locations as well but the food for some reason is much better at this location on S. 1st.  They stay open pretty late but we always call to make sure they are still open because sometimes they seem to close early.

When I came here for breakfast I asked for a second serving of the refried beans  they were SOO good  I m used to leaving the typical breakfast place feeling uncomfortably full so the reasonable portions were bittersweet.

Came in here this morning for some breakfast tacos... Meh...  The good  We were able to sit down right away They brought our first chips and salsa quickly The owner   manager was friendly The final price  The Meh...  The service was slow - took quite a while to get a refill on chips and salsa The breakfast tacos.  We had a bacon  egg  and cheese  and it was basically slightly over cooked eggs  a little brown   with a strip of bacon on top  and shredded cheese on top of that  not cold  but still clearly in shredded form .  It s obvious that breakfast tacos are NOT their specialty.  I also had an egg and beans taco  which was OK. The service was slow - took almost 10 minutes to get our check after asking for it.  With SO many mexican options in Austin  I probably won t be back.

You goddamn bastards.  I have eaten your Tortas 4 times in the last week.  Can t you take pity on a simple white boy who doesn t know how to control himself   Delicious  dirt-cheap food and...  UNLIMITED HORCHATA REFILLS  Argh  It s so delicious  and so many calories   They also speak spanish to me when I come in... I dig that.

I m going to agree with Niki A on this one  whoa  I was a little surprised by the table of vaqueros drinking Especials  Especiales   at ten o  clock in the morning.  After that little awakening  it shouldn t have come as a shocking surprise that my waitress wasn t super comfortable with her command of English  and I basically ordered by pointing at things on the menu here.  This place is flat authentic  no way around it  and as haphazard as the dining experience is  breakfast did hit the spot and was out in a jiffy.  To their credit  Taqueria Arandas recognizes that they get a healthy dose of the local Hispanic population as well as a regular audience of gueros  and the menu is broken down into English and Spanish pronunciations under tiny flags of each country.  There were loads of things that I wanted to try  but this go round I settled for three breakfast tacos  they re 90 cents each...I haven t seen a cent symbol on a menu in I don t know when  and a soda.  Ultimately the three stars is more for the fact that the place is sort of randomly laid out and paying out was a pain. About a half dozen of us sort of stood around and waited while the gal at the check out counter slowly made progress. But everyone was super sweet here  and the people watching was solid enough that I d go back just to experience the authenticity of a world which I m allowed to periodically visit.  And it reminded me why I m amped that I live here.  Because lurking behind some doors is an adventure  culinary or otherwise  always waiting and ready.

After a night doing semi bad things in very strange places  I ended up on the southside  with a few friends  after no sleep  too much beer and a hangover.    Suddenly I had a brilliant cure for said hangover- Breakfast Tacos   Luckily for us  we were able to stumble across the street in our pajamas   well some of us  and sit at a really authentic  delicious  inexpensive joint. I had two tacos and hash browns ...but they were so filling I could only eat one. The hash browns were amazing too. They kind of confused our order a whole lot  but fixed it very quickly.   Now I wont lie and say that Taqueria Arandas was the complete and total hangover cure  but it did make me feel human enough to attempt the drive back to north Austin.  Great night. Great Tacos.

Would you rate authentic American food a 4 or 5 star simply for being authentic if you lived in France  If not  then you should probably think twice about doing the same for a Mexican food restaurant in America. Bad food in Mexico doesn t translate to good food in America. That s exactly what Taqueria Arandas is.   If the above isn t clear enough for you  let me spell it out as frankly as I know how  the food and environment are authentic at Taqueria Arandas  but the food is terrible. There s a reason you pay  2 for a couple of chicken tacos with free  bottomless chips and salsa. Hint  it isn t because the owner is generous  but it might have something to do with cheap products and not having a chef in sight.  I ordered a pretty simple dish - cheese enchiladas with red sauce. What came out of the  kitchen  was a microwaved plate containing three soggy tortillas  rolled around approximately a half-ounce each of nacho cheese sauce  and floating in what science would call a solution of grease and melted nacho cheese sauce. If there was any lycopene present it was in trace amounts and would take a team of CSI folks to detect it. Sadly  I m not exaggerating. Measuring with my fork laid on it s side  the artery-clogging grease-bath was 3-out-of-4 prongs deep - or about a half-inch. The sides of refried beans and rice abandoned their roles as sides and instead took on new lives as beaches to the cheese-lake in my plate.  Because I hate biased reviews that selectively include or omit information for the sake of bettering their argument  I d like to say that their slightly-flaky-in-a-good-way chips are served warm and they aren t stingy with them  and the salsa has some kick to it  unlike the tomato juice you re served at a lot of places. The prices are  as preached about in the other reviews  cheaper than I feel comfortable paying for meat that I plan on eating.   If you re broke or on a tight budget  have an insatiable craving for Mexican food regardless of the quality  and live in the area  give it a shot. Otherwise  I recommend passing this one up. Surely Austin has better Mexican food to offer at a fair price.

I hate to place a crap review on small  family friendly  restaurants that are unbelievably cheap  but frankly  I can t NOT share this information.  I live in Travis Heights and have been going to Arandas for years.  Not every day  but definitely once a month on average.  Cheap food that is good  cheap beer  relatively friendly folks.   It s always been a winner.    That said  the rest of the review will make you a little queezy  so if you re sensitive to disgusting food stories  stop reading NOW.  I ll keep the story short and concise  saving commentary for y all.  The last time I went there  I got halfway through my burrito and found a fingernail floating in my mouth.  I was in disbelief.  Did I somehow chew my OWN fingernail that day without knowing it   So I looked up  and standing just over the food was the expo  or person who carries the food from the kitchen to your table  standing over the kitchen window chewing his nails and spitting them haphazardly out.  I m not accusing him of intentionally spitting his gnawed fingernails into the food of paying customers  but in my case  his fingernail was spit directly into my burrito.  Honestly  I left cash on the table and left without saying a word.  I know I should have complained  but I knew with certainty that I would never be able to visit this place again  and I was so irate that I d have made a scene if I was to start talking about it.  I still get nauseous just driving past it.

For posole  I go to Taqueria Arandas. They have posole on the weekends. It s a spicy broth with chunks of juicy roasted pork and hominy - large  soft corn kernels. It s usually served with a side of tortillas -- corn  flour or crispy tostada  and shredded lettuce  lime wedges and chopped onions.  I love Arandas  Pierna Burrito. No rice  no cheese. Refried beans  juicy pork  lettuce  tomatoes  avocado. The perfect burrito. I also lived on them when I was broke because they can feed you for half a day and cost less than three bucks.

Taqueria Arandas.  Those words are a hangover cure by themselves - repeat them while consuming the only-served-on weekend-mornings menudo  and you ll turn into freaking Super wo man.  Seriously.  Everything I ve ever eaten at this joint is exquisitely good.  Authentic.  No BS  just good TexMex made by real TexMexicans.  And supercheap  too - damn close to everything is under  10  and a lot is under  5   I heart you  Taqueria Arandas.  I know you heart me back.  Let s heart together in my tummy.

So why is it that people assume that they are going to get  authentic  mexican food at a taqueria here in Austin  Even taquerias in Mexico are not that  authentic   but we still go to them. Why  Because we enjoy the culture of eating at a taqueria - sitting at the bar of stand hunched over stuffing our face with tacos as the salsa drips down our hand  the small napkins that can only be used once  wiping our noses because of the hot salsa  drinking manzana  not worrying about what anyone thinks as we eat  and finally the satisfaction of being full and only having to dish out a couple of pesos. DAMN I love it   Try not to overanalyze the taquerias here in Austin  but become a regular at one where you know the servers and cooks. I happen to prefer Taqueria Arandas because I have never been disappointed by their food  both in taste and quantity   and I know I won t have to drop  20 eating there. If you do go  order the Al Pastor and Lengua combination plate. Provecho

I really don t understand most other Yelpers problems with this place. Yeah  it does resemble the interior of a  high school cafeteria  and most of the waitresses don t have a firm grasp on English but what were you expecting  Just don t come here  go to Manuel s or any of the other numerous yuppie Tex-Mex options in this town. This is a no frills   mostly  authentic taqueria that serves simple Mexican fare at a very low cost. And after living here  how do you not know what a few simple word in Spanish mean  The menu isn t complicated.   I mainly come here for the breakfast tacos and plates. They re not the best I ve ever had and the corn tortillas aren t anything to write home about but they re cheap and satisfying. The service is fairly quick  waitresses are very friendly and attentive  and you move on about your day. It s not a place you come for the atmosphere. It s basically the equivalent of an American diner. I was a bit annoyed that you have to pay 99 cents for chips before 11am but I didn t really want them that early anyways and the breakfast tacos were more than filling enough.   I d recommend this place if you re near it in the morning but I wouldn t go out of my way. There are plenty of other locations around town and we just happened to be by this one.

The chicken taquitos are wonderful  except when you get some kinda nastychikkinsurprise  which is about 17  of the time  which is why i gave them 4 stars instead of 5.   But my fave is to get enchiladas with two cheese and one chikkin  or one cheese and two chikkin  if i m feelin  lucky   with LOTS of salsa verde.  the barbacoa is great too.  the tea is like water.  but this place is consistent  cheap  and great.

Shit  guys. Why have I lived next to here for this long and never been here before  We got SO MUCH FOOD for  14 and I m legit about to have the last of the leftovers tonight for dinner...one full week later. I love the chips  but they re obviously from a bag so I m not sure where they get off on charging extra for more than one small basket  but at least the surcharge keeps me from gorging myself on empty carbs before I get the chance to gorge myself on fatty meat  fatty beans  and fatty cheese. Fatty.  The food was delicious  but proceed with caution if you get chicken because I found a tiny bone in my pile of meat. Just big enough that I probably would ve swallowed it sideways if I hadn t happened to slow down my unbridled gluttony for like half a second.  And because there are no signs inside telling you what to do  pick a seat and someone will bring you menus and chips. If you walk up and grab your own chips because there s not an employee in sight  the guys in the kitchen will stare at you with a strange expression on their faces for most of the time you re there.  Next time I go  I plan on getting down on that al pastor because the pictures on here are making my mouth water.  99c surcharge if your food is ordered to-go.

I go here at the end of the month because it is cheap and the servings are big. I don t know what it is about Mexican restaurants  but the real  authentic ones usually have gigantic servings. Anyway  I get their  3 burrito  a big gut bomb. But  it is good  if you get the steak and not the chicken. It doesn t come with rice and beans  though. Not that I can eat all of it anyway  but I still like them with the meal.  The other things I get here are the breakfast plates or the soups. The caldo de res or pollo are very good when you are sick. And it may sound weird  but if you have a cold  eat these first thing in the morning and it is seriously a medical miracle. It always works for me

So here s a tip for when you go to Arandas  which you should.  Just because the torta is under  3 does NOT mean it is small.  So don t think you need to order a side of rice and beans and an avocado taco to make a whole meal of it.    There is nothing remotely healthy for you at Arandas  and for this  I love them.  Also  get the horchata.

I see that there are a number of positive reviews for this establishment  so I have to wonder what went wrong for me. My boyfriend  amp  I went for dinner on a Saturday night  and perhaps we should have taken a clue from the plentiful parking that this was not a prime destination. Main observations   1  The chips were incredibly stale. Store-bought chips are bad enough  but we re talking I-opened-those-Santitas-chips-for-Cinco-de-Mayo-and-now-it s-late-September stale.  2  The atmosphere can only be compared to a high school cafeteria.  3  The staff acted overwhelmingly annoyed by our presence from the get-go. I m sorry I took French in high school or else I would certainly try to order in the appropriate language  but please don t glare at me for not understanding you when you continue to speak Spanish to me.  4  Food was mediocre  but definitely not terrible. I had enchiladas and bf had migas  and we both agreed that if not for the atmosphere  the food alone and dirt cheap prices would probably lure us in on occasion.  All in all  if every other Mexican restaurant in South Austin burned down  I suppose I would return to Taqueria Arandas  5. And I d be damn sure to bring some Spanish flashcards with me.

The food is almost EXACTLY like it is at the other location  stassney  that I go to at least once a week.   I thought for sure there would be some differences  but if I had closed my eyes I would have thought I was right back on Stassney.   Good service  great food  and this building is really open and nicely decorated. It was a nice change of pace  but I m glad I didn t have to give up the great taste I love so much    You can t beat this food as far as I m concerned....amazing salsa  homemade chips  and a pork taco that makes me wish I d known about them all my life.

Rock solid inexpensive mexican food.   Waitstaff is very friendly. It helps if you speak a little Spanish. C mon people . . .  David  you live in Texas . . . you should at the very least be able to greet people and order food in Spanish.  My favorite is the chicken burrito. It s cheap  it s the perfect size  it has avocado in it and no rice. Perfection as far as I m concerned.   The fact that you can get a satisfying meal for about  5 including drink is a godsend. Please open one of these in LA. I beg you.

This place is really great for breakfast  and super low prices. The tacos are inexpensive and wonderful  I didn t particularly care for the menudo but tortas gorditas and tacos are definitely good here.

Where else can you go for breakfast and see half the people in the restaurant drinking a beer with their food   I love this place. Sure  the atmosphere is a bit janky and there is a non-existent parking lot  but the food is good and cheap.   I like the beef fajita plate. Order it with some grilled green onions  or  cebollitas.  The salsa is a bit on the thin side  but it gets a little spicy and then you can t stop eating it.   I wouldn t even call this tex-mex  y all. Arandas is the closest thing to the real deal Mexican food you can get in Austin. They get a bonus for their excellent selection of delicious Mexican candy

I went here for lunch yesterday hoping to find a cheap lunch that was good Mexican food. I picked it because it was close to me and the yelp reviews looked pretty good.   NOT GOOD  and I am pretty sure I was overcharged.   I got a chicken quesadilla. It came with cheese and chicken and it was 1 tortilla folded in half.  3 for really soggy chicken that I am pretty sure was pink. I also got a queso for  2.50. It was pretty good. I was trying to get something that would cover up the taste of the stale chips. I also got a soda from a can and a praline to help get that chicken taste out of my mouth. The praline was stale like they had got it in 2005. Yikes.  I ended up driving home before going back to work to brush and floss my teeth so I could get that gross taste of the chicken out.   8.50 plus  1.50 tip    10. No thanks.

For 6.95 I got 5 filling mini tacos. Fast service  cheap food and totally worth your time as long as you are not expecting something fancy. Looking forward to my next visit and trying out the rest of the menu.

I rate this place high because the food fits the price and the hour.  Don t compare it with Manuel s downtown... both can be 5 star if you respect the differences.  Went Saturday night 10pm for the weekend Pozole.  I know this soup well  had it at over 20 places.  it was excellent.  Big bowl  great flavor  great contents.   My wife was a bit shocked with the lingering cinnamon taste in the Pozole  but I told her that was a lesson in differences of recipes     A web search did indeed reveal that it s known to happen.  Great service on our visit. I ve been to their other locations  you may not like everything on the menu - but it s home made and they have their own style. I ll let other reviews tell you other things.

I LOVE THIS PLACE  Can I say that any louder  I m getting up and standing on my chair to proclaim to the entire world in my biggest voice.... This is my favorite place in the whole wide world.  Everything is good. The coffee. The salsa. The beans. These three things  IMHO  are the foundation of any good Mexican restaurant. Without these  you might as well go home and eat soggy corn flakes.  SIDE BAR  I love tortillas  especially handmade corn tortillas. Aranda s does not make tortilla s. They don t even use yellow corn tortillas. Bad  very bad. For that  I should take away two stars. But I can t. Everything else is so freakin good  I am forced to overlook this tragedy. If they made their own corn tortilla s  I would pitch a tent in their parking lot and beg for a job washing dishes just so I could eat there for B  L and D.  My all-time fave is the huevos rancheros. I know  I know.... all you barbacoa and lengua freaks... what s so special about huevos rancheros  Well  I doctor my HR.   First  as soon as we take our seat  I hear my homies in the kitchen chopping my chilies  getting ready to toss them on the grill for a few minutes while one of the lovely servers brings hot  also a very important factor  cups of coffee to the table with a basket of chips and at least two bowls of salsa.  A coupla times  they didn t even ask what I wanted to eat  but instead brought a plate of HR to the table before we had a chance to polish off the second bowl of salsa. Gracias hermanas   So anyway  as the place is filling up with a cloud of chili fumes  most of the customers near the kitchen are coughing and gagging for air. The girls all laugh and point at the big gringo with the shit-eating grin on his face.  When my HR arrives  along with a plate of finely chopped and grilled jalapeno chilies  I dump all the chilies on top of the HR  and dump a whole bowl of salsa on top  as well. Now it s ready.  SIDE BAR  Chili Heads will understand this  It s very difficult to get HOT  anything  at a public eatery. I always laugh at the places with little red chilies next to the menu items noting it s  HOT  factor. Huh  guess again  One must go to great lengths to achieve the desired amount of heat. I m talking Scoville Units here. The more the better. And the hot coffee on top of it only enhances the burn. Ah  tasty.  Anywho  when the egg yoke mixes with the salsa  ranchero  beans and chilies... hold the phone  Clarence..... I need a minute. Good  God y all  it s heaven on earth.  Regarding other menu items. The al pastor is fantastic. It s good any way you like it. The pozole is top notch.  When you Austinites go to Aranda s  5  please tell Estella and the girls  the Big Gringo says hi

Chicken Burrito and Ice Tea   around  5  with tip   Solid.  This is perhaps the nicest of the various Arandas locations around town. I find my standard chicken burrito is a little better here than at my old regular location on Burnet.  Stick with the basics here and you should be happy. Tacos  burritos  done.

I m pretty addicted to this place.  Some of the best lengua  beef tongue  I ve ever had  coupled with a unique salsa and fresh corn tortillas  and ooh mamacita that Horchata always hits the spot   QUICK service by extremely nice waitresses  who don t speak a lick of English -- a good thing  makes Arandas a hit.   I really need to branch out and try some of the other menu items  I stick to the Pastor  Lengua and Barbacoa platos   but every one of my many food experiences at Arandas has been outstanding.

I only stop in here for lunch. I think it s a great lunch spot. I always get the Al Pastor Burrito. It is very flavorful. Queso and guac are pretty good.   Price is awesome. One of the best values in the city.

We go here all the time. Cheapest breakfast in austin.  3 or less if you get there before 10am. And its pretty damn good  and a nice portion of food. My favorite is the chorizo and eggs. All breakfast plates come with potatoes  beans  and tortillas. For lunch I really like the chicken burrito with added avocado. Again  3.   The chips are always stale  but we ignore that because we always love the food.    The price is just unbeatable. Best place for  morning afters   hangovers  and when you don t want to cook but can t break the bank.   I really hate that I read that fingernail review.... I will just have to chew carefully because I will not be giving up my  randas any time soon.

I used to love this place. Loved the ambiance  the people  the kind of food  the prices.  Last time I ate there I got THE worst case of food poisoning I have ever had in my life. After hours of rather intense suffering finally went to the emergency room and had to pay over  200 for a GI cocktail which finally made me feel better. There was no question this is where I got the food poisoning. It was the only possibility that day. I won t eat there again.

Chips and salsa as soon as you enter.      The food is fresh and they give you plenty of tortillas.  I had a rough one last night and for 3.25.....I got a fat ass plate of migas that knocked the poisons right out of me.  Any of the meats are good.....but i like the al pastor and the beef fajita.....    Good value  quick  affordable.....and I love watching dudes drink Negro Modelo at breakfast.     The horchata is what dreams are made of.     Pwn on intertronz phans.

The price and quickness give it 3 stars.  I went for breakfast tacos during one of those - still half drunk  halfway hungover mornings.  I needed grease and eggs STAT  and out they came.  Then  we got ignored.  I took the boy s car keys and sat in the car with the air conditioning blasting while he paid up the bill.  I wouldn t go if I was craving something deliciously tasty  but I would if I was in the need for quick breakfast tacos in the area.

3.25 got me three fluffy savory scrambled eggs with bell pepper and chilli  delicious refried beans  home fries and 3 tortillas. Menudo needs way MORE chili  menudo should not be pink  having said that it was still good and I finished the bowl THE VIBE - Lots of OAs  original Austinites  from the neighborhood here....old Mexican American families that despite the rising taxes and influx of new people seem to be staying put and keeping 78704 old school. It was kind of cool and comforting to be amongst them listening to them greet each other in Spanish and English....old and young. I have to say that this is what makes South Austin so awesome the merge of the different food and cultures...... THE FINAL SAY - Good standard Mexican American food with lots of personal service

What can I say...   I love this place   Opens early and closes late.  I ve only tried their tacos so far  as I tend to go there when I want to eat something cheap and tasty after a long night of debaucherous activities.  I ll get around to trying out some of their other offerings and updating this review someday.  I ve tried every all the various tacos they have and my favorite so far has been the taco al pastor.  The pork is juicy and perfectly seasoned with no chewy  rubbery bits like you tend to get at other restaurants.  I have yet to try their flour tortillas  but the corn tortillas are outstanding.  Served fresh  warm  fluffy  and flavorful  they re some of the best I ve encountered in Austin.    The service is pretty decent too.  It s self-seating  so grab a table and within moments a waiter waitress will be there with a basket of deliciously fresh chips and salsa  ready to take your order.  Once you ve made your order the food generally takes no longer than 10 minutes or so to come out.  Drinks  chips  and salsa are refilled frequently without being obtrusive.  Payment is simple as with most taquerias  just go to the counter  tell them what you ordered  and they ll ring you up.  Their tacos are very inexpensive at  1.60 a pop so it s cheap and easy to have a tasty and filling lunch for under  5  especially considering the unlimited free chips and salsa  something I feel should be mandatory in every Tex-Mex restaurant in Austin.  Overall a great place.  How can you go wrong with two tasty tacos  chips and salsa  and a bigass glass of water for  3.20   tax and tip   It beats the hell out of Taco Cabana for a Sunday morning post-party taco fix.  It s just a shame there aren t any locations within walking distance of campus otherwise I d be eating there a lot more often.

Arandas... my late night taco dinner.   If I cannot come up with dinner options because I get off work late this is where I go. They have delicious cheap tacos. The beans are good  with dash of salsa  and while I am not a rice fan the Spanish rice here is quite good.   I generally order the pastor tacos  they are generally spot on  sometimes it doesn t have enough pineapple flavor. I can also get them on flour or corn tortillas. I have found the pastor to be good on flour while I prefer the barbacoa  or guisada on corn.   I don t really care for the chips they use  but the salsa is thick and flavorful. Also  I think they should switch from can soda to fountain drinks but that is just a reflection on their business model.   I think the most underrated item on their menu are the burritos. They are massive and super cheap. I was really surprised at the amount of meat which was inside  when I saw the size I assumed I was going to be overwhelmed by filler. Definitely something to consider if you are starving or considering getting something you can get 2 meals out of. And they conveniently cut it in half for easy rationing.   I have also had the torta and while it was quite good it was pretty much a standard issue torta  but then again that s why it is essentially a Mexican hamburger.
Great authentic breakfast tacos  Excellent price  good service and no wait. Would definitely return

This place is pretty good...it s a little more authentic than I m used to but I was very happy with the food and decently happy with the service. We came in on a Wednesday night around 7pm and they were dead so we got in  sat down  and were greeted quickly  in Spanish originally but we had to tell her we didn t speak it well enough . I got the steak fajitas and my friend got the enchiladas and we were happy with them. They brought the food out at different times  which was odd but that was okay. They kept our drinks refilled while we were eating  but after we were done it got busy out of no where. When we got there  there were two tables  including us  and as we were eating  three-quarters of the tables filled up and with just two servers  they got overwhelmed. We waited and waited and waited for our check so we just walked to the register to pay. That was disappointing but I understood since they were buy. All in all  I liked the food and the server was friendly so I d be back if I wanted something a little more authentic  but I m still looking for good gringo-Mexican food.

I love this place   I usually get the combo plate with chicken and beef. It s one of the more expensive items on the menu  but after drink and tip  it s still only like 8 or 9 bucks.    Most of the employees will talk to you in Spanish  but most  if not all  know English too. And if you have a problem with someone speaking to you in Spanish  maybe you should open your mind a little before you go to a Mexican restaurant   Cause this ain t no Taco Bell.   As a lot of other people have said  the service here is really great. And I don t know how late this place is open  but it s open pretty darn late.   Next time you re looking for a good  cheap Mexican place  go here. I ve also eaten at the location off Manchaca and Stassney  and I like that one too. But this location definitely has a nicer building.   Seriously  try this place out.

We don t know wtf-Mexican food you Austin-hippies have been eating  but Taqueria Arandas had the  blandest tasting Mexican food we ve ever had. Taco Bell had more flavor than this place.  Following Yelper advice and after reading the great reviews  we were really psyched about going here. Especially to fulfill our Mexican food craving    I ordered the lengua and Curry Lover 1 ordered two tortas. We had to ask for more salsa to douse our food with  since they were flavorless. I do admit I liked the tortillas  but I like HEB tortillas  so that doesn t say much... I don t know if it was an off night for them  or what -- but I was sorry we came.   I thought I was eating healthy food  since it tasted like nothing  but we all know that Mexican food at places that don t speak English definitely are not on the healthy food spectrum.  The waitresses were great though    Anyways  this is the first time the Yelp community has let me down. I hope this never happens again.  P.S. While sitting here typing this up  I can hear both our stomach s making odd gurgling sounds.

The food is a basic regional Mexican food. At one point this was a very economical place to eat at  it isn t that way anymore. If I am going to spend around  8 I will go to Polvos and for a couple dollars more get much more food and better too. There is also a little problem with the wait staff  they usually can t speak English which isn t a problem in itself but they tend to give the most basic service to Caucasians. And before you call me a racist  understand I have been eating there for 12 years and once had a brutal food poisoning...but I kept going back. So  overall..its an ok place..but there are better. I would suggest a Tostado burrito or Torta. One should do ya. The breakfast specials are cheap modest but reasonable.
Bought 24 tacos this morning for  21  without tip .  Everyone loved them.  You will too.  Potato and chorizo taco had egg in it too  and was awesome.

Food was great. Not from this location but I have had it at different locations. I never go on yelp but Jesus. This was the worst service of my life. I waited on my order for 20 minutes and left. Never got the food. They kept serving everyone around me and when I asked them if I was in the wrong section or needed to do something different they kept talking about the news. Seriously this is the worst location in all of Texas. The franchise as a whole is great. This location in beyond awful. Went to Chapala off oltorf.  Had my food ready in 1 2 the time I waited. They were packed. This taqueria arandas is really awfully ran. Management is 99  of the issue.

I recently stopped in the Taqueria Arandas  5 for my first time. Even though I ve lived just up the street from this place I had never been but there always seemed to be a steady flow of customers so I assumed it was a solid choice.     Having now been there and tried it I would rate them as  fair  but not much more. The food is decently priced and is the typical cuisine you would expect from your average Mexican food joint. The service was good  and the food that we had was alright  just nothing to write home about.       If you re in the neighborhood and are looking for great Mexican food  you might look elsewhere  but for the price  I suppose this would be an option if you re on a budget.

Ordered to go  tortillas both flour and corn are straight from the package. We ordered huevos Ranchero and asked for our eggs over medium and they came out over hard  no run to the yolk at all which was very disappointing. Ordered a side of rice and it had absolutely no flavor.  The best thing out of the entr e was the actual Ranchero sauce.  Will not be going back.
Love love love  Best coffee  juevos rancheros  and tortas  Service with a smile   The price is RIGHT

I stopped in for lunch one day and had a great lunch    They have a nice  bright dining area and I was able to get a table right away. I ordered two tacos the carnitas  pork  and barbacoa. They come with onions and cilantro. I had them on corn tortillas. They were both delicious although the pork one was my favorite.   The salsa was actually very good here too. Normally I don t like the salsa but this stuff was good.   When I was ready to go they hadn t brought me my check but as I ve been going to more of these small taco places that seems to be the norm. You just go to the register and they cash you out.   My lunch was under  5 with a can of Diet Coke. You can t get much better than that  I enjoyed it and will go again.

Simple.  Try the aguacate  avacado  tostado and the taco and have a meal for less than 5 bucks. The salsas are killer.  I love it  but I don t go as often as I want. The portions are huge and the food is decadent.

This is my first Yelp review  so please ...be gentle.  This has been one of my favorite go-to places in the city for almost five years now. When my boyfriend and I can t really decide on what we re in the mood for  we usually end up going here. The food is consistently delicious  the service lands in that perfect area between obtrusive and lackadaisical  and a party of four can eat very comfortably for under  20.  I tend to rate a Tex-Mex place by how good the rice is and their s is no-frills and flavorful  a lot like the establishment. Try the torta cubana with milanesa and a side of guacamole - it hasn t let me down yet.

Cheap Late night eats. We were here on a Wed night at 11 15 the place was empty but the service was friendly and attentive. My fiancee and I both ordered a fajita beef burrito and two chicken tacos. SO much food - Next time we ll probably just split a burrito and have one chicken taco each. The burritos are huge - packed with flavorful meat  beans  avocado  lettuce  and tomatoes. The tacos were literally the most delicious chicken tacos we ve ever had. Shredded chicken with lots of flavor  limes  lettuce   amp  tomato. Homemade tortillas. Great chips. Decent salsa. Great prices - I think the massive burritos were only 3 something a piece. We ll definitely be back next time we re craving late night tacos - or for breakfast  Their breakfast menu looked fantastic - and runs from 7am to 11am.  Cons  No fountain drinks. Soda comes in cans. They do  however  have margaritas  amp  beer - but we didn t try this time.
I love this place ... the people are the friendless. The food is phenomenal. It s very clean and great for a date or a big party. If there was 10 star I woukd give it a 10

I have been going to this place for over 10 years. I have had a lot of the items they offer here and can t remember anything I ve ordered being  bad . The Torta s are excellent. But I go out of my way to come to this place for one dish that I have eaten here hundreds of times. A dish this place does better than ANY other Mexican food place I have ever been too in the United States. I will eat a raw habanero if anyone can point me to a place that serves a better Chicken Flauta plate.   Most places take a fried corn tortilla  put some chicken in it  and fry it again. I think the secret to these flauta s is starting with a raw corn tortilla  adding the chicken  and then pan frying. You can tell because the center is soft  not like a piece of chicken in a hard chip. When you add the lettuce  tomato  lime  HALF an avocado  rice and beans you have THE BEST FLAUTA PLATE in the U.S.  -1 star for beef enchilada s. Never had them myself  but my girl had them and they were gross.
First time here  cheap  but really good food. Never ran out of tea  chips so salsa.. Friendly staff. 1 bad thing i had to pay for queso.. should be free with the chips salsa but o well...

I ve had a few different types of tacos  chicken  beef  etc.  and they re decent  but the al Pastor is always solid. The quality varies from okay to great  different cooks    but when it is dialed in this is the best al Pastor taco I ve had in Austin.  I m usually good for 3 tacos w chips and salsa. Unfortunately  I tend to get two al Pastor and try something new for the 3rd. Stick to 3 al Pastor on corn  flour is good  but nothing beats good corn tortillas  and you ll be all set. Tacos are  1.65 and the chips and salsa are free. The chips are mediocre  but the salsa is pretty good.

This is definitely my favorite place to get tacos. It s authentic mexican food and incredibly cheap.  Free chips and salsa as soon as you sit down. Sometimes the chips are stale  but it doesn t even matter because the salsa is so good.   My sister and I come to this location ALL the time. The waitresses are so friendly and only speak in spanish  which I adore about this place. It s never busy and the service is really fast. You can easily be in and out in 30 minutes if need be.

I went to Taqueria Arandas for the first time last week with my roommate. My friend was the only non-Hispanic person there  so I took that as a good sign right off the bat. The waitress came right up to the table to bring us chips and salsa  which were okay  and then back about a minute later to take our food order. Obviously we hadn t had time to look over the menu so we asked for a few minutes. She came back in probably 3  and that s where I m taking away a star. I don t like to be rushed  So I got one chicken  one barbacoa and one al pastor taco  while vegetarian roomie ordered the cheese enchiladas. All of my tacos were FANTASTIC  especially the al pastor. I am a taco fiend and will definitely be back for more. My roommate said the enchiladas were a little too cheesy for her taste and didn t finish her plate. I tried them and thought they were pretty tasty  for just cheese that is .  I ll be bringing my dad here soon as he is always on the hunt for great Mexican food. I ll let you know what he thinks.

Found this place from a recommendation from the front desk at our hotel and the food was really good.  Salsa actually had some kick and the chips were really light and fresh.  All 3 of us really enjoyed our meals.

Ok  this is the first time I ve written a bad review with even the slightest ounce of guilt bc the staff was wicked nice  however the food.....Jesus  um....-cue disturbed look in complete and utter silence while focusing on the nothingness in a VERY dark corner- .........just.....no. Typically   I prefer for my sober dining excursions to take me to places that will provide me with fairly healthy entree options  but I can forego such a preference in order to experience a new venue. It s a risk  if I don t google or yelp it   but I can be a gambling woman on occassion and if the menu selection fails me completely......well  I ll just have a liquid dinner and make a total asshole out of myself. Whiskey on an empty stomach  Always an amaaaaazing default plan. Now  we all know it can be rather challenging to find something healthy at a Mexican food restaurant  but when all else fails....POLLO  That being said  I ordered  Dos tacos de pollo con corn tortillas   which is exactly how I made my request bc they didn t speak much english and honestly  I thoroughly enjoy such a thing. It gives me a chance to stay fresh on my espanol and even though my pronunciation probably leaves me sounding like Peggy from  King of the Hill   f  amp   it  as long as I m understood I feel delicious and foreign. Now  moving on to what WASN T delicious  but sadly enough was probably the most foreign thing I ve ever come across....in a really bad  psyche-damaging kind of way. When my tacos came out  I couldn t help but notice the MASSIVE pile of lettuce on top hiding the true contents of the tacos. I m talking  like....half of a pound. Unusual  Shit  I d say so. When I grabbed my fork and slooooowly pushed the lettuce aside to reveal the feared mystery beneath I immediately thought   Holy Mother Mary of God......what...what the SHIT is in these tortillas   It was like a cheesy horror film where some stupid skank starts screaming in the background while the camera continuously zooms in and out. The piles of shredded carcass lying across my tortillas were comprised of an assortment of colors ranging from  dead  to  alive   bone shards of various length  then polished off w  orange grease and chunks of fat that glistened in the afternoon sky. Son-of-a....-amanda pauses to control regurgitating  yet in this case  pretty much recreating  the taco all over her laptop- Seriously  SERIOUSLY  I mean  what was I even looking at  Chicken  Bird  Rat  Perro .....Pedro  There is no doubt in my mind that the elusive  chicken  that was chosen for this meal was found in a field  beaten w  PVC pipe  de-feathered  Psht  if it even HAD feathers  which if so....thank you  Arandas  for at least doing that much   thrown into the grinder....whole....then placed on my damn tortillas immediately afterwards. I m not gonna lie..........I ate one of the tacos bc I was starving my ass off  but even though I was still ridiculously hungry  I merely nibbled at the surrounding tortilla on the straggling  Chainsaw Massacre  taco feeling really guilty and disturbed by what I had let myself consume. I ll never know what it was  but I do know that I ll never feel right about that meal.   Therapy could be in order. That  or my mother is going to have to get used to really bizarre phones calls from me in the middle of night where I mutter incomprehensible things in both english and spanish while crying profusely.  UPDATE  2 00am strikes and Amanda is sick-as-hell ARG

When I go here  they know before we tell them that we want 2 chicken tostadas each  an iced tea  green salsa and extra red  but they let us say so in broken Spanish before bringing out the predictably fresh  large and satisfying plates.  I would give it 5 stars based on that experience alone  but I ve tried some other dishes with mixed results.  I no longer bother experimenting - the tostadas never fail me.
this is a nice authentic tex mex restaurant. Good quality food and great service.

When you hear about those great  hole in the wall  kind of places that are better than the flashier  more expensive restaurant - think of this place.  The menu does not have as much variety  but it is good  it s fresh and it s somewhere you can go every week rather than just for special occasions.  That s my kind of restaurant.

Today s lunch at Arandas was  2.91 before tip  I had the Chicken Tostada which comes with beans  cheese  lettuce  avocado and sour cream  and chicken  of course  .   I am gluten free and I ve asked them about it in the past  se habla espanol . I don t ask about the gluten every time  so if you are hyper-vigilant  which you should be   I recommend checking to see if there is any trigo  wheat   harina  flour  or salsa de soya  soy sauce  in the dish. They will look at you like you are crazy  but it s worth it.  Ask for the green salsa in addition to the red - they typically bring out the red only.   Best deal in town.

This place gets its right  especially if you are looking for more authentic Mexican food and not Tex-Mex. The gorditas are my fav  I opt for chicken. Tortas are filling and fantastic. The cheese quesadilla is  died and gone to heaven cheesiness  with a perfectly yummy toasted flour tortilla. My husband loves the menudo  barbacoa and lengua tacos.

These folks are pretty solid.  I ve found that quality can be spotty in most taquerias and I ve definitely seen it here.  When the salsa is on I can eat two bowls.  When it s not  what a drag.  Lately they ve been on all the time.

The chips and salsa were good and we also got a side of guacamole which was also good.  But I must ssy the burrito and mini tacos were not very good.  The beef filling in the burrito tasted like a very cheap cut of meat that they sliced very thin so you could chew it.  The chicken filling in the mini tacos was just ok.  Even at a resonable price I was expecting more.

Spicy salsa here  Ole  Stopped in and had breakfast over the weekend. The staff didn t speak much English but we were able to order and get what we had wanted. The food came out quickly and looked great. I Had the Huevos Rancheros and they were delicious  The Ranchero sauce was bold and flavorful  with the now accustomed heat like the salsa. My dad had the huevos con chorizzo plate and said it was great and that the chorizzo wasn t at all greasy. I think my dad and I got out for around  12 for the both of us and that included two coffees.   All in all I say that they make a quality breakfast and that I ll go back. Just not in my truck because the parking lot is tiny  FYI.
Cheap food  well made  not frills  just a good spot to grab a quick bite.  Been coming for years  love the remodeling and additional parking.  I love the limeade.
Beans have lard in them so I tried to eat around them which is very frustrating. Very limited food choices for a vegetarian. However this place is very cheap if that is what you are looking for.
Went over several times during the holidays and the food is still the best.  Breakfast price can not be beat.  Chorizo and Eggs or Huevos rancheros can not be any better.
This restaurant isn t nearly as good as the one on Burnet Rd.  because of difference in styles and abilities of the cooks.  It s OK  but nothing special.

The real deal.  I  give it 5 stars because bang for buck this place is as good as it gets IMHO.  Most of the customers are native Mexicans and locals who know better. The food is legit.   Service is friendly and efficient. I have been to several here in Austin over the years and they are always good.  Some of the best chorizo in town.  Nothing fancy. A total Mexican immersion experience -  great  cheap  food  complete with an all Mexican jukebox and Mexican soccer on the tv. - you almost forget you are still in the States.

I have been eating at this store for 5 years and it s very good food for the money. You can t beat the price and they give you delicious chips and salsa for free. The wait staff is VERY nice. They do speak spanish and english at this place. My favorite thing to order is the chicken tacos and the quesadillas. 2 people can eat for 10 dollars here - no s  t

This place is great  authentic mexican food  Great prices  Open all the time  Perfect for end of the night food after drinking  Carne asada tacos are ridiculously good. Can t go wrong here...with anything
Easily the best Mexican food I ve had for this price. You won t be disappointed.
Great comida Mexicana for the price. Never too busy and always a fast turnaround with your order. Can t go wrong with any of the breakfast plates  or caldos.
Solid pozol  and a tasty michelada every time. Very fast and always fairly good service with a smile.

Have been there twice so far. I loved the pork tacos  so I went again within a week. The 2nd time we went  they totally forgot my boyfriends order  she said  your enchiladas are on the way   then proceeded to walk out the door  I m guessing her shift was over. After about another 10 minutes  we flagged down a waitress and she had no idea we were waiting on another plate  neither did the kitchen. The manager apologized  but we were ready to leave. At least he offered us a free dinner next time. Good food  but obviously sub par service.

So my friends take me here against my will. I sit down  not a very nice staff at all. I get a beef fajita taco and a tostada  it was not good at all. No flavor at all andthe texture was so rubbery. The salsa was some kinda of soupy hotness. nothing was good. too bad...
Hit the spot during our SXSW break between bands. Tacos Al Pastor were great  as yelpvertise-excellent. Waitress was pleasant  service quick  and the flan was fine.

Mmmm.  The breakfast tacos taste of awesome.  I give a 4-star rating for some areas of awesomeness.  First--the price--for breakfast tacos and a breakfast plate  the cost was very inexpensive for the variety of items that we ordered. Now  Secondly--the food flavors and quality were EXCELLENT  pardon the CAPS but the desired effect was hopefully achieved .  We ordered the cactus and eggs plate  and a variety of tacos  I think 9 --all were fantastic. The rancheros sauce was delicioso. The staff are extremely friendly and wicked fast. I was extremely impressed with the experience and I highly recommend you give it a shot.

I have been eating at Arandas since I was a kid. This place is fantastic  The food is incredibly cheap and the waitresses are super nice. I love seeing the place do well and it s crazy to see how diverse the people eating there are. You can t go wrong with their burritos  I prefer beef fajita with cheese added. The chicken tostadas are also great  I love that you can eat a ton and spend  10.00. I have a hard time controlling myself here  so I try not go everyday... but I could.
Good food and ample portions... I had the green chicken enchiladas with a side of guacamole  delicious  and a slice of homemade flan.

This place is bigger inside than it appears outside.  It was nicer inside than we thought it was going to be too. I had the chicken enchiladas verde.  They were okay.  Nice chunks of chicken inside.  I like a little more flavor in my green sauce though.  More garlic. My wife had cheese enchiladas.  She liked them.  I thought they were just okay.  Why don t more places use real cheddar cheese instead of the Velveeta type stuff  Salsa good.  Very attentive helpers.  More than one person checked in on us.  I like that.   We would go back.

Arandas has been a tradition with the Sistah Posse for the last 15 years.  The barbacoa tacos with cheese  cilantro  onions and avocado are to die for - my sister s usual. I always get the chicken flautas with double beans and cheese on the beans.  Mom always gets the migas with double beans. When we let Dad join us  he usually gets the carne asada or the new grilled chicken dish...I think it s called pechuga     . A south Austin standard in my opinion. Try the limeade...super yummy.  The location on Burnet Road is the best one

Talk about one of the most underrated Mexican places in town. The food is cheap and delivered to you fast. I ordered a combo with consisted of rice  beans and a huge portion of barbacoa and pork for less than  7. Chips and salsa seemingly arrive at your table the moment you sit down and you ll never run out of it due to very prompt service. For a little less you can get a burrito  with all the trimmings for half the price of one you could get at Chipotle  or Free Birds. If you re on a budget and want some delicious homemade Mexican food  there s really no other place than Arandas.

My older brother started taking me to Taqueria Arandas back in the mid 90 s. I  go to taquera arandas probably 2 to 3 times a year. All the food that i have ever received from taqueria arandas was greasy and bland. Granted their prices are cheap and the portions are plentiful. I can tell that most of the waiters hate there jobs. I understand this because too  am a waiter.  If you order the beef tacos they will not have any seasoning on them  so they taste as if you cooked them in a pan. There only plus is that they are open really late hours other than that i probably would never go there.   On the other hand my girlfriend likes Taqueria arandas because of the margarita s and that s it.

LOVE all the Arandas  but this location is my favorite.  Plenty of parking  comfortable decor and a super fast staff.  You absolutely can t beat the price  I grew up on Mexican food and its nice to be at a restaurant that isn t trying to convince me a taco with beans a cheese is worth  5.    Jukebox also has a great selection  not usually something I look for in a restaurant but I can t help noticing every time I m there that the music is great.  Usually when I order to-go at  a taco place I have a drink while I wait  here I barely have time to take a sip and they have my food ready.  So glad this place exists.

Only four stars  but this really is one of my all-time favorites. By all means  this place should probably just be a 3 star  but the value of what you get here for the price just completely makes it worth it. I love the beef fajita or al pastor burritos. I get them with avocado and meat only  no beans or lettuce  and that s really my favorite way to have them. You have to try one that way. I also rip off a lot of unwanted tortilla  those things wrapping the burrito are huge and it s too much . Also  if you want a great chorizo and egg plate  this is one of the best. Two people can eat here for less than  10 if you eat light  but easily under  20 and you ll be stuffed. I always insist on getting their green salsa  they don t always offer it  because I just absolutely love it. It is made fresh so it is always a little different from day to day. But when it s just right... mmm. The wait staff doesn t speak much english  but they are very good about being attentive. Don t be alarmed when the tejano jukebox comes on randomly after you ve been there for several minutes. It does that.

This is my go-to place after a night of heavy drinking. Consistent  good food  quick service. Huevos rancheros and chicken tacos are some my favorites  but definitely try the carne guisada - SOOO damn good   Oh and everything is ridiculously cheap  which is really nice after spending a ton on drinks the night before

Great for breakfast  lunch  or dinner. Always the same friendly waitresses  always good consistent food. The verde enchiladas are good  the migas are awesome  the carne asada is great  and the menudo is hard to beat in town.

This my favorite hole in the wall Mexican food   they are always busy - large portions  fresh produce  real cheap best bang for your buck. the wait staff has seemingly not changed in at least 8 years and it is nice to see all of the renovations they have done to the place since my wife and I have started to go there.  quality experience - get the carne asada with nopaitos  its awesome

These are some of the best tacos I ve ever had in Austin. The tortillas are buttery and amazing. The smoked brisket was smoky and tender  with just the right amount of delicious fat and grease. The chicken taco with the melted cheese was devine and one of the best tacos I ve ever had. This spot is amazing. It is hidden in the back of Buford s Bar  don t miss it

I had tried the one at Bufords Friday night. I had gotten a brisket quesadilla  chicken taco and chips queso for  34.    It was all entirely way too salty....chips included  so I threw it away after a bite or two of each. Although I m sure that other locations may have better Luck  I personally will not  drive from north Austin to try it again.

Ok I ve had asador at both locations now  and while I think they probably were incredible when they first opened  now they re slinging en masse for the bar crowds and the quality control has gone downhill. The tortillas and salsas were very good  the meats were okay - bit dry. Honestly I told my friend she should have taken the queso back. Not only was it actively cold when we got it  I also think there was something wrong with it. It had a very funky sour note to it  like beer cheese. The chips were delightful  fried perfectly crispy and well seasoned. It ll do if you find yourself in Buford s  which I try not to   but personally after my experience I would recommend others to go to One Taco down the street at Little Woodrow s instead.

Let me tell about this  6 tacos.  Brisket was Rich in flavor  toasted flour tortilla   the carnitas was simply not carnitas plain no seasoning very little meat as well on both.  Staff was rude  requested some ice with our coke and simply decline saying the coke is cold enough. Bathrooms were clean and patio was enjoyable.

Amazing food  The meat was so tender and flavorful. I could tell the guacamole was extremely fresh which I appreciated. Tortillas are perfect  The queso had an amazing kick to it  Order the chicken quesadilla and the brisket nachos

The brisket and carnitas tacos are really really good - especially with a decent slather of the green sauce that helps cut a little of the fattiness. Then again  the only thing preventing this from getting to 5 stars is that it  is  fatty. Mind you  given what it is  you expect it to be fatty  but then again  my liver is still in a little bit of shock a few hours later.   Still  excellent tacos  and given that you re in Buford s  you can order a pint of  expensive   beer  chill  watch football on the screen  if that s your thing  and eat your tacos.   Note  the chips  optional. expensive  are deeply fried  and not particularly good...

These are the tacos we ve been craving for the last 4 years.  Yes  we re from CA and have been missing street tacos. I love ALL tacos so not hating on Austin tacos. Don t come   me lol .  We ordered the chicken and brisket tacos. They were  6 each which is pricy but they were bigger than your average.  The flavor was on point. Tortillas were fresh. The two guys at the stand  we went to the Las Perlas location  were friendly and cranked em out quick. I was surprised with how great everything was considering their set up was basically a taco stand.  The chips are SO good. The chile salt is where it s at.  But  9 for chips and guac is a bit offensive haha thankfully they gave us extra chips since we still had guac left. Not my favorite guac. I d recommend just ordering the chips.   That food coupled with our delicious drinks from Las Perlas had us excited for our next visit.   TIP  you order through Toast tab so if you expect it to be busy when you visit  you could order it 10-15 min in advance from arriving so you get your order sooner.
Great tacos  The meat is really the star of the show. Served like traditional street tacos but bigger.
Best tacos I ve had. Not sure how they stack up with other tacos in Texas as it s all I had time for  but they were delicious  The salsa and guacamole was a hit as well.

Very small  unassuming taco stand in the middle of a brilliant concept of three specialty bars. I had the brisket and carnitas tacos. The brisket was more like a taco stand barbacoa  which was amazing   and the carnitas shined through with a rich  sage like flavor that I had never experienced. I m used to citrus  white pepper  and garlic as a mojo style carnitas  but this was an unexpected surprise. Thank you for making my experience tremendous. Top notch  and absolutely matched the caliber of the cocktail and bar service that it accompanied. I couldn t recommend this more. I wish I had more time in Austin to appreciate this place on a weekly level. I assume it s spectacular for events  as well. Five stars all the way to this whole establishment.
Very nice taco spot on Rainey. Seating is right on the street and off street. Tacos were filling and not skimpy. The bar in the back is a little gem too.

Got a chicken taco  the chicken was hard   also not sure if Austin knows what a cheese quesadilla is supposed to be. Got some chips and salsa with queso  for 10 bucks the queso was worth 2 bucks. Wife had a catfish taco  which she said was good. Overall for the price and the food I give this place 2  only because of the catfish taco.

These are some of the best tacos I ve ever had at a food truck. Five stars for highly exceeding my expectations  but I knocked it down a star  because it s a little pricey. The chicken tacos and brisket tacos are my favorite  and they also have house-made chips  which is huge. They have an online app  so you can order 20 minutes prior to getting there  and then the food is ready when you arrive. I moved close by  and am thankful I did. This has quickly become my go-to spot for watching football games during the week.

Overall  Hidden inside Seven Grand  First off  this place was hella hard to find lol bc it is located inside the bar Seven Grand. When you go in  it s all the way in the back outside   FOOD  super delicious for the late night munchies. We got four tacos - carnitas  chorizo  quesadilla  and barbacoa. And they were amazing  My favorites being the carnitas and barbacoa. The great thing is that they make their own tortilla. The texture of the tortilla was slightly crispy  which I thoroughly enjoyed. Can be considered pricey since 4 tacos were like  20.   SERVICE AMBIANCE  I will say it took a while to get the tacos  granted there was only one dude making them . People working there were super friendly and chill. Very dimly lit place inside while outside there is a lot of space with heat lamps to keep warm.

The place was empty and I should ve followed my heart...  I never choose a place with low reviews and this time I gave it the benefit of the doubt... BIG MISTAKE... tacos and guacamole salty  no forks to cut the quesadilla for my small child. Staff seem they didn t want to be bothered. Don t waste your time.
I tried every taco and they were all fantastic  Unique flavors  balanced flavors  just right portions. Come here  get one of everything  thank me later.

What a hidden gem for Austin.  As you walk through  the bar and reach the outside patio  you see a grill top and a bunch of coolers.  I was expecting a very average taco based on the setup but let me start by telling you  this is no average taco spot.   We placed our order and after the guy was done charging us  he turned around and started prepping the tacos.  It took about 5 or 6 minutes but the order is brought to you while you drink.
