The moment you take a bite  you can taste the freshness. From the home made tortillas  to the perfectly cooked and marinated meat inside.  Topped with just the right amount of onions and peppers to make your mouth water.   All of this for   3 each  and you make the perfect spot.  I will definitely be back here again

Great tacos  But you eat what they have.   No carne Asadi   No ropa vieja .   We have ground beef   Yes  excellent ground beef tacos  3.5 a piece . I did love em.    Chips were mildly greasy like they were made in. House. Salsa was all sauce.   Food was great   But you eat what you are served.   4 star tacos. 2 star process-tacos desk is at the back of 7 Gand Whiskey Bar.   Nice people. Good food. But the system needs tweaking. Still  might be back tomorrow. I like tacos  enjoy whiskey and the people are nice.
Low key and amazing. Legit. Solid. Late night. Whiskey  . Advanced. Extra. Happiness via a drunken text. Just do it. You re welcome.
Had the brisket taco and it was one of the best tacos I ve ever had  Very filling and juicy and the tortillas were crispy but soft at the same time. I am in my happy place. Will definitely be back.

The employees of Asador are the biggest jerks. Paid  32 for 9 tacos that were barely filled up and not even good quality. Wouldn t pay  32 again for these small tacos. Had higher expectations. Tried to get a refund  that s when their rude personality came out. They threw the refund money at me  had to pick up from floor . Rude service  bad quality. Not all service industries workers are heros

I tried their mushroom quesadillas tonight. It has some traces of pumpkin in it which I thought was quite interesting. Anyways they was pretty good. I thought for the quesadillas they were slightly overpriced  but I guess this is downtown we re talking about. The flavor was great  comes with salsa on the side as it should. Decently filling. They apparently can only be ordered online which got on my nerves because I would rather just swipe my card. Overall 7 10.
THESE ARE THE BEST TACOS IN TOWN   Get the brisket taco. You will absolutely die. An absolute hidden gem behind the bar Pelons    3 tacos  Best in town hands down.
Amazing Mexican brunch    Would highly recommend the chorizo w poached egg   Will definitely return
The brisket taco was one of the best things I ve put in my mouth. The brisket itself is super moist  flavorful  and slightly spicy. Tortillas are homemade. My mouth is so happy right now.

Holy moly  best tacos ever would be an understatement. I didn t really think much of this place  I thought the entrance was very boujie but the shop is actually in the back on an outside patio. I had the crispy carnita tacos  smoked brisket tacos  and the quesadilla. Each were so fresh  and literally cooked perfectly. Not sure how they did the tortilla but it tasted amazing    My favorite were the pork carnita tacos  11 10 would recommend. It is a little on the greasier side but I didn t mind it at all. I ordered seconds of it just bc it was so good.  ORDER THEIR TACOS

KC traveler hitting up Austin. Found Asador on yelp near my hotel  and I needed tacos. When in Austin  right  And i just love tacos. Deep down  would make my one food level love. Off i went in Austin s downtown in search of my tacos.   I walked in through Las Perlas  and grabbed a Oaxacan Las Perlas Margarita  5   would drink again . Then i wandered to the patio  looked at the menu  and said  screw it  one of everything.  6 tacos were on my way.   It s a one person show  so exercise patience. It s worth it. So worth it. Srsly. In food ecstasy  I lost track of what i was eating.   So go. Grab a margarita on your way through  get one of everything  and live your best taco life.
This the best tacos in Austin Texas I ve ever tasted  Full of flavor  The meat was juicy and the tortilla was perfectly toasted

Asador should be in the contending of best tacos in Austin. The service is always friendly and the tacos can t be beat. Be adventurous with your order  everything on the menu is worth trying. Will be coming back again and again.

Amazing tacos  They re a bit pricey  but some of THE BEST pollo asado tacos I ve ever had.  I don t eat beef or pork  so I know good chicken tacos lol.  So flavorful and juicy. I highly recommend getting them with cheese - they put it on the tortilla first so it s melty and delicious.

Great food but the location is inside and in the back of another location  so heads up. Also don t walk 7th street alone during the night time  I went for dinner around 8pm. Aside all that the food is very good. I had the Pollo asado taco  and the smoked brisket taco which were both delicious. I have to say that the pollo asado was my favorite of the two. I would definitely recommend it

Been in Austin for 3 days and this was the best taco place we found. It s like a secret hideout in the back of a bar with a guy cooking tacos on a grill. It Amazing  If you re in Austin you need to try this place.

Tacos are an essential part of Austin culture  and Asador has become a go to. Beyond the standard menu  the specials are fantastic. While a typical Austin taco relies on a blend of ingredients to achieve a good taco  Asador achieves an amazing taco by focusing on quality ingredients paired with amazing spices. The mole tacos  brisket  amp  mushroom  are amazing and a trip to Seven Grand or Las Perlas is not complete with at least one  or more  tacos.   Cheers to the guys who make this my goto taco spot

Wow  These tacos were fantastic. We couldn t find the place at first because it s located behind the bar but I m so glad we didn t give up. We had the chorizo  pollo and beef and all three were delicious. The amount of food this place was pumping out was crazy and it was all fresh. There was one cook and one waitress hostess cashier and they were busting their backs getting after it to deliver one of the best food experiences I have ever had and I ve had some good ones
We were not thrilled. The food was alright. The staff was also pretty good. I ll try them next week.

My friends and I were struck dumb by how good these tacos were. Considering its rather nondescript location behind a bar  we were expecting average tacos and instead were surprised and delighted to find some of the best--if not the best--tacos we ve had in Austin. The corn tortillas are perfect  the meat is flavorful yet crispy  the ingredients and spices are quality. While many taco places in Austin rely on wacky concoctions  Asador knocks it out of the park with simple recipes done 100 percent right.
These guys make some of the most authentic  savory  and delicious tacos I have ever had. You absolutely won t be disappointed. Also try it Gringo Style which includes queso added.

We were looking for handmade tortillas so we checked this place out. It was a one man show on monday night so service was slow. We ordered chorizo  beef  and chicken. The tortillas were good but the meat was way too salty. Also the guac was salty too  not sure how or the tortilla chips had too much salt . Wouldnt recommend it.
Lit barbacoa  probably the only reason I m at this fancy mescal bar.

Perfectly cooked  perfectly seasoned and spiced  creative while remaining authentic  and priced appropriately  These are legit the best tacos in Austin...if you ve only ever had bullshit white people tacos with a bunch of nonsense all over them that cost  6  I implore you to go to Asador.

This place is located in the courtyard behind Las Perlas. I ordered the mushroom taco in mole Amarillo and the quesadilla with queso oaxaque a. Both were amazing and unlike anything else the city has to offer. The mushrooms are mixed with the perfect combination of mole Amarillo and the quesadilla is brilliant in its simplicity. And all tortillas are made fresh in house and are cooked to perfection. If you re looking for the next great taco in Austin  this is your spot.

Had dinner last night. The pollo asado was excellent and the special was insane. I especially like the tortillas  they re definitely grilled or something ahead of time and aren t floppy  damp tortillas you might get elsewhere. Owner was friendly and happy to serve. Had drinks in La Perlas while we waited. 10 10 would return
Great service and excellent tacos. Being behind Las Perlas and Seven Grand  they re a perfect addition.
Great tacos and great service  They re nestled in the back of Las Perlas and goes perfect with the drinks.

So we re in town at an event on 6th St  got hungry walked like 3 seconds over to 7th St... couldn t find this lil slice of heav n.  Walked through a Mezcal bat and boom Taco Paradise    Just go order one of everything and smile

Absolutely love this spot  A little hard to find  but that s part of what makes it fun. I don t live in Austin but make sure to go to Asador every time I m in town and take people with me to share the love. There s something about the tortillas that is just amazing and love that the meat options are different each time.
Try the chips and salsa  Quite delightful and a good pairing with the mezcal next door.
A tortilla press  a cooler  and a grill walk into a bar. The bartender says  holy shit  these are some great fuckin tacos.
Tasty ass tacos   Perfect place to be for bar munchies.  Definitely recommend for anyone visiting Seven Grand.

Amazing tacos. Get the guac if you get chips. These guys will literally never disappoint you. If you come to them with a request  concern  or personal problem  they take that ish in stride and deliver the highest quality feelinqueso  read  tacos  known to man. Literal saviors of humankind via 7th street. Personal goals have been set after meeting their kind. Asador is the level achieved post-self actualization. Indulge yourself. Eat tacos. Believe.

I hate to be that person but I m gonna be that person  I was born and raised here and we all know that somehow being a unicorn and living here your entire life   eating tacos or some variation of them approximately 3 meals a week kinda sorta maybe makes you some kind of authority on the subject. And if not  then the sheer volume of tacos I ve eaten in this lifetime should give me some kind of credibility. I ve had tacos from damn near everywhere in this town 3x over and again. There are some real gems out here  and some really over hyped crap too . But these tacos....these tacos are the best. I don t even know where to start  so I won t. But as a teaser  true taco lovers know the tortilla will always have the potential to be a deal breaker. Fear not  These tortillas are the bomb. With more bomb stuff on  em  Discovering this place was like the first time I discovered HEB sold fresh  real  handmade tortillas some mornings at select locations for all my amateur taco making needs. You re welcome  new peeps - life changing. If the package has a label on it  you grabbed the wrong thing. Follow the scent of deliciousness towards the bakery and look for a bag that s still warm . And re  a previous reviewer - yes  they do run out of ingredients sometimes. Welcome to Austin and being served real food  From a food STAND  With...wait for it...limited capacity  If you want stuff that s always available then go to Taco Bell to get down on dat good good that certainly ain t fresh and certainly ain t real. Also  brisket tacos are far superior to carne asada  it s asada  not asadi for those of you new to Tejas . Also for the record  tacos behind a whiskey bar is like a glorious dream come true. Anyway  for you patient taco enthusiasts out there who support small businesses and like indulging in great booze while scarfing down awesome food  go get  em  Get there early. Relish in euphoria. And the guac. Like I-don t-even-need-chips-for-this-guac-it s-so-good kinda guac.

Man I love this place   Almost always have the Baby A s soup.  Not only the food and drinks.  But  watching this crew tonight work together.... a restaurant with the GM sweeping the floor and busing tables.  NO drama.  Pleasant and relaxing atmosphere for a night out.   Love love love
Food was awful. My margarita was made from mix and extremely sweet. The only decent thing that we got were the asada tacos which is pretty difficult to mess up.

Great service and clean restaurant. Atmosphere is fun. Drinks were good and strong. However the food was awful. Probably the worst I have had at a Mexican restaurant. The enchiladas were so salty they were had to eat. The huevos were flavorless. I wouldn t recommend eating here. Drinks with friends and family yes.

Baby ain t so bad. A welcoming  large  Cantina style Mexican restaurant in the hotel and shopping district of Domain.   The outdoor deck patio is large and well shaded. The service is efficient and friendly. The music can be a bit tacky  e.g.  Boyz to Men  though it adds to the informal vibe.  The food is average--not bad but nothing to write home about. I had the grilled Acupulco Fish Tacos  fried is another option . Good blackened flavor  just not exceptionally fresh or high quality ingrediants. The house salsa was smooth while standard and not entirely memorable.   If you re looking for an informal atmosphere with plenty of seating  Acupulco may speak baby talk to you.

Do NOT go to Baby Acapulco - Baby A s off Stone lake blvd  across r the Arboretum    There toilet literally exploded toilet water all over me when I flushed it. Not a little water  we re talking the force of the water actually pushed me back into the door of the stall     There was No marker  No sign  nothing saying the stall was broken or out of order. No clue.    I enter this tiny stall  lock the door  pee  go to flush and BAM    Water shooting high speed out of the toilet onto me while I m trapped in this tiny ass stall.  Yes  I initially screamed because the shock and force of this mini flash flood of exploding toilet water aimed directly at me in a tiny locked stall....  After I had a minute to process  I was angry and collected myself as best I could. I called for the manager from my cell phone in the bathroom   she walks in as I have my hands full of paper towels and standing in an inch of water covering the floor of the bathroom and  she says -  Oh yeah  we had someone out this morning it was supposed to be fixed. Do you want me to get you a towel or something  ....     I was in shock. I look at her   paper towels in hand  clothes soaked  and say  no but you can get me a refund.  She says  okay    well the plumber was here this morning and they said it was fixed .  and she walks out.  No apology  nothing.   She tried to just comp my food and not my drink...  Seriously     Lady  I m covered in toilet water and your entire bathroom floor is covered in water      She finally says she will refund everything  supposedly  we ll see...  Never go to Baby Acapulco Stonelake Blvd. Austin Texas.  Not only are the facilities dirty and broken but the manager is awful       Note to the manager - you should have said  I am so sorry. You re entire meal and single drink is comped. How else can we make this right  .     Baby A s at Stonelake - I fully expect a full refund.

Good. Nothing wrong with that but it s just good Tex-mex food. Nothing particularly amazing about it. Service was ok but they were so slow that I think the staff was bored. It s a huge restaurant that seems like it s being wasted. Could be a great place to hang out and eat but needs to step up it s game especially for the money.

I have eaten here several times in the past year and last night being the most recent. Why it is not more crowded I have no idea except people have not rediscovered it. I used to go to Baby A s in the 90s and loved it but in the late 99s I found their food not so good and cleanliness subpar. WELL NOW THEY ARE BACK     At least at this location  I love it  I crave it  Service is exceptional  Food is flavorful and fresh  Best place in town for queso too  Serving size is perfect  Quesadillas can t be beat  Tortilla soup  puffy taco are omg  The rest of the menu is real good too. Yea is fresh  Margarita menu has the usual offerings and a few unique to This restaurant. Go

I am a service connected 100  disabled veteran first responder. I arrived at 6pm today at Baby A s Stonelake Austin. There is NO handicap parking and I m on 8ltrs oxygen with little time left in life. There are no other cars parked near either entrance and I ve witnessed only 2 others pull in since the manager  Carlos came out to where I tried parking close enough to get inside on my own w o use of my transport wheelchair  which must be pushed by attendant . Carlos refused to assist in wheeling me into the restaurant  claiming he was too busy. I m appalled at the lack of compassion of this individual  What has become of common courtesy or even pride to represent the establishment your income is generated from  Needless to say I won t be dining nor referring anyone here ever.
Great good and reasonably priced but it s just way to understaffed. You have a server doing both serving and barrending. Waited 10  minutes for a drink.

Goddamn this place is awful  Not only is the food garbage but the service is even worse. Frozen Mexican TV dinners are more edible than the shit they call food. How it has stayed in business for so long is anyone s guess

Mediocre food at best. Store bought chips and tortillas. The enchiladas were overly salty as were the refried beans. They ve basically got a two drink max. They have a point system with their drinks and once you reach 6 points your cut off. So two margaritas max. Not a place to Uber to for drinks with friends.  On the positive side  they re pretty cheap. The salsa with the chips was good. Regardless  there are better Mexican food and drink options in town. Not worth giving this place a second look.

Hi Lisa  I ll tell you why  most  of the loyal customers have stopped coming here. They treat the local with  cold  food. I ve been coming here for 16 years and they have continued to decline in service and food. Maybe you get a hit or miss with who ever is cooking for the day however  I continue to visit random days and times and for the last 3 months  I ve been served cold food. I like purples  however today it truly happened. They are a LOT weaker than the originals. Don t waste the    I wonder why the Mgr. doesn t care. The workers don t care. The chef is new and eats the food hot I bet instead of serving it hot to the customers. I purposely did not attach photos  because I believe someone should come in  amp  turn this place around     Help them Jesus

Service is bad. They aren t up front about their to go alcohol policy. But at least I didn t have to spend extra on a tip.   Edit  order To go was also incorrect and missing items. Imagine that. Needs better waitstaff and management.   Won t be back.

Baby Acapulco is exactly why their rating reflects. Generic Tex-Mex food that is just a little bit more expensive than it should be. Lots of options when it comes to gimmicky festive margaritas  10 beer taps and a full bar. If You re in the area and want to drink or want a place with a fun vibe to hang out with friends baby A s is great. If it s date night and or your craving Mexican food there is about 100 other places in Austin that or better scratch that itch.

Needed a fun place in a pinch to celebrate a lifetime of service  gathering of 40 people to enjoy lunch and fellowship. The staff here responded in a day s time and hosted a wonderful event. The food was wonderful and the margaritas were delicious. Thanks to all the staff that made it happen.

First stop at this location in some time and it s hard not to overweight COVID effects to it  but I ll try.  Baby A s is always a good pick for Mexican food in Austin.  Is it the best   Probably not.  Are there worse   Absolutely.  It balances quality with price and a great atmosphere to enjoy Mexican food with groups small or large.  This one is located near the Arboretum area near the confluence of Capitol of TX Hwy  360   MoPac  1  and US-183.  Not very visible from any of the major roads so you will need to know the turns or use your preferred navigation approach.  That being said  it puts the location away from other establishments and so it has its own parking lot and doesn t have that feeling like you d have if you go to a restaurant in a mall or large shopping center.  Easy in and out and plenty of parking.  The restaurant is large.  Sprawling indoor and outdoor seating.  For COVID  limited capacity so lots of empty tables with even a 20 minute wait  advertised at 30 minutes  always over-estimate to your customers  pro tip .  Good indoor atmosphere in terms of decor  kitsch or not  you can call .  Very open with high ceilings  large and small tables  and more intimate areas where you don t feel you re in a large restaurant.  Booths or tables  your preference.  For COVID  limited menu  one page front and back no including separate drink menu .  A few items in each of the main categories  enchiladas  tacos  fajitas  mixed plates  etc .  No problem finding what you like if you like this type of food.  That being said  my dad got a hamburger.  Because he wanted a hamburger.  It looked good and he liked it.  I got the nachos appetizer as a meal and wasn t disappointed.  Instead of a large mound of chips with everything piled on  they were thicker chips about the size of half a crispy taco with the main ingredients on each  then a dallop of guacamole  sour cream  pico  and pile of jalapenos to flavor each.  Was perfect and tasted good.  I got the ground beef  they also had  chicken  fajita meat or veggie.  The service was a bit slow.  My feeling was they were short staffed.  In fact we were seated and after some time of nobody taking our drink order  our hostess jumped in to get us drinks...and by then we were ready to order so she took that too.  Drinks came out medium to slow  maybe 5 minutes for waters and a draft beer .  Later the server came flying in to introduce herself and ask if we needed anything  then got reasonably attentive service thereafter.  I wouldn t deduce a star because of this and the busyness of the Friday night  but just noteworthy.  I feel like anytime you go out to eat in COVID times  additional patience is cumpulsory.  Everyone is working hard  no indication our server wasn t she just didn t get to us very quickly  So all in all  a good experience.  I wouldn t put this at the top of my Austin Mexican food list but certainly would drop in here again if convenient.  Which is about my definition for 3 stars.
This place is just really run down. The food was okay but the atmosphere was not great. The restaurant Itself almost felt dirty. Not good enough to come here again.
Excellent food  I had the Chile con queso which was delicious  great tortillas and salsa and then the soup was excellent. Will recommend to anyone. . John served my table and he was great.

We had a yelp perk to go to at the theater nearby  so we decided to try Baby A s out. They do have their own parking lot and the place itself has a lot of room. There is a bar  plenty of seating  TVs  amp  outdoor seating as well. You will be greeted by a host then be seated. Our server was Cesar and he made the experience all the better with his personality and jokes. I add a star just for a server being great at their job and making me laugh.   I was interested in trying a margarita but noticed they looked like they re all frozen but there are a few that come on the rocks. He was nice enough to have us try their famous purple margarita to which is said to be the strongest there. I asked him which are on the rocks then he mentioned a watermelon one and stopped him there. lol The watermelon margarita on the rocks was so delicious and you can taste bits of watermelon too .   They give you some chips  amp  salsa that are good. I ordered flautas plate  amp  hubby ordered beef enchiladas. They were good but nothing to rave about and I was expecting at least four of them but got three flautas with rice and beans. The enchiladas were two of them.   I would return for some margaritas and maybe if i m in the area Ill order some food. Its great for big groups  amp  having a drink.

I enjoyed the food and company tonight at Baby A s  I tried their famous strong purple margarita and I wasn t feeling it  tasted like grape dimetapp  in my opinion . I may have to try the Superman marg next time. I got a regular frozen  some queso and also the Brisas Bowl with grilled shrimp  avocado  and a sweet habanero sauce. The puffy tacos also look good  It s a popular spot with a few locations around Austin.

I am actually surprised for bad reviews on service   I dono if I was just lucky today but our server was really polite  prompt and friendly. Food was just okay but very reasonably priced. Nice big patio seating for those who seek social distancing
They charge you twice for meals. Servers are incompetent. Food is shit  Horrible service. Would not advise going there

I just want to start off by saying that I ve never been the person to leave a review online  I m rather the one reading the reviews. But for the wonderful time I had last night I feel like I had to say something  I want to take time and appreciate my server Stephanie who attended us with Hospitality and a friendly attitude. She gave us all the attention we needed and had our food delivered right on time  I could see her smile through her mask  I got everything I wanted from a Restaurant experience at Baby A s. Should be a 5 star restaurant with their Waitress Stephanie in the house. Thanks for the experience and we ll make sure to come again

Baby A s certainly has a reputation for getting people drunk with their purple margarita  but I m here to tell you there s more to Baby A s...  Important takeaways  Great service Pretty decent food  if you know what to order  Okay fine  they have great Margaritas  Service - every time my fianc e and I go to Baby A s we sit in the bar area and everyone who has helped us has been so attentive  friendly  and welcoming. Cody is most often working when we come in and he barely needs to ask us what we want at this stage  but does so out of courtesy.   The food - it s not the best food in Austin but damn if they don t have one of my favorite meals in the world. BABY A S SOUP Y ALL   It s like chicken tortilla soup and pho had a baby. Chicken tortilla soup  but better  in flavor and pho in construction. You re served a base of broth with chicken and avocado in it and a side plate of crispy tortilla strips  red onion  cilantro  shredded cheese  and a lime wedge to make the soup your own. It s like a hug in a bowl and it s the best thing on their menu hands down.   Honorable mention to my fianc e s favorite meal of the amores tacos - that green amores sauce is the BEST.   All of their other food is pretty standard tex mex and is nothing mind blowing but it s definitely good enough to venture away from the soup  a rare occasion for me .   Margs - everyone knows Baby A s has some wild frozen margarita options. What s great about them in my opinion is the consistency. There s never an off day  they are always delicious  not too sweet  and have the right strength. My fave is the mango  they clearly use a pur e or something instead of syrup and artificial flavors like other places and it shows. It s not electric orange and it actually tastes like a mango  Its my go-to every time.   Overall Baby A s is a solid choice for food  drinks  and a good time and deserves more respect than it gets

Sebastian at Baby Acapulcos is an amazing server  This was my fianc  and I s first time here and we had a fantastic experience  The manager Carlos was also very kind and honored a military discount for my fianc  who is active duty at the moment  The food was very delicious and the purple margarita is AMAZING  10 10

My friend and I met for dinner at BabyA s.  It was a busy night and like most businesses these days  they were short staffed.  After waiting a few minutes  somewhat annoyed  I flagged down a server and asked when we would be waited on.  She  Liz  immediately apologized for the wait  which really wasn t that long  and Liz said she could help us.  I don t consider myself as high maintenance but my friend and I made many requests.  Liz graciously assisted us with kindness.  I will come back to Baby A s specifically because of the customer service and hospitality of our server Liz as well as the awesome food and drinks.  Thank you for the great service and awesome food

I take a lot of issue when a restaurant s drink prices are at or higher than the entrees. I came in tonight at 8 27pm knowing they were closing soon but I had time to eat and drink a couple cocktails. I got a patron margarita and it was okay but absolutely not worth the money. My stuffed avocado arrived with a cold center of shredded chicken. Super disappointing. I tried a mezcal margarita and it was alright but I would never pay more than  8 for it  it was  12.99 . Service was awkward and I now know why this place has fallen off.
Their drinks are always on point. I love all of those damn frozen cocktails. This location is awesome. Grab some good food and head across the street for a movie.
I believe this place has been closed. Went here on a Friday night at 8 30pm and they were closed. No one in sight. No one answered the phone.

As of today this will be my last time visiting this place.. Customer service has completely gone down hill. I have been coming here for at least 10 years. This year the turn over rate has been very noticeable especially at the bar.  I was coming here mostly everyday after work but that has come to a complete stop today.   Word to the wise when you or should i say your bartender comes to work with an attitude and treats people like they could be doing something better with their time then taking care of the customer  that s the first sign that maybe a change of venue is needed.  When I come in and sit myself at the bar 10 minutes before the next customers sit themselves  I expect to be serviced first   not when you feel like serving me. If you feel like throwing the napkin and the straw on the bar just remember I m not your dog or someone that you dislike.... I m am a paying customer...   Although my business will not be missed I m pretty sure you will manage to run off some other customers...By the way I m not the only regular who has experience these episodes.   When I bring this to the attention of management I would normally expect some kind of professional response but that was not the case in this situation..  I m a customer experience manager for a pretty large corporation and If i were to ever hear of or see any team member treating a customer in this manner  we would have a very long talk that would probably end in termination.   To my understanding this very employee has had complaints before but the employee is still there.

Baby  a s.... Disappointing  You walk in the door greeted by sewer septic aroma. Nice  right  Skinny margarita  no natural ingredients used except for the tequila. It should be fresh squeezed lime juice  agave nectar or simple syrup. Have no idea what I received. Unacceptable margarita. Food  mediocre at best. Piling cheese on sub par food doesn t make it more appealing nor palatable . Menu limited. It sucks to be traveling on business  with limited restaurant choices   and most are sub par. Prices have also increased   My salary hasn t. Chains... I should know better. I will NOT be back.

This has become my family s go to for happy hour gatherings. Tonight was my mother s birthday day celebration which was great  Can t beat happy hour appetizers and drinks for a bday celebration   A few rounds of nachos  amores tacos  drinks  and a few entrees made a perfect Thursday evening perfect. We had Shelly as our server and she was friendly  funny  quick and checked on us often. She even offered to take a family picture for us around my mom s bday cake which we thought was super nice of her. Thank you Shelly for making my mother birthday celebration all the more Special  We ll be back again and again
A stepped version of Chuy s. Great drinks  great food and great dessert  Baby As is an Austin classic

Came by on a whim with some friends for a quick bite.  This place is soooooo spacious  PLENTY of seating  I think the food portions are decent and the prices are moderate.  We sat by the bar and were helped by the bartender who was courteous and great at making our drinks    so glad I got to try their purple margaritas that are so famous

Ordered a Jerry s burrito.  Looks and tastes identical to a Taco Bell Burrito  except in this case it s 15 dollars.  Waiter said it would be 5 dollars more for steak.  That means20 bucks for a Taco Bell quality taco.  Won t be back
Great fish tacos. Skinny margarita was tasty. Live band Bubba Coltrane was awesome and our server Kate really took care of us - and there were a lot of us

My first time here and I wasn t impressed. My friend and I had to look around for a waiter to ask where we could sit. We sat down for five minutes before our server asked us to order. Service was slow and the restaurant wasn t even busy. The seats are dirty and need cleaned. Our area wasn t cleaned before we sat down and the server apologized for the dirty floor that he later swept.   We didn t order food only drinks. They serve only margaritas  but have different flavors. The  strawberry  margarita is the only drink that taste different. The  purple  is the strongest. I may return to try the food and the drinks were good.

While traveling in Austin for work  we stayed near this restaurant and decided to walk over and try this place out. I m extremely picky when it comes to Mexican food.   The salsa and chips were really good and I had high hopes. That was soon diminished when I ordered food. I had fajitas with the thought that this would be a safe order. Needless to say  it wasn t. It was just meh.   My boss ordered tortilla soup and said it was meh as well.   Good place to o if you don t have a car and stay at the Embassy Suites near here.

This was  unfortunately  a superbly disappointing experience. Don t get me wrong  the food was fine  and the kitchen speed was decent considering we went at 7 on a Saturday night. The service  however  was awful. Our server was friendly enough  but she was constantly forgetting about us. We asked her  and another server  a total of 4 times for silverware and still left without ever having gotten any. We were also charged for 2 sides of sour cream  yes  I know it s not expensive  even though they were only requested because they were missing from our plates. The menu mentioned specifically that sour cream is included with the nachos but  as it was missing  I requested a side of it.  I was not aware she would charge for a plating mistake . Then  when the busser took our appetizer plate  she also took the chips and salsa we were still snacking on  as well as that side of sour cream. When I mentioned the sour cream being taken  by mistake  to the server  she apologized and brought us more but charged us again. I understand a busy Saturday night  my fianc  and I have both worked in restaurants for years. But this was incredibly disappointing and not worth the price at all. We will not be returning.

came for the first time for margaritas a few days ago. Atmosphere was fine  service was fine but the margs were bad. Idk if the liquor they used is just that poor of a quality or if they re using the wine based version of a margarita but it was easily the worst frozen margarita I ve ever had. Was surprised later that one of that low of quality and size was also a cool  10. I would recommend going anywhere else if you re looking to meet for a margarita  Chips and salsa were standard as well  not bad  not good

I was invited to an event that was at this Baby A s location  amp  I have to say I haven t been to this location in YEARS  amp  I so have not been missing anything.  While Baby A s is not known for their food they are known for their drinks so I was disappointed that the margarita on the rocks that I ordered was very weak  amp  I was so needing a margarita that just hit the spot  -     .  I did eat but it was only guacamole  salsa   amp  queso with chip  amp  no complaints there.  The seating layout inside is very cool but wish they would put some money into remodeling  to update it some  amp  I m sure that would really help w  their business  amp  getting customers to return...atmosphere is everything.

I moved away from Austin three years ago  and had a chance to come back today for a business trip. I couldn t wait to come to Baby A s for lunch.  They did not disappoint  I had my favorite chicken tortilla soup  and couldn t be happier. . Cody took great care of me in the bar area and made it a great experience as usual  I told the manager  Tim that there needs to be a Baby A s in Plano. I ll keep my fingers crossed.

Sat for 15 minutes and no one ever greeted us or took our drink order. Nothing   Just got up and left  and the manager acted shocked that we were leaving but no attempt get us to stay or get any help. Don t bother

Got some rotten vegetables with my fajita plate. Moldy cheese and stale chips.   They get 1 star cuz the margarita is on point. Only need 1 to get the party started. 2 to seal the deal.   Music is Michael Jackson  BeeGee s  Al Green  etc. not to bad.

This location has great spacing in terms of social distancing. I felt separated from the other diners which I appreciated. Our server  Jessica  was also very friendly  accommodating and provided excellent service. We will definitely be back

One enchilada and a cup of soup took 25 minutes to make on a to-go order when they weren t busy. I was told on the phone it would take 20 minutes  and it still wasn t ready when got there 20 minutes after the call and there were only 7 guests in the restaurant at 4 pm. The enchilada was supposed to be fajita beef with avocado sauce  which I had them verify the entire order verbally to me and what came out was ground beef with ranchero sauce. I didn t look at the food in the to-go boxes before leaving since they had verbally verified the order from the receipt  but obviously I should ve because they couldn t get a simple thing right. Not only that  but the enchilada only had meat inside  nothing else. Obviously there are supposed to be other ingredients like cheese inside as well  but there wasn t any and no cheese on top. Finally  the guy taking the order on the phone was abrupt and didn t even say anything after I said I d be there in 20 mins.  he just hung up on me.

Felt like happy hour so I saw a cool looking place up near the Arbor and stop in at Baby Acapulco s. I was seated outdoors a lovely day and decided to try the Mimosa to start with the happy hour menu the small tacos. First as i waited for the drink to arrive my waiter being very friendly said he wanted to see my drivers license I thought strange obviously I am well over 21 but it is a practice to ask every senior citizen there drivers license to make sure you can drink responsibly. The tiny tacos served was pretty greasy so I decided to order the queso with chips then my Mimosa showed up and had too much of the orange juice added less alcohol  but overall good. I do recommend the queso creamy hot and delicious served with chips amazing taste. I then ordered the corn cakes very good my favorite. Waiter attentive great place to chill out for Happy hour and relax. Yes diffently will returned for dinner next time. Parking no problem and stays pretty busy being off Stonelake. Happy yelping

Well  I came for the legendary purple rita and had a lot of fun grabbing drinks with a friend.  I wasn t overly impressed with their food but as I drank more of the purple rita  I ate more   They had a cheesy wedding singer type band when I came and the other times there was not a live band at all.  I m not sure which is better worse.  Baby As just isn t as good as it use to be or maybe my standards have changed since college.

You come here for the drinks. Do NOT come here for the food. It is a good place to chill or bring in some out-of-towners for an app and a snifter.  They are known for there drinks  rightly so. Fairly strong and with a nice selection.  Food is more geared for apps and snacks to keep you from driving inebriated once you have the high content specialty drinks.

I don t know why Baby A s has a low rating. I actually think it has good food. Now I know when you park there you can t find the entrance and I ended up entering the patio area. Seems like it was a popular place to enter since they had to put up a sign saying please check in front. I do recommend the Chicken Tortilla Soup combination which on a cold night hits to spot. Be careful it gives a good spice kick when you finish your soup. With the combination you get a taco and rice with it. Now I was tempted to get the Purple  Ritas but I was driving but my friend liked it a lot. The service was good for a Wednesday night.

Went there twice while staying at the hotel nearby this week.  The first night we just had drinks and the bartender was super nice  excellent service  I wish I remembered her name.  The second night we had food  it was ok  nothing to write home about  but the service was terrible.  The server acted like she didn t want to be there and didn t want us there  forgot her name   and then we cashed out and headed to the bar and had terrible service again  forgot his name .    The margaritas are crazy strong  in our group we tried practically all of them   especially the purple  the purple is basically just tequila and everclear with no real flavor.  If are looking to get drunk for 8.95 the purple is what you want.  However  if you want a good tasting margarita  go elsewhere.    The service was so bad the second night  I likely won t be back.

A Mexican place in a mall setting at about what you d expect in mid America. We were hoping that being in Austin it would have character or charm or something more but alas we were left with a mid America mall Mexican dinner.

The venue is a low cieling Mexican restraunt with an indoor bar and an outdoor seating area. Parking is okay  since there is additional parking behind the place. The indoor seating is a normal Mexican restraunt setting  but with elephant pinatas everywhere   I got the pork tacos on corn  there was a subtile taste of pineapple  and it was not very flavorful or spicy at all. I find that most people will like this level of taste  but for a real foodie  it s mediocre. You can always spice it up with the salsa given for each table. The meat was well done. The portion size is for one average person.  Overall  I go here because it s close to zilker and it has air-conditioning.

I ve always been here with a group of coworkers during lunch and although not spectacular  the food is good and largely dependable.  The service is great  as the waiters are polite and on top of things in terms of refilling water and chips.  However  if you re in a sizable group  8    expect a long wait for the food.  For a party of eight  the entire dining experience will take at least 1.5 hours with 45 minutes of that time waiting for entrees.  If you have that time  however  the food is rewarding.  First impressions are always important  and for Mexican restaurants  it s usually their chips.  The chips and salsa is pretty good with a good amount of spice that s not overboard.  The chips itself is very addicting and I m always guilty of satisfying any hunger I had walking in before I see my entree.  Baby A s chips are worth getting excited about.  I end up getting the Acapulco Fish Tacos most of the time.  My favorite part of this dish is the variety in the tacos.  Along with the fish there s avocado  cabbage  cilantro  and tomato  all of which tastes heavenly together.  It s mad difficult to make tilapia extremely delicious and although it can be a tad dry at times  Baby A s grills it well.  I just tried the Shrimp Enchilada today.  The enchilada is presented with two grilled shrimp on top and numerous smaller pieces of shrimp cooked inside.  Although there s a lot of shrimp inside  I wish they were a lot bigger.  Their tiny size made them dry out very easily and end up chewy.  Not so impressed.  The grilled shrimp on top  however  were pretty good.  All in all  a good standard shrimp enchilada.  I can see myself getting this again.  Never had their drinks before  but they re pretty popular with the group I go with.  If you re looking for a fun time to hang out  grab drinks  and enjoy quality Mexican food  this is a good place to go.

My friend and I decided to get out and try some Mexican food. I had eaten here before and it was ok. I had a sweet waitress and ordered my favorite which was puffy tacos. The chips were warm but broken up. My puffy tacos had little meat in them but soaked in melted cheese. The tacos were stale so I told my waitress. She left my beans and small amount of rice at the table. She brought back two smaller inside portions of meat and lettuce soaked in cheese with smaller puffy tacos. I asked my friend to try the second puffy taco shell and she said it was stale. The kitchen guy came out and said he made them fresh for me. I tried to explain that they tasted the same. So that being said for  12.50 I had three bites of my black beans and a spoon full of my Mexican rice. No apologizes or offer to compliment the meal. I will not be going back to this restaurant again. There are too many Mexican places to choose from.

Horrible  Horrible Horrible     I m sorry but this place needs to rethink its whole operation.  How on Cinco De Mayo does a restaurant run out of things and limit you to just one Margarita.      Which  by the way  suck    It s all Mix and not fresh.  I am really disappointed because I had many people show up and all of us had to wait for plates  tortillas and water. Each of which showed up 20 minutes after each other.  Our poor server Lady was overwhelmed and forgetful.  The food was atrocious.  Ordered fajitas for two early in the service and they still came out cold.   They only thing half way decent was the chips and salsa.   No Bueno Baby A s.  Hopefully this place will be better prepared in sept or next year around this time.  I mean Cinco De Mayo lands on the same calendar numeric day every year for eternity

For a Tex Mex chain this place is actually pretty good. They happy hour menu is what makes me a repeat customer. I m a fan of the Amores  5 tacos you get during happy hour and the drinks are pretty good too. It s pretty spot on street taco quality. Wish they are a carne asada version of this too and it will be golden. We also come by here for the chicken tortilla soup on cold days as well.   Place is huge  looks old a bit rundown but I guess that s what gives it character. The staff here is fantastic and service has always been great in every visit.
Spacious Mexican restaurant- was very quiet when I went.  Food was good and service was ok.

We had dinner again at this baby A s last night with our UTA student. We live in DFW area and we will always keep returning to this restaurant so long as food and service is good. Last night  our waiter was David and he was excellent  Thank you for your good service and good food  We shall return in the next month or so   PS. The margarita is tasty at this place   And the shrimp quesadilla  A must to order. Although  my son keeps raving about his burger how good it was

This was my first visit to this establishment. There is a great  festive ambiance when you walk up to the restaurant from the parking in the rear. There is a great patio with plenty of seating and warmers. Id like to sit out there next time i visit. There is also a small stage where I am assuming live music happens on certain nights. We only waited 10 minutes to be seated on a Friday night. I enjoyed all of the lights  not sure if they are always there or if it is due to Christmas. We were seated in a booth and noticed that the carpet was as old as the building  old   I am not a fan of carpet in restaurants  ever   The booths were also dated  used and abused. Needless to say  it s time for some new flooring and new booths. I ordered a swirl Margherita   blue  amp  coconut . Very good  I ve heard that this place is known for its Margherita s  amp  they didn t disappoint  The chips and salsa were really good  The salsa was not too spicy  just right for this gringa  . I wanted a good combination plate that wouldn t fill 3 plates  so the Helen platter was a nice surprise. It came with a cup of yummy chicken tortilla soup  1 chopped chicken enchilada  rice and a puffy taco. When the server brought it to the table  I was a little disgusted by all of the sweat all over his face. It was gross     If I would ve seen any of that sweat drip  it would ve been all over    So we blessed the food  I  topped it all with salsa and Queso and dug in. . I loved the soup. Not overly impressed with the enchilada but the taco was ok.  Overall  it was an OK experience. 3 stars due to the carpet  booths  and sweaty server  I would go back for the patio  Happy Hour  Margherita s  appetizers  chips and salsa  and possibly live music.

Came here for my first yelp event     Yah   and i had such a great time  We went during happy hour  Mon-Fri 2-7  and they have a food menu with items that are only  5 . I got the street tacos and man were they delicious. The carnitas were cooked perfectly and the corn tortillas hit the spot. I really do wish I got our servers name because he was great  attentive to our drinks and cleaning the table when needed and we had about 8 people in our party. So let s get into their salsa yummmmm I mean the right amount of heat. I don t have anything bad to say about my experience. But I will tell you the famous purple Rita is defiantly strong they knew what they were doing when they put a 2 per limit on it. Keep up the great work
Curb side purples please      Really the line would wrap around the block stay safe and we can come visit soon.

The place looks nice.  And  the food was alright. I had the fajitas. I asked for floor tortillas and only received two initially.  Then it was hard to get extra tortillas.  But  I was in town visiting due to business   and many people at the hotel  and the waiter s were bragging on the purple margaritas. So  me and a few of my colleagues ordered it.  Bad taste.

Tried to support Baby A s at this  difficult time...we are regulars. The food was cold  not packed well in the bag.  They lied and said that they were not allowed to sell margaritas. We checked later and found other restaurants are in fact selling margaritas to go. So disappointed...won t be back for a long time

Went in for a family dinner  Alyssa was great  Not only was it great service but she was patient with my kids. I will definitely be back and will be asking for her  What a great experience   thanks for Making a great dinner tonight

Very disappointed. We have gone to Baby A s for a little over a year now  amp  the last visit here will probably be the last one. My boyfriend has always gotten a military discount on his food only  but this visit he was told he couldn t get it since he wasn t in uniform. He showed him his military id  amp  was still told  the Id would not work  amp  he has to be active  amp  in uniform. We were then told the policy had change within the last three weeks.  I do want to point out that we were there about a week ago  amp  he was able to get the military discount. If the policy is going to change  post a notice on the door  amp  make sure everyone on the team is on the same page  amp  aware of the change.

Tried to eat there Tuesday  seated  but then NEVER even got water  chips or knew who was  supposed  to be our wait person    Service has gotten worse and worse over the last year...will NOT be back there....

Update 6 months later  loved the tacos al pastor with the beans  could do without the rice  Service was slow for a Sunday  Jordan seemed lost  And the margaritas are still good as ever  Brought my partner here for the 1st time and he really enjoyed everything   I ll be back in the summer   FYI  I was at the Cheesecake Factory and the tacos there were average  if you want good tacos with plenty of meat come here instead and drinks are half the price of that other place

Place is devoted like a tiki bar.  Except for the fact that you are in Austin where the temps are over 100 and the location is an office park.    The portions are Texas sized.  A bit too salty for my taste.  I ordered fish tacos. I ended up eating  he fish but didn t eat the rest of the meal.  Maybe it was because it was 100 degrees outside.    The service was a little slow and I went in around 1230 pm  the place looked empty.    If I come back to Austin I may try this place again to see if my experience was a one time  thing or a consistency with this place.

Despite reviews that I read before visiting this restaurant for the first time  the experience overall was quite nice  The food was tasty and prices reasonably. I had the Sarita combo and queso compuesta. The enchilada wasn t my favorite but the puffy taco was very good. Our waitress consistently checked on us and our beverage glasses were never empty. I would recommend trying this place out.

Best tortilla soup I ve tried  It was so delicious plus my waiter made the whole experience 10 times better  Teo was very attentive and even after a small problem  he ensured to to fix it in a timely manner. Definitely recommend
Service was great  Adan did a great job  The service was quick and efficient. The food was delicious and the staff was very accommodating

We love eating at Baby A s Stonelake  and want to call out outstanding service by Mimi. Mimi is awesome  remembering our favorite drinks and dishes  making sure we have everything we need  and generally making us feel taken care of. She s the best

We went to Baby A s for my birthday dinner this week and had such a wonderful time   One of the nicest things about our visit was our server Jessica.  She was so personable and accommodating  and she cheerfully attended all of our needs -- friendly  but not intrusive.  I think Baby A s needs to give her a Christmas bonus

These guys are so great  I love this team  the location  and of course the building  The purple margaritas are fun  and the food is decent. They have a lot of room  and make it fun with music at times.  Say hi to Ricky when you come in

Food was blah  ritas didnt taste like fresh squeezed lime juice nor good quality tequila. My chile relleno was not freshly made- may have been microwaved. I asked to have salad instead beans  and got shredded iceburg lettuce. I did like their rice. Would not go back here. If craving fresh made tex mex and ritas go to Chuy s  Lupe or one if the reputable ones. I think this is more for those who want to get sloshed  drinks were strong . Knocked down another point for damaged clothing and nasal passages. Then bathroom reaked of bleach fumes and then got bleach stains all over dark new pants from side of sink.

I went to baby A s today to meet a coworker for an early dinner. The restaurant was almost empty while we were there  but the service was great. Our server Alyssa recommended the stuffed avocado and it was delicious she was great and the bartender Joseph was very nice. We love this Baby A s location.

Our waitress was very polite  friendly and attentive just enough. My tongue needed its own personal fan as the salsa was spicy but very flavorful. The chips were great. Best salsa in town. The beef enchiladas with cheddar cheese was very good. The chicken tortilla soup is world famous. The puffy taco was excellent.

This is our favorite location primarily because of our FAVORITE server... Sherri  She is so attentive which is hard to come by now a days  and not to mention she never fails to keep us laughing and having a great time throughout our night  The purple margs are obvi our fave  but the queso compuesto is bomb and the tortilla soup gives me life. Although we are equal distance to the Baby A s location in pflugerville  we always choose the Stonelake location because we know we ll see our favorite girl Sherri  Keep it up Baby A s Stonelake

When you receive a basket of bottom of the bag chips with your queso order  mostly no bigger than a quarter  you know you re at a restaurant that doesn t care about their food. Sadly  the rest of the meal was no better. The chicken in the puffy tacos was soggy and bland. Really  the only reason I see to ever come here is if you want to get drunk off their strong purple margaritas and listen to live music on the patio. Skip the food.

Love Baby A s food  no matter what I get I m always satisfied with the savory flavors and the decent portions they provide. Today was no different as we all enjoyed sitting and eating some good food. The staff was pleasant and willing to answer any questions we had about the food. Overall  pleasant experience.
I really enjoyed my experience here  The food was so yummy and our server Jessica was so nice and fun  she had us laughing almost the whole time we were there. Will definitely be back

We regularly visit Baby A s. Sergio always takes care of us. He goes above and beyond to make sure everything is correct and we are happy. I can t say enough great things about him  If you are ever there  ask for Sergio

This place....I just can t even. Service was alright... My friend order the  Triple Stack  quesadilla  which just means there is an extra tortilla in the middle. That thing was 10.00 and the saddest thing I have ever seen. I could go to taco cabana and get a personal one that is the EXACT SAME SIZE  cheaper and a thousand times better. The photo I am posting is my baby changa which cost the same as his sad quesadilla. My baby changa was good  but seeing my friend get completely screwed over for his meal is just unacceptable.   Do yourself a solid and just don t go there. I feel like they are charging way too much for something my 6 year old niece could do a better job at making
Purple Margarita  That s it. Enough said. I will keep typing because I have to. Chicken Tortilla Soup

Food  GREAT. Drinks  Strong. SERVICE  TERRIBLE. My family and I were here for a family reunion and had a party of 28. Upon entrance into the establishment the attitude of all service workers we encountered was very poor. Our main server Madison barely made any eye contact and said less than the minimum words that should be exchanged in the conversation of placing an order. I will say that she was on her own the large majority of the time we we there while several other workers were standing around doing nothing. That influenced the poor flow of the refill of drinks  chips and salsa  and the 30 mintues between drink and food orders. The manager came around to help her out a little bit and when I let her know that after 3 sips of my drink it was too strong and that I didnt want it anymore she told me that they dont allow drink returns and that she could bring me out some strawberry puree. Why would I pay money to make my own drink or drink something that was poorly made  Nothing of greeting was said to us upon arrival or departure. I did not feel valued as a customer here at all  I will not be returning.

Where s the door  I parked in the back and couldn t find the right door. It was like a maze. Once we finally made it inside  we were seated immediately. Come to find out....Baby As sells margarita flights  This is such a great idea. There margaritas are strong as usual.... So strong. They will definitely knock you off your rocker if you aren t paying attention. The only downfall of the flight is that you can t mix and match the flavors you want. There was a game on the TV and a large crowd screaming at the game. I was not expecting this in a restaurant setting. It was almost as rowdy as a sports bar. It was a little off putting for a restaurant. We were looking for a place to eat and have a conversation with our meal  but it was a little loud for that. The service was a little slow even though there wasn t a full restaurant  but our waiter was very attentive the few times he came by. It was nice visiting a new location for this great restaurant.

We are normally and super fans of Baby Acapulco  but today was not the best performance on their part.  Service was slow in we were left waiting for about 10 minutes to ask for a more corn tortillas.  By the time the waitress came bag with the corn tortillas  the fajitas were cold.  They were very busy today as it was cinco de Mayo but I feel like it would  have made more sense to have brought more than 2 corn tortillas from the start for the large fajita plate that we ordered.  Between the 2 adults in our party  we ordered 4 regular Margaritas.  When we inspected our bill we realized that they had charged us for 4 premium Margaritas.  We call their attention to this error and it took a while to fix it. We were dining with children and the children were beginning to lose their composure at the end of the meal which is why we decided it was time to leave. By the time they actually got our bill fixed  the kids were really losing it and it just made for a negative experience.  Also  instead of fixing the price for each Margarita they just took one Margarita off which means that we still were not made whole for their mistake and they ended up keeping some of our money.  If you make a mistake  you need to make the customer whole and not just arbitrarily decide that you are going to do whatever is convenient for you  amp  keep their money. NOT OK

Hosted an event here for work and the staff was amazing    Chris was our server and he made every effort to make sure we had everything we needed. The manager James was also very accommodating and made sure my event went smooth. Even the security officer helped when we were having technical issues with the presentation    Will definitely keep this on my list of venue locations for Austin work events

Love this place  We had a 45 minute wait  amp  the manager James was SO helpful. Him  amp  hostess waitress Mayra worked it out so that we could get seated earlier  amp  gave us the most incredible service. Mayra was WONDERFUL  amp  so sweet
Omar was an amazing server  He was always checking on us and providing great service  10 10 recommend the purple marg without a doubt
Bobby and Ricky  bartenders  they are Both the best . Always helpful  and both really Laid back. They both always make our experience here a great one.   Keep up the awesome customers services guys.

We finally got a baby sitter and parents night out could not have been better   Atmosphere like this and people like  Jordan make this a choice location to spend you parent time out . The food is great but the fun times were what we came for thank you jordon
This is Our go to spot when we want Mexican food in austin.  The service and food always meet our expectations.  Love is some baby a s.

The food was amazing drinks where amazing. Our waitress Francis I believe her name was was outstanding  Another waitress who did amazing was Jessica I love going here the vibes you get right when you walk in are awesome. Definitely will be back

My family and I went yesterday.  And was treated so bad.  The waitress was so unprofessional and rude   she snatched the menus out of my hand and then made a jester of cutting her throat behind my back in front of my mother  son  amp  daughter in law.  This was our go to place to eat with the family.  Now I will not step foot back in this place.  We left without even eating because after her jester we decided it was best

Great job Keona A.  My second time here. Ref check  273 table  D32... Great service  amp  great food   These days it s either one or the other...rarely both   BabyAs nailed it  Yep  my family will be back    Ask for Keona

I absolutely love this place and our server Mimi was so amazing and so attentive to our table  She stayed smiling the whole night  It was such a great experience to have such positive energy around amazing food and drinks  Thanks Mimi

I have always been a huge fan of Baby A s. Haven t been in a while and I was SO GLAD that i decided to come back on Cinco de Mayo...  They had a cover band playing pop and rock hits from 80s  90s  and today which was really fun  especially after the purp rita kicked in .  Food and service was great..  Did I mention I LOVE their purple ritas  Seriously 1 and 1 2 and you are GOOD   HAHA it s so amazing

Visited for my 3rd time and had a new server greet me  Her name is Mimi...shes was great fast short but sweet with everything. I was surprised at the options we have with ordering food and drink suggestions  Thank you so much Mimi for making our experience better than our previous.

Adan was amazing friendly and actually looked through the menus with me and my boyfriend to help find what we would enjoy. If you are ever at this location you should always request for him  you won t be disappointed.

Keona was just fantastic  amazing service  friendly personality and just the best and more than I could expect on such a busy night.   We came on Cinco De Mayo and our waitress was the life saver of a potential bad night. I will come back and can only hope to have the same great service

I cant leave zero stars so I guess I liked the live music. I sat for 10 minutes wuthout being served so I walked into the bar and got a drink. Back to my table  still no service aaked for a manager then it took another 10 min. To get a rude little girl with attitude. My friend got a frozen that tasted rancid  so asked for a different flavor also rancid tasting as if the mix had gone bad or a mouse was dead in the machine. We ended up drinking water watching the band due to lousy drinks and service. I have never been so let down by any Baby A s and I have been to the all. Dont waste your time or money  and dont be as nice as I was instead just walk away.
Our server Cody worked a large table tonight and made it happen  Drinks were on point and on time. Thanks for the service tonight Cody

I was in Austin for the weekend and a friend recommended Baby A s. My time was kinda limited so I placed an order to go. When I arrived I met with Alyssa one of the servers. She advised me that my order would still be a few minutes. She was very nice and offered me something to drink while I waited. The restaurant was a nice place and Alyssa was very nice respectful. I will definitely be coming back to Baby A s

Sometimes you just need a good kinda dumpy place to drink at that you can go to on the regular.  Baby A s is it for me... and mainly because of their bartender  Eddie.  The place isn t the best venue... but on the weekends  they have live music... and you basically can t mess up warm chips and queso.... you just can t... well I bet you can  but they don t.  I treat this like my local bar... and mainly because Eddie s just a cool guy to hang out with there.  He can make anything... if you re drinking anything outside of the purple frozen drink which you can only get 2 of... because it ll getcha drunk quick....  I ll be honest with you  the menu isn t all that thrilling... I haven t had anything off of it other than apps.  It s mexican food at it s most basic... but if you want a quick meal  or a cool place to just kinda hang out at... or a great place to embarrass someone with terrible singing on their birthday at... Baby A s is your spot.  I m not wowed  but I m also not gonna stop going on the weekends... it s just a calm  decent place to chill..  3.5 stars... but I ll round up to 4.

Hmmm--I m not understanding the poor Yelp reviews. We went on a Friday afternoon around 5 30. They have a nice outdoor patio and an indoor patio with a nice fire pit. Because it was rainy  we sat inside at a booth. We were surprised at how large the restaurant is  Lots of booths and it s cozy inside. They have a page of their menu just dedicated to their various margaritas. I m not a flavored margarita fan  so asked about just a regular margarita  which the waiter said is the lime flavored margarita. It was  5 on happy hour  and a good strength but tasted too lime-y for me.  My husband got the premium margarita   8  which was not on happy hour  but it the glass was FULL of ice  which was really ridiculous.  My husband ordered the big bowl of tortilla soup which he loved  and I ordered the Pollo Tropical plate. Very good and healthy  I liked the warm chips and salsa  they are thicker chips and I prefer thin  but there were still good . I was pleasantly surprised at the prices and portions. Most entrees are around  10. We will definitely be back and look forward to the patio in the spring months

The food is pretty good  and the service is great. I have been a handful of times w  my uncle and have had a pretty positive experiences.  The last time I was there though  the employee tried to argue with me about my Service Dog. He told me he was going to talk to the manager  and I said fine. I am glad he talked to his manager  because he was set straight. Not his fault  but I am glad that he had the good sense to double check. In the future  please verse your employees a little better on service dog laws  otherwise I had a relatively pleasant experience.

We hosted a party there recently and the food was delicious. The drinks were really strong  but in a good way. We were able to reserve the back room  which is a nice round area with plenty of seating. Our waiter  Sergio  took care of about 35 people and did it with ease. Whatever we needed  he was on it  We were able to send over our orders ahead of time  so when we got there  the food came out promptly. Baby A s and their entire team deserves kudos for their great food and awesome staff

Food was OK  service was OK. Not the place it used to be. The only truly bad thing was they have street corn on the menu. Rather than have a fresh piece of corn that is grilled and well seasoned  which is what Mexican street corn is   they start with a piece of frozen corn  boil it so it is nice and mushy  add some mayonnaise and a sprinkle seasoning to create a truly unappetizing  inedible product.  In the summertime  the cost of corn is incredibly cheap. The idea of getting fresh grilled corn sounds awesome. Getting the mush is pretty disappointing. I told the manager about it  he said he couldn t do anything about it but it would he would pass the information on. I didn t get the feeling he would.

I haven t been here in years but after a doctors appt I figured I would stop in and grab a bite to let traffic die down before driving home. Hostess sat me in a nice corner with a window since I was alone.....Big shout out to Krystal for her recommendation on the soup and tacos. She even asked me for my preference on the protein I wanted. I ve never had a waiter waitress so quick on their feet  even my sweet tea stayed full
Mannnnn Krystal is THE BOMB  Hands down  The best server I ve ever encountered. Make sure when you come to ask for KRYSTAL

Food was decent  however it was  300 to cater for 15 people   20 per person .  Order was to be picked up at 11 45am and it was not ready until 12 00.  This was for a business luncheon so I was on a schedule.  Arrived to the office with lunch and although they gave us forks  we did not receive plates or any utensils to serve the food from the containers.  Would not recommend for catering services  expected a little more for the money paid.

I came in with a party of six and told I was in a bit of a rush  and I let that host know she told me it would be a 45 minute wait  yikes  Normally this would be a reasonable  time but as I said I was in a time crunch. Well to my delight another host named Alyssa  went above and beyond and was able to accommodate my party in about 10 minutes  Talk about a life saver  it s small things like this that make the difference. I just wanted to commend and thank Alyssa for her awesome and prompt service. I will definitely be returning

They have 30.06 and 30.07 sign s .  They ve lost my business and apparently others as well. Went in on a Saturday night around 8 30ish with some friends from Dallas and the place was dead. Not sure what happened this place used to be poppin  but I won t be going back.

This was the second time I had been to Austin  from Florida  and the first time I had Baby Acapulco was closer to downtown area so it was a bit crazier. I thought I d check out a different one and this is where we ended up. I was on a business trip a couple weeks ago before the new year and wanted to take my coworker and he LOVED it  We had fajitas  enchiladas and some of their margaritas. Man  such good Mexican food and drinks  Our server was a sweet young lady named Maria  I believe  and she was a great server  never had to ask for anything she brought us anything we needed before our meal came out and welcomed us to Austin with great hospitality and recommend some things we could do on our spare time  again very sweet young lady. The restaurant was much cleaner and nicer looking than the other location. I will continue to come to this location when I am working in the Austin area.

Tuesday night dinner after arriving in town later in the evening for a business trip.  I mainly picked this place because it was convenient to my hotel.  I had the chile relleno stuffed with beef.  Beans and rice as sides were kinda bland and not very satisfying.  The main dish was good and cooked properly.  Chips and salsa were avg  salsa was a bit hot for my taste  and I typically like hot things.  Almost to the point of them needing a  mild  option  but maybe that s just what you get in TX     Long story short - I wouldn t go out of my way to eat here  but the server was nice and the meal was presented quickly  on a plate that was about 200F... .
Raiza was amazing  She handled our 10  person table with separate checks and a lot of chaos. She was friendly  professional  prompt and courteous. Thank you so much

They decided to run my credit card for more than I signed for  and the service at the bar was terrible  and the restaurant wasn t busy.  I was visiting Austin and heard good things so stopped by with a coworker.  Service at the bar was terrible.  I kept having to ask one of the regulars to flag down the bartender because they were completely ignoring us.  I always tip well  but apparently didn t tip enough because the charge to my card is more than the bill with tip  and I have pictures.  I tried calling the store directly  but got no answer so I emailed the restaurant with the email address listed on the website.  Waiting to hear back.

This is our favorite resturaunt for mexican food AND holding our family birthday parties at.  We just ate again yesterday and one of our favorite waitresses was there.  Her name is Raiza.  She is an awesome waitress and always keeps us loaded with chips and hot sauce without having to ask.  You will not be disappointed with Baby A s

Not a relaxing place.To much drama just to get a damn drink. They worry more about watching over your back  like having your mother with you  instead of worrying about the quality of their food and personnel. Make it a bar or a restaurant can t handle both.

BEST PLACE EVER     My girls nd I have been coming here since they opened and it JUST GETS BETTER    It is pretty awesome when u are a regular and the server  bar tender KNOWS UR DRINK    Well  RICK in the bar is for SURE to treat u JUST LIKE THAT    He gets EVERYTHING right    And to satisfy a table of middle aged women to the level that Rick does  not an easy task  but he does EVERY TIME    TWO THUMBS UP FOR BABY S AND 3 AND 1 2 IF RICK IS UR SERVER

Baby A s in two words  Purple Margarita.  Drink your limit of two and everything else is great and fun from there.  My favorites here are the Baby A s Soup  Green Chile Burger  and Puffy Tacos.  Of course  the chips and salsa are always great to start with the Purples.  I see a great deal of negativity in reviews  but if you come here with managed expectations  everything is fine.  Don t expect world-class dining  but do expect good  reliable Tex-Mex at a reasonable price.  The service has always been great  friendly and attentive for me.  To top it off  Baby A s features some great local talent in their live music lineup

Unimpressive.  10 for 6 nachos and  13 for a pathetic serving of shrimp enchiladas. Eh. Go spend your money somewhere else. For subpar texmex in small servings  this is the place to beat. Otherwise  don t waste your time.

Hosted a Meet and Greet for Texas Sport Bike Riders. We rented a patio and received spectacular service from Jordan and Liz Beth  Decent food  great space  amazing service  I highly recommend if you re having a gathering.

Bummer. Wish I would have checked the reviews first. I stopped here because it was the closest restaurant to my hotel and it looked nice from the outside  star 1 and 2 . When I approached the stand the host said   what do you need    I responded   a seat  maybe  .   Apparently he expected that answer because with menu in hand he walked away. I assumed  right this way sir  must have been implied so trailing the unhostly host I was pleased I wasn t following him to his smoke break and was seated at a booth in a very uncrowded restaurant.  Chips salsa and water were delivered as expected. I then saw the host deliver a basket of chips to a table after he took a chip off the top and ate it during the delivery.  I was already halfway through my basket so I figured whatever. Chips and salsa were not bad but I didn t give it a star because I doubt they were homemade.  My waitress arrived and I ordered the fried fish tacos with cilantro rice and black beans. The tacos arrived in about 10 minutes. After examining for bite marks  I did the taco head tilt and tried one. Very bland even with the side sauce.  Beans were not bad.  Chips and salsa were the best part of this meal. My glass of water remained empty as my waitress and the unhost served the other 10 patrons.  I don t know how long they have been in business but I will be surprised if it is much longer. Too many really good restaurants around. There is  10 I wish I would have spent at Subway.  Don t mean to be so negative  I really tried to find something redeeming.  Enjoy

My wife  Melissa and I love the puffy tacos at Baby A s and lately that has meant trips to this stonelake location.  Always so very good...  Nicely spiced  great Charro beans  tasty rice and lots of chips and salsa too to bring out those flavors even better.  We just returned from our latest visit a few minutes ago and this time was even better than usual-our waiter  we asked his name and it was Sergio  was friendly  accommodating  did not hover but seemed to know when the salsa was running low and served up those puffy  beefy wonderful tacos hot and ready to eat...  He made our trip even better than usual.  I already had a picture of an earlier serving as the background on my phone but if I didn t  I would have done it today.  Thanks  Sergio...   Emil  amp  Melissa Balusek
Amazing  Our server David R was so kind and took excellent care of us  best frozen margarita I ve ever had

Its unfortunate that Austin is under a boil water band  but when this place uses the situation to gauge the customer on  2.35 for every soft drink and a  1 for all water.  Come on now... It would great if they only charged you once  which would make more sense...

Baby A gets a bad rap but it s actually a great place to meet for lunch or hh.  They do the normal Tex-Mex stuff well   Burritos  enchiladas  tacos  fajitas  and margaritas.
