Don t go there for a white glove experience...you go for hh 4-7  especially if there is one right by your office .  The tortilla soup is one of my faves.
Food was good. Drinks I hear are strong. Bitcoin meetup is here so that s a good thing.

Attempted to order a to go order over the phone and the host made it very difficult ... can t believe they will turn away business on to go orders over the phone... it s about speed and you make me come in to order to go and sit here and wait  Maybe the manager should re-evaluate their policy on to go orders. Okay well I will never order here again and suggest you don t either
Our server was named Jesus and he was great     He served us all night delicious margaritas and kept checking on us constantly to give us more French fries. He is the best

There are many reasons to come to this Baby A s. But the first and greatest of all  are the bartenders  Ricky and Diego. They are consistently some of the most on point and fun people to be around - especially when they re together. I come just for them. On the other hand  if you like GREAT frozen margaritas  warm chips and good salsa  and fantastic al pastor. Come to this Baby A s.

If I could give this place a zero  I would. We decided to sit inside because there was live music and we thought it would be too loud for the baby so they seated us in the restaurant. We only went to drink and grab dessert and thank goodness for that. We didn t have anyone come up to the table for at least 10 minutes after being seated and never got chips and salsa or water. After getting our own drinks from the bar  we finally had three different servers come up to the table because no one knew who was suppose to be assigned to us. We ordered one drink from the first server and she never returned to our table. After probably 20 minutes  the manager approached our table and asked if we had been helped. I said we had had a few different people but all we were really going to be was drink and she became super crappy and said we should have requested to be in the bar...with the baby. We said we wanted to be in the restaurant side and she proceeded to say that it  wasn t their custom  to have people just drinking in the restaurant and stared at for a minute before grabbing up all but one menu and walking away. Another waiter came back to our table and asked if he could bring us chips and salsa or anything else and then apologized for our service. When he turned to walk away  the manager was waiting for him and chatted with him and he never returned to our table after that. Had we been planning to eat  the entire experience would have ruined that...like it did about us ordering our dessert  which we chose to get elsewhere after leaving. Super disappointed since it looked like it could be a great place but I guess next time we will look further out from our hotel. Thanks to the guy that actually did try to help us out  we appreciate it.

We went on a Friday for happy hour and did NOT have a favorable experience. We spoke to the GM  Ron  about it and he gave us his card and invited us to come back.  We did and had a great experience the second time around. Service was excellent  food was excellent  And we noticed that other tables were getting ready same outstanding service as we were.. so it want just because Rob told them to take care of us. We ll go back again. Thank you to Ron and the Baby A s staff for making an effort to win us back.

Y all.....MARINA is freaking AWESOME. She was very friendly and was honest about the menu. She offered fantastic suggestions. I had the fried fish tacos and they were bomb. The Blue margarita was lit. Go to her now
Excellent service our server Alyssa was amazing very fast and kept our glasses filled. Definitely going back

Worst establishment I ve ever been to.  Very bad service. Run down.  The sign off the road is falling apart. Doesn t seem like they even clean the place.  Management team  you ve failed horribly.  Do not come here. This place will not last much longer.

I stop coming to this Location because they changed the bartenders. But today they had NANCY and SERFINA and they know their trait and I miss them I never have to wait for anyone and their attitudes are always POSITIVE       Thank you keep that team
I order Baby A s tortilla soup from Favor several times a month  amp  Baby A s  always gets my order right  amp  they are fast  Yummy food- good service.

Nope.   Bad service  dirty place.  Food  mediocre  faster than draft beers ordered.   For a city celebrated for so much including its cuisine I would not recommend and would in fact urge you to go elsewhere. Like Taco Bell. At least it s cheap fast  amp  you know exactly what you re getting.

I haven t been to this location in about a year but today s visit was above-average. As a matter of fact it was an excellent visit. Our waitress Destiny was the best    Prompt and friendly and the chips and queso were on point  I will be returning soon

If this place steadily improved for a decade or so it could eventually get to two stars.    It s my fault for going here.   Everyone in Austin knows Baby As is terrible.   But we were headed back from a game and the kids were starving and we thought what the hell- at least it will be quick.  Well we were wrong about that most of all.    I won t go into detail but there are a bunch of small things that are easy for a restaurant to get right that place can t get right.  We never got our apps  the drinks weren t right  the food order was wrong  and the check took forever.

Not a complaint at against Baby A s in general just the location in the Arburetum  Let me say this particular location is absolutely horrible  if you sit at the bar and have to deal with their bartenders for food and drinks. Sat at the bar and tried to get a drink - took 15 minutes of actual begging and pleading to even get an acknowledgement from 2 bartenders though the place was dead on a Thursday night   First time at this newer location but been to the location on Barton Springs and prior location at I-35 and 290 at least 100 times in last decade  never a problem.  AVOID THIS LOCATION at all costs

After calling a couple of places that had long waits  my girlfriend and I decided to come here. Our server  Scotty  caught us as we were walking into the building and promptly seated us. The outdoor seating area is nice  and live music was in full swing. Complementary chips and salsa are great  the queso was decent  and the drinks were strong. Scotty was excellent until a large party showed up  and even then he was good. The entrees were the only part of the experience that didn t tickle my fancy. The tortilla soup was nice and spicy  but there was a huge hunk of chicken in it that needed to be shredded. The enchilada with verde sauce was lot better than the puffy taco  a mini taco salad of sorts . The rice was a bit bland. Overall it was a good dining experience for a lazy  warm Saturday night.

Keona is the best server ever      She was very fast with our food and attentive. Te food was great and I recommend the queso compuesto. Love the old 80 s music while sitting at the table. Plenty of tv s to watch all the sports you want. Highly recommend for lunch and dinner

I go into Baby A s at Stone Lake as often as I can. I will only sit at the bar when Joseph the bartender is working because he is awesome. He gives great customer service in the bar and it is always a good time when he is there.

Two things to order here   the purple margs and the pork al pastor with charro beans.  Do NOT stray from this and you will leave moderately giggly and sated.    Hubby and his friend both got the  Famous Wet Burritos .  That just sounds nasty.  There are only a few things I would eat that are described as  wet   and this ain t one of em.  Why would you want a soggy burrito   The  wet  just means they cover em in a sauce of your choosing and hubby s actually was not bad covered in queso  but that thing musta packed about 6694 calories.      The pastor here is usually pretty good.  Little chunks of seasoned pork and pineapple sauteed     together  with cilantro and purple onion on the side and served with a nice and tangy avocado sauce.  The charros are really good  chock loaded with tomato  onion and bacon.  This is my go-to meal when forced to eat at Baby A s.  The purples    Well they make me warm and fuzzy in all the right places. They make me dance across the parking lot.  They make me kiss and say  I love you man  to my hubby s best friend as we left. They make me sing  Baby Got Back  at the top of my lungs in my car.  Charro beans and rice din t miss me

Bathrooms are atrocious   Won t return to this location unless they address these issues.  One stall was out of service.  The other two were full.  The one I used had no toilet paper holder and the only available paper was in the floor between this stall and the one that is out of order.  Does this mean the toilet paper had seen the overflow that caused the  out of order  designation  Not sure.  They were out of toilet seat covers and the trash can was overflowing.  All this  during happy hour  not even the dinner rush.  A waitress did ask what I was taking pictures of and said it didn t like good for the middle of a shift. I agreed it didn t look good at the end of a shift.  She said she would tell the management.  Not comforting for a grown woman out to happy hour forced to choose between using questionable toilet paper or dripping dry.  You guess which I chose.
Marcos was amazing  Great customer service and had a smile the entire time  Did not a Have to ask for anything  he was 100  on top of everything      Thank you Marcos

First time here with a co-worker.  Tried the purple Rita everybody bragged about. Only had one and let s say I didn t need another. Very good. My shrimp enchiladas were also on point. I ll be back. Highly recommend.

On a Friday night  with great weather for being outside  when half of the tables in the Gazebo were open  they could not seat us. Still didn t understand why. The hostess needed to check with 5 people before she could give an estimate  inaccurate  by which we could be seated.
Best Margarita s in town. Great appetizers  rest of the menu is pretty good. Service is usually really good.

Just wanted to give a thanks to RON And his wonderful staff here at baby A s For making us feel really welcome And also providing great customer service.  We love this location. The purple margarita  Is one of our favorite drinks here Highly recommend it. We also love sitting outside on the patio Enjoyin Austin s beautiful weather there s also really big trees  With lots of shade.

Great place to hang out with the family. Relaxing atmosphere  great people and our server Ms. Carolyn was on top of her game. The purple margaritas are as good as they say  SORRY. I hit wrong Baby A s location. I was at S. Lake shore in South Austin  Riverside. I m certain the food at this Baby A s is just as delicious.

I m a huge fan of baby A s in general as they make my favorite frozen margarita in town  but this location is especially wonderful for multiple reasons. First off  the location is unbeatably accessible and also has one of the cutest outdoor patios in the area. ...But the real treasure here is Bobby  who was my waiter tonight  and mentioned that he also bartends. He was transparently informative about the happy hour specials  his recommendations  and was truly committed to ensuring that I was always pleased with my order. I must admit that I was having a rough week and came in for a margarita with a girlfriend  but Bobby s kindness and sincerity actually turned my day around  which doesn t happen much these days. I would definitely appreciate more individuals like Bobby in the service industry.  Stop by if you re in the area

We go here for the 2 P s. The patio and the purple   This place is like the  Oasis  you don t go there for the quality of the food  but simply because you want to be in the atmosphere.... The patio is great with the live music on the weekends. Nothing in Austin and beat a purple margarita to start our your weekend.

Minus a star because the food isn t as good as the Pflugerville Baby As. The drinks however are always good. Service was also great  always is when we come to this one.. I thinks the service is a little better than the other one. This one doesn t have as nice of a bar but does it s job right

Baby As is a great place for a relaxing lunch. It was decorated beautifully for Christmas. My 3 year old twins loved the blow up Santa and hot chocolate. The tree and lights were so pretty. We got many cute pics  Sheree  our waitress  was very attentive. The boys were begging for queso from the moment we sat down. Sheree made a joke about getting it out quickly for them and boy did she. My mom and I had a margarita. They were strong  Just how we like them. The lunch portions were perfect. I recommend the puffy tacos and cheese enchiladas. We can t wait to go back for a relaxing lunch sometime again soon.

Not the food. Definitely not the food. I came to have drinks and listen to Joe King Carrasco Play live. Yep  I had some chips and salsa  bean  amp  cheese nachos  but that s it. This place needs help in the menu department. Any restaurant can sell beer and  meh  margaritas.  That is all.

The food was okay  the service  Susan   sucked. Was very rude and unprofessional  she treated us like 3rd class citizens. Her attitude changed when she noticed my louis Vuitton wallet...... I still left her a more than average tip. Will never go back
Horrible service  Thanks for forgetting to bring the food  Once we were FINALLY waited on

Came in with a group of 15  and the service was terrible  It s understood that it s a big group but it s no excuse for our food to come over two hours after we ordered. Some of our party went to the bar to get a drink and we re asked where they were sitting before they even considered serving them. Do NOT come here with a big party  it s a terrible idea.

Visited Baby A s this weekend i had the pleasure of dinning in and had the most wonderful experience. Mimi was my server she is the most pleasant person. Her warm beautiful smile and amazing attitude. I will go back just for that reason.
A decent place to have some Tex Mex. Never had to wait for a table. The veggie fajitas we re good.

Saturday night  ignored at both hostess stands  finally told that take a seat by what appeared to be one of the few waitstaff on duty  ignored for another 10 minutes  went to eat at the bar. Been there a dozen times  normally 2 Margs and I m good. This one was so weak all you could taste was sweet and sour. Had to order a shot to make it right. Barely edible  fried avocado  husband had chili rellano  also barely edible. Should have went with initial thought to get hell out of there. Felt  and tasted like a restaurant in steep decline.  And that is too bad  family owned place for 30 years and all. Austin is too much of a culinary town to survive this for very long. Get it together Baby A s. Please

I guess I really wasn t feeling Baby A s today. Service was really slow despite not being busy at all for a dinner service on a Saturday night. We were seating quickly -kudos B.A.  but it took about 15 minutes for the waitstaff to acknowledge that we were in their section. By the time she came around for the drink order we were already ready to order. Cool  this should speed things up right  Okay  maybe too sped up. I m used to hearing my fajitas before I see them. No sizzle  more like a Luke-warm slab of bell peppers and onions in my face. Had to really hunt for the beef. Where s tha beef  I m also used to the server saying  careful with the plate  it s hot . Guess he already knew I d have to heat up my food with the little lamp at the table...  Changed from 2 stars to 4 just because of Clarita. THANK YOU for reaching out and addressing this concern. I wish people understood that sometimes that s all it takes to change someone s mind about a review. Some good old  hey  we hear you and we want to make things right . I appreciate you taking the time to reach out. Good guest service goes a long way.

Mirian C and Evelyn did a wonderful job. My friend and I came to this location for my birthday  Sept 4th and we re serviced by Evelyn then came back today Sept 7th and were helped by Mirian and they were both super friendly and attentive. Will definitely be returning for the great service and strong margaritas.

I went in for dinner Friday night after a week of cabin fever because of the weather.  The atmosphere was warm and bustling which I found to be nurturing.  My server was Sheree.  She was engaging and friendly without being overbearing.  She had a good grasp of the menu.  So  when I told her I was gluten free and sugar sensitive she recommended the fish tacos on corn and the mexican martini.  Both hit the spot  I noticed Sheree had red lipstick to match her red Baby A s which I thought was a nice touch. The entire experience fed my body and soul.  Just what the doctor ordered

Hello Sunshine  It feels great to be at an outdoor restaurant  listening to music after all this flooding.  It s been some time since we last visited this location. Nice to see they ve updated part of the patio  amp  the menu had a fresh look with a couple of new items.   We began our Friday with a couple of Mango Ritas that did not disappoint. Although it took some time for our food to arrve  we didn t mind it. We thoroughly enjoyed listening to  Nudge  perform. Thanks for the TGIF entertainment   I ordered Yayos al pastor tacos  yummy  My husband ordered the deluxe dinner which he enjoyed. If it didn t take 45 minutes to receive our food   it might have rated a little better.
A rat running on their outside patio. Waiter said its a possum  no  its not ... Its a rat...they dont care

My fianc  and I went to baby A s just recently and we had an amazing experience. The host Alyssa was very friendly as soon as we walked in and she sat us in Miriam s section and she took excellent care of us. Our food was hot and our drinks were cold 10 out of 10. I would recommend Baby A s to anyone that is looking for a fun and friendly dining experience.

Our waitress was very attentive and available despite her large section. The food was on point. But the lights wrapped around the trees at night made such an amazing environment  my favorite part  for good food and good talks.

We are from out of state and staying at a hotel near Baby A.  We just walked over and were immediately greeted in a grand Texas fashion and seated.  Sheree was our waitress and was absolutely awesome    Her personality was as if we had know her for years    She was incredibly attentive  even with a large customer base. The manager also greeted us and was very interested in our dining experience.   I order fajitas and my wife ordered a salad.  Both were very high quality.  The margaritas were superb    Two thumbs up

My coworker and I had such a positive experience here. John  Ramos  was very very attentive to our table and he checked on us very frequently. We are going to ask to sit as his table every time    the margaritas are amazing

Awesome purple margs and enchiladas. Sergio was the best server we ve had in a long time and we will ask for him in the future. The band outside was great as well. Highly recommend Stonelake Baby A s and ask for Sergio
Great food. Great service. Great drinks. Yum. Go go go  Sam was a great waiter  Go fast
Just wanted to say the purple margaritas are great. Food and atmosphere were great as well.

The prices are very reasonable for the portion size  the drinks are strong  and our server  John  was very accommodating of our orders and requests.  Overall a very positive experience  planning to come back.

Unless you are coming here to drink  pass in the food.. It is not sit down quality food for the price. Drinks are good and happy hour prices are not bad. Adding to my review  they will not deviate from the lunch menu  no substitutions. They brought out 2 salsas for a table of 9  And 2 baskets of chips

We have always enjoyed babyAs. The tortilla soup is amazing  but lately we have noticed they are not keeping up with maintaining the structure or the grounds. It is a shame because it is a cool place.
Great patio. Spacious with live music. Food is ok. Only going for drinks for now. Must try purple ritas.

Went there to celebrate with some friends on a Friday just after lunch rush. Ordered two fajitas-for-two plates with additional shrimp and black beans. Both plates arrived and were not sizzling like fresh-off-the-grill fajitas usually come. These were more like  we made too many batches and hold these under the heat lamp for some sucker . The meat was dry  the shrimp were small  and the general portion was not conducive for sharing for two  let alone four  a double order .   Probably not returning to this particular location any time soon. Sam s Boat is just around the corner.

Sat outside at table 20.  Great environment and really enjoyed the patio and fall weather.  That s all I can say good about the place.  Got there at 6p  ordered margaritas and food at 6 15 .  I know exactly what time it was because we checked to make sure we were in happy hour.  Chips and salsa were brought promptly  but we were almost done with the salsa and chips when our waitress still had not brought our waters.  At 6 55 I ask about our margaritas and she said  You just ordered waters right    My gf wanted to leave  but the waitress said she would have the margaritas out right away and the food was coming out now. At 7 02 we finally admitted defeat and left.  I ll never go back.
The purple margaritas are soooo good. Evelyn was an awesome server  I ll definitely be back
Great place  Live music on the weekends    Best margaritas to drop your panties     ASK FOR CHAD HE IS THE BEST SERVER THERE

Really wish I could give 0 stars. This has been one of my favorite spots for years. My friends and I have been drinking purples foreverrrrrr. Anyway  my best friend just got married to a man from Africa who just moved to the country a few months ago. We got him so hyped up for trying the purple margarita and when we got there  the waiter said that the manager had to take a second look at his ID  understandable since he is from Africa  and most people aren t used to out of the country identification . Anyway  the manager came back and said no way and made it super clear that my friend s new husband MUST bring his passport from Africa if he wanted to drink. We made it a big deal and clearly asked them  if he comes back with his passport  he can drink a purple marg   and the answer was an overwhelming  yes.  So two days later there we were  waltzing into Baby A s  our friend with 3 solid forms of ID and his African passport. And yet again  he gets denied  because it has to be an  American government issued ID  which doesn t make ANY sense because he is a LEGAL IMMIGRANT that lives here now. Clearly  we could consider this a form of discrimination. Be careful if you have friends that are from a different country because they will not be allowed to drink in this establishment. Apparently  Baby Acapulco is more strict than border control. Only people from America are given purple margaritas.

This place has rly fallen off. Margarita was bland and sour  sent it back. Chkn fajitas chewy and chkn quesadillas were more like finger food with chewy chkn. Too many better TexMex options in Austin.

I stopped by here to grab a bite before going to a movie  and to my surprise the service was good but the food was awful.   To my opinion I would rather pay that over priced junk food at the theater than coming back here.

This place is a pleasant surprise.  Most chain Mexican restaurants serve ho hum food  figuring they can ride it out on the party atmosphere and lots of beer and tequila sales.  Food execution at Baby Acapulco is a cut above.  Yeah  the menu is standard American-Mex    tacos  nachos  enchiladas  fajitas all with the predictable sauces and trimmings.  However  someone is doing the right thing in the kitchen.  Beef in a burrito is usually cheap tasteless stuff  since heck  the burrito is going to drown the meat in tortilla  rice and beans with jalapenos for extra disguise. So you might as well put in  meat packing material .  The fajita beef here is cooked to a perfect medium rare and is full of flavor. The beef burrito actually tastes like a good steak ...   Onions are usually cooked to indifference in Mexican sauces  no longer having the tang of a fresh onion but not caramelized either. Onions here are cooked very al dente  so they have fresh bite and a good vegetable taste  having been on the grill just long enough to take the edge off them.  Someone is buying good meat and good onions and is watching them very carefully on the grill - which is not usually the case in Chain-Mex.  So this place is a step above.  Sure  there are other mexican restaurants you can go to in Austin for unique dishes  cooking in a distinctive personal style   or where you can do the fine dining experience.  But this place is very solid on the standards.  Anywhere outside of the American Southwest or Chicago  it would be a destination Mexican restaurant  Footnote  I notice that my experience was substantially more positive than that of other Yelp readers. There may be a reason for this.  I reviewed this place at 2 pm on a slow weekday afternoon. The place was 5-10  filled. My food was pretty good and care and attention was shown with the meal.  It is entirely possible that quality may go down in the middle of big rushes when the staff is heavily worked. The complaints of indifferent cooking and slow cleaning - are consistent with a situation where the rush is on and both food prep and cleaning are being rushed or deferred in the interest of serving a lot of drinks.  It could be that I was just lucky - but I suspect Baby Acapulco is one way when  things are quiet - and another way during the big happy hours and weekend nights.
Great Tortilla Soup.  Really good chicken enchiladas as well.  Funny building but they do have live music on weekends.    Those purple margaritas just scare me but the Mango one is yummo.
Love Baby As - service was exceptional tonight. Our server Keona was wonderful  Soup is the BEST

Had the best service for our workshop dinner. I called ahead of time and they brought in Karla  who works at another location  to help out and gotta say she was on her game  Props to her for taking care of our large group of 35 people and getting us having patience with us. Thanks  Karla for providing top-notch service for our group. Food and drinks were amazing as always.
The queso is not good at all. I was very disappointed  Our server was way over worked and we hardly ever saw him. The actual facility has great potential. Would be best not in the summer though.
John R was amazing  Not only was the food great and made fresh but John R was very attentive and made sure my dinner date went perfect. Thank you for a lovely evening

food was good but service was lousy yesterday  7 23 14 .  Wasn t the servers fault though.  The restaurant decided to book 2-3 events at the same time one of which was a movie screening with 100 people attending so everyone else s orders were slow.  30 minutes for friends to get a beer no thank you I will go somewhere else.    Also we had to sit outside because the hostess was reserving the vacant tables for the special event.  They have plenty of fans outside but of course none of them worked so we had to sit there and bake.    Manager was informed and did not give a discount for lack of service to make up for it.  Not complaining about quality of food though but Won t be coming back here.
Krystal was fantastic   The staff is very friendly and helpful  They are there to make sure you have a great time

This was our first time here and let me tell you  the food is delicious but what s even better is the service.  Our server John R was super friendly and courteous. Great food and excellent service at a good price  oh let s not forget those amazing margaritas   You must give it a try
Mexican martini was excellent   Alexa took care of our large party which was no easy task   We willbe back

On a sunny Sunday afternoon  1 23 pm 2-9-14    I waited so long for a waiter on the patio that I went inside to order.  The patio was filling up with tables and we hadn t even gotten water yet because there was no  waiter in sight.  I mentioned this to a nearby table who was there even longer and they said the same thing.  The food was ok for the price   but the service was way below other Baby A s locations.  Trust the other reviews or take your chances...
I was never so disrespected at a restaurant.  I ve been here previously without issue but today the B team was in charge and it showed.   Not sure I will ever return

Enjoyed a birthday dinner for a friend here. We were a large group and our waitress was fantastic  The entire waitstaff sang happy birthday and treated the birthday girl to a complimentary flan. Margaritas were delish  Overall great night.

I came into today for a drink and dinner. I had the delicious taco bowl and a mexican martini. I am writing this review bc i had the best bartender serving me. His name is Bobby. Fab service. He is amazing  helpful  and super attentive. If you come here  ask for Bobby. He told me what was good to eat and drink here.

Seeing the large number of low reviews here  you d think that the management would take some steps to up the level of service.  We went a week ago today  and despite e-mailing the manager directly AND another location to request a regional manager or district manager to contact  I have had no further contact from them.  They obviously just  don t get it .  We experienced nearly the absolute WORST waiter in history -  Alice  - on our visit.  Rude  disrespectful and downright ugly a few times in our brief encounters with her.  We complained about a few things and yes  they comp d a couple of items off our bill  but that wasn t why we wanted to go there  to get free things.  We wanted a nice relaxing evening with some good food and needed good service.  We received the opposite  and it reflected in our ZERO tip to the waitress.  She was absolutely THE WORST.    If I ever return to this establishment  I ll definitely ask to be reseated if sat in her section or ask for another waiter.  Worst experience of my dining life.  Several problems   margarita tasted like crap  she didn t take both of our orders and we only received one  had to wait for the other  she refused to come check on us to see if we needed anything  if things were alright  etc.  She did everything a waiter should NEVER go.  While the manager was nice  I do expect the courtesy of a return e-mail or call when I take the time to let you know what kind of an experience I had at your location.  Be warned - it s bad  very very bad.  Looking for better mexican food  amp  better service   Try Rio Grande in Pflugerville.  It s everything Baby A s wants to be but fails on.

We went with nine people to eat since this place was by our hotel. The sitting area was full and we asked for a table. The hostess said it would be a half hour wait. We moved over to the area by the patio to sit and wait for our table.  A rude employee came over and stated to us that there was another baby A restraunt 10 minutes driving distance away with no wait. We asked him if we could place a to go order and he stated the to go order would take as long as the wait for our table. We told him we could wait for the table. The same rude employee came over to us and asked if we could wait for a table inside. We stated it was cooler outside  but he insisted we move inside. We moved inside and continued to wait for our tabe. They sat every person in the restraunt  including people that came in after us. My daughter went over and asked about the wait. Then the same rude employee can over and said   what is the problem here. We told you the wait was till 7 55.  We pointed out it was 8 10. He said  well we are just taking longer then.  My daughter stated there was an empty table. He stated   that is your table and we will seat you when it is ready.   The table was empty and wiped down.No one was over by the table working on it. The employee then stated   I do not want to seat your party  because you have been rude to me  and I am afraid you will be rude to your servers too.  I told him that he was the one being rude and asked to speak to the manager. He stated he was the manager. I told him I was uncomfortable eating in the place due to his behavior and attitude. He stated  well you can leave then.  He continued to be rude and finally stated that we had to leave due to our attitude. We left. When we left we had waited there an hour and fifteen minutes  when the original time given was 30 minutes . I have never seen a manager of a buisiness ever display such unprofessional service. His demeanor made our whole group feel unwelcome in the restaurant. I feel like he did not want us there and had no intention of getting us a table in a timely manner. To make matters worse every word he spoke was in a sarcastic irritated tone of voice  so it did not come across as sincere.   His name is James Galvan. He did not have a business card. Perhaps he chooses not to make buisiness cards due too him having unprofessional management skills. When I asked him for his name  he pointed to his badge and said  my name is right here.   I have been to different baby A locations in Austin before for 20 years and never was treated this way. I am sure you will continue to loose buisiness by keeping James Galvan as a manger of your restraunt . I wanted to post this to make everyone aware of James Galvan s behavior and attitude.  I was not surprised to see that reviews of this location were not 5 star. Perhaps under more professional management the ratings would improve. I am not sure if I will return to any baby A restraunt. I am sure I will never return this location in Austin  Texas on 9505 Stonelake Blvd as long James Galvan is the manager.

I went to baby a s on the advice of a coworker. Now I have been a couple of times And I love it  The first time another coworker and I our server was a bubbly gal by the name Charlie. She answered all of our questions and even went to the kitchen to ask the cook the one totally obscure question that my coworker asked that she didn t know. Even though she was the only server on duty at the time  she kept our drinks coming. I did not have to ask her for refills and I never saw the bottom of my glass  It was refreshing to get a server who anticipated your needs instead of having to be asked.  The second time I took my sister a few days later because I was craving their soup. I ordered the Helen s combo so that I could try their enchiladas. The enchiladas the puffy taco and the soup we re fabulous

Baby A s is always amazing   We had a wonderful waiter tonight - Raul.  He hasn t taken care of our table before.  Raul was attentive and did a fantastic job.  He was friendly and continued to check back on our needs.  Would love to have him wait on us again

I give this location a higher rating than the others because it s a great space. There s a good number of parking spots  but it gets tight during buddy times.   This is a place you go for happy hour and appetizers. I wouldn t recommend bringing friends visiting from our of town or going there hungry. The food snob in me knows better.

I absolutely love this place. This location has an awesome patio  where on the weekends they bring in a live band for entertainment. Their margaritas are AWESOME  and a good selection of beer. The tortilla soup is delicious  and very fresh tasting. My favorite is their crispy chicken tacos  DEVINE  Salsa and chips are always on point as well. Family friendly  and a fun place to go out with your friends. I highly recommend this location. The one in Pflugerville off of I-35 is good too  they redid their bar area last year and its really nice. Give Baby A s a try

Dude  holy crap  lol  To say worse service ever is an understatement. At one point  we thought about getting up and going elsewhere but then just decided to hang in there just to see how the night play out. Thankfully  with a few Margaritas  a very patient sister who just decided to take over the situation  the terrible service became funny and amusing so we didn t leave pissed off. But oh how we should have    Walked in on a Friday night. Visited the hostess stand and requested outside seating. The host told us to walk down to the patio  find someone in a stripped shirt  and he ll take care of us. Cool  right  Except in a sea of people swarming  the striped shirt is no where to be found   Light blue striped shirt  no name tag . After flagging down a waitress  she helps us find him. That was about after 20 minutes. Great band playing  no biggie. But then we find him and he tells us to go back to the original host stand  Now I m irrate. So I walk up to the host stand  which isn t close  btw   and the guy proceeds to blow me off  Like looks at me  looks at his other choices of ppl to help  and helps them until all options have run out for him. So when those options ran out  I asked to speak with a manager  immediately   nice - still patient here  but firm . He looks up  sees someone very slowly walking through the door  then tells me to hold on. Oh no you don t buddy  I said immediately. And now I m losing my patience. The manager himself was not much help except for finding the striped guy. Waited some more. A lot more. Watched ppl come in after us and be seated  and still waited. Great band though so not too bad. Finally sit.   And wait. And flagged someone down. And ordered a super high end Margarita to have it taste like water from sitting too long. Ice melted and everything. Are you exhausted reading this yet   I m exhausted writing it. I ll wrap it up by saying the night just continued in this fashion. Awful     Our arrival time was 7 23pm. By the time we ate  I kid you not  10 39pm. Thank God for the great band and great company for distraction.   Oh  and did a manager EVER come by to apologize or even check on us  Lol  you re kidding  right
Connie was the best  We came in an hour before closing and she served us with a smile and good conversation the entire time. The food was awesome and the purple was on point. come here

We came to have food and drinks with a party of 6 on a Friday night around 9. The place is not busy. We sit a table on the patio  server tells us it s a closed section. Ok  no biggie. So we go to the bar to order drinks because no open tables on the patio currently. We are told  if you want to sit on the patio  you can t order drinks from the bar . Ok. So we finally get a table with a number on it on the patio  as we were told to do . Server comes up and says section is closed again. Bartender won t serve us  we do as we re told as far as tables go. Literally no one can help us  Finally one server is helpful  he was compensated even tho we never got to eat or drink because of the frustration of trying   gets us a table set up outside of his section. No one ever comes to greet us or serve us. So we leave. All service industry  so we weren t rude or even asking for much. Very understanding about the situations that kept being tossed at us. Worst baby a experience ever.

When you come to Baby A s request a tall dark haired gentleman named Bobby. He is the most ambitious  forward thinking  and attentive waiter we have had the pleasure of being served by in a long time in this town. He knew what to ask us for even before we thought of asking for it. The queso and mushrooms was fantastic. They could serve mediocre food and we would still come back just to see Bobby.

This place was DRASTICALLY UNDERSTAFFED when we were here on a recent Wednesday night at 7 30.  When my party of five arrived  we stood in the entry area along with several other groups  probably 15-18 people total  for almost ten minutes before an employee noticed we were there   During that time  I saw no employees anywhere in the restaurant. I was trying to go find someone to ask if we should just seat ourselves but there was no one to be found   When we were seated  our waiter Ruben was fairly attentive  which was surprising given that he appeared to be the only waiter on the floor for the entire circular section. He was a nice guy and seemed very competent but given the number of tables he was helping he did forget a drink order and forgot to take our meal order  but I actually was willing to look past this as he must have been pretty overwhelmed.  My friend asked Ruben to recommend an enchilada. Ruben replied   well if you like shrimp  I d recommend the shrimp. If you like beef  I d recommend the beef. If you like chicken  I d recommend the chicken.   Hmm.  The food ended up being pretty decent. I ordered the carne guisada and cleaned my plate. The margarita was strong enough to give me a little buzz.   During our visit  my friend and I played a game to see who could thank Ruben more grandiosely each time he came around to check on us which wound up being the highlight of the night.  I doubt I would come back here again unless an out-of-town friend specifically wanted to check it out  or if I was intentionally trying to kill a few hours.

I used to go to the location by I35 and Howard until I found this one  The outdoor seating area is definitely what pulled me in  Love the food. Our server could have been a little more attentive the last time we visited  but she WAS taking care of the whole patio on a beautiful day  I really do love this location. My new Purple Rita spot for sure

Absolutely love the food here  Amazing fajitas  The staff is always super nice. Ask for Raiza  she s one of the best waiters there. David always makes sure we have chips and went above and beyond to ensure everything was ok. Great team work.  Overall  I love Baby A s  guarantee you will too   Highly recommend  5 Stars

Decent Tex-Mex food  service could have been better. Was on the patio on St. Patty s Day  many empty tables  several servers on the patio and no service for 30 min at a time. Several of the other tables  servers were checking on us and serving us because it was kinda getting ridiculous and I don t have the highest expectations.  -

Ate with a work colleague at Baby A s tonight for the first - and last - time.  The food was not great and the service was worse.  We walked in and it took forever to even be seated.  Wait service was terrible.  At the end of the meal finally had to go find someone to pay our bill.  Ordered the Baby Changa - chicken filling was chewy.  Tried to get a margarita on the rocks - tasted horrible.  Skip it....

Sat for 12 minutes without silverware while my food got cold.  When the lady finally came back with the utensils  I told her it was too late and I was leaving.  The food had sat there for 12 minutes.  She said   Fine   and walked away.  I left.  Don t go here.  Terrible experience.

To start  I have food poisoning today  and I went to Baby A s yesterday. By eliminating other foods I ve had this week as they were eaten with others who do not have food poisoning  I am confident my food poisoning came from Baby A s. I had never been here before and had heard mixed reviews. I am definitely siding with the negative reviews.   The food poisoning alone should hopefully be enough to encourage you to steer clear of Baby A s  but I ll review my meal too in case you need any other reasons to stay away. I tried their  famous  purple margarita. I m fairly certain it is purple because it is grape cough syrup mixed with margarita mix. At least that is exactly what it tastes like. Is it strong  Yes  but it tastes terrible and costs a small fortune. For my meal I ordered the taco salad. It was tiny for the price and was just a tortilla shell bowl full of shredded iceberg lettuce with some toppings. This is far from the  fresh lettuce  listed in the menu. It comes topped with ground beef   tomatoes  cheese  and sour cream. The beef is flavorless  and the cheese is low quality. I believe one of those two was the culprit for my illness.   Overall  I am unimpressed with Baby A s. It was expensive  lacked flavor  except the margarita which just had terrible flavor   and gave me food poisoning. Needless to say  I will not be returning.
Our sever Alexa Wolff was AWESOME    She made sure our glasses were always full and our service was amazing  we will definitely be back because of her

A third of the tables are empty but the hostess says    there is a twenty minute wait. They are two parties in front of you.   UsualTex-Mex menu at reasonable prices. Good but not great food.  Consistently understaffed so average to poor service is the normal here. Baby A s survives not because of great food or service but because it is the only Mexican restaurant in the Arboretum.
Horrible customer service. Im a server so i usually let a lot of things side but the manager Regina is something else

I come here occasionally with my mom and daughter. It s definitely a toss-up if we re going to get good service or not. I came here today for happy hour with a friend and we got a waiter that provided good service  but tried to sing to us the whole time. We are nice and tried to go along with it  but it was very VERY uncomfortable. A woman from a table across from us interrupted him at one point to help us out. Two other guests at different tables even asked us what was going on. This location really needs to keep a better eye on their servers. Great atmosphere  food and drinks  but the service is very questionable.
Average Mexican food. Beer was cold and within walking distance to Embassy Suites Arboretum. Salsa good and spicy. I d eat there again.

I arranged and attended a work function here recently. In fact  this was our second in maybe a year and a half here. This was done on very short notice on our part  and Baby A s stepped up and accommodated us with open arms. They had a terrific set up for us in a comfortable and spacious room for ourselves. The appetizer buffet was well received by the group. Evie was particularly helpful in making sure we were taken care of  as was our server  I m sorry that I can t remember his name  I m very bad with names  . I recall that our previous function went very well also. I have nothing but positive things to say about this Baby A s and would definitely recommend based on my experiences.
Staff was friendly and the purple margarita for  8.75 was good for the price since it was strong. Got chips and salsa included with it. Glad I finally got to try their storied purple margarita.

Sometimes  in the middle of a hectic stressful week and you don t want to cook or clean up after  you stop in at your local beloved Baby A s. This location has had some serious lows but lately it s been on a serious upswing both food and service wise. I frequent this location a lot as it s super close by.  Tonight  my sangria margarita. enchiladas Texanas  and salsa were perfect and my waitress Evelyn P.  was 6 stars  She was super helpful  friendly  and competent. I requested an item sub and she made sure my order was accurate. Evelyn was extremely attentive but not overbearing. Don t let her go  Overall  the latest changes have proved most positive at the Stonelake location

Love goingto baby as on Sundays for two reason the breakfast bolw wich is delicious along with my dos equis michelada  Yum and the great waitress Lizbeth   she always takes care of us she is so attentive always working hard but always checking if her customers are doing great

This place is great  Everyone is so nice and prompt  Our waiter alisa was great  The purple margarita will have you feeling like you ve drank 10 drinks lol. I guess thats why there is a 2 drink minimum. The manager james definitely cares about his customers. He was literally table touching in a wheel chair   I most definitely will always come to this location

We visited mimi this past friday with my friends that came in from Dallas. like always she makes sure were taken care of   she always tries to make recommendations or new ideas that we havent tried. This past weekend she recommended the new pink churros..and they were amazing    thank you mimi for always being so caring fyi mimi just got into medical school congratulate her and tip her well she might treat your health one day

Bad customer service. I placed a to-go order and it didn t include chips and salsa. I asked the hostess why they were not included and she said there s an additional charge for to-go orders  even though they re free if you dine in. This is a ridiculous charge especially since any other Tex-Mex restaurant includes them free of charge.

This place used to be one of my favorite North Austin eateries  though it seems to have really gone downhill in the last few years.  My best guess is that the business is not doing all that great  so they re making cuts to save money.  I used to love the seafood enchiladas  but now the sauce is watery and there was notably less meat  which was overcooked.  They even cheaped out on the beans  which were at least a third water.  My friend ordered the soup  which  again  was more water than soup.   I m severely disappointed.  I miss the old Baby-A s...

RAW chicken  and thoughtless manager  Eating at this Baby A s could be detrimental to your health because the cooks do not care enough to ensure that they are not serving RAW chicken.  Ordered the Chipotle Chicken Dinner....First several bites seemed fine  but when I cut into the center of the cutlet the chicken was slimy  very pink  and COMPLETELY RAW  Not sure how much raw chicken I might have actually eaten.  The manager  A. Rodriguez   acted like it was no big deal when I talked with him. They comped my meal  but did not seem a bit concerned about possibly exposing a customer to Salmonella and Campylobacter - both of which can cause serious illness and even DEATH IN HUMANS.   a href   redir url http 3A 2F 2Fwww.webmd.boots.com 2Fdigestive-disorders 2Ffood-poisoning amp s 3e480c910cbdbe19c50b5021c402d570d0dc0df77c916e354ff38db4dfe20def  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  webmd.boots.com digestiv   a    The next few days should be interesting...hoping that I do not get sick.  Talked to my MD and you can anticipate sudden onset of nausea  cramping and diarrhea 6 to 72 hours after eating salmonella infected food. Campylobacter infection may take two to 5 days to become apparent. This will normally include diarrhea  fever  stomach cramps  nausea and vomiting .  The Chipotle Chicken Dinner should be renamed  pollo crudo  or  Pollo con Salmonella.    Eating at this Baby A s could be detrimental to your health because the cooks do not care enough to ensure that they are not serving RAW chicken.

Very great place to eat. I ordered the grilled chicken  salad and it was delicious.  Great service.  Could have been a little cooler in the restaurant but it was so big I think it just couldn t keep up with as hot as it was outside.

My mom and dad came in to town Friday night from Houston and we all wanted mexican food. My daughter has a severe soy allergy so I called first and talked to Tim the manger. He said that it should not be a problem. We arrived and I met Tim and after we were seated our waitress and Tim checked with the chefs and made sure that there was no soy in the food my daughter was eating. They took special care to cook everything separate. Most of us had fajitas and they were fantastic but all the entrees were good. A big thank you goes out to Tim and the rest of the staff at Baby Acapulco s. Great food and great service

I ve been to this location a few times and the service was okay. Veronica G gave my husband and I great service. Well mannered and was very attentive. The food and drinks were really good. I do recommend the Claritas Chicken and the Watermelon Crush is a perfect Margarita for the summer.

Omg  It took forever to get our food. This  seriously some bad service. We re not coming back. It was really a case of a bad waiter. Took forever to get drinks. Had to ask for silverware  plates for our queso and our check. I can stand it when tables that arrived after us are getting their food way before us. My husband is still waiting to pay and that s after I cleaned up all three kids and gotten loaded in the car. I ve had a lot of time to type this up. Save yourself and go somewhere else.

No.  Just No.  I went here for a good bye lunch for a coworker.  I guess most people like this place because they make  purple margaritas  which I understand essentially are grain alcohol and  purple .  Since it was lunch I wasn t drinking  and the food was less than marginal.  I had the Tacos al Pastor.  They came with a pile of passable Spanish rice and watery charro beans.  The pork was fatty and not especially flavorful.  The good parts were the corn tortillas  seemed freshly made  and the cilantro and onions were fresh and aromatic.  The atmosphere at Baby A s is pure  volume Tex Mex .  Get  em in  stuff  em full of starch and grain alcohol  and get  em out.    The only way I m returning to Baby A s is for the exact same reason I went today - it was a work lunch and someone else paid the bill.

This place is hard to review..... mainly because I didn t really have a meal here. I was on a quest for Sopaipillas  every ones  except people in Austin... and fans of flan....ok  maybe just me  favorite Mexican dessert. After dozens of calls all over town  we finally found a place that sold them.... and better yet  the Sopaipillas were served with Amy s Mexican Vanilla Ice Cream. Yum. The Sopaipillas didn t disappoint. But the restaurant gave me a strange vibe.  I would have liked to been at the meeting when this place first opened.    You know what people love.......Mexican food     ........Don t forget about elephants  People also LOVE elephants     ok  ok  How about a PINK elephant .... .isn t that CRAZY     Wait  wait  wait...... how about an island theme     Hold up..... people also like babies..... we can t forget about that one   The chips in salsa didn t taste super good  the TV s were really outdated  there were people smoking on the outdoor indoor patio  yuck   and the band was really weird.   The sopaipillas get 4 stars.... the resturaunt gets 2.

Went to Baby A s for happy hour yesterday. I had that  I m needing a purple  kind of day. You really go here for the everclear  purple  margarita... not the food. This mexican food is not so bueno. Guacamole tastes strangely un-fresh yet green... how do they fool mother nature like that   We also had the queso compuesto  which isn t bad and goes well with the slightly stale chips.  First time I went there  I had one  purple   then some other fruity margarita concoction  and decided to have another purple  not sure if I somehow confused the girl and then over purple d or what...  but I ended up thinking karaoke sounded like a good time. Be forewarned.
Magic things come in small glasses. And  er  they serve food here     It s in my best interest to stay seated  thanks.

I always end up at this location with the same friends and each and every time the same one of them goes   Hey  guys  do y all remember when this was a Bahama Breeze      And each and every time the answer is exactly the same   No .   If any of you lived in Austin and REMEMBER when this Baby A s was the Bahama Breeze  henceforth to be known as BB  then I bow to you  oh soldier of time.   This Baby A s location is meh. It s sort of hidden behind a huge parking garage and mass quantities of trees near the Arboretum. I totally should have heeded the fact that the location is kind of BFE  bum flipping Egypt  and not gone. The awful palm tree covered booths still haven t been recovered after the BB acquisition and they re starting to completely deteriorate.  The food is also meh. I ve had carnitas and bean and cheese nachos and can tell you both were completely forgettable.  The only saving grace  The drinks were strooooooooooooong. Mayhaps you should go for happy hour only   If you really feel the need  though I ve no idea why you would  to hit up Baby A s  then you should definitely hit up a different location.

A great night out great food  nice patio environment  live band  but the professionalism of the staff especially Keona set it apart. She was attentive  knowledgeable  amp  extremely personable. I will definitely ask for her the next time I go to Baby A s.
Love to hang out at Baby A s for a margarita  Best salsa and queso. My favorite on the menu  baby chimichanga   Mmmhmmm yummy   Superman margarita is fabulous

During a shopping excursion  a client asked if we could break for lunch here.  My initial reaction was   yuck   but it was her treat so I figured why not.    Well  call me a convert.  I can t speak to anything else on the menu  but my client insisted the tortilla soup and the veggie fajitas were to die for and my gawd  you ve never had anything so fresh  unique  and flavorful.  I was truly in heaven and would go back in a heartbeat if it meant tasting those flavors again.  Our waiter left a little to be desired.  HIM  How re you doin   US  Great  and you  HIM  I m glad to be leaving soon. US  Oh yeah   What time do you get off  HIM  I don t know....I guess whenever you guys leave.  In other words   you re the only things keepin  me here  ya bitches    Making patrons feel like they are somehow inconveniencing you by eating in the restaurant that employs you   That attitude is not only rude  it tends to inspire lackluster tips.    Just sayin .

Worst service EVER     We were sitting there for over 20 minutes and no one ever came to get our order. There was another couple that came in after us and within 5 mins the waiter came to take their order. Asked to speak to manager and he didn t seem to care of how upset we were. This place is just flat out horrible   I wish we could do no stars because that is what they deserve..

When a drink is purple  that s your first clue.  I got up from my booth to go to the bathroom at Baby A s.  It was my first time there.  When I stood up  I got the sensation that one of my ass cheeks was stationed about where my left knee was.  I was holding on to the edge of a table  the way toddlers who are learning to walk do.  I looked over at the purple drink I had gotten  and saw that it was only a quarter gone.  So I had only 1 4 of the purple drink  and I had forgotten how to walk.  It is my hope that I actually used the bathroom facilities  I don t remember.    I m pretty sure that the magic behind the purple drink takes maybe 20 hours to brew per day  with like potions  magic-summoning dances  and other sacrifical rituals.  That doesn t allow for much time to prepare food.  So don t order food.  Problem solved.

The only reason this place gets 2 stars instead of 1 is because of their purple ritas. They are really good and their frozen drink machines work well. Besides that  the place pretty much sucks. The service is slow  the food below average. I also hate the  gratuity added to parties of 6 or more.  I m pretty sure the majority of their business at this location comes from the offices around here. That said  they re almost always serving groups. Forcing someone to tip for service that is slow is a good way to piss people off  myself included.  I ll visit Baby A s again  but I ll never eat lunch or dinner. Stick with the purple ritas and you ll think the place is fine. Go so far as to order a meal and you re sure to be disappointed  unless you re from out of town and have no idea what good Mexican food tastes like.

Let s get one thing out of the way immediately.  I love the purple margaritas with everclear at Baby A s.  An alcoholic s dream drink.  l like them a LOT.  So that is the main reason we came here to start our night off before looking to get in trouble in the Arboretum area.  One of them takes away the stress of the drive down from Dallas.  Two and you are giggly and happy.  Three and you forget why you are even there in the first place.  Yum.   Yes  they will serve you more than two.  I guess you have to look like you are handling them ok or maybe it is server specific  I have no idea.   This Baby A s location is fun because the damn patio is bigger than the inside.  They have covered patio  non-covered patio  a fire pit for colder nights  and a band playing outside.  Apparently some nights are also karaoke but unfortunately for me - and fortunately for all the other patrons - it wasn t the night we were there.  I ordered the grilled fish tacos and turns out they were actually pretty good  or at least better than I remembered them from last time.  Light and not too filling so I could fit in more purples.  And that s really all you are there for right

So  we went to Baby Acapulco yesterday while it was still light outside.  Baaaad Idea   You can actually see to count the layers of grease and dirt on the tables  chairs  and even the hand rails.  The table of 4 behind us actually ran the ticket - who does that       And the Fantastico Platter was pure grease with a side of sour cream  ate the whole damn thing    So  I ordered a purple margarita  smiled  and planned my next trip to Baby A s.  GO PURPLE       I think I am still drunk from last night...

I m having trouble deciding whether to give this place 2 or 3 stars. I have some friends that like to drink here. Seriously. Every time we want to hang out  they come here. And that pisses me off. And I m not sure if that s Baby A s fault.  Purple margaritas. Yes  they will get you drunk. Yes  you can taste the Everclear in them. Yes  that means that they do not taste good. You know what else gets you drunk and DOES taste good  Whiskey. If you want some fruity colored drink that has vague hints of rubbing alcohol  this is your spot.  The food is mediocre. Of all the times I ve come  I ve only eaten once. It wasn t awful  but it was pretty unexceptional. I m leaning towards 2 stars because I shouldn t have to eat mediocre psuedo-Mexican in Texas. It s not right.  People come here to watch football. Sometimes there s a shitty band playing outside. I can t understand why somebody would come here to drink. Argh. It s all so perplexing.  Fuck it  I m going with two stars. May I never have to set foot in this place again.

Don t even bother going here unless you re in the mood for a margarita made with everclear  and even those taste like garbage  . But hey  if you can stomach the purple margarita  you might just forget about the cafeteria-quality Mexican food.   Chips and salsa  worse than Tostito s and Pace. And it really doesn t get better from there. The menu has all of the items you would expect a Mexican restaurant to have  but nothing tastes good except the Chicken Tortilla Soup. That s the only thing. If you must go here  get that. Nothing else  or you will regret it.  Now check this out  I get tricked into eating here often. It s a punishing feeling to spend money at Baby A s when there are so many other Mexican restaurants in Austin. It s just too easy to outdo. I prefer fast-food Mexican to this.  It would be nice if there was one aspect of this restaurant that made it stand out  but everything is meh or worse. I suggest spending your money somewhere else.

Did not know how to make a classic martini. Food was to go and not bad to tell the truth. But  the service was not what I would want if this was my place. Had a huge impact on my rating. Bartender was sub par. I had the fajitas. Had it to go  and had to tell them how to pack it for my hotel room nearby. The bartender said hello when I arrived but took approx.10 min. to bring me a menu. The bar had two other people who had already eaten and were obviously on their third  or second beers  so I don t understand what took so long after we  just echanged pleasantries.      Also   it did not look clean and a place I would take people to eat. Service needs help.   bartender  and the overall look of the bar inside left little to be desired. Food was not bad. For takeout. This place is redeemable. If they take the advice from everyone who posted. Good luck. Hope you can take it to the next level.

Absolutely vile  Lousy service  no silverware  no napkins  miniature glass of wine  tasteless food... then overcharged by  6.50  which I had to correct with the manager. Definitely low class.  How embarrassing. Never again. I will warn my friends.

I was annoyed that my burger came out missing what I d requested  but the next burger to come out was  too. Get specific at your own risk  people. Neither order was fixed quickly.  The bathroom was missing only broken glass  discarded needles  and a flickering orange light. Water pooled behind the toilet  toilet paper was strung along and clumped  on the floor  the dispenser was empty  look up  the usable toilet paper hangs on a nail on the back of the door   and there were scratches  graffiti  broken tiles  and caulking in a deplorable state. If the manager is male  he uses this bathroom and knows how bad it is  right  It doesn t need cleaning  it needs construction.  After being in there  I noticed how run down the interior hall was. Replace that ancient carpet and the mirrors whose wood frames look like animals clawed at them in desperation not to be dragged off to be made into fajitas.  Depressing nastiness on top of a pattern of kitchen mistakes. Below  meh  and definitely not going back   1.

If you ve ever thought to yourself that it s virtually impossible to mess up a taco  think again   Baby A s meat not only tastes like Alpo  but you also get to enjoy it in what looks like a land-locked version of a cruise ship.  We ate there a year ago and avoided the place like the plague ever since.  Then  we were in a hurry to get to a movie at Gateway across the street last night and thought we would give it another try. Doh  24 hours worth of stomach issues later  I m reminded of why we stayed away.  If you re going for quick Tex Mex  hit up El Arroyo or Jorge s.
I absolutely love Sheree. She is the greatest server ever. She makes sure that I have a great time and enjoy my food every time.

Ordered the chimichanga  the call it a Flaca Platter .  Call me sick  but I loved the deep-fried flour-chicken-cheese-grease combination that was called a chimichanga in my school lunch room  and I go searching for that experience from time to time.  No one has quite matched the joy for me yet  but BA s was closer than most.  That s supposed to be a compliment...  The atmosphere is completely laid back.  The wait staff was punctual but not annoyingly doting.  A baseball game was on the big screen so I didn t have to talk to my date if I didn t want to.  The house band just finished warming up when we arrived  and we were treated to some decent Tom Petty  ZZ Top  and Clapton covers during our meal.    The thing I liked best about BA s was the relaxed atmosphere.  If I were looking for an easy place to knock a few back after work or get down and tie one on with some friends  I could do much worse than this place.  Good food  good service  and an inviting  relaxed atmosphere.  What more do I want

We love Baby A s for their Famous tortilla soup  margaritas and the warm friendly atmosphere. We always get great service from Bobby and Ricky at the Bar. Friendly restaurant and a family like environment. The purple and Superman Rita s are our favorites.

Well  I must be an alcoholic cause I don t think the purple margs are all that strong.  Seeing how that s most of the appeal of Baby A s  I can t see any reason to go here.  They re daaaaamn expensive for a drink too.    Some of the worst dinners I ve had in north Austin were outside at Baby A s when the band came on... music so bad and so loud I had to basically hoover my food and bail.

Checked out Baby A s for the time in off-beat path location on Stonelake. Really tempted to give this one star but this first review in awhile. First off  the parking lot was filled  but the place was maybe 1 3 full of mostly after work drinkers. Service was Grade A terrible -- our waiter looked to have just been promoted from bus boy server and it showed. Food is typical tex-mex with too salty everything -- margarita special was  1off and 1 2 price appetizers that were basically crap. The Tv s are old tube style with bad color  the booths are too low  and ambient noise is bi-polar -- outside is a loud band  while inside is hush quiet 80 s tunes -- weird mix in my opinion.   Basically the extra star is for the band. They were good and their name was derived off of scraping off the old roofing sealant signage on their trailer to leave the words  the sea ants   clever.   overall  this place s management has probably gotten too used to the low standards of the afterwork  rita crowd so the food  service and indoor ambience suffers.

I was just reading the reviews here  and the manager s responses. I gotta tell you  my stomach hurts from laughing so hard  Ahahahhahahah      Is this some kind of joke  Is this lady serious  Sounds like a 3rd grader writing these replies.   Look  lady  it s pretty obvious from these reviews that in general  your food sucks  your service sucks  and you have not a clue how to fix this on going mess. Do you collect  29k per year to sit at home on yelp and tell people you appreciate the idea that they like your margaritas  Wouldn t your time be better spent training the staff

Help    I feel like I ve been sleeping for a decade and just woke up  It seems like we ve been eating local  Cedar Park  a lot lately and I don t know what it s like in Austin anymore   We ve been to Baby A s more times than I can count over the years and I ve never seen it as lame as this past Sunday. Where is the crowd  the game on the big screen  the karaoke  the outdoor bar  the waiters or waitresses    The sign said  SEAT YOUR SELF   so we did. Chips and salsa came as soon as we sat down  but we waited forever for someone to give us the menus and take our drink order. It took so long I had to pick up the menu and utensils myself at the entrance of the restaurant. It took forever for our waiter to come take our drink order. It took forever for him to come back with our drinks. It took forever for him to come back to take our order. The only thing that didn t take forever was the food which came out in a reasonable amount of time. What am I missing  Have I been away that long or am I just imagining things  Do they have a new owner or new management  Didn t the waiters used to all wear burnt orange polo s because they all had black on today

It s just not the same Baby A s.  It s like the hipsters took over and destroyed it.  I guess it isn t Baby A s fault but it just didn t have the same taste and atmosphere.  Too touristy for my tastes.  The place could use some lights inside so you can read the menu.

So back in the day this place was Bahama Breeze. Then they went out of business and Baby A s bought it.  Baby A s was cool  to me  when I was in college. Sure  purple margaritas with Everclear in it. Now  not so much. I d rather have a good tasting one with good liquor in it. Baby A s are known for strong drinks  but they are all mediocre and bland....just like their food. Everything here is bland and mediocre. The service is sub-par also. I think they ve realized that who typically comes here and that they lower quality service is the norm. I m not going to lie -- I come here every once in a while  but I don t expect much and would prefer to go many other places.  So if you are in college and want a strong drink and cheap Mexican food  then go here. If you are done with college  go somewhere else.

No you lost my business after 3 days to respond. I ll try another one. She didn t tell a manager  I wanted to talk to a manager. And you are just going to say you ll talk to your staff. How about you tell me you re going to fix it and the next visit is going to be amazing. I ve seen you copy and paste the same bs on everyone s response.
Absolutely the best chicken tortilla soup in town  And their lunch specials are awesome  almost all under  8.00. I got the soup and taco combo for  6.95  D

A friend and myself went to this location and it was a horrible experience.  We walked into the restaurant and no one greeted us and we had to stand there staring at the waitress and bus boy for 5 minutes and even then neither of them said anything to us. We had to ask her if we seat ourselves or what. She said sharply   Just sit anywhere . So we sat and chips and salsa  which were the best part of the meal  were brought to us but our waitress  the same snappy girl that told us to sit anywhere  walked by our table 5 times and never took our drink order. We had to stop her to ask if she was even our waitress and even still we had to stop her from walking away and make her take our drink orders. I had a strawberry margarita and it was ok. My friends margarita on the rocks was awful  it tasted as if the sweet and sour had gone bad. It was gross.  I ordered the tortilla soup  decent  and the chicken fajita nachos... I ended up with chicken fajitas. They were cold and not the normal sizzling fajita that you think you ll get when you order fajitas. My friends vegetarian fajitas were atleast hot  but were not seasoned right. It didnt taste like mexican food. The rice was disgusting and so were the beans. The beans looked pale and cold and were not appetizing at all.  Overall I would not go to this location again and frankly I am unsure that I would try a Baby Acapulco again after this disaster.  We went to this location on 4 18 2012 at 8 29 pm and our server was Becca.
Dhara is the bomb waitress   She recommended some great vegetarian options and was super informed and helpful.

Yesterday was a cold and rainy day.  Perfect day for a bowl of steaming hot soup.  Baby A s tortilla soup gets all the raves around town.  It was okay.  The queso was the familiar Velveeta concoction. Chips were warm. Waitress was slow.  And the joint seemed a little dirty  like Gordon Ramsay could run his discriminating finger across the kitchen s overhead exhaust and draw back a very greasy digit. But the soup was okay.

Pros  Lots of parking  good HH prices  free wifi Cons  The food.  The only thing holding this place back is its food. The drinks are well priced  especially during HH   the seating is plentiful  service is a little slow when full  but not bad.  Get a purple  rita  They re a little sweet and you re limited to two of them  but they re worth getting.  Drink and food specials during HH make this a good option if you wanna hang out   kick back and chat with some friends after work before moving onto something else. Live band karaoke on Thursday was also a lot of fun   If you gotta eat here  stick to the quesos  nachos and soups. The tortilla soup isn t bad here and is a good portion for the price. I just don t like anything with their ground taco meat  though their fajitas are alright.
Love the food and drinks. Good customer service as well. Try a superman or the purple Rita.

This used to be my favorite place to go after work to have a drink. I ve been coming to this location for almost 10 years. As I sat at the bar I d had ordered my usual. But this time I was asked to show identification. I was in shock as the bartender states that they have a new policy. To be severed you must show identification. I said but you ve know me for years. He d apologized and said yes but that s the company s new policy because someone at another store got caught by TABC serving alcohol to a minor. What  This has nothing to do with me. I have been a loyal patron to Baby A s for many year. Today will be the last time I will visit location. Baby A s needs to provide proper training to their employees and not use a blanket policy as such to require your regular customers and especially those who appear to be over 30 or 40 years of age to produce identification.

Out of all the Baby A locations I prefer this one.  The food is average  customers can tend to be a bit rowdy even with families present but it s okay.  As everyone s all ready said  it s Tex-mex and nothing really stands out all that much.  I ve been here when bands have played in one bar area thats separated from the rest of place.

Has your boss been riding you like you re Sea Biscuit   Do you wish you could just forget about all of that and have a nice evening   Would a nice  stiff drink help   Go to Baby A s and order the purple margarita.  It is made with Everclear  it s  surprise   purple  and it s tasty.  You feel it warming your throat as it goes down  and it is such a good feeling.  Make sure you eat some chips and salsa before you drink it though because you will need something in your stomach before it starts hitting you so quickly.  They have a limit of 2 on these  and it s with good reason.  After 1  you probably shouldn t be driving anyway.  If you order 2  your waiter or bartender will likely check to see if you have a designated driver.  If you try to order 3  you will only get away with it if you have a designated driver that your waiter has not served  if you ve ordered food  and if you re not completely smashed.  They know how strong these drinks are  and they don t want any liability on their hands for good reason.  Something that pairs well with the purple margarita are the nachos.  I like both the beef fajita and the shrimp nachos.  They come 6 to a plate  and they arrive with just enough  fixins  to spread between the 6.  Usually I ordered half shrimp and half beef fajita  and they charged me an extra  1.00.  It was worth it.    Their chicken tortilla soup is tasty too.  Their queso compuesto is quite nice too.  I had one friend order it with cheddar cheese.  It was stringy as would be expected  and she seemed to love it.  Frankly  I found it kind of gross to watch her messing with 2 foot long strings of cheese while eating her nachos.  To their credit  they accommodated her request.  Their beef fajitas are decent as well  so almost any dish you order with them will be acceptable.  I wasn t a big fan of their tamales.  Their chips and salsa are pretty good  and they re complimentary - as they should be   This location is one of the  nicer  locations throughout the Austin area.  I have been to all of them  and this one is my favorite.  It used to be a Bahama Breeze  so it had a much better start than the rest.  It can get pretty busy on the weekend evenings  but they do have a full bar you can blow some steam off at.  It was always well worth the drive to the best location.  Both dates I had at this place went quite well  but that is probably partially credit to the purple margarita   I went to the location in Pflugerville one time  and our friend s credit card was accidentally swapped with another patron s bill.  He got a rather large hold put on his card that lasted for several days  and it put him in a pretty big bind.  There wasn t much the restaurant could do after the swipe had already gone through  and ultimately the issue took care of itself.  To be fair  that could happen anywhere if a waiter is not paying attention.  It was just a big hassle for him.  No other complaints about that location other than the fact that it can get pretty busy.

Great relaxing atmosphere. Never had a bad dish  love the purple margarita  The chicken in the quesadillas was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Wait staff isn t the most attentive or quick but always pleasant.
