Made the drive from South Austin just for Frozen Margarita s and salmon salad. First time John waited on us. He did a fantastic job  Very professional and paid close attention to our needs - Thanks John  Great job

A 3.5 if I could  but I will settle on 3.  We went once before to sit on the patio and drink margaritas and smoke.  They have delicious drinks  which are nice and strong for the price.  This time  we rolled in starving after a crazy imax experience and in need of some grub  with a secondary goal of ingesting tequila-y goodness.  It took our server a little while to get to the food ordering point  but once we did order  it came out quickly. I ordered the shrimp enchiladas  which were actually quite outstanding  best I ve had in town thus far  though they would have probably garnered a fourth star if it would have been crab and shrimp with the yummy cheesy sauce .  The fiance s big ass combo plate - he just summed it up as  standard fare .  Yummy  but nothing extraordinary.  The chips and salsa tasted really good...but I think it s just how hungry I was  not really that they were quality.  Go for the drinks  go if you want some decent tex mex  don t expect anything special  but after 2 visits  I d go again and give some other dishes a try.  I still have to try my normal standards - the taco enchilada combo plate  and the taco salad.

Baby A s. I wanted to fall in love with you because of your name and the lucha libre on the menu. It was a very close thing. Your salsa bit back with a lovely zing. Your chips were warm and crispy.   Then the Queso con Shrimp came. First off  if you aren t saying Cheese with Shrimp  why the one Anglo word  What is wrong with Queso con Camerones  Is it too much to expect we Americans to learn more Spanish word  Then the dish itself.   The cheese was drippy and melty but when you got under that  the shrimp and onions were inundated with grease. You came with flour tortillas  points for asking me if I wanted corn or flour  but that didn t make up for the grease. I don t expect my queso to be greaso.   My dining companion ordered a wet burrito and said it was very good. My chicken fajitas were a very small portion. And the chicken didn t look like it had been cooked for fajitas. More like a grilled breast that had been sliced up then mixed in with the lovely grilled onions and green peppers. Honestly  I thought it was cold and touched it to make sure it was hot before I ate it.  The sides were tiny. Is it going to kill you to give enough sour cream and guacamole for more than one fajita  And three tortillas  I was not thrilled by my meal overall. Plus I had to remind my wait that I was out of tea--twice. And ask for more sweetner because there were only 2 packets on the table.  Dessert was great. My friend had the sopapillas and ate them all up. I had flan. That flan about made up for the fajitas. Should have stuck to Ernestine Ulmer s philosophy.  Life is uncertain. Eat dessert first.   So  sadly  it wasn t a great first date  Baby A. I ll probably go back though. I m a sucker for lucha libre references.

I m usually a fan of Baby A s but this time was terrible.  Right off the bat the hostess ask if I was my friends mom.  Im not that old.  Totally offended me.  Second  the waiter rushed us and we received terrible chips for our chips and salsa.  Bottom of the barrel chips.  After our food came out the taco salad did not have meat in it and had to be sent back.  The quesadillas that my son ordered came with lettuce  tomatos and sour cream which I specified that he did not want.  The only good thing on this visit were the drinks.  I ll make sure not to come back to Baby A s....ever.

Went here for drinks with friends and sat outside on the patio. The service was a little slow and the food didn t look too spectacular  but Baby A s is definately worth going to for the margaritas  It has an extensive margartia menu. The purple margarita was great  but my favorite was the prickly pear   If you have time to wait and are in the mood for margaritas  I would definately visit
Ricardo and Jaime are the best bartenders in Austin  They re fast  fun  and personable. We love coming here  Best margarita in town

This is me and my boyfriends favorite and go to restaurant. We ve been here over 20 times and have always had great service and food. The tortilla soup is the best you will ever have and is very big in portion. The Margs are also to die for  my favorite being the strawberry and mango. Love love love baby As and especially this location and staff.

Sat on the patio  a little slow to get seated but service on the patio was great.  Scotty does a fantastic job  just ate chips and salsa and some queso.  All were very good.  Girlfriend loved the purple margarita.

If I could give less than 1 star - I would  Let me explain. My mother and I went twice. The first time was okay  our waiter disappeared and our drinks ran out which for two ex-servers is a big red flag but on a scale of one to ten  NOT the worst thing that could happen. Food is good  drinks were pretty good  we even liked the disappearing server to an extent.  The second time we went  again  drinks were good  food was good  service was even pretty good  However.  1 hour after my mother used her credit card to pay for our food  we paid in cash the first time   my mother s card numbers were being used.  The thief who used her card charged over FOUR THOUSAND DOLLARS since our dinner on 12 3 16.  The CREDIT CARD COMPANY is saying that it was the purchase at Baby A s where it got stolen. When we called the corporate office number for Baby A s  they blew my mother off and did not care.  Very very very disappointed in this  as most companies upon hearing there is even a chance of credit card fraud you d think would jump to make up for any problems. I was going to try and convince my mother to try a different location  as there are several in Austin  but I think we ll go with a whole new restaurant chain instead  due to the handling of this situation.

I gave this place 2 stars because service was great. I read reviews about this place and only decided to try it because of the good reviews about the drinks. That was my first and last time unfortunately the margaritas are gross. It tasted like the cheapest tequila ever made. If you re too drunk to care then I would recommend this place other than that I wouldn t dine here. I was disappointed and the only good thing here was friendly staff.
Ricardo and Jamie are so way fab   Best costumer service evs. My friends and I walk in and they welcome us with a smile and great service - it s like we re sitting on the pack porch
Skylar is the best server ever. Always quick and friendly. Always remembers what we order. And has a great smile.

Ate here tonight with a party of 5 and a child.   Here s the good and bad   Good   friendly waiter  delicious mango margaritas  Bad   nachos...stale chips  nasty-tasting beef  seafood enchiladas--couldn t eat them.  no dressing on salad  asked for Italian vinaigrette which never came  asked for no salt  glass came with salt  asked for no croutons on the salad  gluten sensitivity   salad came with croutons  slow service  although Daryl was very cheerful  Overall  it was not a good time.  Management  comped  the seafood enchiladas.  We all were disappointed in the food and somewhat in the service.  We won t go back unless it s for one of the mango margaritas ONLY.

Been going to Baby Acapulco since 1995 and was discusted with the food quality my last outing. All the sauces served came from either a can or a bottle  non of the sauces were restaurant made. When I go to a restaurant I expect freshly made sauces and salsas  not from a can. If I wanted can salsas and sauces I would pay less than half the price and go to a fast food restaurant. Pretty disgusting.  I can do to Taco Cabana or many other ma pa restaurants who serve freshly made sauces with every dish.

One Purple Marg down  next time going for two    The limit . Place looks like it would be fun to come on a weekend night. The food was good as well had the fajitas for two and they tasted like fajitas.

Mirian aka mimi was just the most amazing waitress the other night  Not only did she go above and beyond for my table but also assisted me in picking out a gluten free option for my child. Will be going again
The Barton Springs location is worth 5 stars  this location is just different.. Service  food  and drinks all not as good as the other location.

First time at this location. Been to every other location in Austin. Over all this place was a total cluster f  k. Poorly managed.  Ghetto  is the best word I can think of and this applies to all their locations. The vast variety of margarita drink choices is the only redeeming quality about this place. The two drink limit is pretty lame. I had one purple margarita and one regular and they wouldn t let me have any other margaritas. The way they told me this was completely humiliating and embarrassing. I won t be going back to any of their locations.

Lots old people     Sing karaoke no less.   Maybe it s just me but I think it s a place where 40  single divorced people get their groove on.   Anyhow  I liked my fish tacos.  Was it the best    No.... but I liked mhy fish tacos  -D

Baby A s has two things that make it great  sour cream chicken enchiladas  amp  the purple rita. Be sure to try the stuffed jalapenos  they re cruncy and superb  the wait staff is speedy  friendly and playful. the scene is casual  amp  trendy. This isn t my fave tex-mex in atx but it rivals chuy s.

Came to this location tonight for drinks with my family. We live in Round Rock  but wanted to do something different and check out the live band situation. Grabbed a drink at the bar and were so impressed with how welcoming Bobby was with us - treated us like regulars  We will definitely make the drive to come back in the future  Please ask for Bobby if you sit at the bar

My Favorite restaurant in Stonelake  Best Mexican food for miles  The patio is one of the best parts.  Very chill with lots of trees and cool lights.  Even live music on the weekend nights.  You can t go wrong

1  Ditto Nickie G. on those purple margaritas.  Holy freaking cow  amazing.  Take note to drive carpool with people who are not drinking purple margaritas.  2  Okay fish tacos -- yums for fried goodness  but a thumbs down  not a huge thumbs down  but one nonetheless  for having a small portion of fried nuggets.  Again  I like a lot of meat  here  fish  so the maybe 4-5 fish nugget-lets were not really enough for me.  The cabbage slaw had more of the red-kind that s a bit more bitter than my liking  but all of it was fresh  Sauce was yummy  too.  And the bite of the hubs  fajitas that I had  delish.   3  They ve got a sitdown pacman 80 s videogame machine.  Rockin. But again  to give this review its proper accord  please keep in mind that I was way into  1.  Whew  those purple margaritas...

Went here with a friend for drinks and dinner  and had a great time...with my friend. Food drink-wise  the evening was a little below par. I always enjoy queso  and I m not snobby about it  so that was tasty. My main entree was alright  but definitely could tell it was beginning to cool down as it arrived.  Our service wasn t great - he didn t pay attention to my order  failing to substitute an item on the plate. I also didn t get the impression he wanted to be there. In addition  they had a band start up toward the end of our meal  which was fun  but WAY too loud. It became hard to talk  and frustrating to guests.  I may go back here for drinks  but honestly  I feel there are betting options in the area. Best thing about the night  pineapple margarita.

Ceviche - Purples - corn tortillas  Baby A s has great tex-mex and an even better patio. I have no idea what the inside looks like because we always sit outside. We have gone every Friday for Lent and will make it part of our routine for sure.

I didn t get a chance to check in here on Sunday as it was date night so I didn t have my phone. We spent our day at Barton Springs Pool and had passed by here before on our way home. It looked like a cute place to try  we love patio seating  So once again we were on our way home  amp  pulled a u turn to check it out. We were greeted promptly  amp  say outside. Our server came over a few minutes later as he seemed very busy but was very friendly when he got the chance to chat. We didn t have a big appetite as we were more in the market for drinks  mom dad date night . There was a picture of a watermelon margarita that my other half couldn t pass up  they had him at watermelon... I had a tropical margarita flight... it was just what momma needed- they DON T short you on the alcohol  Strong  amp  yummy    I did order a little snack of wings  half  amp  half. After 2 rounds of drinks our server asked if we wanted to order any food... wait  I did. He then rushed away and put in the order and came back with some queso to munch on while we waited. I did mention that he seemed very busy right  We were not upset as we were enjoying being out and having some alone time. The wings came out shortly after  amp  were tasty. They had a perfect crunchy outside  amp  great flavor. Our time came to and end and we will definitely go back  maybe take some friends next time.

Great place  Purple margaritas are the way to go.... I ALWAYS sit at the bar. Eddie seems to be there most of the time and is always fast and friendly. Liz and Ricky have waited on me several times as well and are quick to come by and chat even when they aren t waiting on me. Very welcoming place and it has turned into our go to spot at least once a week

This was more about service. Yesterday.  Wednesday friend and I were out running around.  Saw an open sign lit up in windows facing movie theater. Went inside.  So many people walked past us ignoring us. Finally I start waving hello do you see us   Someone came up and said for us to have a seat they aren t open. I mentioned the sign being on and front doors opened. Whatever.service. Our server was ok. After we paid he didn t come back. We were not campers. But wanted to finish my tea and have a refill. Never came back.  We also kept making sure no one was waiting for a table .

Not a bad place to have a seat  eat some salsa and enjoy the weather on the patio while it s not 110  outside.   D  Of course  that being stated  if you DO sit outside  be patient with your waitstaff around the lunch hour  they ve a lot of running around to do.

I have never enjoyed Baby A s. It had been YEARS since I had been. My friend was having a birthday there so I would not have gone if it wasn t for that. We had a large party  probably 20 people  so I understand that things are going to take longer but the waiter was just OK while we were ordering and eating. We didn t always get the extra things we asked for and I actually got up and got the tea pitcher from the server station to refill our glasses. After we got our checks and paid the waiter HOVERED around our table to pick up the receipts  I finally gathered them up and gave them to him so he would stop. There was a group of 5 of us that stuck around and would have been happy to spend more money but our waiter was probably home and in bed by then. We were basically ignored and we would have to run people down to ask for drinks from the bar. Out of everything we asked for we ended up with one drink which they immediately brought the check for. I had the stuffed avocado and it was good but my partner had the seafood pasta and he said there was 3 pieces of seafood at the most. He was seriously disappointed.  Something else that p  amp     me off was that they included the tip in the tab. I get it  I really do but the service sucked.

Low quality food  high priced drinks  and the harassed my blind friend when she brought her guide dog in  but soehow when I arrived and asked if they had seen a table of blind individuals said they hadn t seen any blind people all night.
Great service from the bartenders Ricky has excellent customer service.  Very friendly

This restaurant has the worst service. We visit weekly to listen to the bands and usually have 1 margarita each. We sit on the chairs by the band but are always told they won t serve that area so we go to the bar.  When we go to the bar they won t serve us because we are sitting in the chairs by the band.  Tonight we sat on the deck and ordered 2 frozen margaritas without salt and queso.  We got 2 margaritas with salt and no queso. I know the waiter heard us because he asked if we wanted a small queso.

This place is the worst. I m new to this place and never ate here but this surely will be my last time. I came to visit my cousin down here in Austin and we wanted to eat somewhere close so we chose this place because it s right next to our hotel. When we went inside they told us the wait time would be 7 55 pm. We went outside to wait and about 3 mins later a waiter or manager  I forgot  came and said that a party chose to sit where we were sitting. So we said ok and got up and went inside and waited till it hit 8 00 pm. My cousin went and asked a waiter why it was taking so long to get a table. Then the manager came and interrupted her and asked what s the problem. She asked if why it was taking so long to get a table. The manager points at a clean table w  nothing on it and says  we have to clean it. Then she says why can t we eat outside where we were first sitting because there was no party there. He says  no and they had to move because the person playing the guitar couldn t be heard and they had to move places. She says something else then walks off but then the manager follows her and comes to us and says is there a problem. We say we been waiting since 7 30 and said that we would have a table by 7 55. He then says it s 8 05 then my cousins interrupts and says it s actually 8 10. He then says what can t wait the 10 extra mins. Then he started calling my cousin rude and something else that was rude. So then her mother starts to defend her daughter. He then says he ain t gonna serve us because he was scared that we were going to fight w  the waiter even though they were nicer then him. Then we said that he attempted to make us leave and make us drive about 7 miles away. He then says that he never asked us to leave but now we do. Now this made me angry I was about to get involved but we left because all we were doing was wasting time w  this guy. If I could rate lower I would. Never ever coming back to a place like this that treats there customers like there nothing and waste your time. And we have the guys name and will be calling corporate because we were very missed treated by y all

I love this place for a relaxed  laid back Friday night after work with friends or Co-workers. Enjoy live bands on the patio and sip on a variety of their famous margaritas and devour greasy goodness Mexican food. Not the highest quality  but this place is all about the atmosphere.  Yes  that s what it is and I really like it for what it is. The purple passion is their famous margarita with a limit of two  but all you need is one
Chips and salsa and ritas are great   We ordered the appetizer plate and the baby changa and it was disappointing.  Highly recommend visiting for happy hour  dollar off all ritas .

We have not been here in years. All around mediocre. Food and service. It is a large restaurant  so you do not feel crowded  but there is nothing special here. Salsa - just not up to par for a Tex-Mex restaurant. Appetizer plate - messy presentation. Everything seems straight out of the freezer - just heat and eat. Queso - no character or taste of real cheese. Disappointing.

I had been to this location several times in the past and love the huge outdoor patio. Not sure what the heck happened to this place since I was there several years ago but clearly has gone downhill. We arrived and walked in via the back patio area. There was a small table to the side with menus and there were many tables open on the patio so we assumed we were to just wait there for a hostess to either take our name  seat us  or give us some type of direction. We stood there for a good 5 minutes with many staff just walking right past us. Finally someone who worked there said  You need to go to the hostess stand inside to get on a wait list.  Ok. Would have been nice to know 5 minutes ago or have a sign stating that but hey  whatever so inside we went. We then stand inside at hostess stand. No one is there to take our name or put us on a wait list. Finally a guy comes over who clearly is flustered. He takes our name and give us an automated buzzer then tell us will be  about a 20-30 minute wait for the patio.  No problem. So we sit. After about 50 minutes and being ready to just get up and leave at this point after watching multiple other people come over to complain about seating issues our buzzer goes off. We go up to hostess stand where the guy then tells us to wait because  he is going to seat a group of us all at once.  So we wait  a group of about 3 other parties walk up and we then all file into formation like a huge awkward cattle herd through the restaurant while he leads us all to separate tables. Did I mention it was awkward  Because it was. We finally sit down and before our waitress even hands us our menu she asks us what we want to drink  I pause for a split second and very nicely say   I may need just a quick second to look at the drinks  The waitress then ROLLED HER EYES at me  huffs  and says   I ll be back  and storms off. Wow. What a great attitude for working in the service industry   sarcasm  So we then waited patiently for 5 minutes  10 minutes  15 minutes while watching her go to every table except ours. At this point she was making it obvious she wasn t going to come back to our table. Again at this point we are ready to just get up and walk out. Another waitress after about 20 minutes from the other one walking off who clearly had seen what was happening finally came over and said  has someone helped you yet   I explained I had told our waitress I may need a quick second to decide on a drink but that was about 20 minutes ago. She kind of gave us a look and and a nod as if to be like  oh yeah  her  and said   I will go ahead and take care of you guys table.  She was great and honestly the most friendly person who helped us while there. The food on the other hand was not great. I got chicken fajitas that didn t even taste like they were seasoned and my husbands rice was cold and stale tasting. Overall we spent about  75 there only to get bad food and bad attitude from the majority of the staff. It s a shame because the location has a lot to offer but we definitely learned our lesson this time and won t ever be back. And the eye-rolling waitress may want to find another career that doesn t depend on tips or require having any basic social skills.

The day we almost ordered Pizza while waiting to be seated at this restaurant   Called day before and day of asking if this restaurant took reservations or call ahead seating... I was informed it was  first come first serve upon arrival . We arrived with our party of 10 and were told 1 - it would be an hour wait 2 - they have plenty of tables but not enough servers  as we watch one of who knows how many managers milll around joking  3- we stated too bad you don t make reservations and they stated  wait do you have a reservation    WHAT   You make reservations    No uh yes ...it s up to the Manager  4- an hour and a half comes and goes and we have yet to be seated but see 2 larger parties being seated before us. My 6 year old started crying the pity tortilla chips and water came out. We realize that they keep seating smaller parties and they  have no intention of seating us. We are now contemplating ordering Dominoes pizza to be delivered in the waiting area while we wait.

So disappointed. Went in at 3 today  Saturday  6-3-17  to have lunch before going to the movies and there was no one at the host hostess stand. Waited for about 8 minutes and no one even came or acknowledged our presence. Bartender lady saw us  but she was busy at the bar. The place wasn t busy at all. So just left the restaurant. Hope to come back and get better service.
Incredible experience and food  Elizabeth Gibbs and Diego Dias did a wonderful job helping us at the bar. These guys deserve raises     GREAT

We had the best time  My boyfriend and I went on a Saturday evening before going to see a movie. We were seated immediately and the bartenders Elizabeth Gibbs and Diego Dias were with us right away. Despite being incredibly busy they were both very attentive and fun to talk to     Not once did they let our drinks get low  kudos to Baby A s for having such fantastic staff

Well    I just tried my second Baby A location  Really pretty patio  totally different vibe than downtown    Thank you again for yummy food and fabulous Margaritas     I would like to say I was there on Cinco De Mayo  and saw the patio interaction as shared in a previous review. The manager was certainly trying to visit all the tables  and welcome the guests. She also was a little more attentive if there were any issues voiced. My party of 4 adults were a little concerned with how long our food was taking  the manager on that day checked back with us several times. She wanted to keep the feel that our needs were heard and that our experience was turning out to be better than worse. THANK YOU  She offered the statement...  please be sure to save some room for dessert...to top of your meal....  she stated also it would be her pleasure to bring it...on the house   There was no doubt in our mind she was VERY guest experience oriented...THANK YOU     By the time our afternoon ended  our appetite was satisfied  we felt like we have a new friend...BABY A overall. There was no doubt in our mind that THAT manager would try to fix anything if there was a problem  and if next visit there is no problem...we have no doubt She will come and chat n welcome us and CHECK ON US throughout our visit. How could anything get much better than knowing we are in great hands. Thank you very much....I know I will refer more people there because I can be sure they will also be well taken care of  We WILL again return VERY SOON to see our friends at Baby Acapulco s.

I have been a loyal customer of Baby A s since it first opened.  During that time the business has waxed and waned and the food has varied from good to bad.  We have had great experiences and great food and have endured untrained waiters  bad food  cold food and have even seen a rat run across the room at the Stone Lake location.  A lot of history.  During the last couple of years things seemed to be improving  but the last couple of months it has been a different story. During our last visit the waiters and managers seemed distraught and distracted.  Our food was cold when served.  The kitchen at the Stone Lake location is open to parts of the restaurant and bar.  We observed two separate cooks removing our food from the microwave and testing the temperature with their BARE FINGERS.  Not once  but twice   When we pointed this out  we were told the cooks were new.  Nothing else was offered except the check.

Let me start by saying I love Baby A s but I never been to this location. It s Cinco de Mayo which I had seen flyers a week ago advertising for the event. Well today we had to wait two hours for a table  which I expected and was not mad . When we where finally seated it took 45 mins for a drink order. Then  there here three adults and one child  when our food was brought they didn t have the kids meal. Heard a story from the waiter about how they had a bigger turn out then expected and that they had to close seating people because the cooks  all four of them  had 50 orders....anyways we are still here. We arrived at 5 pm and it 10 and we are still waiting for the kids meal  Never again   So an update on the rest of our evening... Service was very slow our waitress was not attending to our table  we had to ask another waiter passing by for silverware and soft drink refills after asking our waitress and never receiving them. We requested to speak to the manager on multiple occasions however no one came. Finally  we asked the waitress if it was OK to just have a pizza delivered  lol  so we could feed the child who never received her food. One would think she would understand we were not very happy at that point still not having received a kids meal or a refill on chips and salsa to try to hold her over.   No one came around to clear off the tables or the empty glasses after they where empty then suddenly I noticed someone picking up all the glasses  leaving the dirty plates mind you  that were left on all the tables I figured the bar had run out of clean glasses and I was right because we ordered a second round of drinks that came in smaller cups.  One person at our table pointed that out to our waitress who s response was  that is a cup and amount that we were given  and yes they were the same price for a smaller portion. Since she still had her original cup she poured the one just received into the other cup in front of the waitress and asked for a manager because it was clearly not the same amount  and again still no one came. The reason why we chose that restaurant because it was easy access to the rest of our kids after they got out of sports practice so another parent and about five other girls met us. By that time service was much faster they receive their food and we asked for our checks. My check was for my entr e and two drinks both regular reprice although one drink was clearly a half size order. The lady who complained about the drinks size at our table received a full price drink and one that was half off  mind you we both ordered the exact same drinks and we both sat at the exact same table  at this point I just wanted to pay for my tab because I was very frustrated. At this point it was the first time that I myself complaint and asked to speak to a manager because I didn t understand why I was being charged more. However Just wanted to leave so I handed the waitress my credit card and decided not to tip at this point. We paid our bill and was in the parking lot when someone tapped me on my shoulder  it was the manager telling me that I insulted her waitress. I quickly told her that I was insulted at their service and mainly at her for not trying to make it right. I did not blame the waitress I blamed the management and that I could not understand that only now she is going out of her way to address the issue because I did not tip yet our service was terrible and we asked for her many times and there was no apologies or attempts to make the service better. The debacle with the kids meal could ve at least been made a little better by bringing the child something to snack on. The altercation ended with her telling me to never come back to her restaurant again which my immediate reaction was to tell her that I had already made up my mind to never come back to this restaurant again and tell everybody I know about my terrible experience.   Now if I could teach the manager one lesson it s that if  someone ask to speak to a manager that s probably what they want to happen. Secondly  you tip off the service it s not necessarily a requirement I was required to pay my bill which I did and I quietly left however the manager followed me into the parking lot which is never OK I kind of feel personally attacked. I did not and dine or refuse to pay so I should ve never been confronted in the parking lot.

So bad.  Like why is this place so so SO BAD      It s a relic but a horrible  like no one ever talks about and when you get here  you ll see why it s so bad. Life is too short  drive on my friend....Manuels is a block away. You remember Weiner s    This is the Weiner s of Tex-Mex.  We are too close to Mexico for being THIS BAD.  It s embarrassing. I got served a margarita on the rocks that was mostly water. Couldn t find the waiter for 20 mins so I take it to the bar myself. Bartender says I have to talk to the waiter. Lemme get this right. The guy who makes a bad drink won t make a new one until I talk to the guy who brought it to me.  Dafk   On top of an hour and a half wait to be seated  a dirty high chair  no water or chip amp salsa for over 45mins. Then the manger comes by and asks if she can do anything else. My reply...food. I want to order food.  The whole reason anyone goes to a restaurant to eat.  Head shaking.  How bad does this restaurant have to be to mess up the one job they have   When our food came  the shrimp was rubber and dry. Nothing was good.  Bill comes  they actually tried to charge an extra drink for the bad margarita.  Told them to take that off and that there should be a comp for the whole terrible experience.  Nope nothing.  What a sad day to see this place become the worst tragedy.

First time there and it was great  Food was delicious and our server John R. was excellent  He was on top of everything  we were never waiting on him  he was running around making sure all his tables were taken care of. Not only was there great food and service but also some delicious margaritas and all for a good price
Perfect evening to sit on the patio and be serenaded by our waiter  Octavio  I want him as our waiter from now on. Very passionate about his love for music. Loved it

Terrible terrible food. The place was filthy  and the service was horrendous. Our server took forever to take our drink orders and bring us our food. The food was bland and the tacos were stale.  Thankfully the margarita was strong enough so I could at least eat the food.  Never going back.

Service in here is horrible  They take forever to take your order and to bring your food  drinks  water  even your check. I live their margaritas but other than that I won t be here for anything else. Sucks because I love this place  the decoration  environment and food but the service completely destroys the mood.

Had a large party on the night of Feb. 2nd Thur and had Jordan as our waitress. I had to share because I ve never had what I called Perfect service until her. She was on the ball  at tentative  and her customer service was exceptional.  I had to tell the manager what a great experience we had. Great food  atmosphere   and exceptional service.

Don t know why the rating here is so low  We ve been there the past 2 Saturdays and it s so fun  Live music.  Been 2 different cover bands each time.  Very entertaining.  Husband got several different kinds of margaritas.  Seemed to enjoy them. I m pregnant so I enjoyed virgin coconut daiquiris. Very yummy. Food is okay.  Typical tex mex in my opinion.  We go more for the atmosphere.  It s so fun  And our waiters have been really nice and helpful each time

Unfortunately I will not be returning back to this establishment. Really considering reporting Baby A Stonelake  to the BBB and health department. We just left about 10 minutes ago. My husband and I were seated. The waitress greeted us right away which was great. We ordered our appetizer and drinks. The food and drinks came out promptly to the table. This is where the one star rating comes in. As I picked up my drink to take a sip I look down at the table  and see a roach..yes a ROACH staring at me like I interrupted his meal and I need to move to another table. I immediately notified the waitress  she grabbed a napkin snatched up the roach and threw the napkin away she came back to the table  and apologized and stated that the manager would be out to speak to us. About five minutes later the waitress returns with no manager present. She asked if we wanted the food taken away  no we want to still eat it  yes take this food away..yuck   I got up and told her that we re leaving. I have been to this location several times  but that is the last time I will step foot in there again. I probably wouldn t have written this review if the manager would came out and apologized or at least showed his or her face.

My husband and I decided to go out for a drink on 07 10 2015 a little later than usual to beat the crowds.  He was in the mood for a frozen margarita  so we decided to go to Baby A s because it was close to the house and they have a patio.  I would have given them 5 stars if we were actually able to sit out there  but it was late so they were already closing it for the night.  We decided to stay and go inside since we were already there.  Our bartender was really nice and had a good since of humor.  My husband had the purple margarita and I had a strawberry Mexican one.  It was good and not too strong for me as I am a lightweight when it comes to the drinks.  My husband said that his was good also.  The chips were awesome and the salsa was very good as well.  Again  the only negative I can give them for this night was no access to the patio the one time I really wanted to sit out there   .  But overall it was a positive experience and I know now if I want to sit on the patio I need to arrive a little earlier.
Waited 25 minutes for a waitress 45 minutes for a refill that had a straw wrapper in it and had to send my food back because it came out wrong. Save some time and money and go someplace else

We started going to Baby A s in  89 at Barton Creek and have been to every location in Austin numerous times. We now live closer to Stonelake and have been going mostly to that one  since they opened it. You may not find extreme gormet food  which means high prices  but good solid basic Mexican food  which we can afford to go once or twice a week and have super margaritas and half price appetizers and not break the bank. Never had an expereience with any of the staff that wasn t positive and helpful  and when we take the whole family  we can afford it  with free drink refills. Great margaritas  prices  and atmosphere.

Came to town for a meeting and was in the hotel next door.  Didn t really want to drive so I walked over for take out. The service was great.  The young lady behind the bar was friendly and gracious.  I had substituted this and that and although I don t think she was supposed to do certain things  she assured me she would take care of whatever I wanted.  I got my food quickly and walked back to the hotel.  It was maybe 100 yards away.  I got back to my room and the food was still very hot.  It was great.  I was very satisfied with my choice
Some of the best Mexican food I have ever had  and DEFINITELY order the Purple Margarita

The only reason I even went here was because my future in-laws wanted to go. I would not have picked this place when in Austin. Service was good enough  but when I got my beer  there was a plastic knob in it. When I informed the waitress  she brought the manager     over to inspect it. Not sure why this was necessary  she could have just taken it back and shown him in private. But anyway  my beer was not comped. I was served another one and only charged for one beer. Maybe good service has spoiled me  but usually when something isn t right through no fault of your own  you get someone comped to make up for the unpleasantness. I guess Baby Acapulco has yet to learn this great customer service tool. I ordered a chicken dish with tomatoes  cheese and mushrooms. It was very good.
Good bar tenders and margaritas. Food is average but cheap. Good place for happy hour.

Took my husband for his first visit to Baby A s. We both were happy with our experience. I got their tortilla soup with extra cilantro. He got chalupas  I think . I love their chips. The room we sat in  to the right when you walk in  rubbed me the wrong way....not sure why. Also  our waitress was very friendly but was MIA after dropping off our food. Should have taken her up in her offer for extra napkins....
After a long day of flying  Baby A s had exactly what I needed. Their chicken enchiladas with verde sauce were on point. I love a restaurant with a gluten free menu

I think my experience could ve gone better. The waitress there wasn t so great. She was nice and everything but wasn t very organized. I could tell she was really trying  but it just wasn t very good.  The food was 4 1 2 stars out of five. But did take a little while because the waitress I think was new or something.   Although I enjoyed the food  it s a little too pricy for what you get is what I think. This place needs improvement before I come over to this place again but  I kinda liked it.

Ordered fajitas for take-out  everything was there except the tortillas. Steak didnt look so tasty so i just ate the rice  amp  beans it came with instead of driving all the way back for the tortillas.. rice  amp  beans were good  but i was expecting to eat delicious fajitas so i was still a bit bummed no matter how good the rice  amp  beans were  Salsa was ok. pretty hot for mild  thats what we asked for anyways not sure thats what we got.. they did hook us up with a huge bag or tortilla chips.. maybe i was suppose to use those  tortillas  for my fajitas  Anywhooo id probably be willing to try the place again if i was in Austin alot but since im not i ll probably be eating else where next time i drive through.

It would be nice if that Clara lady told you guys how much she gives servers as a vacation pay after working two years for her company   Zero   My son worked there for two years and received nothing  Its a motherly instinct to react  my son was a awsome server and to be treated like nothing really upsets me. Eating here you are supporting this kind of treatment  its a shame that a family restaurant will treat my family this way. Shame on you  I want everyone to read this and understand what I feel. Answer that Clara

I have a love hate relationship with this place.   When it s good   it s VERY good   when it s not....it s HORRIBLE .    In my opinion  which is very subjective I know..   this place has the best chips and salsa in the Austin area.     I went in with my entire family this Sunday morning to eat.   The website says they open at 11AM.   OK   wouldn t that mean that they SHOULD be able to feed   serve somebody AT 11 AM    or shortly after that..    There was probably a grand total of 20 people or less in the restaurant    including 7 of us..   and it took FOR-EV-ER to get our food.   which was straight forward   with nothing exotic   or strange requests.    The queso was lukewarm and jelly-like   by the time the meal arrived   everything was if it had sit on a shelf for a while   lukewarm at best.    The puffy tacos   which we normally really like  were NOT very good....the chile relleno was not worth eating   and it was overall a BAD meal   like something they really didn t have time to cook.      If you say you open at 11AM   you should be READY to go at 11 AM
Holy yuck  You live in Texas where there are a million other options for Tex Mex... Use them  Bland food  sad queso  and bad service.

This was an absolutely awful place. I m not that picky with my food  but I ended up going to Wendy s after this and having a burger because I was still hungry  and needed something better to push it down with  sad    I ll start with the entrance. It was barren and we waited 5 minutes for someone to even show up to seat us. Once seated  the waitress was slow. She wasn t terrible  just nothing to tip extra for. The chips were flavorless and the salsa was odd. The margarita was okay  nothing great  but worth the money.  The entree is what caused the 1 star rating. I got the stuffed avocado. I knew it wouldn t be as good as Trudy s  but I expected something half decent. Well  it was grotesque. On my first bite  I got some soggy basil leaves  I think they were   stuck in my teeth. On the second bite  I bit into something hard and sharp and yanked out two skinny chicken  I hope  bones from my teeth. Appetite LOST. I tried the beans  they smelled rancid and tasted worse. The rice was flavorless.  I ended up eating half of it and mushing the rest of it around in my beans til I couldn t look at it anymore.   Oh well  back to Trudy s and Chuy s.

Worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. The food is not fresh.. I had a hamburger...tasted very gamey... Just not good at all. Probably a frozen burger. I would think twice before coming to this restaurant.

Food is questionable. Not worth trying. Service is terrible. Sign says wait to be seated but no one comes to seat you. Decided to seat myself at the bar and still had to wave down the bartender to get service. Plus it was not even busy. The only thing that was great were the drinks.

Worst. Restaurant. Ever. Don t waste your time or money on this hellish pit of abysmal service and food that makes one yearn for taco bell... If you do get trapped or ticked into going  avoid the waitress that looks  and acts  like Kitty from Arrested Development. She s the ditziest  most forgetful  rude  just plain hating her job kind of waitress you could imagine. Three tortillas for a double order of  sizzling  fajitas which came out looking microwaved on a lukewarm skillet  and tasted like SHIT  Heb pre bagged fajita meat is better  -p  30 minutes to get friggin water    Screwing up everyones checks  trying to get an inflated gratuity  since its included   I could go on and on... Just avoid it at all costs if you have a mouth and brain that work.

I agree with my friend  Jason E. s review of our visit yesterday  and was so disappointed.  the waiter was clearly not happy and not responsive.  I didn t know the situation  if they had him spread too thin with too many tables  etc.  Everything we asked for was a LONG wait  and the cheese enchiladas are  Meh .  The manager was a very kind lady  but Chapstick that they got free from a tequila vendor did not remedy the situation.
This place is GARBAGE  and if you give this place more than 1 star you have the pallet and the brains of a horses ass. DONE.

Had a great margarita and a great time   Our server John  was great-very friendly and knowledgeable for our visit in Austin... And willing to put up with our silliness  Highly recommend to anyone who is looking for a casual dining experience.

I used to go to this Baby A s location ALL the time. They had great service  food and music up until the start of this year. The management now needs to be replaced with competent people.. All of the good servers have left and the food is getting cheaper. This past Saturday they cancelled the band for  bad weather . There was zero rain all day Saturday and almost clear by the time the sun had set. This is the second Saturday in the past month where they have cancelled the music  number 1 reason anyone goes . Maybe they can t afford to pay the band. I don t know what is going on but the restaurant looked like someone had died this Saturday. I will NOT be returning to this location EVER.

I meet a group of my friends here monthly and we are treated pretty badly.  The last time I was there I ordered queso and asked for some fresh nachos THREE times to go with my queso   By the time the nachos arrived my queso had curdled.  I asked them then to replace my queso.  From now on  I don t believe I will be ordering food from them.  They re generally pretty uncrowded  so meeting up with a group is rather easy and you can get seated quickly.

Where to start   Weekday night  only moderately crowded  but service was slow  surly waiter kept having to be asked for water  napkins.  The chips tasted stale and the salsa had a metallic taste to it.  No one at the table enjoyed their food.  Don t get the fish sliders   They had the nerve to bring out little dry buns with a rectangle fish stick   Not even real fish   and  industrial fries that were undercooked.  Not worth the price.  Same for the other diners.  Not going back.  Ever.

I ve always enjoyed Baby A s  even though on occasion I ve had to send a dish back to be reheated  etc. Yesterday visited the Stonelake location and you would think they could get a plate of nachos right  WRONG  First I ordered the chicken fajita nachos  sent them back as the tortillas and chicken fajitas was burnt. They had chopped the fajita meat so small it was like trying to eat jerky. The cheese was almost non existence. Sent them back and asked for JUST bean  amp  cheese nachos  with a few onions on the side. They finally arrived as most of my party was finished with their food. This time the nachos arrived with beans  a thick layer of onions  cheese and then another layer of onions. There was no way to pick off some of the onions and the cheese was like rubber. Needless to say all I got for lunch was a few chips and salsa. Come on Baby A s get a chef that can at least make a good plate of nachos.

By far the most beautiful of the Baby A s. This is a good place to go for hh when you have a large group because they always have room. However  the chips are really bad. The queso is lacking and usually filmy. The deadly purple drink always does me in because I can t stand to eat their food. It is just too blah. Now  rumor has it they have improved the food here and at the one on Barton Springs  but I just haven t tried it.
The purple drank was good and the bar tender was good  The food was cold and tasteless

Fantastic place if you want to have a warm-up night out restaurant. Great food  especially love the soups  chicken enchilada soup my favorite from the place  and their choriqueso dip and chips are awesome. Large margarita selection  most would tell you the purple margarita is where it s at  in which  I wouldn t disagree. However  I don t think it really isn t that superior but I do like their Superman s...great stuff their. Love coming here before going a night out of downtown.

Baby Acapulco s is not what it used to be or maybe it s just this location - I hope.  I m not going to give up yet. I will try the Riverside location  because I spent a lot of time there in the late 90s between classes.  It was always great.  We ve been away from Austin for a few years now and couldn t wait to get our Baby A s fix.  I was so disappointed.  The service was embarrassingly bad.  They sat our table of five and brought one small basket of chips yet plenty of salsa to go around.  We ordered queso as an appetizer. The queso came and still no fresh chips.  By the time the chips came the queso was hardened.  The chips were cold and stale  anyway.  We kept running out of water and chips and repeatedly had to look around and ask someone for refills.  When our entr es came  we were yet again disappointed.  My enchiladas were hardened and crispy on the bottom.  I had to use a knife to cut through the enchilada   I would have sent them back but we had already waited so long for everything it just wasn t worth it.  So the service and the food quality was very poor.  I also want to mention that as we were being seated I asked the host if we could have a quieter table to the left of the hostess stand instead of a table in the middle of a very noisy section to the right of the hostess stand.  He immediately said no that section was closed.   I quietly told him that my oldest son has autism and it would really make a huge difference if we could have the quieter section which by the way did not look closed at all as there were people seated there.  He again said no the section is closed.  I gathered the family and said we ll have to leave. The host was fine with that and did not offer us any options whatsoever.  Because we had driven 30 minutes over to the restaurant from our home and it was way past dinner time for everyone  I decided to push it a little further and asked to speak with the manager.  She appeared to be annoyed  but allowed us to take the quieter table.

Disappointed   We had a group of 5 meet here on Saturday night  amp  the service was soooo slow.  The place was not busy  so there s no excuse.  Over the 3 hour period that we were there  I only managed to have 3 beers.  It wasn t because I didn t want more  it was because our server kept disappearing.  We even joked with him  amp  asked if we need to order 2 drinks at a time.  I am not exaggerating when I say that on average it took us 8-10 minutes for every cocktail that we ordered.  We thought he had cut us off after our first round because we didn t see him for so long.

We considered ourselves to be regulars here until two days ago  when after our  terrible dining experience I think it s safe to say that we ll never be back. I wouldn t boycott a place after one bad experience  but we ve noticed the service taking a gradual decline in the past few years.   My husband  who is the beverage manager at a local fine dining restaurant  is always interested in trying new beers and wines. He asked about a certain beer on the Baby A s menu  and the server 1  didn t really know anything about it and 2  said they didn t carry it anymore. So my husband ordered a different kind of beer  and requested the larger size but was brought the small size instead. Speaking of drinks  we asked for drink menus and were brought one to share. This isn t a big deal  but before we were done with it the server came and took it away from us to give to another table. He grabbed it in such a hurry that he grazed my husband s face with it. Our son burned his mouth on the french fries while the server happened to be walking by  and the server laughed about it  completely our fault for not checking the temperature of the food  but still.. don t laugh at him   The manager walked by and asked very apathetically about our experience. When he wasn t apathetically asking diners about their experiences he was sitting and watching TV  no doubt much more enthusiastically.  We had to ask for a to go box 3 times before getting one. The server forgot to take the kids meals off the bill on kids eat free night. Instead of apologizing  for anything  for that matter   he rather sarcastically said  Here  ya saved 10 bucks   He just needs a new job  preferably one in which he doesn t deal with people. We are easygoing people  not hard to please. And if a business makes a mistake  that s fine by us. It s how they deal with the mistake s  that matter. And by those standards  this restaurant doesn t even deserve a star.  If you re looking for a good Tex-Mex restaurant in the area that delivers on both food drinks and service  try Trudy s  Chuy s or Lupe Tortilla. We ve never had a bad experience at any of those restaurants.

Thursday night happy hour is the way to go here. They have live band karaoke which is an absolute riot and the mexican martinis are delicious. I recommend the Chicken Chipotle  it s good and relatively healthy as well. The chips and salsa is good but the queso isn t my favorite. Definitely try the purple margarita if you never have  I don t get it because I prefer to maintain the ability to stand but it s definitely something you have to try at least once in your lifetime
Food was great  good price  margaritas were excellent...came after work for happy hour  both bartenders Ricky and Eddie gave great service

Ok my first night in Austin and it s kind of late and i m traveling for business so I don t really know anyone here.  Check into my hotel and look up someplace close because I haven t had a chance to eat yet. Locate a place named Baby A s. Yelper s give it a so so review but it s close  it s late and i m hungry. The atmosphere  amp  music reminds me of cheesburger in paradise. Old 80 s tunes playing on the radio  amp  the crowd doesn t really look in my age range so I decide to take my stuff to go. I have to say from the sampling of Tex Mex i ve had it s never been my favorite  amp  this place really didn t change my mind. The enchlidas had some sort of chili like substance on them which was pretty decent  amp  I didn t mind it at all. The Crispy Tacos weren t too bad either  amp  all the ingredents seemed fresh. All in all I don t think it was the best place to start off my trip but it didn t let me down all that much either.  I missed out on the purple magarita s but based on the other reviews doesn t seem like I missed much.
The only reason I can think of to go to Baby A s is to get smashed.  You think you are going for a casual drink and some guacamole.  Beware.  They sneak up on you.

Great service  disgustingly dirty  used to be a gorgeous restaurant years ago   husband said his beef in his enchiladas was comparable to Alpo  and I felt a little dead inside because of the gas station smell on the patio.  Oh  and don t forget the unhot cougars.  We ll go back when it s not a Baby A s anymore.

Loved the Blue Margarita  one was sufficient . The food was good  It was fresh and the service was decent...BUT the damn bagged chips you serve sucked the whole experience  What is up with Austin Mexican Restaurants and  serving chips from a bag  STOP  Yuck

Food s not very good - but I would recommend going on a Thursday night for their live band karaoke.  The band is great - and it s a really unique idea.  Just order drinks and snack on a few chips  though...the food isn t worth the money.

Where to start....  Couldn t find the entrance  weird layout in regards to the parking lot location.  The hostess was unfriendly and made grunting noises while she walked us to our table.   Soon after we sat down  one of the table runners slammed some chips and salsa down on our table without saying a word.  Finally a man waiter walked up and took our drink order.  A few moments later a different waitress walked up and took our food order.  We watched her put the order in and clock out and leave.  Not sure who our server was at this point we waited quietly observing the restaurant.  Very dirty  severs kept the serving tray on the floor.  Does anyone make a good margarita anymore         Watched the first waiter come back with our drinks finally and the house margarita was a flop.  I noticed our waiter would wait until all of his tables drinks or food was ready before he would make the twenty yard trip from the kitchen  letting the other tables food get cold so he didn t have to make an extra trip.  Food was awful  I said at one point to my wife   I d let you try my food  but it really isn t worth the reach across the table.   We decided to order the purple margarita to hopefully have something good during our dinning experience.  The waiter kept telling us how strong they were  over and over.  All the while he failed to mention they make them with EVERCLEAR.  Seems like something you should disclose if someone says they have never had one or even been to the restaurant.   Do not go unless you are looking for bad food and a hang over from their cheap drinks
Purples  The other stuff is all just decoration for the purple margharitas.
The margaritas are awesome and the waitress Jordyn S. Was beyond AMAZING    Her customer service was one of the best I have seen in Austin. If you come to this place ask for her for the best service.
Yum  Really good for lunch hour. They have a lunch tortilla soup crispy taco combo that is awesome. Comes with rice so you get a lot of food for a lunch price

I went to baby A s with my best friend who works in the area on her lunch hour. We were in the mood for taco salads and soup  After 15 minutes went by  without a  hello what would you like to drink   from our server  my friend got up to tell the hostess that nobody had helped us. We noticed the guys that got sat before us already had their food and we didn t even have water  I wasn t upset about it just hungry and annoyed. After my friend got back to the table we waited yet again for a server to come to our table. We noticed two servers  both walked by us...I thought maybe they hadn t decided which one of them was gonna take our table. Nobody came up to us. By that time it was 12 30 we had to go somewhere else because my friend only had til 1 00.  Fast food   my friend and I went to the server station and said  hey nvm we are going to taco cabana   We weren t expecting a response. Then CARLOS  one of the servers who ignored us said... okay go to taco cabana bye   In a very snooty way. As we were walking out my friend stopped and turned around cause she wasn t done with the situation. I followed her and we both asked to speak to a manger cause NO SERVER SHOULD SPEAK TO A GUEST LIKE THAT. He didn t care that we were leaving out of frustration it s like he WANTED us to leave. Anyway  as we were waiting for the manager CARLOS walks by us and says something about taco cabana so my friend calls out at him.. excuse me    He comes over to us  puts his finger in our faces and says  you can go to taco cabana.  That s when I get upset. As a waitress and someone who has been working in the service industry for years  I was disappointed that a server like him exists in our industry. As servers we all get frustrated BUT NEVER should we give poor attitude towards our guests. The manager seemed a bit concerned but then told us that they were understaffed. Carlos asks my friend and I if we wanted to fill out a comment card with A LOT of attitude. We were offended and annoyed. The manager didn t do much but really  what could she do  Carlos will get away with being a complete asshole to us and taco cabana was just around the corner.

I love this location. The staff is great and attentive. I have only eaten here a few times but the food was great. I really enjoy the outside veranda. there is a fireplace pit you can sit around and enjoy during the winter  they have keroke if you enjoy that  and the purple margeritas are amazing. To me it has the best atmosphere out of all the baby a s in Austin. You should definately go check it out.....
The only thing keeping this place open is their margaritas.  The food sucks.  The staff is rude.  But  man...those margaritas are killer.

My best came to visit Austin and we went for an early dinner   after work Monday to this one  which I personally love ...not this time. We were seated right away  yet it took our server  a young female J quite a while  to actually come to our table  after another male went to get her to take our drink order...She did not seem like she was interested in taking our orders or even a welcoming attitude. When we did get our order  she almost threw the plate at my gal pal  it made quite a loud noise and seemed like it would have turned and spilled her food  of course no apology from her almost disservice . During the meal  it seemed like she was now trying to provide better service to insure a decent tip  yet we still felt like we were being rushed out of the corner booth. This is the first time I have ever had such disrespectful service at this location  they have all been so welcoming and attentive  even when I ve been seated briefly at the bar ...I may rethink my next visit to this location again  for quite some time and definitely if I I do return and get her-we will definitely request to be re-seated.

Think i lost the little fellow who tells me I ve had enough.....oh well  Tex-Mex food that is ok. If anything I like the atmosphere that this place has and the drinks keep me coming back. Be careful with the the purple Rita s because they are made with Everclear  they limit each person to 2 but one may be enough lol
Jason has an energetic positive vibe that always brings us back. And treats us as a friend.

I have had bad experiences every time I visit this location.  It s in a great area which is convenient to get to  so I have given it a few extra chances  but it s terrible every time.  Last night we had a server who was apparently working his first day.  He was friendly enough  however he clearly had no clue how to wait tables.  Our empty plates sat in front of us for at least 15 minutes.  After we piled them all up in the middle of the table  a manager eventually came by to pick them up.  I realize that each server has to learn the job  but a new employee should be paired up with another more experienced server for training.  We ordered wings which were tiny and VERY overpriced.  The order of 16 wings probably had a total of 2 ounces of meat.   Our water cups were never refilled.

A hip  happening  casual place.  Always popular with me and my friends.  They have locations all over town.  This particular location has a big area set up for live music.  You cant beat the happy hour specials half-off appetizers here   It s a big place too  so there is plenty of room tables  and there is plenty to choose from off the menu.  Also great for graduation engagement parties.  I love their shrimp nachos.  Beware the purple ritas

This has to be my favorite location. And my number 1 spot for Happy Hour. Their Margaritas and Queso are the best   They have karoke on Thursdays which is cool and outside they have an awesome firepit for when it actually get chilly. And I go there so often I ve got a favorite waitress  if you go ask for Jordyn she is awesome

Came in for a quick meal and ended up staying for 2 hours talking to eddie  the bartender . The food he recommended was amazing and the margaritas were awesome  ill be back for the live music on the weekends

We went to Baby A s for a birthday engagement party Saturday.   We had maybe 30 there.  The service by Juanita was just awful.  She was friendly enough but you didn t have coke products  didn t have Mountain Dew  not even Root Beer.  When I asked what you did have she just said Dr Pepper  amp  Pepsi  amp  Lemonade.  It took forever to order.  We never got napkins or silverware and I never got a drink refill  not that I had a chance to ask  and we were there 3 hours .   Everyone who ordered after us got their food before us and we asked and she assumed we got ours and knew what we ordered but no.  So after another tremendously long wait we got our little wings.   When we complained at the end she said people were in our area that were not part of our party  which was not the case.  There should have been more than one server but judging by the yelp complaints  you re always understaffed.  On the good side it s a really nice restaurant  with nice d cor and nice indoor outdoor seating and we liked the band that played.  I just can t believe service can be so bad at a restaurant that should be wanting to make 30 people happy.  Two stars may be generous but we had a good time at the party at least.
Had a great night with friends. Tyler was great and made sure we had food and drinks

Walked in here after shopping. Food was okay nothing spectacular. I got the baby A s soup  aka Tortilla soup . I also got a strawberry lime margarita. I wasn t impressed with the margarita but it was drinkable. I know there are better Mexican restaurants in Austin

While is Austin  Texas  visiting my two youngest sons we wanted to check out Baby A s Restaurant. It is within walking distance to where my sons live.  We were greeted inside the entryway by Darah J.  I asked her if they had any booths  in which she responded   No.   I realized she was teasing and  immediately  I liked her sense of humor.  Darah seated us in a comfortable booth and asked if we would like something to drink.  She brought us a huge basket of warm chips and salsa and  then  told us about the Happy Hour Specials. The restaurant was cheerfully decorated with Christmas lights  which made for a cozy atmosphere.  Darah was extremely polite and said how much she loved working at this restaurant.  We ordered some Happy Hour Drinks and appetizers  which were amazing.  I ordered the Taco Salad and it was really delicious.  We sat and visited for a couple of hours.  Almost  every employee who walk past us asked if there was anything we needed.  Of course  we requested more chips and salsa   My sons purchased Martinis which were really good.  We hope to go back  again  before my vacation ends this weekend.  Darah J. was just so very friendly  knowledgeable  and accommodating.  It is  always  a pleasure to find a server who truly loves their job.  I rate Baby A s Five Stars and recommend it to any one who visits Austin  Texas. Thank you so much.

Normally our family would dine at the Howard Lane  location and have never had an issue.  But we decided to try Stonelake. WORST mistake ever. The service was bad and the waitress Maddie was very rude.  Are you all done because my shift is over . Her behavior was discussed with the manager and it was clearly known at that point her behavior was learned and we d found the source. As we paid our bill and left a tip  another waitress approached and I quote   Do you all have children  sarcastically   . Really     NEVER  NEVER did I saw NEVER will I patronize this establishment again. I m only giving the rating of 1 star because yelp won t let me post without selecting one.

I was surprised everything was really good. I don t know why everyone is giving sub par reviews. I am a fairly picky eater as for taste. I have been to countless fine dining places  and for an inexpensive place the food was really good. I am planning on returning.

We go to this place like once a week. The margaritas are a MUST have. They definitely hit the spot on a Friday night after a long work week. The regular table salsa is pretty spicy which is nice. I usually get the fajitas and the steak is so tender its great. Their sliders are fantastic too. I look forward to going to this place.

Come for the drinks and decent food. The tortilla soup really is pretty good  otherwise most other items on the menu will satisfy you. Service can be hit or miss. The only complaint I have is from a visit in the past when the waiter argued with the table next to us about what kind of beans they ordered  seriously. I guess they got charged for the extra beans and wanted to know why  the waiter refused to correct the mistake. I have a feeling he lost his tip over that  1.99 for the bean mistake. Other than that  give it a try.

I m so sad to write this review as I ve been going to Baby A s for happy hours lunches  dinners for years now.  I m a frequent customer of theirs and have seen a sudden shift of management and staff.  Today at lunch  I was shocked to see there was only 2 cooks and a few servers to manage the whole restaurant.  We were hoping to have a quick lunch.  It took about 10 minutes for our server to come around.  He was out of breath and I felt totally sorry for him having to wait on all the tables around us.  Our food took a lot longer than usual and came out incorrect.  I wasn t about to say anything because it would take another 20 minutes to get it corrected.  I don t blame our waiter at all.  The manager came around to see how everything was.  We asked him for something that was never brought to us.  As many times as I ve been here  I ve never seen this manager before.  He clearly is nothing like the former manager that ran a tight ship there.  I m afraid this will not be my go-to place for much longer if my experiences continue to be like this.  I ve seen the service continue to go downhill week after week  yes  I go there a lot .

Girlfriend and I did a movie at Gateway 16 last night  starving when we left  theater really needs to increase their service staff on weekend nights... LOOONG wait  and several of us said to heck with it  and dropped out of line.  We re missing the movie     Anyway  Baby A s is what it is... good Tex-Mex  a fun atmosphere  and our server  Linda  was very attentive and good at taking care of us   Hope Baby A s owners appreciate her - she ll draw business in  We tend to be a bit spontaneous - seems like the least expected experiences are the funnest  so we like to just make those last minute decisions to try something.  It Was fun to discover a cover band playing the inside outside covered area.  Band is named  Spark    Like so many places in Austin  live cover bands are everywhere and this one was better than most.  Apparently  they ve just grouped together and I have to say they were tight and enjoyable.  If you get a chance to catch them  you ll enjoy them   The harmony s of the ladies and gents in the band were spot on  and well coordinated - and the lead guitarist is good when he bears down on it and solo s. Love walking in to an Austin spot  never knowing what to expect  and be entertained so well

Slow service  overpriced happy hour  mediocre  at best  tacos. The purple margaritas are the only thing worth getting  but are still nothing special compared to the wealth of great watering holes Austin has to offer.
Sat for 15 minutes with a basket of chips. No water. Waiters walking past us with no concern. Restaurant was not 1 3 full.

So it was late on a Wednesday night and the boy and I wanted some food.  We thought we d give this Baby A s a try  mainly because we couldn t remember why we avoided it in the first place. Oh ya  now we remember.  The margaritas are blah. His frozen didn t taste like anything and my tasted syrupy-sweet.  Our waitress took forever to do everything and she couldn t remember what was on each plate  which I get  I work on a restaurant and sometimes things just slip your mind. But I didn t even get beans on my plate and when I asked if there were supposed to be black beans with my tacos she said  what kind did they give you . And there were obviously not any on my plate.  Then I was half way done with my meal before I even got those beans.   It took forever to get our food.  And it was not busy at all. Like barely steady.  Our food was pretty bland as well. Nothing to remember.  I didn t even take the rest of mine home which is rare for me.  Overall  the service didn t care  the food was nothing memorable and I won t be back.

This place is awesome I love the staff  and they have very good manager s   Adrian is the greatest. They really need to add some different items to the menu We need some new food choices  other than that I just love this place  it s one of my favorites. The drinks are great and don t forget to try the purple very good     SEE YA THERE     Evelyn  amp  John
Luuuuv this place. I may get a side-eye for saying this  but I choose Baby A s over Trudy s any day  Purple  amp  Superman Margaritas are the best. Great staff  great vibe  great food  love it

Go there Sunday at 1 PM  party of 7.  Everything s good as usual but when the food is served it takes an extra 30 minutes to get the orders of two of the diners finally served.  The manager does come over and apologize but doesn t offer to comp the meals and of course they automatically take their gratuity anyway.  I consider myself a very generous tipper but that amount is based on the service of the restaurant and  or the waiter.  In this case it would have been significantly lower due to poor service.  I didn t have that option since they deducted it due to the amount of people in the party.  I guess money is more important then customer satisfaction to this Baby A s.  I won t be going back to this one

I have loved Baby A s for the last 20 years I have lived here  but I was more than disappointed by my experience today.  I got there on Cinco De Mayo thinking it would be crowded  it wasn t.  We found a table and was provided chips very fast  but no waiter was in sight  again it was not crowded.  After 5 minutes Checko shows up gets us drink and then disappears  about another 5 minutes we ask for water and was told water is not provided cause of the drought  and put his hand on my shoulder  ok but that should have been told to us when we sat.  Took another 5 minutes to get water  at least.  The rest of the party showed up  3 adults  1 child  and we told them to order a drink ASAP when the waiter decides to show up.  He seemed to not want to be there and his attitude showed.  As stated I have been to Baby A s and the service was always fun  the food was never great  but the rita s are ok.  We finally ordered  2 burgers  nachos  and queso.  The burgers  and nachos came out but not the queso  it is just melted cheese  right    Took almost another 7 minutes till the queso came out.   A bit later a manager  female  red-dyed hair  came out to see how we were doing  she didn t go to any other table.  We said the service was lacking big time  the waiter was very apathetic  she said what could she do  and offered deserts  we were still eating our food  and we declined the deserts.  We just stated that the waiter should be spoken to.  she stood there and spoke to us for almost 10 minutes and we said we were fine  but she continued to talk to us.  About 5 minutes later she came back and offered us lip balm from a tequilla company  and we declined.  Part of our party was there two night before and had a great experience with another waitress and the manager then had her come by and check on our table and she was bubbly and enthusiastic  the way I am used to.  We finished our meal and the check came and there was gratuity added automatically  since there were 6 of us  even though the child did not eat.    Bottom line  food was ok  drinks ok  service was horrible  management involvment uneeded  and nothing was reflected on our bill.   Bahama breeze was great and always crowded  I can see why Baby A s at this location was empty on Cinco De Mayo.  Not planning to come back here ever again.

This franchise has the potential to be a fairly decent place to go. However  b c the insist on nepotism in having the owner s unqualified daughter overseeing many aspects  coupled with mediocre quality at all levels  it remains a middle of the pack choice in ATX. Perhaps tightening up a dedication to quality and hiring actual pros in the industry to run and manage would elevate you to a respectable level. Margs are still powerful and good if you are willing to settle on every other aspect of your experience to get them.

The food is not good.   The service was not the worst  except the waiter  Dan  put on a pregratuitity  something he can only do if we were an 8 person party    but there was only 2 of us.   The assumption that we were no tipping scum was insulting.  Then when the credit card slip came back asking for even more gratuity I realized they were trying to take advantage of us   amp  hope we didn t notice that they had pregratted us  so we would unknowingly double tip.  I called management to make them aware that at least 1 of the wait staff was opportunistic   amp  conniving.  He was rude  amp  unconcerned.  That s when I decided to  yelp.

Horrible service. I called in to place a to go order and kept getting placed on hold for a ridiculously long time. As I passed it on my way home I decided to just pick it up. When I got there I was told they don t do to go orders. That is fine if that is their policy  but we have picked stuff up before. And why didn t they say that on the phone. And why did they have to be so rude about it. We have had bad service and messed up orders while dining it  so this was the last straw. I will not be going back.

The cheese enchiladas tasted like a TV dinner. The baby changa was a gelatinous blob of soggy goo. The salsa had the spice of 1000 jalape os. The queso tasted worse than velveeta. Every liquid based food item had a skin on it when it was brought to the table. Totally worth the experience if your wanting to write a good negative review
Don t. Do. It. Do not go here. Horrible food  horrible drinks  horrible service. Good live band is the only thing going for it.

I have eaten takeout at a different Baby A s before and thought it was mediocre but was willing to give it another shot. There was a large group of us that went  30-40  and  I was told  someone had called in over a week ahead to reserve the room and let them know a large group would be there. When we showed up they were unprepared for a group of this size. The manager that day was running around taking orders and apologizing that they were understaffed.
