He seemed overwhelmed but also seemed to be doing most of the work required to take care of a group that large. The food was once again mediocre. Nothing to complain about but it didn t really stick out in my mind either. There was a live jazz band playing in another room and on Sunday s for brunch they have  1 mimosas. I would be willing to go back to listen to some jazz and drink mimosas but am likely to go elsewhere any time I feel the need to eat Mexican Tex-Mex food.
This was the worst service I have had a restaurant in over 5 years  we eat out at least 3-4 times a week. This waitress was slow and didn t care. The food tasted like it was zapped in a microwave.

I love this place.  I never have to wait long.  Staff is always pleasant and food is good.  I m a huge fan of the purple margaritas   If you re looking for a chill spot for a laid back dinner or drinks  then this is a good palce.

I ve eaten at Baby Acapulco s a couple times at two different locations.  My last visit was this past weekend at the Stonelake Boulvard location.  The place seems to be just as much as a drinking establishment as a restaurant.  We were there on Saturday night and quite a few people were trashed  as in more than drunk .   I had the Seafood Enchiladas and my wife had the Grilled Salmon Salad.  We also had their famous Purple Margaritas.  The service was excellent and our waiter was very attentive and helpful.  The food was good  but nothing special.  Baby Acapulco s seems to really excel in their drinks and my favorite thing about my meal  on both visits  was the Purple Margarita.  These Margaritas have Everclear in them so be careful.  There is suppose to be a 2 drink per person limit on them   but our server said he would serve as many as we wanted as long as we had a DD  which we did .  Oh yeah  we also saw a guy projectile vomit on his way to the bathroom and then had the unpleasant experience of watching our fellow unsuspecting diners walk through the vomit for the next few minutes.  This wasn t the restaurant s fault...but it s going to happen when you serve drinks with Everclear in them.

First time ever  Appreciative of the late-night hours.  Excited to enjoy an adult beverage until we learned that ALL their drinks are tequila-based margaritas.  Not being a fan of tequila  we were pretty limited  but asked the waitress for suggestions.  She had none  so we went for Corona and Limes...always a good choice at a Tex-Mex joint.  I had the Helen s Combo....tortilla soup  green chicken enchilada and choice of crispy or puffy taco.  I think a puffy taco means it comes in a little corn tortilla bowl   The green sauce on my enchilada was fresh  unique  amp  delish  The taco was average and ordinary  but still fresh and fine.  The tortilla soup was warm  full of chicken and very tasty.  Not spicy at all  but very satisfying.  My fave tortilla soup is from Chuy s however.  My friend had the Jerry s burrito being a cheese-covered-anything fan  he was thrilled.  Filled with meat  beans and rice  then covered in melted queso....too big to eat all at once  but he left stuffed like a pig and happy  The only downside was the lackluster service.  After looking directly in the server s eyes and asking for extra limes  we finally went to the bar and retrieved our own.  Some people  We ll be back  I was impressed by the freshness and the selections here.  Also  the chips were warm and the salsa was different than any I ve tried in a while.  Not bad  not bad  Nick
One entire star for live music only. Especially the jazz Pharos on Sunday. Food   suck. They advertise maple syrup pancakes. Not maple syrup. Not honest.

Worst dining experience I ve had in a long time.  It took forever to get our drinks. We had to eat 3 4 of our queso cold because we waited forever to have our chip basket refilled. I finally had to get up and ask someone for chips. The server barely came by. The food is awful. American cheese   Really   For cheese enchiladas   Taco Bell has better cheese. The band was awful  9 3  and way to loud. I will never go back
awful   everything from service to food.  will never go back even if i was offered  free food and drinks.

One of my favorite taco trucks in Austin  It doesn t look like much from the front  but everything I ve tried has been amazing. My favorite is the Al Pastor tacos. It s really easy to call ahead and pick up your order to-go if you re in a rush

It s hard to go wrong on Riverside when you re looking for street tacos in the middle of the night. It s hard cause it s right next to Anita s but we decided to give is a shot and I m so glad we did. This taco brought me back to life that night  I only wish I ate more.

Are they the best tacos I ve ever had or even the cheapest  Nope but they re still GOOD. They got you covered on your three main meats  barbacoa  carnitas  al pastor  and while they ran a bit too much on the fatty side they still hit the spot. I will say their salsas were a little disappointing though  a tad watery with not too much flavor. I will say the corn tortillas are some of the best I ve had in a minute though. The horchata is the perfect accompaniment  not to mention MASSIVE   so all in all  not too bad of a spot to swing by if you re in the area.
Super tacos for a great price  Food truck out side of a tire shop but had two picnic tables to eat at.
WOW. These tacos were delicious and inexpensive--odd location in the parking lot of an auto shop  but 5 5 recommend. Careful of the red salsa--it is SPICY

Exceptional horchata  enormous cups too   taco suadero was great  al pastor and carnitas just good. The white green salsa was much better and I would want to ask for more of those rather than the red next time.

The inner Mexican child in me smiled from ear to ear. These tacos are not only bomb but AUTHENTIC. I Love how this stand is chillin on the side of the road ready to serve amazing food only by a whim would someone take the chance to try it this is why I am writing a review. The price to flavor ratio is through the roof. The burritos are at a great size can t wait to come back for more.
Exactly what you expect from a Taco Truck. Good breakfast tacos  amazing Barbacoa and Bistek tacos. If you re looking for a quick bite  make a stop here for sure.

I love this place    This is my hidden gem in Austin. Great tacos with handmade corn and flour tortillas. Price is right at  2 taco so load up    If you are looking for tasty tacos that don t cost an arm and a leg you found the spot. That being said  you aren t going to find some crazy Tex mex combos here  just amazing prepared meat  onions and cilantro. Yum    Owners are super friendly and don t worry if you don t speak Spanish  they will understand you just fine.   I ve come 3 times in the last 2 weeks since I found this place. They are seriously that good
Probably get this place at least once a week  always fast but made to order  Great melon and pineapple water and some of the best corn tortillas in town

I was craving several of the menu items since I saw the photos. Woke up hungry so went for a couple of breakfast burritos. I m giving the place 3 stars because    Positive  1  Burritos were tasty. I got egg  potato bacon  cheese  amp  the husband got egg  bean  amp  cheese. 2  They were quite large  You re getting the equivalent of at least 3 breakfast tacos with these.  Not the greatest  1  I started calling when they opened  according to online hours   amp  they didn t pick up for 1 2 an hour. 2  They really were like breakfast tacos  prep  amp  flavor-wise. As much as I like breakfast tacos  the whole reason I went here was because the pictures showed the tortillas all toasted  amp  grilled. Nope. Soft tortillas. Good  but just like tacos with a larger tortilla  amp  folded ends. 3  No masks. Well  the gal who took my card put on a mask  after  she opened the window  amp  was reminded to  but the two others in the truck cooking were maskless.  4   Not their fault  but...  3 others waiting for food just outside were maskless as well. If you re being religious about masks  amp  social distancing  might want to wait this one out.

Excellent hidden gem on the east side  Not ideal to eat here since it s attached to auto shop but they have seating and a tent for shade. Awesome service and quick turnaround. All day breakfast tacos under  3  great spot for lunch tacos - I recommend the carnitas taco and both the melon and pineapple agua fresca

Super delicious and authentic Mexican tacos. Their shrimp tacos are the best in Austin. Shrimp tacos with one of their agua frescas is the perfect meal on a hot day after a workout or being in the sun.

Excellent food all around. Great mom and pop authentic mexican taco stand. I highly recommend the bistec burrito as well as the chorizo quesadilla  the shrimp taco  and the carnitas taco.   Charming atmosphere too and great service. We will be returning frequently.
Great service and fantastic food  Looking forward to my next visit and so should you  Just awesome.
BEST Mexican food truck  in Austin period     Best breakfast burritos  gorditas  sopes  breakfast tacos
For a hole in the wall place  it s really amazing  The tacos are good size  and the corn tortillas are fresh and great quality
Best tripas tacos in Austin  So crispy  Love their breakfast tacos as well   My parents go every weekend bc it s our go to   They updated their menu and it looks amazing

A hole in the wall inside the tire station parking lot on Airport Blvd. Taqueria La Libertad offers some great tacos. It was that good that we had to stop by again in the morning for their awesome breakfast tacos. The green sauce has some nice kick to it
Food is amazing  Authentic Mexican  quick and simple  Great lunch specials

Taco truck in the parking lot of the Macedo tire shop on Airport.  Spring 2018 - moved to tire shop lot at corner of Airport and Springdale   Breakfast tacos all day - only  1.75 each  The basic potato bacon egg taco is solidly good.   The burrito al pastor   6.00  is also good stuff.
Seriously lame tacos. Nothing special  no flavor. Took forever and they were out of all agua frescas.
Best taco truck in Austin  Got the torta and burrito  both very good. The green salsa is super spicy but delicious
Have had Campechanos  al pastor  steak and chicken. All are great and cooked fresh. Their Green Salsa is the best
I ll say it again Best Taco Truck in town

I love this taco truck. The food is delicious  I ve only ever had breakfast tacos there which they serve all day . The prices are very low and the people inside are nice. Note  they moved across the street to the corner of Airport and Springdale.

Cheap and good. Get the breakfast tacos. Have Mexican soft drinks if you re interested. The Tortas and Cubanos are huge. Burrito are decent sized  not big though. Worth a visit on a slow Saturday or Sunday morning lunch.

Luckiest bus transfer ever  where a twenty minute wait gave us plenty of time to hit La Libertad for tacos bistec  barbacoa  and breakfast style egg and bean. All terrific and made 100  to order. Salsas were hittin too  that rojo one was HOT. Looking forward to a return trip sooooon.

Amazing tacos for an awesome price.  Their chorizo egg  amp  cheese and bacon egg  amp  cheese tacos are awesome.   Fried eggs...not scrambled.    I also like their al pastor but surprisingly their chicken tacos are great too.  The flour tortillas are fresh and fluffy.   Sooo inexpensive too.   La Libertad could almost double their prices and I d still pay.

My favorite tacos de tripas and fajitas  Just tried it and every time I get the chance to come eat I will  Their green salsa is the best one. I have tried their gorditas which I like I wish they had avocado but it s what you prefer. I would recommend their fajita tacos

I ll probably increase to a 5 after giving this little gem a few more visits.  The corn tortilla was a bit dry without enough inside to cut the dryness.  However  the fillings of the chicken taco were great  and the price is hard to beat.  I ll certainly go back.  On the value scale  this is definitely a 5.

Ordered two pastor tacos on corn tortillas with cilantro and onion for  4. They came out very hot and with a sliced lime perfectly wrapped in aluminum foil and two mini containers of taco sauce. Delicious lunch served by a very sweet woman. I ll be back the next time I m in the neighborhood
This place is the absolute best taco spot in Austin. Their Barbacoa melts in your mouth  their quesadillas are rich and the prices  while rising a little  are still hard to beat.
The pastor tacos and sopes are delicious   The people that run the truck are really nice and get the food out quickly.

This is one of my new favorite late night go-tos. That doesn t mean it s only good for a late night snack  it s also good for regular meals  but I like that it s on DoorDash and open late.  Both the burritos and quesadillas are great  you can choose what sauce Greek sauce you want with them  and they have falafel and ziki bites  crispy spanakopita bites  as vegetarian options. The fusion of Greek and Mexican works really well. Burritos and quesadillas are some of the best ways to eat food  but if you like the freshness of Greek food  this is the perfect spot for you

This place is a super yummy Greek   Mexican fusion food truck on South Congress   Everything I tried was DELISHHH and it truly made my taste buds dance   What to order  Gyro Grain Bowl Falafel Bites ZIKI Bites  crispy feta   spinach balls   Fries  A HUGE portion of Ziki s menu is Gluten-free and they avoid soy  peanut oil  palm oil  artificials  waste so you can truly feel good about what you eat  Can t wait to go back

This is a newly discovered food truck for me.  I have been here about 3 times. I love the falafel bowl with a side of ziki bites   It all is so flavorful  the combination of what it has in it  is perfect  I was just there today and I ordered my food incorrectly but the team there corrected my order for me  complimentary  I will be a regular and so should you

Ok  I have no idea where I been and why am I just now finding out about this place  Seriously one of my new FAVORITE spots  The food was AMAZING the location is pretty cool there s so many other food trucks in the same spot  The amount of food they serve you is well worth what you pay  I ended up getting the basil fajita chicken bowl and husband got the pork zurrito  And I also got the Iced berry green tea  Omg everything was soo good  all I can say is  JUST GO and get you some ZIKI  It s so worth it  I can t wait to go back

This place is great.  There are a lot of gluten free options here. Had the Ziki Bites.  It was gluten free and delicious   Also  had the Chicken Zurrito and that was really good too. Very good cuts of white meat grilled chicken  fresh ingredients and yummy tzatziki sauce.  Tip   Pre order on the app  as there are a lot of online orders and you will have to wait a bit if you order when you get there.  It is a food truck with two guys making the food  so when there are a lot of orders it may take a bit.  We had to wait about 20 minutes  as we did not pre order  but it was well worth the wait.  A must stop in my opinion for delicious food  great gluten free options and very reasonably priced...

First off.. ZIKI never misses  Delicious and they use healthy fresh ingredients. My first time there I got the slow cooked pork quesadilla and some greek feta fries. Cured my hangover  and I didn t feel like a slob after eating it. The berry yogurt and baklava desserts are out of this world. The first time I got the yogurt  was trying to be healthy  and it hit the spot  especially the fresh berries on top.   My 2nd visit to ZIKI was late like 10 30 at night and I drove over to the truck on congress  and my order was ready within 6 min of me ordering  I got the Basil Fajita Chicken grain bowl and a baklava. Both were hella bomb and super filling. I had left overs from  both and reheated it the next day and I swear it was even better    Im also super obsessed with the ZIKI avocado jalape o sauce. It s not spicy  so creamy and addicting   10 10 for ZIKKI  My new go to spot for affordable  healthy  yummy eats
Thank you   zikikitchens for allowing me to collaborate with y all    Definitely Five stars   Delicious meals   tasty treats   great vibes     Highly recommend this place

New fav food truck alert  I experienced love at first bite. My fav bites were the Ziki bites  zurrito  pork bowl and Greek fries. Be sure to get the berry Ziki tea too  It s so refreshing   I give this food truck a 10 10  and the atmosphere is vibrant and super fun.

I work super close and walked over one day. Ordered a gyro bowl and a frappe. I don t eat a lot at lunch so I was literally able to save it at work and eat it 3 days in a row for lunch  It was so much food and It was still good by day 3 lol. The frappe was too icy so I wouldn t get that again  but I ll be back to try something new soon

I ve seen the social media hype for this place and while it gets points for creativity and for being VGF friendly  it was underwhelming in my experience.   The falafels and spanakopita by itself were good  but the bowls were a pass. The ingredients were not fresh  the combinations made little sense  and with so little sauce dressing  flavors were lacking.

Good spot. I love that they are open late. I tried the burrito I think the first time and second time I ordered the Greek salad and ziki bites. I love that they have me a big sauce for the bites and an extra sauce for the Greek salad. The Greek salad is very yummy.

LOVE the color. Not that that s the most important thing  but still. Super cute little area near some trailer shops. You order from a screen and then they hand it to you. I had the bowl with gyro meat and added extra cucumber salsa-- be aware if you re like me that the salsa is pretty much cucumber   onion  I hate onion so picked it out . Lunch was delicious  only taking off a star because it was kind of pricey--  16 and change for a gyro bowl. I did appreciate that they never pressured me to tip  so at least it was only that.   Would definitely go again.
So good  Really incredible food and they give you a lot of it   Seriously good portions at good prices.  The ziki bites are a must  Can t wait to go back
The bast of the best Ziki my lovely place keep going chicken amazing the falafel and ice tea just wow

Ziki kitchens now has a food truck on South Congress   In true Ziki fashion  the bigger than your average food truck sports a beautiful bright pink color and serves up their phenomenal Greek cuisine with a hint of Mexican influences. If you have not ordered the ZIKI Bites  you are truly missing out  Equally impressive is the variety of flavorful bowls  fresh salads  Ziki Tacos and mezze. Oh and much of the menu is gluten free   What to order    Pork Bowl - Chipotle Honey Pork  Yellow Rice  Avocado Jalapeno ZIKI  Garlic Sauce  Fajitas  Cucumber Salsa  Cilantro Cabbage Slaw  Crumbled Feta  Grilled Corn  Crispy Jalapenos  Cilantro Garlic Sauce. Gluten-Free.  Ziki Bites - Crispy Spanakopita bites filled with feta  secret cheeses  and spinach. Vegetarian and Gluten-Free.  Greek Salad - Choice of Protein  Fresh Cucumber  Tomato  Feta Cheese  Onion  Kalamata Olives  Feta  Classic ZIKI  house lemon oil dressing.
Delicious food truck... we love their beet hummus and healthy bowl options   Super convenient to order at the truck or schedule for pickup on Toast   Lots of vegetarian and gluten free options

ZIKI is Austin s newest and most unique food truck I ve been to in a while. Here you ll find a fusion of Greek and Mexican Cuisines to give you dishes such as   - Falafel Tacos  3 tacos stuffed with falafel  beet hummus  cilantro cabbage slaw  pico  and tahini sauce   12  - 4.25 5  - Gyro Zurrito  flour tortilla stuffed with gyro beef  yellow rice  tzatziki sauce  red pepper feta  fajita veggies  pico  and cilantro cabbage slaw.   14  - 4.75 5  - Pork Bowl  chipotle honey pork  yellow rice  avocado jalape o tzatziki sauce  garlic sauce  fajita veggies  cucumber salsa  cilantro cabbage slaw  feta  corn  jalape os  and cilantro garlic sauce   14  - 4.5 5  - ZIKI Bites  three crispy spanakopita  Greek for spinach pie  bites filled with feta  cheese  and spinach   6  - 4.75 5  - Baklava  crispy filo pastry dessert filled with nuts  syrup  with flavors of cinnamon throughout   6  - 4.75 5  You seriously can t go wrong with any of the dishes above. They re good-sized portions and the prices are great considering the high quality ingredients they use  Plus  the food is filling and each dish packs a punch of flavor and I don t have much criticism on what I ate. So whether you re craving tacos  a burrito  or a bowl - you won t go wrong either way.  All in all  I left highly highly satisfied and give them a strong 4.75 5 for being absolutely amazing  I will DEFINITELY be back soon
My favorite Greek-Mexican food EVER. Tastes perfect  Hope to have ZIKI around forevermore

I had an amazing experience at Ziki Kitchens  I tried their location on South Congress  and what I ordered was absolutely delicious   This food truck serves Mexican-Greek fusion food  and I thought that would be super cool to try. It definitely did not disappoint. They use locally sourced ingredients as well  I ordered the Chicken Zurrito. This is made with a Flour Tortilla  Basil Fajita Chicken  Yellow Rice  Chipotle ZIKI  Garlic Sauce  Pico de Gallo  Crumbled Feta  Grilled Corn  and Cilantro Cabbage Slaw. I ll be coming back here to try some of their other menu items for sure
Great people and great food. There s a unique energy and they re ever improving it seems.
Fantastic Mediterranean bowls the best on Congress. Come here     I got the basil fajita chicken bowl
Stumbled upon this place on Door Dash  and I m so glad I did. I got the pork bowl and it did not disappoint. Pork was sweet and just enough spicy  Everything tasted really fresh too.

I don t usually write reviews but since there are minimal for this food truck I thought I d share my positive experience   I just ordered the chicken bowl around 12 30 am this morning  late night and not much variety out there . I like to think of myself as a Greek food expert  trying many places in Austin  and this place does not disappoint.   First  every piece of the bowl was well seasoned  fresh  and not thrown together poorly  even after delivery and it being so late at night . There are also generous portions  I have enough for at least two meals. Chicken was juicy and well spiced  chick peas were crunchy and delightful  and rice was cooked well  The ziki and garlic sauce were delicious as well. The bowl was put together thoughtfully  impressive for receiving the ordered via DoorDash and it being so late  I will definitely be ordering from here again
Ordered once and I m hooked  The food was so flavorful and fresh  and the portions are generous. I got the falafel bowl  and my husband got the Greek salad. It was delish. Can t wait to get it again

Fresh food with quality ingredients  Finding restaurants in Austin that don t use seed oils is next to impossible  many self proclaimed  health conscious  spots are the worst culprits . Fries cooked in beef tallow instead of vegetable canola peanut oil is an actual DREAM. Literally the only place in Austin you can find that. Everything we ordered was amazing  fresh  and ready on-time. Cannot recommend this place enough - I wish I found it sooner

Excellent food  service  location  hours of operation  and hospitality. I ve never seen Mexican infused with Greek. We tried the falafel wrap  a burrito-like meal  and it s vegetarian.   The original tzatziki sauce it a gray pairing. The desserts are good too   clean outdoor dining.  Very friendly staff.  And you can watch them prepare your food through the large windows. I always love the transparency of how dishes are prepared and the cleanliness of the kitchen. Thank you  Will be back with friends.
Wow that Chicken Zurrito was amazing    It had really great flavor. I will definitely be back soon

So glad we came across this gem  This is seriously amazing Mediterranean food. They opened very recently  but I selfishly want everyone to come try Ziki out  and fall in love with it  just so I can have it forever. Bowls were perfectly balanced  sauces were so tasty  veggies were fresh  meat rice wasn t greasy  like Mediterranean usually is  - all the flavors blended so well together. Also falafel is a must try

Been there 3 times. First time was delicious but the ticket time for a food truck was long  15 minutes . Went back 2 more times and the ticket time was 40 minutes for a food truck   Insane as it is located in the lawn which is blister hot. Also the food quality the last 2 times were terrible. All rice no sauce or meat. Do not recommend. Consistency   food quality is not there

I ordered the Chicken Zurrito on DoorDash because it was late and there weren t many options. I decided to try Ziki because I love a good local restaurant and they were still delivering.   This is probably one of my best decisions.   First of all  the price is extremely fair. This burrito is HUGE. You could easily have leftovers and enjoy this thing twice. I also got the fries which are seasoned quite well and it s a huge portion. I think I ended up paying  20 which included all the delivery fees. Obviously DoorDash is third party but it s still such a steal. You re definitely getting your money s worth here and it s SO GOOD   Please come here. They do Mediterranean style food extremely well. I m very pleased
Delicious  Try the falafel tacos..yum. Healthy and filling. Touch screen ordering outlet is pretty neat.

Late night arrival to town and wanted something resembling healthy so I found this place. We bought the falafel burrito and gyro burrito and it was absolutely delicious. I was so happy to have found this place. Definitely recommend you check it out. One note they only accept credit cards no cash.
Best falafel I ve ever had  super crispy  Greek salad was ok  more of a cucumber and onion salad
Ziki is excellent  I highly recommend it to anyone who is thinking of eating there. It is truly one of my favorite spots in Austin

Ordered this on Uber eats and it s missing half of the items-no pita bread  wrong dressings  will not visit this place again. Would have been nice to be able to eat the  8 hummus I ordered - no bread included.
